review_body: I could go on and on about how I didn't like this place, but if you're looking on Tripadvisor you can already see for yourself what you're getting. I booked on Hotwire and it only cost $97, but then they rob you when you get there with a $32 per night amenity fee. When I asked the lady at check in what amenities I get for my $32 she was speechless, then she said "beach towels" . Haha, beach towels that are old, stained, thin, thread bare, small and probably cost them $2 a piece when they bought them in bulk. YOU CAN DO WAY BETTER

Worst places to stay ever, the windows don’t close properly, people smoke in the car park below and it echoes through the room. I don’t know why it says it has a pool because it doesn’t. And wifi? Yeah right, it only works if you’re standing well outside of your room. Will never stay here again and I recommend you don’t either.

Well a few pointsThe bad, very noisy location, WiFi is spotty and had to continually log on, had to let shower run for several minutes to get something that resembled hot water, room is very dated and many stains on the carpet, refrigerator rusted and a little dirty on the inside.The good, large room, free beach towels and chairs, close to the beach, 10 minute easy walk, ton of shopping and restaurants close by, bed was reasonably comfortable. Large balcony, not much of a view but if you want to sit outside.If on a budget not a bad choice but you get what you pay for, We did not feel it was worth the $200 CAD per night, especially having to pay the Resort Amenity Fee ($32.19 USD per night), thankfully we only spent two nights there

Stayed at the Pearl Hotel in Hawaii, had a marvelous time there.Staff is very friendly and helpful. Right in the middle of the city, close to International Market and just a five minute walk to the beach.

My family and I were here for a funeral and Pearl Hotel staff made this trip more comfortable for us during this hard time . Check in was easy and fast. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. They were very accommodating and always checked on us to make sure everything was Good. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

Hotel was not the nicest but it was by no means a bad hotel. Front desk people were very helpful, the paid parking did kinda suck but that's just downtown Waikiki. The cups in the bathroom were very dirty but then again I've never stayed somehwere they were clean.

We checked in last minute, just for a night. And boy, it was a great night, the staff there were great, so helpful.. Braddah (front desk) went up grade our room to suite last minute cuz we local kamaaina with that aloha spirit. We had the best time here and I recommend it to all my family and friends!!! Thank you folks again for your hospitality and aloha. And we will be back because of the hospitality and aloha.

Everyone was very helpful and welcoming, they have an answer for any question. The room was well taken care of and clean, the amenities were perfect (especially the beach towels that we forgot from home lol!)If we come back to the Waikiki area, we will 100% lay our heads here again!

Good service clean place friendly people friendly guest and friendly worker as well as the clerk clean and well maintain great location nice people spacious room especially the one, two and three bedroom suites with balconies. Standard rooms are also spacious and the bathroom also

Great location in Waikiki large room with balcony, clean and friendly staff. Wifi needs some work as it is slow and drops out all the time. They are doing some renovations, so hopefully they will work on their wifi as well

It wasn't too expensive (compared with the big resort hotels), it was close to shops, eateries and the beach. The staff were friendly and courteous at all times. If we go back to Hawaii, then this will be our first preference for accomodation.

The rooms are small, you will have to pay extra for what you probably have paid for before, keep your booking confirmation at hand, they might not care tho. I couldn’t sleep most nights due to the noise, they have motorbike rentals just beneath the balconies. You can’t open your windows as they also have the bar smoking area beneath the balconies too. Be careful they have so many hidden fees, this is not a resort. However, they charge crazy resort fees. DO NOT park your car there, it’s expensive free on street parking, just read the signs. I will never stay there again. Worst experience ever. The manager is extremely unhelpful, rude and quite clueless. The location is good tho!

Was here on a quick layover from NYC to New Zealand. The location is great in Waikiki and the staff is very professional. Check-in and check-out were very speedy and hassle-free. Also close to plenty of shopping areas.

I've stayed at my fair ahare of hotels that had daily "amenity" fees, but the Pearl by far beats them all for charging you for absolutely ridiculous "amenities".For $30 PER DAY you get the privilege of having access to vending machines. You know, the kind uou find at every grocery store ever. Yeah those. You also have the privilege of using rund down washing and drying machines that cost you $3 to wash and another $3 to dry. $30 a day well spent. Is your parking includes in this "amenities" package? No sir. You will pay $35 a day to park your car in an uncovered and unguarded parking lot in the middle of Waikiki.Also included with the amenities is the slowest wifi i have ever encountered at a hotel. It clocked in at a whopping 2.5mbps. But hey, at least you have that vending machine you can get Doritos out of to eat while your Netflix show is buffering.The rooms are fairly trashy and rather dirty. You should probably take your sheets down to the run down washing machine on the 3rd floor and wash them before you sleep on them. Also the cheapest mattresses i have come actoss in a hotel. You get to stare out your window at three buildings that are infinitely nicer than the one you are in.Best to avoid this joint. The pearl made the Motel 6 i stayed in in Escondido look like a 5 star hotel.Never again.

Staff were helpful location was very ideal for us. The sink plug not working was one of my concerns and room not what I had thought I had booked. Having free water and coffee in the lobby was great and access to do own laundry was good too. Overall it was a room to stay in at night as out on tours, shopping, entertainment or dinner majority of the time.Would use the place again.

Excellent place to stay, staff always accommodating and helpful. Very central and only a short walk across the road to international market centre. 4th time I have stayed in these apartments and will continue to stay there.

Older but well established business close but not on top of beach hustle and bussle. Short walk to main beach and shoppiing. Easy access for transport and restaurants and bars. By no means fancy but spot on for either stop over to break up a long flight or a longer stay to soak up Hawaii's capital.

We were in suite 1001 for two weeks, beautiful unit, clean, spacious, modern and very comfortable.the location is perfect, across the road from the International Market Place. The staff, Karen, Harry, DK, the other staff and the cleaners were very helpful, friendly and made a great holiday perfect. No pool but only a 5 minute walk to the beach. I would recommend this hotel and will definitely be going back.

If you’re traveling to Hawaii and want to truly enjoy what the islands have to offer, I highly encourage you to get out of your hotel and to enjoy Waikiki. From the beautiful scenery of Waikiki Beach to all the tasty foods that line the streets of the city, to the activities only a tropical getaway can provide, I say enjoy the warm weather and get outside!If you’re like me wanting to save money but still desiring to escape to the islands, I highly recommend Pearl Hotel. Everything I wanted to do was very accessible - the beach, shopping, and pick-up to the snorkeling adventure I wanted to go on. My suggestions for an enjoyable stay and gentle-on-the pocket experience:1. Arrange pickup/drop-off to/from the airport through Robert’s Hawaii (transportation service)2. Walk a little. 5 more minutes of walking won’t kill you. This hotel is conveniently located ~10 minutes from the beach and guess what, it’s also almost $200 less per night compared to the other hotels in the area. There are plenty of eateries around too!3. Look for affordable lunch/dinner options. Try the local foods at the markets. I promise they are delicious. Spam musubis have protein and provide energy!!4. Use the drink voucher(s) that the hotel gives you. Hello - free drinks!!!5. Take advantage of the beach chair and towel service that the hotel provides as well. Yes, all of these things come with your hotel!!!Tips for Realistic Expectations of this Hotel:1. Amenities fee - they charge a small amenities fee that is not included in your stay (but WORTH it I promise). Mine was something like $60 for my entire stay of two nights here.2. Lets be real, this is not a luxury hotel. However, It is a CLEAN, affordable option. If you’re looking for coconut-scented bedsheets and an ocean view, ok this is not the place for you. But, if you want to enjoy Hawaii without breaking the bank, this is the one!3. Check-in is 3:00 p.m., check-out is noon. They will hold your bags before check-in time.4. The staff are very nice and always available to you. They have a texting service where you can reach them for any of your needs. On that note, thank you especially to Karen and Harry at the front desk for making my stay an enjoyable and professional experience.Hope this review helps you decide whether Pearl is the place for you. I would go back and I would certainly recommend it to my friends and family.

A street back from the main road in Waikiki. We got the superior suite which was very spacious. Only double beds and the pillows were very hard. Had a microwave and small fridge, which was handy. Great big balcony, but street frontage was very loud at night. Helpful and friendly staff!

Upon arrival, the staff were in a position to be able to offer us an upgrade and an early check in - much appreciated after our overnight, long haul flight! The carpet pf our room showed signs of wear, but the room was spacious, well appointed, the beds comfortable and the bathroom user friendly. Housekeeping were excellent and the location across from the International Marketplace, and ease of access to the beach (and to Dukes :D) was ideal. Would recommend to anyone.

Well worth the visit! My partner and I spent half the day here. Very educational! Sunhat, bottled water and Sunscreen is a must. We enjoyed walking around with an Audio Tour, which was perfect for us. We enjoyed every minute of it, especially the boat ride to Pearl Harbour.... the oil from the ship bubbling up to the surface is just so surreal after all these years!

BEWARE- you do NOT WANT TO STAY HERE. We were on the 5th floor, on the night of October 3rd we saw a lady FALLING right past our balcony and land on the ground below. She fell from the 10th floor! The hotel won’t tell us the details, if she survived or not. We saw her twitching on the ground. The hotel won’t tell us if it was attempted murder, intoxication accident etc. It’s pretty scary thinking we could have possibly witnessed a murder. The police banged on our door shortly afterwards and woke the rest of our family up. We were up the entire night. I don’t like how hotel staff handled the situation whatsoever. It was very traumatic for us. They just seemed to want to sweep it under the rug and dismissed any questions we had. Besides the safety concern; the hotel room is outdated and gross. There are stains all over our carpet, our bedding and our window drapes have stains and holes as well. The bathtub is also stained and the bathroom as a whole just looks really dirty. The worst part are the mattresses and pillows- HARD AS A ROCK. I am not exaggerating- I am only 31 years old and have always prided myself on being able to sleep anywhere and backpack and camp wherever I like due to this ability. The ground is actually more comfortable than these mattresses. Every morning my neck and back hurt, I even bought a pillow at the mall because I couldn’t stand it. It’s absolutely awful. I am shocked this is considered a 3 star hotel. It is in need of much cleaning and updating. Oh, and we saw a cockroach!! I didn’t even know Hawai’i had these, I’ve never seen one on Maui. So there you go- if you have motel 6 expectations, you will be okay with this hotel- it’s on par with a one star motel, your average motel 6. If you want to sleep well and enjoy your vacation, I would stay elsewhere and get a place that actually had a pool as well. Another issue with the customer service- they pulled a switch on me. On the website they advertised $30 parking per day, then at the counter they told me $35 per day. What’s funny is they gave me a parking pass that says $30/day on it ‍♀️ I don’t trust the people that work here. Another important thing to note- WiFi is very sketchy. This was important to me, and we had continuous problems staying connected to the WiFi. When we could connect, signal was very weak.

It is in a good location to the main centre of waikiki and shops, beach, food etc. one block away from main area. It is just a walk through market place and you are on the Main Street of Waikiki. You get what you pay for though. Not the cleanest- non slip mat in shower was covered in black mould, old carpet has a number of stains on. But offers fridge and microwave and coffee if that’s all you need. No breakfast included either, think about how much you spend on this sort of thing before booking. It all adds up!!

The staff are wonderful and the location is fantastic, in the heart of Waikiki. The hotel offers free beach towels to check out which are a great addition. However, the rooms are quite dated. Much of the molding needs to be replaced, the bed is not very comfortable, and the sheets are quite scratchy. For my purposes in traveling for work, this hotel offers the basic amenities I look for with an unbeatable price. If you travel for location and budget, this hotel offers just that.

I really wanted to like this place. It's lower-priced in an area I needed to be at. I read lots of review prior to coming, so I was forewarned. They generally are correct. The staff was polite to me. We'd tried to check in earlier than the 3pm start time, due to a red-eye flight the previous night, but they 'couldn't' make that work, so don't get your hopes up for that. They did store our luggage for a few hours while we walked around waiting. The room was basic, not comfy, but fairly spacious (because it's old). It's in a noisy area, w/ single-pane windows, so don't expect "quiet". It seemed clean enough. The AC was maxed out, but didn't really cool the room very well. Bathroom amenities were good. However, WIFI was bad (for America), which was very disappointing. I mean - this is America, hot spot, etc. Everyone uses internet, and needs good connectivity and speed. It was constantly going down, extremely slow; just had to give up. Staff tried, but they need a much better service. Can't speak about parking, or dining in. Just don't expect too much, and you'll get by, if you're the budget-conscious type like I am.

Mold in bathroom. Mold on a pillow case. Dust particles in bathroom. Hair in drain. Parking is expensive. We reported it and they offered a new pillowcase and to fix the loose toilet paper holder. Carpet smelled of old cigarette smoke.

All the staff are helpful, efficient. Anything requested (towels, addl bed, etc) came within 10-15 mins. We got a 2-room suite which was exactly the right size for my family. The adverse side of it is is 1 bathroom. But everything else is good.

Door slammed too loud, waking up neighbors early in the morning. The AC unit was noisy and not cool enough. Depending where you want to go, the location is acceptable. The room was clean. My overall experience was good.

If you're looking for a solid hotel, close from Tue Waikiki strip - I highly recommend this hotel.If you need towels, you will get it at the lobby. Rooms are very clean. Services are friendly. Thumps up!

Pearl hotel is in a great location, across from the International Marketplace. Close to food and shops and coffee. One of the very rare hotels that offers a 3 bedroom apartment. The rooms are spacious, with a kitchen and lounge room. Short walk to the beach and close to many shops. Highly recommended

To preface this, I lived in this hotel with my cat for almost a month while moving to the island. Pros:-The staff are amazing. Keyneth, Agatha and Jason were instrumental in my transition onto the island. Whether asking for places to eat or just chatting after I got off work, they were kind, courteous, and friendly. Additionally, the management is incredibly helpful and accommodating if adjustments need made.-The location was very convenient, not only to entertainment, but also to the main thoroughfares in and out of the area. A wide variety of food and entertainment was only a short walk away, and I was able to save gas by frequenting them. -They were pet friendly. As I was bringing everything I owned, that included my furry companion, and it was great that he was able to reside there with me and not be kenneled. Additionally, the housekeepers were understanding and wouldn't clean unless I explicitly requested it so that he didn't inadvertently escape.Cons:-The building is old was not built to resist noise pollution. There were many times where I was woken in the middle of the night by some loud car roaring through that street. -The internet is trash. Wi-Fi in my room was next to unusable, and I frequently had to go to the International Marketplace in order to get tele-work done or even browse the internet without ripping through my cellular data plan.-Parking is interesting. Their parking lot consists of about 15 stalls behind the building, and are on a first come first served basis. This is not nearly enough for both the tourists rentals as well as the employees. However, I believe they are giving out parking passes for the Marketplace in order to relieve some of the congestion, but can't say with certainty. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Stay was memorable in this hotel, location was very nice rooms is also nice quality of food was delicious service in the cafe was super staff was very helpful in the cafe specially ms anamika was very nice..

This hotel is located in the centre of Waikiki just 50 metres from the entrance to the International Market Place and offers modest accommodation but is near the top of the tree when it comes to the room service and the attention to detail and assistance of the staff and concierge when checking in and throughout our stay were very helpful in guiding guests to the wonderful tour opportunities available on the island. Overall our stay including the adjacent Legends Bar hospitality was a memorable experience and have no hesitation in recommending future guests to this facility.

My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Pearl Hotel in Waikiki. It was a lifesaver as we needed a room right away and as soon as we got there we were greeted by Keyneth at the front desk. The room was great, quiet with AC and a nice bathroom. Totally would stay here again especially because the person that checked us in, Keyneth was so friendly and accommodating. The customer service was above and beyond here! He even checked in with us to make sure we were taken care of and gave us welcome drink tickets for the bar next door. Will definitely stay here again!

Great location in Waikiki, easy walking distance to things including a supermarket a block away but seemed like an old hotel which needed some updating, noise reduction installments and customer service upgrades. Considering the prices for Hawaii, you kind of get what you pay for but we expected a bit more.

I am just going to list the pros and consPros:Near the beachAlong the strip Provides Beach towels, chairs, and Go Pros on a first come first serve basis.Has a kitchenette (stove, fridge, microwave)Provides 2 complimentary drinks to the bar attached to the hotel. Cons:Hotel needs renovationsIf you like to sleep this is not the place for you. You can hear all the happenings outside of your hotel room.Only 2 elevators and employees uses them too (it could be a wait)No AC in the living room so I had to keep doors open in the bed room to keep the living room cool for those people that slept on the sofa bed.The sliding door to go out in the balcony is hard to slide. I had to wait for my room to be ready, Check in at 3pm room not ready til 5pmParking is a challenge, one night I had to wait 30 mins to park my rental due to no parking spots and I even had a parking permit. Excellent view from the 9th floor (that is where our room was located)

This place is not built for A/C. It has louvered windows, gaps in the outside door, and an exhaust vent in the bathroom. The hotel is built for air flow from the outside. When we arrived the very small A/C window unit was on full high fan. It was 76 degrees in the room. I complained and they sent up a maintenance person. They cleaned the fitter in the A/C unit and told me to keep the bathroom door shut due to the exhaust vent in the bathroom. Once I realized that was one of the issues, I removed the exhaust vent cover and shoved a towel into the exhaust vent. That helped slow the air flow so the small A/C unit could be more effective. We kept the A/C on full so it was noisy. Don't stay here if you like a cooler or quieter room.

Unprofessionalism of staff. The quality of service. Air Conditioning,, notification of when we needed to move was hours before we were tole we need to checkout due to overbooking. I found this so unprofessional. Even if the staff overbooked that was not our fault.. Would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Needless to say we were told the hotel was being destroyed and new condos were being built. Which again was not the fault of me nor my companion.

While the service was great and the location convenient the room was musky and needs shampooing and the pull out bed had not been set up and cleaned prior to us checking in. We paid for an extra day so when we arrived we could have our room immediately and not have to wait till 3pm. Had they have done this they would see the straws, chip and cookies in the pullout bed.

The A-Team attitude. That’s kinda what it felt like after it was all said and done, I reflect on the stay it seemed like they were bad ass hotel workers. The cream of the crop. An All Star team. I don’t know, whatever you want to call it. All I know is these guys are good.

My family and I stayed here for 11 nights, would definitely stay again. Harry at the front desk was great and super helpful! There was plenty of space for the entire family. The housekeepers were very helpful and super accommodating. The staff was very quick with all of our requests from beach towels, beach chairs and regular room towels. The washer and dryer were also app friendly which makes it that much easier to do laundry. Thank You Pearl Hotel for the great stay!

This hotel is central to many shops and restaurants. It is about 5-10 walk to the beach. The hotel itself could use a remodel. The beds are hard, air conditioner was weaker, and overall there are signs of wear through out the rooms (ex:stained carpets, older lights, etc.). Additionally if you are a light sleeper you will likely hear cars and noise from your room.

The quality of the facilities on the internet photos heatedly exceed reality. We booked a 2bd2ba with sleeper sofa, and there was only 1 bathroom that was connected to one of the bedrooms. Also, the second bedroom didn’t have a nightstand, just a bed, so you had to place your personal items/drink on the ground at night. No food/amenities.saving grace was the prime location and a relaxing balcony with cityscape.

This hotel has a bit to be desired. The rooms are musty  There are stains n's on the carpet We a actually had to request a room. Change due to the room smell The shower heads were dirty and since there are no bathroom fans the was some mold. No pool no fitness center. No vending machines. Truly a place that you get what you pay for. Since our trip was provided for us we decided to tough it out. Would never return

For $230 the room was huge with nothing but a bed and desk in it. The carpet was sticky. The sheets were old. Very outdated. But a good location. Staff was friendly. Parking is limited but there is overflow. They’re dog friendly but there’s a fee.

I booked for a one night stay got an email from hotel saying credit card was declined. Called credit company they stating charge was processed was not declined. Emailed hotel back, no answer so i called them and was advised same thing as their email even after explaining that CC advised it was charged. I booked another hotel as it was only two hours before original check in at the pearl hotel. I got an email later that night saying everything was correct now. Well I’m in my new hotel by then. They didn’t refund or apologize for their mistake. Please stay away from this property, besides that their customer service, accounting department and management is lacking (that’s the kindest I can be). TripAdvisor should not promote and or sell this property.

Poor is the right word to describe it. Poor courtesy of personnel, poor room with very old furnitures, poor cleaning and a A/C that has basically only ON/OFF regulation with very loud operations.One special mention to a very poor "Welcome Drink" served in the near sports bar, if you are a big football/hockey/basebal etc fan you'll appreciate.Our room faced the common external access to rooms and obliged us to always keep the curtain closed, unless you want to let the people look on you like Big Brother do.Positive points are position and overall cost compared to nearby.HOTEL REQUEST MANDATORY AMENITY FEE.Parking is 30 dollars, with lot on the hotel yard or in the nearby int. market.We will not come back.

This hotel is very good for the money and close to everything you need. We will stay there again next year. We had an upgrade because we used Aqua hotels before in Honolulu. Waikiki is the beach area where you need to be and this hotel is walking distance to the beach.

We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen and it was fabulous. There was a LOT of space and it had a very large balcony with a full window wall opening up to a really nice open city view, not right next door to other buildings. If you want an affordable, clean, convenient, spacious, no nonsense hotel with a friendly staff, the Waikiki Pearl is for you. If you want a full size refrigerator, microwave, and stove so you can cook or heat up your meals and have a relaxing breakfast, lunch, or dinner on your spacious balcony, then stay here. But if you are a fussy person who is always looking for little things here and there that aren't just right and who wants a luxurious hotel with fancy furniture and artwork, a glamorous lobby, and luxury trappings that you do not really need to enjoy Hawaii, do not stay here.

THE GOOD: Location near Waikiki beach and attractions very good.Clean, updated room with comfortable beds and nice shower.And staff efficient and nice about checking luggage and giving directions.THE BAD: Very noisy and ineffective window air conditioner. Very noisy housekeeping room just down the hall from our room, waking us at early hours. And there is a parking garage below the rooms---that is your view, adding to the noise.Worst of all: Very noisy neighboring guests smoking on balcony hallway at 4 am --- shouting, obscenity, then threatening my husband when he politely asked them to be quiet. It was actually rather scary---a group of large drunk men, one of whom threatened to rape "your wife" in response to my husband's request. To add to the bad feeling, we were charged a hidden "resort fee" when we checked in -- 28 dollars per day for having coffee available in our room and beach towels available for checkout!! (This in a hotel that didn't even have a pool!!) Excuse me---what three star hotel (or even two or one star hotel) does NOT have FREE coffee as a normal matter of operations????If you are a woman alone, I'd advise you to skip this hotel.

We enjoyed our stay here, the staff were friendly and helpful and the location was in walking distance to most things. The air con in the room was perfect and kept us nice and cool. The local activity shops gave us discounts and pointers on local spots to visit.

Omg we just arrived and already want to leave. The room is a blast from the 1980’s. I don’t even feel safe staying here. The pictures on website had us fooled. I don’t think I’d recommend this place to anyone
user_name:
Luvs2Explore29
Mohawk Nation of Akwesasne, Canada

review_body: It's a good, but old hotel, I feel. I think the main frustration was that it basically doesn't look like to the picture. The picture on their website and booking are better, are older,. Now, the carpets are durty and old, thewre's not much furniture for a huge room, the sofa bad is not confortable for an adult at all! If you have problems for sleeping it's a bad option.But if you don't care about any ofg those things, it's good enough for the price, that usually it's very expensive in Wailkiki.There's something good about it: It's near to A LOT of good places for eating, shopping. But gets pretty noise as well.

more info for military personnel who are PCSing - If you are here for single TLA, the fees that are stated to be waived (parking, pets, etc) by the TLA forms and the housing offices are not waived if you are single. You have to pay those fees which will not be reimbursed. If you are married or have dependents, then you are fine. Seems like discrimination to me as well as false advertising since this information is not being told to the housing offices. Thank you Pearl Hotel for ensuring that you will never have my business not my recommendation to anyone else.

Had a brief problem when the internet was not available needed to be reset. the room was large, clean and comfortable with a balcony view of the street. Everything I needed was close at hand. The beds were extremely comfortable.

Good hotel. Location was great. Middle of waikiki. Close distance to malls, restaurants and beaches. Room outdated and not completely clean. Carpet appeared dirty and hadnt been steamed cleaned for some time. Light switches hadn't been cleaned either. Room walls and windows were thin so you could hear the carpark noise. Garbage truck came to the back carpark at 5am for rubbish collection and made a lot of noise. The staff were friendly. Internet connection was very poor. An ok place to stay on a budget.

2 Stars TopsThe room was smelly and dirty and charged a $25 “resort fee” when there isn’t even a pool. They charged for bare basic hotel amenities that has been covered in the hundreds of other hotels that I’ve stayed at. Recommend staying somewhere else. Not worth it.

For the price and location the accommodations are adequate. The rooms are tired and stained and the street noise is disruptive at times. The part I have an issue with is upon checkin they force you to pay a 25 dollar a night 'amenity' fee. For towels and soap or whatever, there sure are no extras at this hotel so this must just be a gouging technique.These things are included in every other hotel I have stayed in but not here. The really greasy thing is its not advertised, I booked with booking.com and already played so at checkin you either pay it or go somewhere else

I felt like I was staying in a pub room in outback Australia - however it was clean and I liked having a microwave in the room. I think it’s worth an extra couple of dollars to get something better!!!

The WiFi was not functioning with my laptop and it is way too slow with my phone. I called a technician to fix the problem, but he was not able to fix it. Also the street the hotel is facing was a bit too loud at night and it was occasionally disturbing. But overall it is in a convenient location and the price is reasonable for the location.

This hotel is not a good way to stay within budget. Room is minimal, not to my cleaning standards, staff was dishonest and the resort fee basically covers towels? I left two days early due to how loud the room was.

Large room but grubby. The curtain lining is all ripped with silver tape hold them together, curtains are dirty and smelly with food stains all over. The kitchen has coffee stains on the wall never been wiped off. The fridge door does not seal so you are forever mopping up water off the floor. Carpets are filthy. No overhead light in bedrooms. Big cracks in windows. The laundry washing machine tends to take more then that $3 charge to wash as it doesn’t count each quarter so expect to pay $3.50 per load.My daughter and I have been itchy and feel like we have been bitten by lice.The service is non existent and sometimes down right rude. I complained re 1 of many issues and it was totally ignored, I witnessed 2 other guests complaining to the service desk and they were spoken to so disrespectfully, the staff need customer service training!Only thing going for it is the location.Never again for us !!!!! Think twice before booking.,.

Stayed here for 3 nights. There’s no pool or room service but you don’t need it as you are in the heart of Waikiki! Nice and clean rooms with fridge and microwave. Keep in mind they charge a $25 a night amenity fee plus $100 incidental fee.

This is truly like home away from home. Why? Because of so many Filipino kababayans working here from the reception to maintenance and upkeep. Why not, we have the biggest no. of migrant workers here. But what I like most about this hotel is - it's near everywhere, from the International Market Place to a few hundred steps Waikiki Beach! It's just unfortunate that an accredited travel agency of the hotel sitting just beside the reception area - made a boo-boo of our much-anticipated luau evening party that we have booked a day before - only to make pleas to the bus tour coordinator the next day showing our voucher that doesn't exist in their system - and then the hassle of trying to refund our payment (thru reversal from credit card) from that agency.

This hotel is in a great location except for the bar around the corner which closed at 3AM. 3 out of 5 nights at 3AM we were awaked to people running in the streets, screaming and yelling. Friday night there was at least 100 people out for over an hour till someone called the cops. The cops were also called Saturday, and Sunday I got up and yelled at them. Where is not only Hotel security, but security at the surrounding buildings. If you are looking for or need a fast internet connection, you will NOT find it here. Housekeeping neglected to clean out my shower/tub one day as well

I can recommend this hotel for a family and for business. Great spot close to the Hawaiian Marketplace. Breakfast included, toiletries and coffee/tea. Clean spacious room.Will be back Close to the $2 taco place behind the Hawaiian Markepkace 12-5pm. Cheap tacos and margaritas

My flight to Honolulu was cancelled due to severe weather. As a result, I was not able to make it to my reservation at all. I called to let the hotel know the situation and asked to cancel my reservation. They said they would not refund me and would still charge me for my stay. How was I supposed to know that my flight was going to be cancelled? I had no way of getting there whatsoever. Next time I travel to Hawaii I will definitely be booking a room elsewhere.

We got a room at the Pearl Hotei just so we could park our rental car and then shower after spending the afternoon on the beach before flying out. The room was about $100/night and parkin was $30/day. I think that is very reasonable for a hotel very close to Waikiki Beach. It served our needs well. There is not hotel restaurant, but there is a bar. No pool. If you are cost conscious then this is the place for you.

I stayed last night and was pleasently surprised. I looked up the least expensive place I could find because I was too tired to make the drive home. For the price I paid, I was not expecting much. I showed up to a clean comfortable lobby and was greeted by Jeffrey. He was extremely pleasant and professional. Check in was easy. Note:$100 deposit required on a credit or debit card. If you pay cash it is returned to you by check. The lobby had a business center in it for printing boarding passes etc. The $26 resort fee was worth it to include beach towels and chairs. Even with tax and resort fee it was cheaper than other hotels that weren't as nice. I was upgraded to a jr. Suite. It was large and spacious. The bed was comfortable and unit was clean. A large lanai was nice to have and it had mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker. A flat screen TV as well. It was nice and quiet and not a bug in sight. And the elevators worked great. I never waited which often happens in these hotels. As I checked out the general manager introduced himself and thanked me for my stay. This was a very great value for the price and I'd recommend it to my customers absolutely. Mahalo to managment for an awesome stay! Linda

It was well worth what we paid to stay there. They upgraded us to a two bedroom that had a small living room. We really enjoyed the space and we got two free drinks at the bar next door just for staying. Also they have golf channel which is a bonus

Glass doors on balcony dont close. Front door broken security lock. Bath towels too small. No lounge chairs in room we had to keep carrying in balcony chairs. Poor for the price in AUD. After a long flight overnight and arrive 8am check in at 3pm is horrendous

The Pearl Hotel Waikiki is in a downtown area of Waikiki, less than a block from the Kūhiō street entrance of the International Market. The lobby is clean and has a few chairs where you can sit and watch an exciting video of the island while waiting to check in. There is a small parking lot in back, $30 a night, first come first served, which we decided to take advantage of because we just didn’t want to have to deal with trying to find parking in downtown Waikiki. There are ten floors with no outside common space; including no sun deck or pool, although on the street level of the hotel is a coffee shop with some outside seating (try the delicious fruity papaya bowl), and a bar. I was told that this is a budget hotel and our first room was definitely budget, like a roadside motel. Although well appointed with covers on the bed and closet; with a table and one chair, the walkway to all the rooms on that level was right outside and if you opened the drapes anyone walking by could see in. There was a microwave, mini fridge and coffee pot with packets of coffee and accompaniments. I had asked for a room with two beds (I was traveling with my 38 year old son) when I confirmed our reservation the week before, but when we checked in I was told that the room only had one bed. I complained (nicely) and was told that they were booked and that we could be moved to a room with two beds on Friday (we checked in on Wednesday), and they would send up a cot/rollaway bed to use until then. There wasn’t much they or we could do so we agreed and went up to our room.The staff were all very nice through all this and The next morning I went down to complain about the room (I’m not sure the clerk understand my analogy to a cheap motel room in Fresno); and the staff that morning said he thought he could get us another room and to pack up our bags and when we came back that afternoon he would have another room for us.This room was quite large, clean, with two comfortable beds, and was decorated similar to the first room. There was a spacious lanai looking over the street and city, giving us a pretty view of the city at sunrise and sunset, and we spent quite a bit of time out there relaxing especially the day it rained. The room was on the eighth floor so the street noise was not bad, although our neighbors did start playing music at 5:00 in the morning. The hotel is close to restaurants and shopping, but a bit of a hike to the beach going around, or through, the International Market. Parking is very difficult with metered spaces only, but there are two ABC Stores close by for water, snacks and other supplies. I would stay here again but probably no more than a few nights, and I would reserve a room with a lanai, and really if I was staying longer in Waikiki I would probably stay somewhere else, at one of the condotels with a kitchenette, pool and/or other common outside areas.

Do not stay here. Gross hotel. Hair stuck in the wall of bathroom. Torn lampshades. Outlets do not work. Had to call maintenance to try and get a functioning outlet in bathroom. Dirty. No amenities whatsoever

We got confirmation for a king bed but they didn’t have any available when we checked in. The hotel is shabby and in need of renovations. The rooms have little furniture, poor lighting and hard beds. The carpets were stained and the curtains torn. It is extremely hard to sleep at night due to the street noise - especially on the lower levels. You pay $25 extra for amenities but there really aren’t any.

I booked the Pearl Hotel through booking.com, at least 6 months in advance, and requested two beds. When we arrived, there was only one bed and they said they sold out. I triple checked my booking and it was clearly noted that I had specifically requested two beds. They offered a cot, however this was not a very good solution and we ended up sharing the extremely uncomfortable bed. I didn't mind sharing, but when you are so close to someone for a vacation you want some of your own space at least while you sleep! Also, the internet was the slowest I've experienced anywhere, and the windows were paper thin. We never got accustomed to the time difference because we could hear every single thing from outside. The upside, it was clean, and everything functioned in the room. They also gave us a free drink voucher for the attached bar. I think the hotel wasn't absolutely horrible but I won't be returning unless other plans fall through. I also provided this information in the survey that they sent the day after I checked out.

I booked online at a great decent price. But when I checked into the hotel a 100 dollar deposit was thrown at me. I didn't have enough on my card to pay out of my account so cash amount 200. We should be told when booking about these deposits because I would not have booked.

This hotel does not have a pool or a restaurance or gym, matter of fact it does not have any feature that you get in a five star hotel. However, I will be coming back here, because, clean linen and bedding is changed daily. The room and bathroom are clean and there is a guest laundry, television, coffee making facility, an iron and ironing board. International market place is just across the street. A very nice coffee shop is just next door or go to the international market and find a very nice coffee house, restaurants, luxury shops with the beach across the street from the international markets. The trolley and bus are a small walk away to take you there and back to Ala Moana shopping centre, Diamond head and Pearl Harbour. ABC shops on every corner for those little things you can't take on the plane.

We paid 1902.00 for 6 nights in a 2.5 star, demoted from 3.5 shortly after our November 5th booking 2018. Beds are beyond tired. Worst was careless and indifferent housekeeping. Sand bag pillows, our junior suite consisted of a fridge, microwave and coffee pot. One chair. Sporadic Wi-Fi.

No rewards offered when asked about the supposed free rewards said it was just coupons // I was surprised that Hawaiian Airlines promoted this hotel on their website. No parking at the hotel site had to pay $30 to park at a public parking down the street then another $35 for amenities // one of the front office clerks couldn't speak English well and was so rude very sassy to another guest checking in at the same time we were // the rooms and the hotel looked nothing like the pics on line.

This hotel was not at all what we expected. The wall AC unit kept us up all night, the shower was rusting, you can't open the blinds unless you want people walking by to look in, the carpet was dingy and stained, but BY FAR the worst part was how terribly uncomfortable the beds were. They are like rocks.

Just visited pearl hotel in waikiki. It was advertised for families but i wouldnt go there with kids again. There is a grotty pub directly underneath which isnt pleasent to walk near on a saturday night. The rooms were really ordinary and the washing machines/dryers arent in your room, you have to go and find them, pay for them and wait.Great location though. Really easy to get around so perfect if you just want a place to crash :)

This is absolutely fantastic. So emotional. Definitely recommend the tour. You learn so much about the history of pearl harbour I would go back again. Loved it so much. Went with my hubby and he loved it too

We had a good stay last weekend. Jeff was helpful. The rooms were clean. The online process was easy to navigate. The parking was limited but the new parking at International market was great. We will definitely be back!❤️

Pros:Good location Nice staffFree drinkConsOldTired CheapLoud ACAC barely kicked out cold air.If you are on a tight budget the place works. Nothing wrong with saving money but I think I will pass on this place in the future.

very nice hotel.- older building but rooms have been renovated. spacious, spotlessly clean and great to have microwave, fridge and coffee maker. Also free drink at the bar next door and free movie cds available the lobby. great location- easy to walk to trolley bus stop, international market place, beach etc.only one small annoying issue- noisy aircon but worked ok

Stayed at The Pearl for 6 nights, location was fantastic if you don’t mind no ocean view. The rooms are a great size and so is the balcony. We had a coffee machine and microwave in room which was more than I expected for the price. DVD card for machine in foyer given on arrival which was a nice bonus. Laundry on 3rd floor was handy and vending machines on 7 were super convenient. The rooms need a makeover-the carpet is stained and curtains had tears. Beds were comfortable and bedding clean which is the most important!

First time in Waikiki, very good location. Stayed for 7 nights, the room was clean and housekeeping does it every day. They let me leave my luggages early and was able to check in earlier. Staff were very helpful. Great thing is its across the International Market Place, lots of restaurants nearby. Parking is $30. Will be back.

Stayed here for 7 nights on a holiday to Hawaii. We were doing it on a limited budget so we booked this hotel because it was really cheap.They allowed us to check in 3 hours early which was very much appreciated after a long flight. The staff were always helpful and courteousThe rooms are basic, but clean and have what you need. The air con is quite loud but did cool the room down. The free drinks and DVDs tickets were a nice gesture too.Great hotel if you are on a budget in Waikiki

Old, dated hotel on Waikiki a block from the beach. The best thing I can say about this place is that it's centrally located, just across from the entrance to the international marketplace. The rooms are very dated with threadbare rugs. The rooms were clean and the linen ok. The beds slept well. The staff was helpful. The Legends club downstairs has a lively happy hour on mondays. The early morning trash pickup sounds like they're in your room, you don't need an alarm clock. A utility hotel at best. Could be a last option for the price.

Economicly priced, necessary amenities and centrally located. Would stay here again and recommend it to others. Staff was friendly, efficient and professional. Near the international marketplace and Waikiki.

Situated just opposite to international market place close to the beach bus shops no need for a car large room for a family big balcony when I was there they were filming hawaii five o in the hotel and in the hotel opposite

While everything was clean, it was also lower quality. This is very conveniently located to all of downtown, but not the type of place where I would want to hang out in my room. Older buildings have their own unique character and this is very typical of what classic Honolulu was like.

Well organized fair price friendly staff very informative disappointed in the memorial float above the Arizona was broken so we couldn't do that part would have been nice to be pre informed. But everything else was great

Booked in February, this was only hotel in our price range for our family.Arrived and the staff were great - super helpful and friendly.Bed was like lying on concrete so asked for a topper (translation not that great as it is called something different here)Also we were a bed short.... we booked 4 beds (everywhere else only had 2 or three) but arrived to find we only had two beds and a sofa pull out bed. So we had to request another bed (at an extra cost of course)We also asked for a portacot - as most places just lend it to you free of change,but we had to pay for an extra bed if we wanted it - so after some discussion we decided against that.We have slept one of the four nughts we are here and have had no complaints since our mix up over the beds.The room is great and having a kitchen really helped safe on costs.I would recommend to budget conscious but beware that there is no pool.The place is good - close to everything

The staff at Pearl where very friendly and considerate. Additional sofa space in the rooms would be great! Overall a great experience for myself and my family, would defiantly stay here on our next trip.

Two friends and I booked this hotel as we were travelling together but each wanted our own bed and it was difficult to find accommodation with three seperate beds of any configuration, Upon arrival the reception are checked us in around 1pm, earlier than allocated our room was located on the fifth floor, the room which was booked as a one bedroom suite witn one queen, one double and one roll out double sofa.The bedrrom was large with windows but no fly screen but an air conditioning the bathroom was a good size but the kitchen and lounge area were extremely large, the sofa bed looked comfortable and the outside the verandah was quite large .The hotel has a sports bar attached and a small shop/market across the road. there is no pool or restaurant on site but the beach is a block away and there are other cafes close by.There is a concierge desk to help with arranging tours.I would recommend this hotel as the rooms were large, but the resort fees are a bit extreme as it really only includes Wi-Fi.

Very nice place and very nice people who work here. Was only here for one night but it was clean and I slept pretty good too. I really felt we were downtown and where all the action was which made it easier since I did not have a rental car.
user_name:
Matthew A
Akron, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: The room was clean and fresh. We left our 'Don't Disturb'' sign on our door as we didn't need our room serviced(capable of making our own beds and keeping the room clean:) but we were able to get our trash taken out and clean towels or linen as we needed them. The location of the hotel was very central to the beach and shopping.Clean beach towels each day and a large range of DVDs were all part of the amenities.The lobby was a lovely place to sit and relax, with comfortable couches.Ice water was available in the lobby throughout the day.For $5.50 you could get an all day bus pass around Waikiki. The Food Pantry, just around the corner, was an excellent supermarket.

Had to arrange this hotel quickly fot one night due to early arrival because of the hurricane. Large apartment with 2 bedrooms. Unfortunately the aircon dripped onto the floor all night which made sleeping difficult.

It was good location to stay and enjoy Waikiki.It is able to go the Waikiki beach through "InterMarket" on foot in 7minute. Because it is able to access small store like convenience store less 1minute on foot!Building is tattered a bit..I staied 5th floor, it was noisy every night, maybe from a strret..Sometime I was care about a noise of upper floor.And inside room, some ights didn't turn on. All staff are nice, helpful! I thinks this hotel is good cost performance if you don't mind noise.

If the room was cleaner I would have rated it better! The service was good and I was happy they got us in last minute, but it was really dirty! If I knew the room was cleaner I would recommend this hotel

We recently stayed at Pearl Hotel following our cruise 17 day from Sydney upon arrival we being 14 people arrived at the hotel around 9am well before check in and the staff stored all our luggage at no charge we had over 28 suit case. When we checked our rooms where large spacious and had everything we needed. On site laundry facilities where great. The staff where so friendly and helpfully will definitely be staying here again.

If you are on a budget, this is a great place to stay. The room rate was reasonable and the staff was friendly and approachable with both requests and in answering questions. The beds were very comfortable. Add to this the central Waikiki location...one can't go wrong!

This hotel is back from the beach a couple of blocks but is still an easy accessible walk. I would class as budget - midrange considering the nightly costs of many of the other hotels in the Waikiki area. The rooms are clean/tidy and comfortable with in room tea/coffee and fridge. They are also serviced dailyLaundry facilities on level 3. Tho they state free Wi-Fi, don't be fooled, you have to pay for it along with use of beach towels and DVD rental ( those 3 things collectively come under an additional single daily charge added at the end of your stay. Friendly and helpful reception staff.The hotel is wheelchair accessible. We would stay there again … the beachfront and near beach front hotels are well above our affordability. There is a ground floor sports bar attached to the hotel. There are dozens of bars and restaurants within 15 mins walking distance. The hotel itself doesn't have dining facilities

Felt very dirty, had itches and bumps all over my body. Also was not informed about the parking expense of $30 dollars per day, until checkout which isn’t good enough. Curtains were all ripped up and door wouldn’t close properly.

We booked this hotel because of its location as it is good BUT he hotel rooms were so dirty. STAINS on the carpet, curtains, lamp shades, Couch was ripped. With the two bedroom apartment you have to go through the main room to use the ONLY bathroom. The fold out bed was completely broken. If you want to relax in a nice hotel this is not it. It also has NO pool. EVERY morning you will here a garage truck picking up glass and emptying it. ITS SO LOUD (no peaceful sleeping in there).I will never go back, we are actually getting a refund as the rooms were so bad.

BEWARE, BE WARNED... i will make this short. My husband and I stayed at this hotel from Monday til Sunday am. After the first day, we saw bugs. All thru the week, I kept getting bites. The manager did absolutely nothing. The desk clerk said he would take 40 dollars off our amenities which we did not use anyway and told him that. His comment was, if u had booked directly you would be paying me thousands. He said he would send someone up to spray. Not sure if that happened or not. We booked thru a travel agency. So the next day, we talked to a manager. Showed him all my bites. He came up to our room and kept telling us what good souls, people we are. He said he would change our room but the hotel was booked. The next day, which was our last day, I had more bites so I talked to another manager. This one was a black female. She looked at my bites, at least 10. She went up to our room 506 and her and my husband found what they thought was a small spider. She said yes, spider bites. When I told her that I may need to have my leg checked she ignored me. Said she would put us in one of their sister hotels and would call me by 12 to let me know where. Well I got the call and was told we were moving to the Aston hotel. My husband and I went back to the hotel. We were ere then told we were moving to the hotel next door, I believe the Hilton. But we would have to pay. She then said we r moving you to another room. She asked if we wanted someone to move us when the room was ready. We said yes. My husband and I left. We came back in a little while later and we were not moved. The manager came up and helped us move, 2 suitcases and 2 carry on's. I found out later, they charged us for moving our stuff. Well my husband and I went to walgreens. The pharmacist asked how I got so many bites. I said the hotel we are at. She told me what to use and said I needed to see a doctor over the bite on my leg. We went back to the hotel and told the manager. I asked her for the names of the urgent care. She asked if I was from the US and if I had insurance. I told her no I did not have insurance. Someone at the front desk gave them to me written on a piece of paper with the prices on it. I waited until I got home to see my doctor. I am on 4 different types of meds and she is worried about my leg. Also the housekeeping was terrible. There was blood on the bottom sheet, I asked for it to be changed. The housekeeper must have thought I was dumb. She put the sheet with the blood on the top. I found her on the floor and told her about the sheet. She said it wasnt her and she would call housekeeping. I went downstairs also and told them. They said they would call housekeeping. No one came, so later my husband threw the sheet on the floor. It stayed there until later the next day. There was hair in the bath tub that was not ours. We did not even used it yet. Management has not taken any responsibility except the 40 dollars the desk clerk gave us and a room change the last day we were there. In the meantime, I have at least 10, my doctor believes is BED BUG BITES and an seriously infected bite on my leg. I have pictures of my bites, etc. So please BEWARNED, BEWARE. I have written this to make people aware. There are also other reviews on here, people complaining about bugs and bed bugs. My travel agent made this reservation for us. We trusted them so did not review the reviews on this hotel. There were other problems but these are the main ones. When I first told a desk clerk I was bitten, the person said bed bugs, so apparently they were aware there was a problem. Enter at your own risk. They need to close this hotel and fix this bug problem! This bite is infected on my leg and got much worse after this picture was taken..

Loved the location. Within walking distance to Ala Wai Canal and the International Market Place. Avis and Budget car rentals right at entrance to mall closest to hotel and easy to get in/out of city from this location. Can easily walk to Waikiki beach by cutting through International Market Place.Suite was also very spacious, but the decor was very dated to the point you question cleanliness. Very quiet, with the exception of a garbage bin pick-up/emptying early in the morning that is noisy. Laundry facilities on-site with reasonable pricing.Staff were very helpful.

I didn't expect much because the room was so cheap. first off they told me no parking on the property so I would have to park across the street at the international marketplace. then when I walked into the room it smelled like wet dog! I hurried to turn on the air conditioner and a blast of musky moldy smell came out! the bathroom floor was slippery I literary slipped just walking into the bathroom. never again will I step foot in this hotel!

The positives were the location and the room very clean and serviced daily. Bed very comfortable. Clean bathroom with good shower.Negatives were, too noisy, rude receptionist on arrival, rude concierge who was more interested in her own personal phone call than helping with a simple enquiry and we noticed she did the same thing to another guest a few days later. That concierge also misdirected us to a pick up location resulting in us missing our transport we had already paid for and so had to pay again for alternative pickup so we didn’t miss our excursion. However they seem to have different concierges on different days and the others seemed much nicer. The room in need of an update it was drab and disappointing and dark. The lighting was ineffective. The air con was very very noisy. Overlooked the car park which was horrible especially with car alarms going off which wasn’t the hotel staffs fault nor was the rubbish collection before dawn every morning which was incredibly loud. However they both added to our disappointing stay. For the size of the room there seemed to be furniture missing. Only one bedside set of drawers and one chair yet there was ample room for a coffee table and two chairs which would have made the room more comfortable. Anyway definitely would not stay there again.

We stayed here for 7 nights for a recent holiday to Oahu. The hotel has friendly staff and great helpful service. The room was large and clean. It was a great location. Only a quick walk through the International Market Place to beach. It was also very close to the bus stop we used regularly to get to the sights of Oahu. Definitely would stay there again.

Clean rooms, excellent location and good customer service. Easy walk to the beach, shopping centers, ABC stores and bus stop.Reception staff were very friendly. Loved the dvd rentals, laundry facilities and 'Legends Bar.
user_name:
Sandeep Q
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: We needed a suite with 3 bedrooms this hotel provided this at an extremely good rate, rooms could do with a bit of an update but we got our number one priorority which was a big suite at a great rate.

One of the cheaper hotels in the area but is a great location in the middle of Waikiki strip. It’s close to the beach and international market place. The WiFi was good and is free. There is always chilled water in the lobby and free dvds to have in the room. There is tea and coffee in the lobby in the morning as well as a fridge and tea and coffee facilities in the rooms. The air con was very loud so I turned it off at night The place is very dated but the room was big and did the trick. Front desk was helpful and there are girls for the beach you can borrow from reception

Excellent location for access to all that is Waikiki. Legends Sports Bar next door, International Market Place 2min walk, easy access one block to beaches, restaurants, shopping, markets, ABC shops on every corner, convenience stores, and gifts all close by.With the balcony door shut there was minimal street noise. The room was basic, dated, definite wear on lamps, carpets, furniture. Beds comfortable, adequate pillows. Air conditioner very efficient, though no degrees shown, so difficult to get temperatures right. Kitchenette, rather tha kitchen, included microwave and coffee filter machine. Needs toaster, kettle, cutlery and crockery, (no plates, microwave dishes, etc.). Freezer in bar fridge didn’t keep things frozen. No sink thus had to wash cups& glasses in bathroom sink. Bathroom roomy and clean. Mould between lip of sink and bench top, towels well worn, though replaced daily if required. Shower head was clogged, needed replacing or spout openings cleaned. Toiletries supplied were pleasant. Cockroaches noted at night in bathroom. Room service, bed making and tidy each day, friendly and helpful staff. Lighting only 3 lamps in living/bedroom. Large spacious room, but needs a table & chairs(we brought the outdoor setting inside), and lounge. Ironing board needs padding under cover to facilitate effective ironing. Parking fee of $30/night too expensive given its first come first served, and not undercover.Nightly hotel fee plus taxes Excessive given there is no pool, gym, or other shared facilities. Laundry clean, again $3/load expensive. We were not told of passbook for International Market, pearl pick, beach chairs. The foyer is very welcoming, spacious, comfortable chairs. Reception staff friendly and very helpful, happy to provide advice and suggestions. In summary, a basic dated motel, which has the location as a redeeming feature.

Great convenient location nearby the International Marketplace and other attractions. Clean room, good courteous service staff. Near many bus routes to get to Ala Moana Center, Airport, etc. Bike rental place next door.

This will have been our 4th time staying at this hotel. Every time has been a great stay! Hotel staff are amazing and accommodations are great! The location is close enough to walk to the beach but not on the main streets where it can busier. We have stayed in the 2 and 3 bedroom suites which are very spacious and updated. Would recommend this hotel for larger families who don’t want to spend a lot and want the space.

Honestly, for the price, the rooms are pretty good. I wouldn’t say it’s the cleanest but it’s manageable. The bathroom needs a makeover though. The toilet is sort of old and it makes a really loud flush and a lot of water builds up before it finally flushes. We thought that the toilet was clogged at first. The shower head has a bit of water stains and residue so maybe they could change the head every once in awhile? It was nice that they provide a PlayStation but there weren’t any games provided and no games were available for renting. They don’t have a pool but they do offer beach towels. No complimentary breakfast but for the price of the room, it’s not really an issue. They do have ice machines located on the 7th floor and vending machines on that floor as well. It was a little hard to find but it was mentioned in the paper they give you when you check in and it’s right next to the elevator. The ac in the room was a little weak. Didn’t really feel like it was on. The balcony was a little dirty so if you want to step outside you should bring some slippers. Overall the room is pretty good. Nothing really bothered me too much but it’s pretty loud at night and you can sometimes hear people fighting on the street. But the one thing I need to mention that I absolutely love is the location. It’s right across from international market place and Royal Hawaiian shopping center and many eateries. It’s a walking distance to the beach. The location is really good, you can easily have access to many restaurants and stores.

I've seen bad reviews and I was expecting the worse. I was pleasantly surprised. It had everything I needed. Bed, shower and T.V. Some people are just hard to please. I will stay again on my next trip.

Super helpful staff. Excellent location, so close to shopping, eating and beach! Buildings a little old but rooms and bathroom in good condition. Highly recommend staying here. We cancelled another hotel to stay here longer.

This was a very nice hotel. It wasn’t to extravagant or anything but it was very decent and in a great location. I would definitely stay there again. The free movie rental was a major plus. The staff was very friendly.

Hotel is located in an amazing location, walking distance to good food and shops. Room is spacious and clean. The air conditioning wasn’t too cold. The guy at the front desk was very polite and helpful. Would stay there again!

I was very delighted to see that this hotel still provides DVD rentals. It made my stay a lot better. My overall experience was wonderful I just wish I got a room with 1 bed like I requested. Instead I got a room with 2 full beds.

Stayed a few days here. Staff friendly. Good location. Easy walk to centre of Waikiki. Place had recently changed hands , but still accommodated our booking with minimal fuss. Room were a little tired, but hopefully new owners would adddress that.

When we first arrived there was no parking was told to park at another hotel and pay $30 or if we can find a spot on the side of the road. My kids found trash y deer both beds and beds smelled like urine..wifi was terrible too

For our budget it was what we expected. The staff were friendly and the location was good. There was no pool but the beach was only a 5 minute walk away. If you are coming from a far distance (we came from Perth, Australia - 16 hour flight) and arrive sleep deprived, make sure you do an early check-in as we only discovered we could do this after we arrived and had to wait 4 hours until our room was ready. We could leave our bags and wander but we just wanted to sleep by that stage.

I was so happy when the day came for me to go on vacation plus knowing that I had booked a hotel 1 block from the beach after seeing the pics I was convinced but seeing it in person im truly sold on this hotel so much that on any future trip to Honolulu I know where I will now be staying Pearl Hotel Waikiki the only place for me

Checking in was awful. Really bad customer service. I was not impressed. The room was okay. The cleaners were very good every day. All other front desk staff other than the man I checked in with were helpful and polite. Was a great location and was nice to stay in once we were in. Internet was good too.

The bed was very rock hard and the pillows were not comfortable to sleep on. The carpet felt wierd to walk on like it was very old. There is so much noise from the car park and neighbours that sleep was hard to come by. But the location of the hotel was in the middle of Waikiki so it was easy to walk to most places, including the beach. And the staff were really helpful

Stayed here for a conference. Chose the hotel for its location and low price. I like to walk so the 20 minute walk to the convention center was a nice way to start the day. The staff at the Pearl were friendly, helpful and professional. When I had a problem with a lamp, it was handled immediately. Rooms were clean and beds relatively comfortable. Rooms are dated. Curtains in my room were somewhat tattered. TV channel selection is limited. Ask for a room that faces the street. Almost all of these have the newer and quieter air conditioners. I was on a budget so this place meet my needs. It isn't fancy. But it is comfortable and clean.

Conveniently located across the road from the International Market Place with shopping and eateries and a 5 min walk to Waikiki Beach.Tour Bus pick up spots very close by if not out the frontRooms were large and spacious and clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful - couldn't fault this establishment.

Hotel Pearl Waikiki is centrally located close to many restaurants and retail stores with-in walking distance to beach.Very clean comfortable room staff very helpful and joyed my stay will go back again.

The staff was excellent, service was excellent, the only gripe I have is the fact that the have limited parking for their guest, so I wound up having to park 2 blocks way from the hotel. When we checked out the service was excellent also.

Stay away from this hotel! I’ve never stayed at a hotel like this before. From the moment we walked into the lobby, I knew it was a mistake to had booked our stay at this place. The building is really old. It looks like an old apartment building. When we walked into our room, it was very dark and dim inside (with the lights on). The first thing you hear is the LOUD A/C! Omg! Its very loud! The carpet was disgusting! There were stains everywhere! We didn’t get a remote for our TV. After being in our room for about an hour. THE A/C STOPPED WORKING! I called the front desk and told them about the A/C and missing TV remote. She told me that she would send the maintenance guy up. He comes into our room and starts looking for the remote control for the TV (like if we didn’t already do that). He couldn’t find it. Then he starts messing around with the A/C and nothing. So, he knocks on our neighbors door and asks if he can switch the BREAKER SWITCH on! The BREAKER BOX was in their room!! WTF?! As soon, as he turns the switch on, the A/C starts working again. A couple hours later, the A/C STOPS WORKING AGAIN!! She sends the maintenance guy up and he repeats the same scenario. Around 1:30am I woke up drenched in sweat! Guess what? The A/C broke AGAIN!!!!! I called the front desk, furious! She then tells me that the maintenance guy had gone home, and that she’ll send the SECURITY women up there. The security came into our room, I told her that she had to go into our neighbors room and switch the breaker switch back on. She didn’t want to do that, and told us to wait until the morning for the maintenance guy to come. At this point I was so angry and irritated! After the security left, the front desk called and asked if we wanted to switch rooms. I said no, because I didn’t want to pack all of our things and move at 1:30am! She then tells me that she’ll wave the hotel amenities fee ($20). What a joke! To make matters worse, there’s a sports bar attached to the hotel. All night, all we heard was screaming, loud bar goers. It was the worst experience ever! The following morning, I called the front desk because I desperately wanted to check out and GO ELSEWHERE. They told me that our stay was nonrefundable and if we left, we would still have to pay for the remaining nights. Also, be aware that they have LIMITED parking. We had to park across the street at the mall, because they ran out of parking spaces. Also, they never did wave that $20 fee for the inconvenience. If you want to have a fun memorable experience in Waikiki, STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!

My folks were guest for two months. On departure date, check-in-luggage and carry-on-luggage stolen from room (4 pieces). Police confirmed no visible forced entry leaving us to believe this is an inside job!! Hotel very relaxed attitude as though this happens regularly. Asked to have security footage reviewed and was advised that since new ownership in the last year and a half, security cameras non operational!!!!!Kirk was to expedite and reach out to their insurance company. Incident occurred on March 7, 2018, today April 10, 2018. After many follow up calls, non being returned and now being put on ignore. Hotel not taking responsibility.Think twice about staying at this property; crime is up in Waikiki and evidently with lack of security and concern for the well being of their guests, this hotel is easy prey!

The Pearl was a 5-10 walk from just about anything you would need at Waikiki. It’s a little older hotel, but had everything we needed. A king sized bed, AC, fridge and microwave. For value of the room we were able to do more.

Usually just a positive reviewer, but this was so bad, and inappropriate, I have to say this...LOUD AC so no sleep (or it was hot with it off), drains didn’t work, cig/blunt smoke kept coming in room. As soon as it was light outside I checked out. Told them about my experience, and they blamed me for my bad experience saying I should have complained. First off, all the rooms had the same external AC units, and so I figured there all the same, who wouldn’t. I did complain about the drains, but it was 10pm when I found out and didn’t want anyone in the room to fix it right then, nor did I want to pack up and move. And the other is policy, they allow people to smoke on the walkway outside rooms. These are external rooms, not internal rooms. Anyways, they offered no apology, no kind of incentive/discount...nothing. Just blamed me for entire property consistent things (except maybe the drain, and it was late) That is the most unacceptable part of this. But, if you need a cheap, clean-ish, convenient place, and can sleep with what had to be a 30 dB AC, then you’re fine here most likely. It would be nice to have known some of these things BEFORE booking, because I never would have booked here.

I have called the hotel more than 3 times to ask back my security deposit and no body knows what’s going on with it, I need the money and they told me to ask my bank about that, I went to ask them, and they said they haven’t received any money from the hotel. I NEED MY DEPOSIT BACK

Nothing flash but great location. Can get noisy during the late night/early morning with rubbish trucks and/or locals congregating in the car park that some rooms look over. Oh and the A/C unit is an old clunker.Daily room service, comfortable bed, helpful staff.Overall good value for money we thought just pack your earplugs.

Don’t be disappointed by the first impressions as we have been so pleased with our stay here. Forget the luxury pools & fancy bars, this place is all about the location and the very friendly service. We had a suite which contained 2 very comfy and clean queen beds, fridge and coffee pot etc. we asked for a kettle and had one in our rooms within 20 minutes. Room service every day with clean towels if you want, excellent information desk at reception with staff who really knew the best places to visit and how to get there. We had a bus stop within 20 yards of the hotel on the main road, about a 10 minute stroll to the beach & shops, bars, cafes all within arms reach. I would be happy to stay there again and would also be comfy staying with my family.

Located right across from the International Market Place in Waikiki, this boutique hotel is right in the heart of tourism central. Which has positives and negatives. On the plus side, you can pretty much walk everywhere - beach, shopping, restaurants, and nightlife. On the downside, it can be noisy late into the night. As for the room, it's spacious and clean with a fairly new flat screen TV. They offer free in-room WiFi, but it is useless. Could never connect the entire stay. I'd stay here again.

Lovely spacious room with separate bedroom. Has a full size bath with nice smelling toiletries, but unfortunately the carpet absolutely stank,I don’t think they have been cleaned for quite a while. We arrived and found a big lump of black hair on lounge floor as well as hair in bathroom. Very outdated but most of all needs a clean.Staff were lovely but cleaners only did bare minimum. $3 to do your washing and another $3 to dry, adds up when you have a big family. Very noisy outside

The location is terrific! Parking was a bit tight. Rooms are large and clean. Very nice. The front desk agent, ‘Dawn’ was professional and most helpful. We would recommend this hotel. You can beat the location. Solid value.

Very good location, car parking was limited and paid. The building and room are old. The price was fair for the location not for the amenities. It's a very good hotel for staying overnight but it's not great to stay longer periods in the room.

I loved Pearl hotel Waikiki even more, because of my prior disappointing experience in Stay Hotel.I had a reservation via Hotel.com at 2 star Stay Hotel for $161.52 per night, which was a junkyard in a back alley, especially for the price and the services that they provide: The room fridge, the public ice-maker were out of order, the windows and the door to balcony were impossible to open, the mattress was old and torturous; the cooler was extremely noisy and was next to bed, blowing the cold air into my face and head, which finally made me sick.
