When I woke up sick in the middle of the night and called the front desk repeatedly, no one was there to answer the phone. Then their only elevator stopped working and they had to wait for the part to be sent from mainland. I finally moved to the wonderful Pearl Hotel Waikiki, a 4 stars hotel near International Market place and a perfect location, where the manager, Steve, gave me an upgrade suite that was extraordinary for $117.00 all included. I truly enjoyed my stay at Pearl Hotel; I loved the room, the location and its closeness to the beach and everything else. The hotel had a free beach towel, movie and game video service, which was a plus. Thank you Steve!

I see some reviews talking negatively about this hotel but why? Chances are you booked this room to sleep, shower and dress. Worked perfect for our trip. You can pay thousands more at other hotels or you can stay here. After all, did most go to Hawaii to stay in our hotel room? Probably not. Served its purpose. If I’m on a budget and in need of lodging near Waikiki, I’d come here again. If you wanna hang around the hotel your whole trip, to bad for you. It was a perfect value for us!

We stayed in this hotel for approximately an hour. The room was not what we asked for in bed type or layout. We expected a kitchenette and king bed and got nothing of the sort. There was no way we would take our shoes off as the carpet was so horribly stained. There were thick layers of dust on all the shelves. There was a hive of ants in the counter and wall by the bar fridge and when reported to the staff, it took longer than fifteen minutes for someone to show up with a can of bug spray. Went to speak to the manager and found someone else staying at the hotel was experiencing a similar situation but with baby cockroaches.

Hotel is great location and for a short stay or young traveler's. We stayed 2 nights on the way home to Australia, purely for its convenient location. Rooms a bit outdated but clean nonetheless. Good place for a quick stopover and on a low budget.

I’ve never had a worst experience in a hotel and I’ve traveled the world. This place has nothing but bad vibes and horrible services and fees. They offer nothing and charge a fortune. You’d be better off sleeping in your car. Oh wait. You can’t park there for less than $30! And we couldn’t park on the premises. Had to walk and park for the same price 2 streets down. The place was a mess, beds were hard and pillows cheap. The lamp was on a slant, furniture was old and uncomfortable. The layout to the 2 bedroom suite was awful. Our guests had to come through our room to use the bathroom. No separate entrance. Can you believe these jokers! They charged extra fees for their parking and amenities that they don’t have. The police had to come for another couple that felt they were being taken advantage of. DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Find another hotel.

Located just across International Market Place, easy walking to Waikiki Beach and Hard Rock Café. Room is clean and staff are friendly and helpful. Great value for money. Will stay there again. Free water at lobby and free dvd's and newspaper.

+Very well located,international market just across the street,helpful and friendly staff Bathroom clean and bigClean room-Parking quite small and expensive but we are in Waikiki!!!Noisy air conditioner Will come back again

Upon check in of the room I realized this hotel was not for me. This was my first time in Hawaii purpose of trip was 12th wedding anniversary. My wife entered the room and immediately got quiet, knowing my wife I knew she did not like the room. we had recently grabbed food before going to the room she took all the food upstairs while I found parking(no parking available near hotel). She would not eat any of her food. Wife slept in all her clothes on top of the sheets. Rooms are outdated and not the cleanest. The next morning after speaking with guy at front desk he told me I would not be charged any additional money if I checked out early. During my early morning run I located another hotel that had vacancies( thank god me and my wife are active duty military). Immediately after checking out and checking into to new hotel my wife was so happy and herself again.

The hotel is clean and well kept for the price range. I travel often to Honolulu on business and stay at basic hotels. I was disappointed when the shower never got hot, only warm - barely warm enough to shower. Internet, while showing a strong signal, had software problems and I was never able to connect. Some of the bedrooms face the exterior hall/walkway so anytime people are walking by or talking in the hallway, the noise comes right into the room. (I rated Location as Very Good, but that is because I was there for business. I would rate it lower for vacation travel.)

Sorry to say that this is not a 3-star hotel - it is an older hotel that really needs to be maintained better.- The location is great- Staff is awesome- The pub in the hotel seems to be a popular place- The beds are old - but they are comfortable and do the jobBUT...- The carpets are nasty- Finishes are old and dirty (i.e. bathtub, furniture, tiles)- Air conditioners (the window units) are old and beaten- If you have a sofa or chairs - they will be nasty- If you have a unit with a Garburator get ready for a smell like you have never experienced before if you run the kitchen tap** ROACHES and bugs** This was just too much for me to handle. Don't get me wrong, I didn't see a mass infestation but after killing a few I was far beyond my limits.The staff was great, they moved me and the rest of my stay was bug free.My advice?I would say - book this hotel if you get a great deal, but don't expect anything more than what you paid for after getting a great deal.Hotels are expensive in the area... so again the intent of my review is just to set expectations rather than to tell people not to book at the Pearl.

Front desk was very professional and helpful. Housekeeping don’t vacuum or change bed linens. We were there for a week (rented 2 2-bedroom suite and 1 single room) and never had our sheets changed. Bring houseshoes to wear in your room because carpet is dirty.

This hotel is in a excellent location and is ideal if you're going to be out most of the day and just need a place to get some sleep. The hotel represents excellent value for money compared to what else is around. Staff are friendly and more than happy to assist.

Dirty, stained carpet , my arm actually stuck to the couch (horrible disgusting), loud music in the next room until 5:15 in the morning, we were booked in for 5 days but moved out after one night the kids were scared, I travel a lot with work and holidays and have never stayed in anything like it, 3.5 stars a joke, don’t stay here

Images shown on Facebook etc are only certain types of rooms and they don’t tell you this when you look at their fb page. Room with a city view is actually one of their carpark. Room is old, dingy and dodgy. Air con rattles and is rusted all over, mould and gunk in bathroom, electrical cords taped over and beds hard as rocks. Asked to move rooms and was told I had booked the wrong room and it was my fault I had used a travel agent even though I was guided by images on social media for a city view room. A city view room on their Facebook page consists of a lanai and views of Waikiki but yet we were given a room with a carpark view. Also I was insulted being told I didn’t know how hotel and booking sites work, yet didn’t acknowledge till the very end that he will let marketing team know of my feedback. Paying $21 for a towel per day for their ammenity fee was deplorable compared to what you receive elsewhere. Have a look at the images and make up your own mind. We left and found alternative accomodation which was cheaper, included the room on the 43rd floor, mini golf, yoga classes, gym and pool etc with a higher level of cleanliness along with newer amenities.

Great location, comfortable hotel, I will choose to stay here again. Front desk staff were very helpful. Very affordable. So close to great shopping and beach activities. It was nice not having to deal with the big hotel scene and crowded lobbies.

This is a basic hotel with very few amenities but if you are just looking for a place to sleep then you could do worse. We had a really large room on the top floor with a large balcony that looked out onto the city. Room was starting to look a little worn but was one of the cheaper options by far in Waikiki at the time we stayed. Service at the front desk was not friendly but efficient and the location of the hotel is a 5 min walk through the international marketplace to the beach. Just off Kuhio Ave

I had a 1.5 day layover in Honolulu, so I was looking for a cheap hotel, preferably near the beach. Not sure how I found this one, through TripAdvisor or Hotels.com, but the price was right and the location is EXCELLENT! I cannot believe it is such a low price and so near the beach, only 2 blocks away. MANY restaurants and shops in the area, since it is in the heart of Waikiki. One drawback was that we had to take a shuttle from the airport, which was $64 RT for 2. Oh well! I could have stayed near the airport with free shuttle but would not have the beach access.The room was a King, and actually a pretty large room. The bed and pillows were comfortable. Room includes coffee maker and refrigerator. The TV was nice, but we could not get the free dvd player to work. Not a big deal. The bathroom was average sized and the shower was OK, not bad but nothing special.My only complaint would be the thin glass of the large room window which looks out to a parking lot courtyard. We had to sleep with earplugs from the voices we could hear from across the way. Not really a deal-breaker for me, but kind of annoying. The balcony is not private, but stretches the length of the hotel, with outside room doors.

Pros: Location, size of jr. suite, microwave/fridge. Liked getting around from this point.Cons: Needs updating, ants in rooms near microwave/fridge. Wait time at reception sometimes gets long. Very noisy in room; balcony windows not well insulated and there is trash truck pickup or delivery truck EVERY morning at 5am.
user_name:
Stephanie C
Sherman Oaks, United States

review_body: the hotel is well located (International market place, ...) but the hôtel standing is average. The hotel deserves to be renovated. The staff was kind and caring. A swimming pool would ne welcome for the price i paid.

Location was great, one block off the beach & across the new international marketplace. I upgraded from the standard room to a Jr Suite for $5/night & went from 271sq ft to 451 sq ft. Room was big & had microwave, fridge, safe & painfully slow WiFi. I got the deal through groupon. Be aware there is a $20 "resort" fee added to every night you stay. Made me head scratch & try to figure out how they don't add that to the "price" of the room per night... Parking is quite limited & is $25-$30 (Can't remember). Overall, great for the money in this area. & the customer service was excellent!!btw, the pictures are screen grabs & weren't inteded to be put on here. sorry for the crappy images & messy beds

Internet was almost off or so slow that even WhatsApp messages did go through,had to go to Starbucks. Staff was very slow to provide a service, big queues to check in ( maybe that’s Aloha vibe). Room was ok, but we found hairs in bathroom and something looked like cheese on the ceiling( hell knows how it got there). If I go to Hawaii again - i’ll pick another hotel.

This hotel is not worth the money. Our first night there a guest had her room broken into and the police had to come and do a report. Rooms are old and dirty!! The noise level from people just walking past is ridiculous!! We do not recommend this hotel!! Save your money and don't waste it on this hotel!

I guess you need to pay more to get a quality experience. Terrible check-in. What was told as far as parking when making your reservation was totally different when you reached there to check in. The check-in is the first experience but the staff was sarcastic, glared at you when you didn't agree and had a comment. Never experienced such a poor customer service. Next year will pay double at the Hyatt but at least I don't need to be upset when I check in and check out. Wow the staff needs to go back to school or may be burnt out but whatever this is inexcusable. We live here and wanted to get away from the fire works but instead got fireworks at check-in. Hospitality out the window.

An affordable and great place to stay during your visit to Waikiki. Although there is parking available at this hotel, it will cost you extra money outside of your room rate. There is a convenient laundry room within the building. The room was in great condition and was very clean. The A/C was a little old, but was sufficient during our stay. The best thing about our stay was the customer service we received. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend other people try out this hotel.

Stayed here for 8 nights in 2 bedroom apartment with my sister for Christmas. Lots of stains all over carpet and on sofa, had to cover sofa with a sheet to sit on it, soap scum shower and bath tiles, dirty bath tub and floor not vacuumed on arrival or during our stay, bathroom not cleaned daily, just towels changed. You wouldn’t think of walking barefoot at all! So grossed out we washed all plates and cutlery before using them. Outside is shabby and unkept, internet photos make it look better than really is. Window in one of bedrooms wouldn’t stay open, reported to front desk but when maintenance man came he couldn’t fix it. As I have to sleep with open window for health reasons we booked this sort of apartment, but ended up using sofa bed in lounge room which had a balcony I could open. I asked to speak with the manager regarding changing rooms or getting some sort of rate reduction, but 3 requests on 3 separate days were unsuccessful and I got various excuses as to why manager wasn’t in office or available each time even though I tried at different times of day and even the suggested times by staff. Was told a note was left for the manager regarding the window issue and my request but there was no follow up or contact attempt or resolution by manager and I was charged the full amount on checkout. Waikiki was fully booked at this time and my booking conditions meant I would forfeit the full cost of room so we were stuck there and couldn’t move to another hotel. Pretty much once they have your money they don’t care and Waikiki so popular they don’t have incentive to give proper customer service and resolve issues. I was fobbed off each day with different excuses. This hotel is cheap and nasty in every way except it’s high room rate cost. Basic cheap furniture, 1 sofa for 4-6 people apartment, no wardrobe in main bedroom. Would not stay again or recommend.

This is a basic hotel across the street from the International Market and two blocks to the beach. It has friendly staff, large clean rooms and is good for families of 3-4. This hotel is very basic and a good value for the money, no pool or frills. If you are looking for very basic accommodations to sleep in, in the heart of Waikiki this hotel will fill the bill.

We were just here for an overnight trip, so it was conveniently priced. First off, the check-in was friendly and the front desk clerk very helpful. As we were walking to our room, which wasn't obviously numbered, my husband took notice of an a/c unit that was rusted and made a remark about the appearance of it. Turns out, it was OUR a/c unit. The door looked like it wouldn't be able to close, there was a crack in the top which made my husband a little wary about staying there. Secondly, parking was on a first come, first served basis. Thankfully there was a stall available when we arrived and when we returned from our shopping & dinner trip. I feel like if guests are being charged for parking, then there should be stalls available for them and not taken up by hotel employees.Oh, and it is located next to residential apartments. We were woken up a little earlier than we wanted to be by barking.Like I said, it was convenient for an overnight trip but if my stay was longer than that, I would definitely look into another location.

Hotel is close to restaurants and shopping. We paid so much but it is old and filthy. There are holes in the curtain, garbage disposal not working and no parking or pay $30.00 per day. It’s a motel and tv and dvd is charge 25.00 per day even if you don’t use it. I won’t recommend this motel at all.

We booked this hotel based on pictures that showed a modern 2-bedroom suite advertised as having queen beds. What we got was a filthy outdated 2 small bedrooms with two double beds. The carpet was badly stained and curtains had holes and were dirty and threadbare. The advertised parking was unavailable and we had to park at a sister hotel three blocks away and pay $30.00 for that. The hotel is well-located and the staff is helpful, but that doesn’t make up for the failings in this hotel.

Jordan at the concierge table was absolutely amazing. She made our stay very memorable, even staying past her finish time just to chat with us. She alone deserves 5 stars!! The hotel is in a perfect location with all requirements and attractions so close. The room itself was huge, although it only had one bedside table along side a king bed. The large glass sliding door to the balcony was very stiff and very difficult to open and close and therefore we didn't utilise the balcony. We had a toilet blockage but that was quickly rectified by the amazing hotel staff. I cannot compliment the staff enough as their customer service was top notch! In the bathroom we kept seeing little bugs running everywhere and we weren't sure exactly what they were. See picture. Other than that the hotel served its purpose as a cheap stay in the heart of Waikiki. The washing facilities made life much easier too! Would stay here again

great location close to everything, shops beach and transport. a bit run down, a few bugs here and there. but pretty good for a short stay. you will also have to pay a fee when checking out stayed for 5 nights and paid over $100 US , wasn't to happy about that.staff are great and laundry on level 3 for those who wish to use it.

Waikiki Pearl Hotel is in a great location, close to everything but just far away enough from the hustle and bustle of the Waikiki strip. The International Marketplace is a stone’s throw away and there are several general stores in the vicinity stocking everything from toothpaste to alcohol. We had a two bedroom apartment which was quite spacious and good basic clean accommodation. Unfortunately you have to walk through one of the bedrooms to access the bathroom, which was a bit awkward if someone was in that bedroom.

Customer service is awesome, Apelina at the front desk made our stay memorable.Location is good, walking distance from the beach and pretty much anywhere in Waikiki, hotel condition is good, not great but good, I only suggest you bring your earplugs because it can be noisy, they really need to fix their window sealing.You may already know that hotels in Waikiki aren't cheap, this hotel is not the exemption, we paid around 200 per night including taxes and fees.I believe they offer shuttle transportation to the airport, take advantage of that because taxi in Honolulu is really expensive.

Excellent location near the international market but the hotel is infested with cockroaches. The carpets are dirty and old. People always complain of the noise level but l was in 8 th floor so l didn't have any problems with the noise.They only provide coffee bags and green tea only so l had to buy my own English breakfast tea bags but on checking in you asked to pay money for the amenities which include refurbishing of the above. Very friendly house keeping staff.

Our hotel was super accommodating to our schedule. Jeffrey at the front desk is wonderful! Great deal for a 3 minute walk to the beach! It's an older hotel but amazing location if you want to go to the beach or good places to eat within steps of your room.

Waikiki Pearl hotel is located at a very strategic location, very near to International Market and only 2 blocks away from the beach. Near to supermarket and restaurants, easy to find food. Near to bus stop as well. Very convenience location. We arrived in the morning, so we had to wait for 3pm for check in, he upgraded us to a bigger room. It was a big room with balcony but the aircon power was too small for that room , the room was not cold enough and I couldn't sleep on the first night and that room was facing the road, was noisy at 4 am as a shuttle picked up the guests and can hear people talking. I requested to change room the next day, they gave me another smaller room on the higher floor. I was fine with smaller room, most important is cold aircon. Yes this room was super cold, freezing but I can manage it. One thing they have many little cockroaches around the pantry area, I informed housekeeping to spray, still there a bit here there. They must do regularly pest control for this. Cleanliness of the room was good, housekeeping cleaned the room daily. Staffs are friendly. We had a comfortable stay at this hotel.

I never write reviews but I feel like it's only fair to share this. When researching this hotel I read heaps of bad reviews but sometimes places are not as bad as the reviews. This hotel is cheap and in a great location but there are bugs and roaches and the air con is very loud so you will not get any sleep! Stay somewhere else!

Stayed here one night. It was reasonable price and my expectation was clean room with a bed to sleep. I had to kill like 6 roaches in the middle of night.. It was very unpleasant experience. I told front desk about this issue. It seems like it is not a big deal for them. I would not stay here again.

This is a motel, not a hotel. The rooms were clean and tidy but very dated. Unfortunately it was not what we expected based on reviews and their website. We got there early but could not check into our room until 14.45pm. I understand they are not obligated to let us check in early, but most places will give you access to your room if it is clean & available. There is no restaurant at this motel but plenty of others close by. They do have a sports bars called Legends that was good for some drinks before or after going to dinner. Staff were friendly and helpful. The location is close to international marketplace, shops and buses.

We had a twin room with balcony on the 9th floor overlooking the street. It was fairly quiet with some noise around 6am each morning with rubbish/trash collection trucks. The housekeeping staff were excellent and very efficient. Reception staff were very helpful with ant inquiries we had. No problems and a good experience all round.

It was awesome with kaimaaina rate, parking limited but around the block there's parking it was much cheaper 15.00. Front desk is friendly hotel close to shops bars and McDonald. Walking distance to Waikiki beach.

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights before flying out of Honolulu. First of all, they charged us $18/day for "amenities", which didn't go towards anything. The room was big, but outdated and there were stains on the carpet. There were also stains on the towels. Location was good, but other than that, we were disappointed...

was here for 7 nights, great location but that's about it. I went there to check in and they mixed my reservation up only had me for 3 nights instead of 7. I paid the resort fees upfront after I had to bargain for them as they wanted to charge me $20 per day with no pool.Once that was all sorted I went to my room 1st room had no balcony , which I paid for. I did complain to one staff member which did help me out a lot (Jeff) awesome.Now the rooms are really bad, cheap an nasty. Stains over the floor, dark an horrible. House keeping would come at 7am in the morning and when I said no not yet they wouldn't come back. I did as for more towels from reception but this request was not completed, as my room was not cleaned for 2 days.The other issues, where the power points in the room did not work, noise outside was really bad ( windows are not glazed) cards for doors keep failing, also they did try to overcharge me.If you need somewhere to say for 1 night that's cheap this would do.But anything over, spend a bit more and spend it at another hotel.

Stayed there for one night before my flight back to Australia. Room was tidy however noticed lots of little cockroaches. The room had a damp odour and the air conditioning unit was annoyingly loud (even on the low fan setting). On the positive, the location was good - close to a large shopping centre and places to eat. However an unsettled sleep. Would not recommend.

Yeah not the best hotel. Expensive. Not entirely clean, rundown. However very convenient & staff are very friendly and willing to make sure you are taken care of. I would only go back again to this hotel because of the location and if I get a private balcony as the other side is very noisy.

This in my opinion the Aqua Waikiki Pearl is a motel. Everything about it felt like a motel and since it was listed with great room pictures that was hotel quality my expectations was high. Needless to say this place did not meet my expectation since I had already paid the full amount upon reserving it months ahead it was too late to back out. The receptionist at the front desk seemed unfriendly as she never did once crack a smile nor had a welcoming demeanor. Parking was also a hassle, since the premises only had about 15 - 20 cars spot available and it was cost $30 a night and the only way to get a spot was to wake up early and be put on a waiting list. There were two other alternative; one was to find parking on the street which can be a nightmare or be directed to a parking garage two blocks away and pay $35 a night. The receptionist only gave me option one and neglected to tell me about option two. I overheard option two later while walking past the front desk with another receptionist. The rooms seemed old and it did look like they tried to update it but fell short. The rooms had ROACHES!!! I saw a few roaches in the bathroom and on the tables in the room thus forcing me to eat on my bed and disposing of it right away. Had I known I would have adjusted my expectation and been fine but the pictures mislead me into thinking something else. So book with cautious and don't get your expectation too high.

We stayed in the Aqua Pearl for a week. The accommodations are clean and nice. The location is amazingly convenient. We walked through the shops and restaurants and walked to the beach daily. The staff was so kind and welcoming. The only inconvenience was parking, but they had alternative parking which worked fine for us.

Not a horrible hotel, but avoid it unless it's less than $100/night or the only choice. PROS: Very friendly staff, good location, great coffee shop and also a bar right next door. Bathroom was clean, bed was comfortable.CONS: While the room generally felt clean, the carpet was very stained and old, and the sheets and curtains had tears in them. (the curtains had duct tape on them!) There was no furniture other than a desk chair and the bed ( and the desk/TV stand and fridge).There are only 18 parking spaces at the hotel so you need to show up at six am to try and get one for later. The other option is to park at their sister hotel two blocks away for $30/24hours (pretty standard rate for Waikiki).

The rooms were really pushing it. Hotel is dark and just gross. Stains galore. I don't mind outdated to save money, but this was a big mistake. We changed rooms 1 time due to air conditioning sounding like a plane landing and the next room was larger with a balcony but more stained up than the last. The carpet was concerning, we are sure if that was blood or red nail polish on carpet either way bringing a carpet cleaner in the room alone would go a long way. Parking was a disaster. Apparently you are lucky if you get a spot. We were not and had to park 3 blocks away at another hotel. Please don't make my mistake by staying here!!

Pictures great till I arrived hotel very dated and dark and small corridors. At first sight the room very dated but clean for the aged hotel. Front desk not very helpful. But Waikiki made up for the rest of my trip

Let me first provide you with my mindset.Husband just finished 8 weeks radiation therapy son out of work, lets go on a weeks holiday to enjoy time together. Yes I am so thankful we can do this, in saying this working to a tight budget.I booked on line provided all my details including my overseas address. When I booked it would not allow me to input my code SPLASH to get my 15% off discount so I used the chat line to advise how I would get this. She advised the rate I got was for local residence, being oversea visitor my rate would be more and when I could not produce local ID would be charged on arrival. I requested written confirmation given this was there system issue and the price given would be honoured, which it was no further discount provided.So it was no surprise we would have been given the worst room. I asked for a double for myself and hubby and my 6'5 sons single bed each instead got a queen.We received a room closest to the lift,the window faces on the walkway to the lift so everyone on this level has to walk past our window. So We have a week of either living in a fish bowl with everyone looking in on us , this is not happening as we do like our privacyor drawing the heavy curtains and living a week in darkness. Why would a hotel give a room like this to people staying a week and not to single night clients . Ohh maybe because their system made a mistake.We also advised there would be 4 occupants room made up for 2. $30 us for parking each night and you are not guaranteed parking on the hotel this is even when you are disabled Noisy air conAlex the guy booking us in did not smile once and was arrogant All these attention to detail started badly and only got worse with a week in darkness If you are booking for few days and they give you the keys to room 703 give it back Only thing going for this hotel is its location,good location,For our family holiday the choice of this hotel has destroyed my dreamNever again

This is a very old hotel that has been given a face lift so that the photos are deceiving. We reserved a standard 2 double bed room, but were actually upgraded for some reason to a very roomy 2 bedroom suite! The first problem was finding light switches in the odd configured suite. I never could figure out how to turn off the lamp that my son had turned on before he went to bed. The smell, carpet stains and general feel was CREEPY!!! There was a locked closet in the kitchenette that had a vent with very large spaces, creepy. The large bathroom had no window and no vent or fan either. The closet in my son's bedroom had exposed pipes and deterioating stuff around them that looked like it was falling down. Despite all of this, the final straw was the rock hard beds we were forced to sleep on because of the late hour that we had checked in. To the hotel's credit, they didn't charge us when we checked out the following morning for the second night that we had originally booked. When asked if we were checking out early, I simply replied yes. No questions asked, they politely checked us out. The best thing about this hotel is their location. It's right beside the new Hilton Garden Inn Waikiki Beach Hotel, where we got a gorgeous comfortable clean room, for only $30 more a night.

This hotel was okay. It was clean. Staff was friendly.Their policy of parking needs to be reevaluated.I reserved our parking spot about a week in advance and was told by Tiki that it was no problem. My husband called before we arrived and spoke to Hank and was told it was no problem. When we got to the hotel we were told that the parking is first come first serve. We did not have parking for the first 3 days we were there. They did have another property a block away where you can park your car. $30 per day.Other than that, it was a great place to stay. It was right across the international market. The best place to swim in Waikiki, behind the Duke statue, is just a few blocks down. Everything is in the area of this hotel. Even the bus stops are just a block away.It was a comfortable stay and I'd recommend it. Next time we may not rent a car because their bus transportation is reliable.

This was our first time in Hawaii and this at the time of booking seemed to be reasonably priced with good star ratings. I think $18.00 per day extra charges for the daily stay is unacceptable since we paid enough money at the time of booking. This sort of stuff should be already included. The hotel in itself is ok. The room was clean and adequate. We could not make tea as there was no kettle and doing it with the coffee machine tasted like crappy coffee.The major downside is the noise at 5am every day. I brought this up but not sure it was understood and then was offered another room for extra money and to be told that it is noisy in any room so we stayed where we were. Since this was a holiday I had hoped not to wake up as if I was going to work!!!

We stayed here for 5 nights in June 2017. Overall, it was a comfortable stay and the hotel is in a perfect location- a short stroll to Waikiki Beach and very close to shops and restaurants. The rooms were dated and our toilet didn't flush properly all the time but for the price of the rooms we weren't expecting luxury. The big downside was the $18 per day "hospitality fee" which includes wifi (which didn't work in our room), phone in room (which was broken). Thankfully the hotel reimbursed this fee. Wifi really does need to be improved. We also had a couple of baby cockroaches in our room which isn't acceptable regardless of the price of the gotwl.Overall, comfortable and convenient but if you are after luxury and perfect cleanliness this certainly isn't the hotel for you.

My room was very clean and very nice looking. Updated recently I think. The location was great. I like that you can walk through the International Marketplace (where hotel street ends) to get to the road that goes right along the beach--and lots of shops along the way. Hotel personnel were all polite and friendly and helpful, above and beyond. They let me park my rented moped in the lot with no extra charge. Very nice area to walk around and explore. I'm happy with this hotel and my visit was wonderful.

This hotel may not be the Ritz Carlton, but they provide Customer Service that makes you feel like you are. We had the pleasure of working Tiki and Johanna. Let me tell yoi that if you were to look up the definition for "Exemplary Customer Service" you would find a picture of them.Tiki is just AWESOME. He treats his guests like family from the moment you walk into the lobby til the day you leave. Johanna is just the sweetest. Always smiling and able to manage phones ringing off the hook and helping guests right in front of her.Thus just go show you that you don't need to spend thousands of dollars a night to be treated like royalty, you just have to find the right place and the right people. And let me tell you, we are happy we found the Aqua Waikiki Pearl, but more than that, Tiki and Johanna.

Good location and nearby shopping center. We stayed in 4 beds room for 3 nights, room quite big enough for us. But no window or lanai or balcony for the fresh air. Staff were friendly and gave an important information.

I am just coming back from four days at the Aqua Pearl. For what it costed me ($78 per day + taxes) I could not have expected more in overpriced Waikiki. Late night receptionist was very polite and helpful. She gave me a high floor room, which was spacious and clean (even though a few refurbishments won't be a bad idea). The room was fully equipped with fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. When I left, I unexpectedly required an airport shuttle service, and they provided it to me on the spot. Location is right in the middle of Waikiki so you basically have everything you need just a few steps away. They also have a free shuttle service to Ala Moana Shopping Mall and other locations in Wikiki which can be tracked online. I would definitely consider staying here again if I were to come back to Waikiki.

The hotel location is good and the price was reasonable. I was relieved that there were no signs of cockroaches in my room after reading some of the reviews on here! In saying that, I can't say I enjoyed staying here. The room was a bit dungeon-y - a small, dark box with a tiny window that was too high to see anything from. The air conditioner was loud and not very effective. Functional for one night but probably wouldn't stay again.

We were very surprised how central this hotel was to everything in Waikiki. Room are a bit rundown and we did encounter issues with our room as air con was very loud, carpet had really bad stains and cockroaches in the room. We spoke to reception and the manager on duty promptly put us in a new room with photos provided, it made a big difference to our stay. We had 3 kids with us and they felt very comfortable staying here. Starbucks Reserve is minutes away and Food Pantry also a block away from the hotel with everything to stock up with munchies for the kids and alcohol for the adults, it's like an IGA but prices are very good for the area. ABC store is on the corner but a bit more pricey and the International Market Place across the road. There is plenty of shopping outlets close by like Ross, Nordstrom and Macy's is close by but if you like Basketball Flight 23 (Michael Jordan 23 ) is in the market place. Our room had a fridge, microwave and coffee machine. Coin Op laundry is on site so very convenient when travelling with kids. Staff are great and management even better, i can highly recommend this hotel for people that are looking for a central location and are also travelling with kids. It is Hawaii and hotels are a bit rundown but remember you go to paradise to explore not to spend it in the Hotel Room.

We stayed here in 2013 and found it great. Location wise was excellent and the size of the room was spacious for what we needed. There is onsite coin laundry service which we used & found helpful to have on-site. Coming back here in 2017 we were less than impressed. We only stayed two nights as everything about the room was awful. There was duck tape all over the curtains covering holes which let the sunshine through early in the morning. The room didn't look or feel clean after housekeeping came through to clean it. The beds were very hard and they were the size of a small double so both my husband and I slept in different beds so we could spread out a bit. No restaurant or eatery on site but there are many close by including the international markets which is not too far away. No swimming pool but only a short walk (5-7mins) to the beach via two blocks. The suite next door to us were having a loud party which we didn't want to ruin to early, but by midnight we had had enough and called reception to let them know. They said others had also complained hours before us and they were being dealt with but we didn't notice security visit them until well after an hour after us phoning to complain. All in all, good location but less than impressive room and services. We don't plan to stay here on our return visit to Waikiki.

Disgusting. We booked only one night to stay in Waikiki with my girlfriend. There were cockroaches and little bugs everywhere. They wouldn't give us our money back. Should be closed. Also charged 30 dollars for parking. Book another place.

The staff was great to work with but the rooms were nasty. Declined two rooms due to awful stains on the carpet and cockroaches in the first room. Third room was cleaner but still had bad stains even after being cleaned the day before we arrived. The sliding glass doors were very hard to open and close. Shower head needed changed, only half the water came through the shower head. The over flow cover fell off on our second to the last day. Air conditioners needed updated, real bad at cooling. Owner needed to decide if he wanted to closed the doors or do some serious cleaning and updating. Staff said they were suppose to be remodelling soon. Hope they do.

After I checked in I went out, when I came back in the evening I found my room invaded by some insect! This was even after I closed the bathroom window. Roaches and bugs were in the bathroom and I found one crawling on my bed. I went to the reception and showed them picture, they gave me immediately new room, which was an upgrade. I guess it´s because the rooms have microwaves and people are buying whole food to cook and also the property is open. However the problem was solved in very professional manner and I appreciate it!The hotel provide beach towels upon a small fee. They also have DVD rental machine and Playstation console in every room. Room facilities includes coffee maker, coffee pouches, microwave and a large TV, as well as safe and fridge. When it comes to facilities I found this hotel better then more expensive Ohana east!
user_location: Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
user_name:
Marketka K
Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: The hotel is in the heart of Waikiki. It's on a busy street in the morning well most of the day so the noise can be a bit of a problem period but the hotel is been thoughtful and giving you ear plugs. I was wondering what they were for in the beginning because in the daytime you don't notice too much but definitely when I was awoken for the third time during the night I put in the air plugs and then slept soundly for the rest of the night. There are not many amenities as they don't have a pool but the ocean is less than two and a half blocks away so get out there and enjoy the real thing. They have unlimited free rental of DVDs if you are somebody who likes to watch movies in the room. The room that I was in was extremely spacious had two queen-size beds with lots of room to spare quite a luxury compared to many of the rooms that I have stayed in in the past. It was a big screen flat TV and a very comfortable bathroom with very nice shampoos lotions Etc the towels were good and not threadbare like some motels and the price was right definitely a recommendable hotel period and the staff we're definitely full of aloha.

Our whole family stayed here over spring break. large room. Large lanai. No pool. Room was dusty and poorly maintained. Carpet had stains. Sliding door had no handle from the outside making it very difficult to go in and out. Most of the staff was friendly and helpful. Wifi was good. I booked under a rate that allowed me a complementary room upgrade based on availability. When I asked they said an upgrade was available but would be $100. Close to the city bus. Hotel shuttle will take you all over Waikiki. My opinion. Aqua Palms was a lot cleaner and nicer, even though the room and lanai were smaller. We just wanted to try a different Aqua property. Overall, the pearl was ok as long as you weren't looking for a super clean and well maintained room.

amazing place to stay very close to everything the costumer service is the best the front desk is always willing to help with anything, very friendly. this was my first time but it was my sisters second time staying at this hotel.if i have the chance to go back i will be staying at this location.

I cannot say enough about this extraordinary hotel. We noticed at check-in and check-out that many other guests were from other islands in Hawaii; that's a good recommendation. Graciousness, hospitality, patience, cleanliness, spacious and hospitable rooms, and LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. It's all here. I'm a flight attendant who's been traveling to Waikiki (for pleasure, not work) multiple times per year since 1997. This is the best value for money you will find, PERIOD, and a pleasure to call your home in Waikiki. I have been staying at this property since 1997. As a flight attendant, I have lots of opportunities to visit Waikiki and I've taken advantage of every one of them. Having been all over the world, my husband still says Waikiki is his "happy, beautiful place." I have recommended the Aqua Waikiki Pearl to friends, family and colleagues and they have always reported favorably. I stayed here from March 6-10 of 2017 -- my first visit in too long, and my companion's very first to Hawaii -- and the Pearl is better than it's ever, ever been. I cannot recommend the Pearl enough. For one thing, there's the location. You are a few minutes walk to the best of the beach. Next door is a small grocery; on the other side is a coffee shop. Across the street, a liquor store/grocery and Korean restaurant. A 24-hour supermarket and bus stops are within those same five minutes. The remade (and now quite glitzy, if you ask me) International Marketplace is practically on the doorstep of the Pearl. Our room, 813, was spacious, with a full kitchen and lanai. (Our leftovers from the various restaurants we visited were put to excellent use.) It was impeccably clean and we didn't see an insect on the property the whole time we were there -- amazing in the tropics. We chose to forego daily maid service, but when we saw the maid on the way in or out she was generous with a stack of towels and coffee when we asked. There's a pet-friendly policy; we didn't see a pet, nor did we ever see or smell any evidence of one, and that's as it should be. Our reservation was made last-minute (the only way an airline employee travels) and accepted graciously. We were greeted with a basket of canned juices and candies, free beach towels and beach chairs. Many of the wonderful staff members were folks I recognized from years back. Lisa, who staffs the tour desk in the lobby, was very helpful arranging our visit to Pearl Harbor. The front desk clerks Ape and Jo were extraordinary. Please accept my "mahalo" and believe me when I say that I cannot wait to return -- perhaps as soon as May -- with my husband. Fabulous.

Only good thing about this hotel is location as it's right across the street from the International Market Place. Overnight parking is $30 and for that "privilege" you will probably have to walk two blocks as they only have about 15 stalls in back of the hotel that are 1st come 1st serve - so don't count on it. This turns into a 5 block drive to come back to pick up luggage due to one way streets. Our room was like a dungeon and had stains on the carpet. We even found a left over burrito in the microwave so the cleaning crew is not first rate. It is not worth saving a few bucks to stay here.

While this was a pretty good location just behind the new International Marketplace, there were several issues. The first was the noise. Rooms at the front of the building, especially on the lower floors, are subject to trucks delivering in a loading zone from 5 am onward. The desk clerk told us the biggest complaint they have is about street noise. Although our first room at the front was large with a balcony, we moved to a smaller room at the side because of the street noise. Some of the air conditioners are super loud. Also the hotel charges $18 per day per room over and above the room rate for access to amenities that many other hotels offer as part of the room fee. These 'amenities' include coffee in the room, DVD rentals, borrowed beach chairs, and the Aqua shuttle. This fee was mandatory and not optional, so adding that to the room rate made the price not as reasonable as we'd expected. As a result, I cannot in good conscience recommend this hotel.

Received a group to Hawaii and needed to stay with them at this property. they wanted "budget" and found them this. Good location on back side of Waikiki (closer to Ala Wai Canal) Street isn't as noisy as some but still can hear the garbage trucks at 4am. If you want no frills and a clean, decent room then this place is perfect. No pool, no breakfast but location is good (especially to new International Market place) and perfect to catch buses to anywhere on the island. We didn't use the scheduled shuttle to Ala Moana. Apples and all day coffee in lobby are a nice touch. Food pantry supermarket just around the corner.Standard rooms are decent sized and have coffeemaker, fridge and microwave (warmed up my leftovers from dinner just fine). I was afraid of my 4th floor room and the street noise but it was fine however I'm convinced that even if I was on the 20th floor of any hotel I would still hear the early morning garbage trucks. Front desk staff are pretty nice - didn't use the "tour desk" also in the lobby. Didn't use the game console in the room but I'm sure if I had kids they would have been all over it. Wifi was average but just bounced to my 4g connection.If you want cheap, clean, centrally located and decent sized rooms, then the Pearl is for you. If you need more amenities than listed, then I suggest a different hotel. My clients were completely satisfied as was I! I did a lot of shopping at the New Nordstrom Rack and had the best almond croissants at B. Pattiserie (a short walk away!)

This was my third time there, as usual the staff was great ! The building not so much. I was not the only one with these problem's talked to 2 other guests on different floors they had the same issue's.

We rented a room at this hotel for the day. It was very affordable, about $80. We arrived in Honolulu at 7 am and our departing flight was not until 10 pm. We have been in this situation many times and in Honolulu it is hard to find a day room. Though some chain hotels will let you buy a day rate it is still expensive and all you really get is to shower because you still have to check out long before gong to the airport.After our flight arrived we went to the hotel, changed into beach attire and went to the beach for the day. The hotel staff was helpful and stored our luggage. At the end of the day we went back to the hotel to shower and gather our things. This is the perfect use for this hotel which is very close the beach but is bare bones, rooms are small and in need of renovation and it is in the middle of the block with no view and no food.
user_name:
Jill D
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Great affordable hotel just a couple blocks from the beach. Has a real good local sports bar with friendly staff. Great for tourists who want their hockey or Australian sports fix. The international market place is just across the street. Also close to many other bars, restaurants and shops. Only down side is no pool.

Unlovely view of a concrete wall and alley. No parking available which meant I had to walk 5 blocks and pay $35 to park overnight. Busy, busy area with lots of bars and for some reason parents out pushing strollers at 10:30-11:00pm.. The hotel staff was nice and the rooms renovated and functional it's just an old concrete apartment building with open air hallways that probably just needs a tear down. I was looking for a budget stay and had super low expectations but with the parking and fees this was not it. Finished off with a hard bed I couldn't get out of there fast enough.

TripAdvisor doesn't allow giving those ".5" points :DThe hotel is pricy & charges extra beach facing fees along with high parking fee. Luckily, we didn't rent any car... but beach fee !!! seriously !!! One needs to walk almost for 15 mints to reach the Waikiki beach... and they say they are beach facing... they don't mention this thing while booking online... such hidden fees LOLRoom looked pretty old with strained carpet.Laundry room needs to be taken care of too...so untidy !No complaints for the reception staffs - they were helpful & kind.They even agreed to hold our luggage as we had an early check-out! The bed-sheets were cleaned & bathrooms were tidy too... thankful for that !!!

ONLY REASON I GAVE IT ONE STAR IS BECAUSE TRIPADVISOR DOESN"T HAVE A ZERO STAR OPTION!!! This hotel is a one step below a PRISON CELL!!! It's $30 to park and even then they ONLY HAVE 15 Parking spots for maybe 100+ rooms. Had to park 4 blocks away!!! I'd rather pay a bit more to stay in a room which doesn't have bird poop all over the balcony, BEDBUGS, Nasty smelling rooms, AC's were at least 30 years old (the one's that go through the wall), commode was nasty, the shower nozzle head is covered in grime and green scum, and seems like there's BLOOD STAINS on the carpet!!! have probably stayed in over 200 Hotels and this is by far and away the ABSOLUTE WORST!!!! Please do yourself a favor and STAY HOME RATHER THAN CHECK IN HERE!!! DON'T SAY YOU WEREN'T WARNED!!!!

Convenient to centre of Waikiki shopping area, everything in walking distance, clean, comfortable, staff friendly, only issues we had was unable to access wifi from our room for the 4 days we were there, we arrived from a 10 hour flight in the early hours of the morning was taken to the motel to find our room would not be ready until 4pm, hotel was kind enough to hold our luggage for us but all we wanted was a shower and sleep, for international guests the rooms should be made available early to coincide with flights, overall it was ok,

Good location to beach and Pantry for groceries and International Market Place and lots of good restaurants\Service at desk was excellent - staff very friendly and accommodating Housekeeping was a little hit and missRoom for two of us was spacious enough for our time there Only complaint was the birds in the tree outside in parking lot - but could be worse things lol

This is a great place to stay with families, so convenient and close to Starbucks,Subway and only one street away from main Honolulu shops and beach . Very clean apartments , the cleaners are lovely! The staff at the reception desk are wonderful! We found this location affordable and away from all the crowds. Especially cause we were there for New Years Eve ! WillDefinitely come back to stay here !

Great location, clean rooms, and the price is pretty fair. The front desk and house staff were friendly.We were extremely satisfied with the quality of treatment we received during our stay here. A must stay if you want quality service & room at an affordable rate!

I want to start off positive. The location is great it's across the street from the new International Market and just a few blocks to the beach. The staff is very friendly especially at the front desk. The hotel doesn't have a pool but they do have coin laundry and free internet. The rooms are starting to get warn but do have microwave and fridge. The beds are so hard you might as well sleep on the floor! Unfortunately there were roaches a bit more than expected in Hawaii.

Let me begin by noting my general disappointment with Waikiki Hawaii as a family holiday destination. The weather was perfect but, in my opinion, it turns out to be nothing more than "an expensive tourist trap". Service is generally poor. The overall ambiance of the place is tired and not very welcoming. Our chosen accommodation turned out to be quite basic - hard beds, no room seating, poor ammenities; and very bad internet in a building that was suffering from poor maintenance. The added daily amenities charge on each room provided little in enjoyment to the guests. Creating a seperate charge for things like water in lobby and towels for the beach is a bit over the top. I sound hard but I guess we have become spoilt in Australia and in South East Asia as to what is expected in terms of family holiday venues. Hawaii might be suitable for a USA stopover for one or two nights but not a ten day vacation....

The people at the front desk were the friendliest. However, this was the worst accommodation due to only window in our room looking directly at the balconies of other people. The carpet had some stains on it and could use replacing.

I found that the only thing worth a beans was the housekeeping lady on the 10 floor .She was so kind . Give her a raise. The hotel is overpriced by double $$The lighting in my junior suite was not working !!!The room was missing a lounge chair ,It only had a desk chair.A 30 dollar microwave and a 30 dollar fridge does not I repeat does not make it a junior suite. The doors slam in near hallways starting super early . If your looking for good beds this hotel does not have . I don't blame the staff . The problem lies in the hands of the owners .

Location felt sketchy, the room was ok, but the bathroom was dirty and moldy. lots of background noise from the back lane. The staff was friendly. The rates were worth it and I would stay here again, but only if they cleaned the rooms better.

This hotel is located central to everything , shops ,transport and site seeing. The hotel have everything you need and check in staff are excellent (Harry ) . There is a bar down stairs for a drink and watch a few sport channels. The rooms have everything you need and the price is very good.

I could not fault the staff they were extremely helpful warm and friendly but most unfotrunately l became extremely ill in the last couple of days of my trip my room was not cleaned at all except for the first several days the carpet was filthy and never vaccuumed once, there was a coachroach in the bathroom sink, there were people next to me constantly slamming their doors day and night, no view except that of looking straight over to the next apartments and a concrete bollard which from a security point of view after dark was a little concerning when entering the room. There was little light of any in the room and l couldn,t leave the curtain open due to he isk of people going past looking in. I was on the seventh floor which from a noise perspective was extremely average as previously mentioned above. Proximity wise to the beach et all it was teriffic but the hygeine standards were disgusting and unnacceptable even for basic low budget accommodation. I would not recommend this at all to anyone looking at low budget accommodation. As it is, i shall never go back there again.

if you get even room face to west, its roomy and bright. some with kitchen in house. parking is 30$ per day. booked about 120$ from expedia. good deal for very convenience location. right beside international village. walk to the beach about 7 min across the mall. 2 min to the river. good deal !

Arrived in our musky room, with only 2 lamp shades working. No other light. Interior run down, carpet needs a steam clean. But at least the beds were clean.Bathroom still had 'human' hair from past guests. The next day, we came back from the beach and it was clear they still hadn't cleaned the bathroom. We called the concierge, and they kindly arranged a cleaner to come up in 15 mins. If you ever wondered what housing commission homes are like... feel free to stay here, I'm sure it's the closest thing.

This is our second stop off here in the last few months. One thing I have realised about Waikiki as a while is that the buildings are all old and dated. The hotels are worn out and tired. Some have had rooms painted but it all needs major work to make it the modern and clean place people coming here to holiday expect and are paying good money for.The Pearl is one such hotel that really needs a major refurbishment. The carpets are all sticky and the bathroom fixtures are old. The building needs a link of paint on the front to make it look fresh.Now that said the reason we stayed here 2 times was the PS console in our room and a card to select a game. This and the truly lovely staff here are what make it worth coming back.

The place is disgusting conditions. Our room had cockroaches on the walls, coming out of the drain in the bathroom sink, on the bathroom floor. There were huge stains on the carpet. The walls were filthy.

Ok this plc ace is in a decent position however you would trade that for decent amenities. Old drab , needs an overhaul. I don't wouldn't do more than an overnight stay here. Do many better options around that have seen some maintenance in the last 30 years

I stayed at the hotel recently and while the location was great, the hotel was dirty and there was cockroaches. And this wasn't the worst part...I left a pair of very expensive swimwear hanging on the drying rack in the bathroom and when I returned to the room they were missing. I reported it to the front desk but nothing was done to rectify the situation! This was not a great end to the holiday and I was very disappointed. I would not recommend this hotel.

This place was horrible for us. It's dirty, noisy and so far overdue for an update it's almost ready for demolition. There were even ear plugs beside the bed! It might be close to the new glossy shopping center but shopping isn't the main reason people come to Waikiki.

We stayed 2 nights on the way back from Maui. The room was large and spacious but very sparsely furnished - just one king bed, table and one chair and bedside table and lamps. One chair in the whole room! No sofa, no coffee table. The hotel is old and could do with a major refurbishment. Staff were friendly enough although it was quite hard to understand the oriental girl at reception. The hotel is quite conveniently located off Kuhio Ave just opposite the newly built International Market Place.
user_name:
Chrissy B
Auckland Region, New Zealand

review_body: TO BE GIVEN A MISS AT ALL COST.Thankfully we had only one night booked.The room smelled awful, ants running along the furniture, fridge & coffee machine not cleaned out. The noise from the a/c was like an aircraft taking off so no wonder they left earplugs for your use on the bedside table.Our room overlooked the car park and was relatively quite apart from the a/c but friends of ours had a room looking out over the street - very noisy.Under no circumstances should you book this hotel.

We booked in for 3 nights coming on our honeymoon to Waikiki for the first time in Hawaii! And First night I got bitten by bed bugs. Not too much . As I had been bitten before I know exactly what the bites are like and it was definitely bed bugs, more likely in the pillow as I only had the bites around my neck and face. Hard to explain but I'm not really a scandal person so I decided just to sleep without a pillow instead of changing the whole room and making a fuss of it. Because we liked our room in general and didn't want to be moved in the small room. So we stayed for another night. No more bites without a pillow, but! We just realised we had lots of money stolen from the hidden places inside the luggage! So obviously the cleaner went through it very well! I wouldn't have even noticed but I just decided to recalculate our finances as we travelled with cash and it was missing a good pack of it! Unfortunately we have no way to prove the theft as there was no cameras in the room and no valuable items were stolen! But really did lot expect this from a well looking hotel in Hawaii! You just made our honeymoon started miserable and I hope this cleaner will just get it back to him!! People beware and don't stay in this hotel!

We stayed here for 11 days, the staff were nice, we actually found Joanna to be more helpful than others, our room was very out dated, upon check in I noticed the air con was noisy and hadnt been wiped down for a while as you could see how thick the dust was, while standing on a chair, there was hair on the bathroom floor, the basin, toilet bowl and in the bath tub, there was also hair and rubbish stuck behind the bathroom door as well, went to make myself a hot drink and their were coffee stains left on the tray the coffee machine sits on from the last client, if there was a way of recording the smell of a hotel room hands down it smelt of urine in the bathroom..the pictures of this hotel as well as the ratings are very decieving!

These people are VERY dishonest! Arrived for check-in and was told their parking lot(which had maybe 15 spots)was full and that I would have to find parking somewhere in the city and walk to the hotel(absurd much?). I couldn't find anywhere remotely close to the hotel to park, so I called to cancel my reservation as they made it impossible for me to stay there. Was told by the manager that they would not refund the room rate or resort charge, and on top of that THEY REFUSED TO REFUND THE PARKING FEE EVEN THOUGH THEIR STUPID LOT WAS FULL!!!! Best to stay elsewhere. Very dishonest.

Booked through Hawaii air website, reserved three nonsmoking rooms for three nights!. However, All of the rooms smelled malodorous with mixed cigarettes, alcohol and awful moldy Window AC. We were stuck in those toxicate rooms for two nights if I didn't insist to switch the last night! Do yourself a big favor, stay away from this hotel!

Spent 5 nights here, and having read some previous reviews I really did not know what to expect. Okay, yes, the hotel certainly could do with a make-over, it badly needs modernising. Having said that, the bed was comfortable, the room was clean, so no complaints there. I was surprised, though, to see ear plugs resting on the bedside locker. It was obvious, though, why these were needed when you switched on the air-con!! What a noise it made! Did it keep me awake at night? No, I just turned it off! One thing the hotel has absolutely no control over, however, is the noise that about 200 birds, no exaggeration!, made about 5.00 in the evening and again about 5.00 in the morning. They gathered on a big tree each evening to rest for the night, they obviously had a lot to talk about each time they all met, because the noise was incessant. And the same each morning!! Anyway, it is nature, so we must just get on with life. Check-in was simple enough, but as I did not have a car I was not asked to pay $30.00 per night parking fee. What I did have to pay, though, was a resort fee of about $19.00. This entitled you to free WiFi, a newspaper, DVD rental, free shuttle bus to Ala Moana Shopping Mall and a few other small things. One issue with the free shuttle is that it does not actually stop at this hotel, you have to walk to the next block, about 150 metres, to pick it up. It does, apparently, drop you back directly to the hotel. I went down to the sister hotel one day to get the shuttle, and was told that there would be one along in about 5 minutes. As far as I am aware, it never came, at least I did not see it. The best option, though, is to take the Pink Line Bus, cost $2.00, to go to this Mall, the free shuttle runs about every 40 minutes, whereas the Pink Line bus runs about every 10 minutes. Your choice. The hotel room boasts a microwave, coffee maker and fridge. As well as an iron, ironing board and of course a safe. I only used the safe and the fridge, which was stocked with 2 complimentary bottles of water upon my arrival. These were easily topped up in the foyer. There are also complimentary soap, shower gel, shampoo and conditioner, replaced daily. The room was made up every day, and the towels replaced as needed. There is a sports bar as part of the premises, with a market just opposite and another one about 50 metres away, if you need to get groceries, etc. This hotel is about 5 - 7 minutes walk, through the International Market Shopping Mall, to Waikiki Beach. There are plenty, plenty of dining options in the locality, but one thing I was not quite prepared for was the prices! Very, very expensive, even for a coffee!! Don't expect a fantastic experience at this hotel, the staff are helpful, (there is a concierge also located at the sister hotel), the room pleasant, but the best thing going for this hotel is the location, unless you want to pay extravagant money for a beach-side location.

Good size apartment however didnt see a cleaner until the day before we left and asked for our apartment to be cleaned. When she arrived it was barely completed and one room was not even touched. When we checked in the rooms were only barely cleaned. dusty, cupboards & handles were sticky, floors sticky etc.However the front people were friendly and helpful and the grand final on Saturday in the pub was a winner.

I called on behalf of a business partner regarding parking. I was told by Joanna that the parking was first come first serve, I asked about the reserved parking 3 times and was told it was first come first serve. Upon arrival at the hotel, they were told parking was at $30 per night but there were no parking stalls left (with many left unoccupied) and they would have to park at their sister property on Seaside Ave. Neglecting to tell them that they would be charged $35 per night there and having to walk 2 streets over and around the corner! I called again and Joanna claimed that I misunderstood her, I am very well traveled and asked her 3 times about the reserved parking and was told it was first come first serve. Not only did she not take ownership for the incorrect information she gave, she continued to tell me I misunderstood her. She placed me on hold for minutes at time and could not resolve the issue. I asked to speak to her manager and she told me to call back in the morning. That is the worst customer service I have ever received. The least she could have done was take care of the parking fees due to her giving wrong information. But she refused. If she could not resolve the issue right then and there, what make you think that her manager would do any different? Why waste my time calling again and having to explain myself. Not to mention the room quality is very poor and are not cleaned very well. I would not recommend to stay here.

Great location. 5 min walk to the beach. Grocery store and pharmacy i block away at Foodland. Good selection of restaurants within 5 min walk. Stayed in 2 bedroom 1 bath and it was all we needed. Kitchen was fully stocked and living room was spacious.

The employees are great!! Everyone is always friendly .The hotel was nice I stayed in a regular room .I didn't ask for a balcony or a view .The staff helped me on directions and helped me with stuff I didn't bring . I really enjoyed my stay very convient to everything . The staff makes your day they always greet you always all smiles .

This was certainly a case of creative photography as my dated and dusty room looked absolutely nothing like the pictures advertised on the Aqua website. The free earplugs was not a good sign. I ended up not using the aircon at all as it was just so very loud and covered in thick black dust, as were the window sills and all other surfaces. It's the first time I've needed to clean a hotel room before unpacking! The carpet was disgusting and the $20 per day fee for wifi and water etc a blatant rip off.

Our last night in Hawaii (AirBNB 6 nights Waikiki, 3 nights Maui - Brilliant) 3.00pm - Room not ready3.30pm - Queue for 35 mins to check inRoom decor circa 1960s, rather than replace noisy aircon they supply ear-plugs. But the most disturbing aspect was the fact that I could break into the room from the lanai (balcony) in less than 3 seconds with a butter knife ... and the markings on the door & loose fitting latch looked like it had been jemmied more than once ... not to worry, a knife wedged under the door had us safe for the night

We stayed here as we have used Aqua hotels before. If you don't mind sharing with the odd roach walking around then the accom level is good. The beds are comfy but the rooms are dated it really needs an upgrade soon. The staff were very good nothing was too hard, housekeeping staff very humble and nice. I would come again if they guarantee no roaches.

The staff, Jeff and especially Harry, were very accommodating and friendly! Also the girls were great at night too. Price was very reasonable but the location was my favorite part.It is a two minute walk to Marakume Udon (the best place to eat on Waikiki IMO) in one direction, and a two minute walk to the Food Pantry (the best place to shop for food in Waikiki IMO).

When I was looking to return to Waikiki, I wanted to stay at another Aqua hotel as previous stays had been great. Based on price I booked in here. To be honest When I read all the reviews I was put off HOWEVER, this hotel is awesome! Good reviews always mention the staff, and I agree they are all wonderful, they make you feel so welcome. We stayed in a Junior Lanai Suite, number 908 and it was perfect for us. The room was HUGE and the bathroom clean and had everything we needed. The Lanai was massive too and was awesome to enjoy a few longboards on. The hotel is right by the International Marketplace, and a really short walk to the beach. For the price it is perfect. There are heaps of food options nearby, and the DVD service was awesome too. I would definitely come back and stay here, it is so handy. We stayed for 12 nights (couple) and really had no complaints. This hotel is not the Hilton, or The Modern, and no you probably won't get as many Instagram likes tagging yourself here, but seriously, you are in Hawaii, who cares. My ONLY suggestion would be that perhaps they need to have more people working on the front desk, as often at check in and out there were long queues. If you are questioning whether to stay here, don't request room 908, or book a junior lanai suite and have a good time outside of your hotel room! Also, if you are looking for a great tour, go see Bob just down from Ross and he will hook you up! Mahalo!

We arrived at this hotel 2 weeks ago , I had read reviews so I wasn't expecting too much . Yes it is an average and old hotel , very basic , but close to everything . Disappointed there are no kettles in the rooms only coffee makers which don't heat the water enough and no real milk . We stayed here firstly for 5 nights and then 2 nights and up graded to a room with a balcony $10 extra a night plus tax . Room bigger but much the same . Staff a very friendly and helpful and rooms cleaned each day .

We recently stayed 10 nights at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. Our flight arrived at 6am and we had asked to leave our bags at reception knowing we wouldn't be able to check in, no problem. We arrived at 7.30am to drop off bags and were able to check in to our room, amazing start as our toddler had finally fallen asleep in my husband's arms. We booked the junior suite with balcony and found it very spacious. Housekeeping did knock a little early for us (8-8.30am) but we got a do not disturb sign from reception to combat that. The only thing I would say is that if the do not disturb sign is up, please don't call our room to ask if it needs servicing as this woke our daughter from her nap a few times. But very helpful staff otherwise, we found the concierge each day very happy to help, and reception staff lovely. Close to Waikiki main strip and the international market place which reopened while we were there. Loved the free shuttle offered between hotel and Ala Moana. Rooms are dated but we found them clean and comfortable, and we were only in there for naps and bedtime, so was fine for us. Thank you, we thoroughly enjoyed our time with you guys and would stay again.

Carpets are so bad that you wouldn't wanna walk on them barefoot.Same with bathroom tiles.Aircon had a funny smell.They left ear plugs for us in the room in case it gets noisy.Bed was cleanThey should either offer complimentary brekky or free parking to justify the money they are charging.Spend a bit more or find a better place for that money.wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

The decor i agree is tired, but you can't beat the very friendly service and if you had a problem it was fixed, the only major for us was the air con unit was very noisy which made sleeping hard, for us the location was great with a sports bar nextdoor.. The staff all went the extra mile for you..

The room was spacious enough but the carpets were absolutely filthy. The air conditioners were covered in a blanket of dust and were very old and very noisy. The location was good, within walking distance to most things. Front desk staff were excellent.

With a major international military event in town, we had no real options within our budget, so we stayed at the Pearl. It's about as far from the water as you can get and still be in Waikiki. The beds were like slabs of asphalt with sheets on them (my dad would approve), and there was about a five day waiting list for the privilege of paying $30 a day for parking. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, which was the only saving grace of this dump. Did I mention the non-discretionary daily "hospitality fee" for things like the use of the in-room safe and the coffee packets?

This hotel is well located and while the decor is a bit tired, it was perfectly clean, serviced (well) daily, and had a comfortable super king bed with snowy white linen, a great shower and air con, fridge and coffee maker. By far the best asset the place has alongside location is the staff. Our shower wasn't working properly but was sorted immediately for instance. Special commendations to Mark on the front desk, and the fantastic concierge Nina.

I would like to start off this review by stating the customer service at this hotel is great! Every person we have talked to or worked with have been helpful and polite. They get 5 stars!!! Mark and Dee are awesome!3 years ago we stayed at this hotel and we have once again come back. Great location and lots of space for 5 people. Kitchen and fridge are a plus when trying to save money on food. Yes I would agree that the carpets could be cleaned better and the construction is a pain but let's be honest....you are in Hawaii and shouldn't be spending all your time in the room. It's a place to sleep and shower. As long as the room is clean (which it was) and the shower works I'm good. They have made some upgrades since we were last here: instead of first come first serve for parking it has to be reserved (if all spots are taken then you can park 2 blocks away), movie rentals, for the 2 bedrooms they now have a wall instead of a curtain for the 2nd room, and lastly nice beach towels and chairs you can use at the beach. On our next visit we will stay here again.

After a very long flight we arrived hoping to check into room before scheduled time...wasnt a problem .staff were very friendly & welcoming..we had a 2 bedroom apartment ,again very clean and everything we needed..Only down side was the bathroom was off one bedroom meaning people in 2nd bedroom had to walk through 1st bedroom to use bathroom..strange layout..would stay here again ,very close to shops etc

Accommodation prices vary greatly in Waikiki. We chose something middle of the road. This is an older style in need of a refurb. The reception and housekeeping staff are really lovely. We stayed in a junior suite, as we were there for 12 days and wanted a bit of extra room. The verandah was large, though the view was of the rooftops on the opposite of the road. Nice lights at night though. The bathroom was roomy and looked as if the vanity had been refurbed. There was a safe, tv, chair, a fridge, microwave, coffee maker & the bench this was on looked to be refurbed. The junior suite has a double bed & a queen bed in it. We found the bedding comfortable & clean. The carpet had lots of marks on it. The housekeeping did a great job of cleaning the rooms. It's a short walk to the beach. The position is great.
