Handy to bus stops & the Food Pantry for supplies. The new Garden Hilton is being built next door. It's also across the road from the new International Marketplace which will be finished this year. There's also a sports bar downstairs which has US$3.50 Mai Tais from midday to 8pm. That's a great bargain! We were on the 10th floor & it was a bit noisy but I think that's only because of the construction of the Hilton & International Marketplace. The Hilton will be opening in July, I think & the marketplace in a few months. You will be able to cross the road, walk through the marketplace, straight onto the main Waikiki area.

Spacious rooms with kitchen lounge and balcony. Beds luxurious. Airconditioning was very cold. Lifts good. Coffee shop which made devine papaya boats for our breakfast is just outside. Close to shops transport and amenities. Staff most helpful. Recommend this hotel for convenience and price

Like many other people here, I didn't check into this place with very high expectations but left very impressed with the staff, room clenleness and the hotel overall. The room was very clean (including the bathroom). Staff were very helpfull and friendly. The DVD rental booth in reception was a nice touch even though some DVD's were very dirty and skipped. (This was of course no fault of the hotel though). If you get a bad dvd I would recommend you let the staff know so they can inform the company which supplies the DVD's.Location was great! It's a 5 minute walk to the beach, 2 minutes to the nearest bus stop and plenty of options for food in the area. There is also a bar and nice coffee shop at street level underneath the hotel.Other hotels in the price bracket that this hotel falls into seemed quite below standard (from reviews and pictures on TA and their own websites) so as I said at the top, I didn't go in with high expectations. There are a few negative reviews about this place listed here. With the exeption of comments regarding the noisy air conditioning, most are just people nitpicking about things that realy don't matter. The way see it, if I can stay here for 3 nights without my wife complaining about anything, unless you are a depressing pool of misery who can not be pleased, I am very confident you will have a nice time here!I would be more than happy to re-book here next time I come to Honolulu

This hotel is really busy, midday has a lot of people coming and going and they run a slick operation. We arrived really early and they did not have a room available for us until the official check in time. Fair enough.The room was massive and clean but dated. Perfect though for a one night layover and i got some good sleep.Location is ideal, we walked everywhereLovely staff, friendly and efficient check in, helpful and unfussy bag storing service for our early arrival and late departure.Rates were very competitive, there are seldom bargains to be had in Honolulu but we were very happy with our rooms' pricesWould definitely stay again

Would rate this hotel higher except it is dated and there is very little parking for a nine story oroperty. Also they charge for parking even as a guest. The pluses are great staff who are always friendly and helpful. Thd room was comfortable but needs some upgrades of furniture an a replacement of the window AC. Location is convenient to dining and scads of high end plus local shopping.

I stayed there for 2 nights in June, 2016. I found both rooms to be clean. My first room was tiny. I was in a hurry to get an early check-in so I took whatever they could find. They gave me a 1 queen bed room on the 2nd floor that was tiny and smelled musty. I moved into a 2 king bed room the next day on the 10th floor and it was nice. It had a view and a patio. It also came with a small refrigerator in addition to the microwave and coffee pot that comes in all the rooms. It's in the heart of Waikiki and a very short walk to the beach. It's convenient to bus routes and lots of restaurants. My advice is to get a room as high up as possible. The rooms on the west side have views and patios. This is a bare-bones kind of place. Nothing fancy - no gym, no pool, just a lobby. Check in is slow - not sure why but I think their computer is slow. They could really benefit with a better check-in process. Beach towels are free to use. They will cheerfully give you more coffee packets at the front desk.Summary - I recommend the place despite a few issues. It's a good value for the money and close to everything.
user_name:
Ron H
Thornton, Colorado, United States

review_body: This is the first time to stay here. I had a group of high school seniors and we had 4 rooms for 4 nights. Everything with our checkin and our stay went very well. Mark at the front desk was very helpful and offered some suggestions for things for us to do on our last day before heading to the airport. The rooms were clean and the staff friendly and helpful. Although we did not spend much time at the hotel except to sleep and shower I felt that the location to the beach and services were very good. I do plan to stay here again next year.

Stayed here with my family, it was a great location but that's about it. The room was not very clean, stains all over the carpet and lounge, I don't think the place was vacuumed once while we were there. The beds were ok but sofa bed was VERY uncomfortable! The staff were friendly but I still wouldn't stay here again.

The aqua Waikiki pearl is in a great location in the heart of waikiki. The rooms are large and clean. What makes this place special is the the night staff named Apelila. She is a great person with excellent customer service skills. She makes a difference with every guest, with a warm aloha smile.

Stayed one night. Was only $75!!!! 2 bedroom, living room, kitchen. It was only me so I didn't really know where to sleep. Friendly front desk. Right in the middle of Waikiki. My only complaint is it costs $30 a day for parking but that might be standard in Honolulu. I highly recommend!

The Aqua Waikiki Pearl was centrally located hotel to stay. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. Room is clean. People mentioned about construction noise, but it’s not that bad for me. I read many bad comments, and luckily, it is not happening on me. I stayed here for four nights for my friend’s wedding. Maybe I checked in too early, they gave me a two bedrooms suite, and I can say it’s too huge for me. Both beds in two rooms were clean and comfortable. The kitchen is a bonus for me, so I can make some noodle and save some money for dinning out. Also, there is a grocery store around the corner if you need some soda and chips. Overall, it’s a good stay and I will be back for sure.

Make sure you get a room with a balcony otherwise you won't sleep (the air conditioners in the non-balcony rooms are noisy - earplugs are provided) but if you can get past that it's nice enough and the staff are lovely... Concierge is wonderful and really helpful...

The location is close to the beach, walking distance. I will take about 10 or less to get to Waikiki beach. There's store across the street where you can buy chips and water. They also provide towel and chair for you to bring at the beach if you needed one. The room are not that clean though. We got a two queen bed. When we ask for extra towels, they took an hour to give us the towels. Over all the place is okay.

Stayed for two nights after flying into Honolulu. This was our base to see Pearl Harbor before we went to the other islands. Big rooms and easy check in. Staff was kind and helpful. There's a great taco place on the corner which we really liked. Good location for the price.

The hotel is well located and central to all amenities. The rooms are basic and dated. The air-conditioners are noisy, antiquated and need to be replaced. There is building going on all around the hotel. The rooms appeared clean but the carpets were heavily stained from previous use. Overall the staff tried hard to accommodate our needs and most were very friendly. The biggest shock was the resort tax added to the room charge for a range of services that were advertised as complementary.

This is an excellent and affordable location to stay when you are in Waikiki. We went on an extremely tight budget and was able to enjoy the island without breaking the bank. I have nothing bad to say about Aqua Waikiki Pearl. Our stay was excellent. Looking forward to going back!

Location of the hotel is good. Just a 10 - 15mins walk to the Waikiki beach. When the international market shopping mall opened in summer, it'll be faster to walk to the beach.Nearby is the Food Pantry supermarket so you can stock up on food and drinks. And shopping is just a walk away. With Ross around the corner, there's also a Forever 21, H&M and many other luxury boutiques.Food is also easy to find and the choices are endless.The room is spacious with comfortable bedding (we had the room with a lanai). Though it can be pretty noisy in the morning as it's just by the roadside.Also there's a Sony Playstation if you do have kids that gets bored easily.There's free iced water provided throughout the day. And coffee and tea is free for breakfast too. Beach towels is rental free too.The staff are friendly and will answer any questions you have.

I was impressed with the ease of checking in a little early and very pleased with the upgrade into a suite. The employees were all friendly and most helpful when I called for assistance with the PS3 unit to watch a DVD. He was there withing 2 minutes and figured out we had a bad HDMI cable. Definitely recommend to anyone on a budget.

My husband, daughter (10) and I had a 12hr wait between flights and were completely exhausted. We called several hotels and no-one could assist with accommodation. We stumbled across the Aqua Pearl through hotels combined. We called and they said we could check in straight away. This was at 10am. The room was cool, clean bed was massive and very comfy. We didn't use any of the hotels facilities. However we will note there was building in the street over which was loud, but bearable. The staff at the hotel were very eager and friendly.

This is a great hotel to stay for both couples and families. It is one small block from the beach and shops. The Waikiki trolley stops just around the corner. The trolley costs $2.The hotel is quiet and in a good location. We upgraded to a 2 bedroom apartment. It's also had cooking facilities, handy if you want to save costs and prepare some of your own meals. There is also a nice little bar that shows international sport on TV, including Australian football.Overall a great place too stay.

My stay here was amazing. The room was huge and very clean. The staff was really helpful, smiled and Robbie went out of his way to make sure my stay was amazing!!!! It's in a really good location in the middle of Waikiki. I've stayed in almost every hotel in Waikiki and this is by far one of my favorites

We chose this hotel because of a lower price, but wish we paid a bit more to stay at a nicer place. They charge a resort fee for...hmm..not sure what. They do give you beach towels and coffee for the room ( I could not drink that). Carpet floor was stained, bath was old and did not feel too clean. Location was OK, we walked to the beach, dinning. Too bad loud construction started at 7 am and woke us up...not that I have attributed the rating to it. Very motel like stay here. Overall, I found Waikiki not as nice as Riviera Maya, Dominican or many other great places around the world.

Great Staff, great location huge room,stayed with family and friends Hotel very central beds and linen clean bathroom huge close to shopping beach and directly across the street (Kuhio) from int. market place. There is construction going on soon to be finished. Kudos to all the staff very friendy,informative and helpful really enjoyed our stay

We were a party of 4 adults and 2 children and had 2 x Queen and Double Bed standard rooms on the 10th floor. The rooms were large, very clean and very comfy. The beds and pillows were comfy. There was free wifi. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. We'd all stay there again.
user_name:
deroman50
Orange, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: The hotel in itself is a bit old and could benefit from a renewal (stained carpet floors and furniture). It is however very well located (10 minutes walk from Waikiki beach), and has the kindest and warmest staff ever, filled with aloha spirit (Ape, you are fantastic). The parking lot is a must if you have a car (Alawai bvd nearby offers free parking but also costly tow away hours): make sure to make a reservation when you arrive as it is on a first arrived first served.

The Aqua Pearl was a strictly clean and good hotel to sleep in. The staff are friendly and competent. Rooms were always clean. Did not have the best of amenities but had free wi fi , clean beds and linen.Higher floors lessens the noise of construction and the window a/c helps block out the noise.

We stayed a week at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. It is a very bare bones hotel located in the middle of the beach area. The room had a bed, night table, desk and chair, TV, and a dresser. There were some lawn chairs outside on the balcony.That being said the staff was excellent. They were very knowledgeable and willing to be all the help they could be.If you just want a place to crash and are not worried about luxuries this is the place for you.

Our family of five stayed here for four nights. We had in a two-bedroom unit so needed to use the pull-out sofa bed. The beds were clean and comfortable but the pull-out sofa bed was absolutely terrible. The rooms were clean enough, towels adequate, and when we called about an issue, the staff responded and solved the matter quickly. We had a nice kitchenette, kept it clean, and made sure our food was stored properly -- but we did have to squish a few roaches. Guess not all guests clean up. Location was very good. There is a good size grocery store around the corner that we found after shopping in the smaller "Food Pantry" which is kind of connected to it...ask them and they will direct you to the larger store. Everyone in Hawaii is so friendly and helpful. Convenient location for buses to Diamond Head, Pearl Harbor, and the pick-up location for the bus to Polynesian Cultural Center (at their World Trade Center). We "connected" to WiFi but were never able to access it.

So Tiki, Ape, Harry and the Maintanence and who fixed our sliding door are so friendly, helpful and make everything so easy. Great location. No fuss, no muss. Just nice place to stay. Twice I stayed here and I would stay again.

The hotel is ok. The hardware facilities is very common. However, front desk staffs are VERY friendly! We stayed here for 4 nights. The coverlets and quilts were clean and fine. On the first day we had a little bit disappointment, because there was no bulb and/or no function in 2 lights (there are total three lights in the room, but one missed bulb, the other one was no work). However, the hotel fixed it soon. Besides, the carpet had some dirt (bearable). Coffee machine got rusty and had waterlogging (we gave up to use it). There also had ants in our room (so we have to pack foods after we ate). But here is an economic place to stay, because it is close to Waikiki beach (only two blocks). And the public traffic is very convenient (bus stop is very close to the hotel). After we moved to another hotel, we realized Pearl has a very good location, low price, with general quality. That’s her advantage.

Had a lovely stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and welcoming and it was easy to check in and out. The room was clean and spacious and services everyday. The location was very central and close to everything. The hotel also has a shuttle that runs between all its other hotels to take you to Ala Moana Shopping Centre which I found helpful. Thanks for a lovely stay!

The hotel is basic but offers large rooms with two twin beds. It is a converted condominium. The window type aircon we had was noisy and needs to be replaced. There is a lot of construction near the hotel so expect noise during the day. There is no construction noise at night. The location is ok as it is close to a grocery, restaurants and the beach. The open parking lot can get full at peak season. The hotel provides beach towels and beach chairs. It is good enough for the budget conscious vacation goer.

We had booked 4 nights at the Aqua Wave and were moved here due to the refurbishment at Wave. We knew both were a relatively budget option for Waikiki, but the room was so disappointing we checked out after the first night. Yes the rooms are large as advertised but very poorly utilised, lots of empty space and gaps where there should be even basic furniture, eg how about putting bedside tables on BOTH sides of the bed! No wardrobes, the door to the drab balcony was so stuck we nearly got stuck out there. Have low expectations and you might be happy here. Give it a decent refurb and this could be a great place. Having said all that, the staff at the front desk were all great, and couldn't have been more helpful and understanding when we left early.

We stayed at this accommodation end of December 2015. The room was very low standard, old and bathroom very poor. Construction all around, woken up at 6am weekdays. Can hear people in the room next door. WiFi continually drops out. Hidden costs - When we arrived we were provided with a flyer advising that we had the following services available to us (included in the accommodation) - WiFi, beach towels & chairs, shuttle bus to shopping. However when we returned home our credit card was charged with an amount. When I enquired they advised that it was a service fee. If I had known of the charges I would not have used any of these services. I have been attempting for 3 weeks to get a response to reconsider the fees and have received only that the Manager will contact me, which he has not. Would not recommend this place and would never stay there again.

Too much construction all around Jan. 2016--the street, two hotel buildings behind and adjacent made it very noisy!! Check this before booking...Rooms large, good cleaning service, helpful staff at front desk. Street parking is difficult to find...beware of towing.

While we didn't splurge on this hotel and the size of the room was generous it was disappointing for the money paid. The view was of a dingy street and there was construction taking place so that there was banging from early morning until early evening. We used the hotel as a base, so didn't spend much time there which is good as you wouldn't want to relax there. Parking is a huge issue and we had to be put on a waiting list to park at the hotel, which we had to pay $30 for the night. The staff were friendly though and the location is walking distance to Waikiki beach which I guess is what you are paying for. My suggestion would be to spend a little more to get something with a nicer view and no construction.

The only good thing about this hotel was its location to the beach and shops. Check in time was suppose to be 3pm however that was not the case and even by 4pm the staff behind the counter looked bewildered with a blank look to say, "yes we are on the computer screen and booked in but not sure if you can check in yet". The carpets were all dirty and stained and I'd recommend you wear some sort of shoe inside to prevent your feet from getting dirty. On a couple of occasions we were not given enough towels for the number of family members staying in the room. The insinkerator did not work, and one hot plate only worked out of two. One of the towel rails fell off the vanity basin area and had to be fixed. Our other family members were staying in another room in the same hotel and their TV did not work and they had to be moved rooms as the first room was so dirty. Also on one occasion their toilet lever fell off and the toilet did not work (3:30pm) and when they rung down to reception they were told that someone would come the next day to fix it. Of course they had to say that that response was unacceptable because they needed to use the toilet over night and into the morning hours! The photos of the accommodation show nice outside balcony furniture. This is not the case. There are now other plastic chairs. It also shows nice flowers, vases and coloured cushions on beds in the marketing photos. These did not exist. And the bathroom in the marketing photos shows the towels all presented nicely and this was not the case either. I would recommend you do your research first on other accommodation before you stay here. Also it is very noisy from 4:00am onwards with rubbish trucks and then construction going on around the building. They do provide ear plugs for their guests next to the beds. For the cost of this place to stay I did expect a lot better. It was very disappointing. It was annoying that we always had to tell staff of their problems, such as not enough towels, hot plate not working, and so on when they should be maintaining and inspecting the rooms all the time to make sure they are in working order. We paid for a room that was in working order which it wasn't and staff seemed to not really care. This could be a good hotel, especially for families, if they just invested in it and renovated a little and wanted to keep up a good standard for their guests.

The rooms look nothing like the photos. The carpets are stained and dirty, the foldout bed was broken, the insinkerator doesn't work, one hotplate worked out of the two, the toilet got blocked, utensils not adequate for self contained unit, the furniture was from the 70,s, no maintenance done, check-in was later than 3pm, furniture on balcony is old and not like the photos. This accommodation spoilt our holiday as Australians are not use to this sort of accommodation and expect better. At present there is much construction going on and every morning at 5am trucks and noise wake you up. The free WiFi went in and out. I recommend researching more hotels before accepting this place. My travel agent has been made aware of my feelings.

Stayed week before we come to New Zealand. Front office staff very helpful. Thanks to Henry, Tiki and smile reception lady. House keeping done a good job. Clean rooms. Easy walk to Waikiki beach, bus stop etc.

Stayed here during Christmas for 11 days. Friendly staff, good location and comfortable stay. I wish parking was cheap, they charge $25 per night or $20 overflow garage. Walking distance to supermarket, beach and bus stop. I would definitely stay again here.

Off the beaten path but easy walk to Waikiki Beach and restaurants. Staff was excellent, room was clean. Very few in hotel services but concierge was very helpful. The hotel was simply in need of renovation. It looked old and our room was missing a chain and had a broken deadlock. Furnishings were outdated by current hotel standards but we're comfortable.Decent little bar accessible off the lobby although not part of the hotel.

Our room which was on the 7th floor was large, well equipped and clean. The staff were welcoming and very helpful. Our room was comfortable and suited our purposes entirely. The only problem was the air conditioner sounded like a tractor and had to be turned off at night. Other than that the Hotel is centrally placed at Waikiki and doesn't have the problems of a crowded main street outside the entrance. There is a large amount of building construction going on in the next block and close to the Hotel, however, I was only at the hotel at night and the building noise didn't worry me at all. Overall, a good place to stay at.

Hotels location was solid but and rooms were fine. What made this a really big pain was I booked through trip advisor and the hotel has no record in their system of my reservation. Check in ended up taking quite a while but they eventually got us a room. Check out was even worse. I had prepaid for the room here on trip advisor and hotel had no record and tried charging me again. Even after showing them my credit card statement and receipt the front desk worker continued to tell me he'd call to let me know if they needed to charge me again since he couldn't verify it. He told me he'd seen Hotwire, trip advisor, etc. but questioned whether you could actually book and pay through trip advisor and that perhaps I was mistaken. He was also pretty insistent that I should have come to the desk the day before to verify I paid (a pre check out trial run I guess?) Most of the issue was on trip advisors end but desk guy at check out was so rude that I thought I was in a prank show.

Sure this is only a 2 star hotel with no restaurant, and few amenities, but it is safe, and probably the most reasonably priced place in this area of Waikiki. Forget the view, but who stays in their rooms look at the views? What it lacks in amenities, it makes for in the great staff. They are very very good. I have a feeling that this hotel will be entirely remodeled soon and the prices will go up, so I would recommend it now.

We booked a 2 bedroom apartment to stay with my in-laws, and it was OK, but the layout was definitely odd! The only bathroom could only be accessed through one of the bedrooms and only one of the bedrooms had a wardrobe, which altogether meant sharing on a whole new level for us! 3 aircon units (1 for each bedroom and 1 in the living area) was nice, but there was only 1 remote to control them all and the wall holder for the remote was located in one of the bedrooms. When we arrived the microwave was a little dirty, but a call to reception fixed that with a cleaner arriving in double quick time!! Isaac at the activities booking desk was lovely and very helpful managing to squeeze us on to a Pearl Harbour tour at the very last minute!!Every single staff member I encountered had a smile, was super helpful and easy to deal with, which is the only reason I'm giving the 4* rating.

We stayed for 4 nights on arrival, then cruised, then one more day and night before we flew home. The check in and arrival was very smooth and easy. On our return, tired and too early we were offered an early check in for a cost of $15. This was really good. The rooms are large and spacious, excellent in house laundary, tours booked at reception, and lots of kindness and good advice along the way. The staff all have that extra something makes it a pleasure to ask a question or exchange some ideas about possible trips or tours.The central location, next to a variety of modest excellent restaurants is a real plus.

I recently visited Honolulu and had the pleasure of staying at Aqua Waikiki Pearl. Upon arriving I was greeted by a friendly staff member named Tiki I believe. He was so nice and so helpful. I came to the hotel early before the check out time but Tiki allowed me to leave my bags with him so that I can enjoy the beach and then come back to officially check in. I came back to check in I asked if I was able to get two beds instead of one because when I booked the hotel I made a mistake and booked it for one bed. I was traveling with my co worker so we needed two beds. Everyday when I came downstairs any question I had he was more than helpful to assist me. He told me where to go, he always greeted me with a nice smile. The day I left I had a red eye flight and had a lot of time to kill between me checking out the hotel and going to airport. Tiki held my bags once again and I needed a shuttle to the airport, I made a mistake with the time so he he was able to adjust the time for the shuttle as well. I had such a great stay at this hotel, and thank you so much Tiki for making sure I was ok.
user_name:
cheyenne0104
New York City, New York

review_body: Room was very big and spacious and staff are friendly and helpful, however a few frustrations with our stay. Before checking in we called the night before to check the credit card hold amount and was told $100. Upon check in it was all of a sudden $200 due to the fact that we booked a bigger room. That could have been explained when we called. Never heard of any bond amount changing due to the room type in any hotel before. Then the receptionist tried to downgrade us even though we paid for the upgrade due to the fact we asked to put just $100 hold as that was not explained to us. Had to make my own sofa bed then asked for extra towels twice but was never brought up on the first night. Not quite sure if they're under construction with their car parking but there's limited space with their on site car parking so you'll need park at a different location when it's full and pay the car parking direct with cash and the hotel will remove that charge from your bill. Maybe find a better system to reimburse guests instead, as we wanted to put that amount on our bill and use the $200 amount that was held instead of forking up additional cash each time we had to park there. Location is very central and a short walk to Waikiki town.

I was directed to this property by the owner of this and other Waikiki hotels Aston Properties through their central reservations desk. They stated that the Aqua Waikiki Pearl was "equivalent" to another property that I stayed at previously, Hotel Renew. Nothing could be further from the truth. The Hotel Renew property is very nice and I would go back again and again. The Aqua Waikiki Pearl is dump on the order of what one might expect to pay for by the hour. This property appears to have been decorated, sparsely, through Goodwill hand-me-downs and rejects. I can go on and on in a negative manner about this property but suffice to say; STAY AWAY!!!

We stayed here for 3 weeks while looking for a place to live. There were 5 of us and we had moved from the mainland. It was clean enough, they changed our towels daily and the sheets not nearly as often. We had to ask them to change the sheets and vacuum. But we were staying for a long period of time. Parking is expensive for the lot in the back of the hotel which is only like 10 spots, otherwise you will have to search for street parking on the Alawai. But the room was the size we needed for the purpose and a budget deal.

The hotel has great staff that were very helpful. We got upgraded and the room was nice. There is construction going on next door that starts at 7 and that will be going on for a little while yet. We enjoyed the location but the carpets need replacing.

My first stay was back in 2013 with my most recent stay in June 2014, which means Im well overdue for another visit!Aqua Waikiki Pearl's Central location, affordable rates, and friendly staff is unbeatable! I scored a free upgrade on my first stay to a spacious junior suite (including the bathroom). I was impressed with the space in the bathroom compared to alot of the other Waikiki hotels I've stayed at.Although there is no pool or gym, there is the lovely Waikiki beach 5 minutes away (hotel offers complimentary towels, and chairs for guests), and the streets lined with stores to keep you on your toes all day - I mean, you didn't travel to Waikiki to stay in all day, right? I've had family and friends also stay here upon my recommendation and they all loved it for the price and central location to all the shops, bars and Waikiki beach.Staff have always been helpful, and have always come through with booking my last minute transfer requests each time whether it was for the airport or a day tour ~ thanks guys!I've stayed in different hotels and apartments in Waikiki, but Aqua Pearl is still at the top of my list for cost and location :)

Maybe we were having great luck because this was a last minute booking at a great price. The Check In was relaxing and friendly, we got free DVDs for the room. Free wifi. The room was so nice with a kitchenette. The Kids and us loved the brand of complementary soaps/lotions (paya brand). Definitely would stay again. A lot of construction going on in the area, but it wasn't really a noise problem for us, Aloha :)

This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and I was upgraded the first stay but the second stay i was given a standard room and very disappointed. The room was small and very cramped wit small bathroom, no view and a tiny air conditioner.The room was situated on the 9th floor at the very end of the hotel and shaped like a triangle. If you intend to stay here I would definitely suggest you upgrade. Internet free was excellent and NO resort fees are payable,

This is not a 5 Star Hotel but the staff and location were definitely 5 star. The carpets do need replaced, but rooms are spacious and very clean with complimentary tea/ coffee and toiletries. This Hotel is within walking distance to everywhere, staff are amazing. Would definitely stay here again.

We got upgraded to a 1 bedroom which was great. Room was comfortable and relaxing. Hotel is very clean, located close to Ala Moana shopping center. They have security guards. Lots of ammenities. Wi fi, video games, lots of dvds, coffee and water. We would definitely stay here again.

The Pearl was decent, although needs to be updated. Wifi signal was spotty. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff was exceptional, especially Dawn the night front desk clerk. Nice view of the skyline and many things within walking distance.

To start - my 4 star review is based on a 3 star/budget friendly hotel. The Aqua Waikiki Pearl is located pretty much in the heart of everything. We walked to breakfast each morning, walked to the beach, to bars, to shopping... could have walked to Diamond Head - but we took "The Bus" - which has several stops all within steps of the hotel. Need a late night snack? Walked to the little market around the corner during a tv commercial break! Popped out for a night cap late one evening... just a really convenient location! The room... this is where they lose a star - ONLY because it could use a bit of updating. Our room was clean, and the house keepers were very sweet and accommodating when requesting extra towels, etc. Our room was upgraded with balcony at check in by Mark at the front desk which was really nice. Enjoyed cocktails out there while watching the tall palm trees sway. I want to give a special shout out to Tiki at the front desk. A great guy who oozes Aloha spirit. Love that guy!

We didn't actually plan to stay at Aqua Pearl. We had booked the Aqua Oasis 3 weeks earlier for just one night, but on arrival at Oasis at 2pm we were told that the Oasis was 'overbooked/rooms had become unusable' and so we were shifted to one of their sister properties - the Pearl. Not particularly happy about that but we really had no choice as it was afternoon and the hotel had already been paid for. Oasis paid for our cab to the new hotel. At the Pearl, we were upgraded to a massive double suite which was very nice. All clean, good towels, nice linen and comfy bed. You gt very nice quality beach towels too. Must say that ALL of the staff at the Pearl were exceedingly helpful and this partially made up for the issue with Oasis. The location was just fine for a quick walk to the beach. There was construction going on next to the Pearl and so was a bit of a worry to see earplugs on the bedside table, but we didn't have any noise issues in the morning, although there was a bit during the day but we weren't really hanging out in the room... Our room faced away from the construction so I'm not sure how others would have fared... I note that other reviewers have commented about cleanliness - we certainly had no problems at all in our room. (Of note, I did send an email to the attention of the manager of the Aqua Oasis but at almost 1 week later I have still had no response or acknowledgement.... that's a bit disappointing and in contrast to the attention shown by the Pearl staff and manager- think her name was Nicole)

Look, the staff here are superb. Very friendly and efficient. I have no problem at all with the people here. So they really a positive.As for the negatives, hey, it's an old building and it shows. It's run down inside and out. The carpeting in the hallways is soiled and worn. Same can be said for the walls in the hallways. I usually like to take the stairs anyway, a good thing because the elevator is slow and not air conditioned. The room amenities are pedestrian and average. Was this meant to encourage us to get out of our rooms and explore Oahu? If so, it worked. The maid service, incidentally, somehow forgot to make our bed when we arrived late in the afternoon. Not sure what happened there, but came back to see the sheet on the bed but nothing else. And they brought only one replacement towel for a family of three. The parking situation is not good. One is forced to use the valet service, as the parking lot is tiny given the size of the property. They have to move cars around just to get your car out of the lot. If you don't have a rental car, no worries, as the location is quite near public transportation and walkable to nicer places.The location is central but in a beat down part of waikiki, with a lot of construction going on. Very loud and noisy during business hours. A seedy looking bar located right at the entrance to the hotel made for awkwardness with two young kids with me. They do have a cool tree with lots of raucous birds in the morning. It is a bit out of place in such an urban environment, but I actually thought that was really cool, so I hope they don't chop it down!We only stayed three days and transferred to a lovely B&B on the windward side of the island. That was a stroke of genius. Woe unto high-traffic, high-noise, high-crowd, expensive Waikiki! Go to the quieter places and enjoy yourselves.

Lucked out and got a room with a view that doesn't look out towards the street-side. Waited for a long time at the service desk because there was only one staff working. Staff was friendly and helpful though. The parking arrangements aren't ideal (small lot; first-come-first-served), but its location was fairly central so you can pretty much walk anywhere. Rooms were average - you could tell the hotel is a bit older and not as fancy as others, but the size of the room made up for that! There were lots of space and although the balcony was nice, it was too noisy to stay out there for longer than 10 minutes.

The hotel is not new, but it is clean, tidy, has big rooms and affordable prices. The personnel will be more than helpful and make you feel at home. It is in a good location and the facilities and enough to have a good time.

This hotel is not the newest in Waikiki, but it is affordable, updated, clean, within walking distance of the beach and world-class shopping, and it has the best staff I have encountered. If you intend to spend a lot of time in your room, and want ocean views, this is not for you, but if like us, you intend to spend most of your time on the beach or being a tourist, this hotel is a great option. There is morning coffee in the lobby, or there is a Starbucks or Coffee Bean a short walk away; there are restaurants within a very short walk, or a grocery store a block away. As I have stated, the staff is what makes this hotel stand out. In our first room there was a problem with the air conditioner. Within 20 minutes of notifying the desk, a maintenance worker had confirmed a problem, and staff had moved us to a new room. When we needed change for the laundry, it being a holiday, the front desk had run out, so one of the employees, on his lunch break, obtained a roll of quarters for our use. It is those little things that make this hotel stand out.

We stayed here in the Aqua Pearl in July 2015 and again in September 2015.We were not impressed either time .The Staff are very helpful but the Owners/Management need to address the state that the place is in. The rooms smell,on both occasions we could not run the Air conditioning for too long as it kept you awake all night and Sleep is something that a Guest needs,and the addition of Squishy Ear Buds is Not good enough .

Harry was super nice - thank you Harry :). Basic hotel for good price in a good location. Tour desk on site. I would stay there again. Only downside was construction going on next door that was noisy from 7am to 3pm but earplugs were provided. Sports bar downstairs and good general store across the road.

We did not specifically ask our travel agent for a budget hotel so we were very disappointed. The rooms are large, bedding and bathroom were clean, the staff were nice, but that is all that is positive. The carpets were very dirty, we had two towels for three people and had to wait till the next day for the third, there was one chair in the room, the balcony was so dirty with pigeon poo we could not use it, the location is not good, sleazy looking places nearby, a lot of construction going on around the hotel. Very disappointing overall.

This was a disappointment. The only good part was the clean bed and bathroom. The room smelled musty (or whatever smell that was) and the carpet had a big stain of (something)! The noise from the construction across the street was deafening at times. Always construction everytime we stay in Waikiki! The front desk staff look as dated as the hotel and does not give a first or second or last impression. I paid over $200 a night on my way over to Canada and a bit less on my way back because it was then the beginning of September. I would class this hotel as Low End.

Was due to stay here for four nights but left after one night. Room was outdated, air conditioner sounded like a jet engine and building works next door commenced at 6am. We were not informed of building works at the time of check in.Three times we requested that the air conditioner be looked at yet nothing was done.As we had a car, parking was a major issue. I managed to find a park on the street 2 blocks way on the first night and as we were going to Diamond Head early the following day, we left before the meters kicked in.Returning that evening, my sister went to the front desk to organise parking as we didn't want to drive around the streets looking for parking. $25/night for hotel parking. We were told there was a free bay out the back. Driving around...nothing.Was involved in a minor prang, which wasn't the ideal end to an evening and decided then and there to check out of the hotel as things weren't going right for us.I have NEVER left a hotel mid stay but just couldn't bear staying here for the remaining 3 nights.I has reservations about staying here prior to my arrival, but decided to bite the bullet and stay due to a tightish budget. Never again.

This is a budget hotel in Waikiki. It is older and in need of a face lift.There is a ton of construction around this hotel which means a lot of noise after Sunrise and bugs (it is HI, it happens).The price was right and the beds were comfortable. We booked a 2BR with kitchen(ette). Not really suited for cooking as the pans are cheap and everything sticks and you only have 2 burners..no stove. Just fridge & microwave, coffeemaker & toaster.The good:The staff is fantastic (thanks Harry, Tiki & Ladies) and as helpful as they can be. The concierges will help you book wonderful tours (thank you Lisa & Isaac). The bus service is great, close by and reliable but of course.....slower to your destination. A short walk to Kuhio Beach Park. Food Pantry is close by also with pre-cooked foods and pretty well stocked market items. Many reasonably priced restaurants near by.The Bad:The construction noise, the parking and the cost, $3.00 for laundry loads, WiFi was spotty except in the lobby, no guest computer for printing boarding passes. $15 per day "resort fee"All in all, not a horrible place to be if you are on a budget and are an early riser.

We weren't looking for a 5 star hotel. We got what we paid for and we were fine with that. Aqua Pearl Waikiki is older, more smaller hotel but their renos are paying off. They were however right in the middle of things when we stayed there and our view was actually of the gutted neighbouring building. The front desk personnel were always nice and helpful. Also the nice fresh scent in the lobby was a nice welcoming whenever we came in or went out. Hotel beach towels were nice as well. Better then most I've seen. My husband and I stayed for 2 nights this past July as the rest of our vacation was in Oahu's North Shore. The rooms were a nice size and our washroom was surprisingly large. Tasteful styled rooms. Also coming back from a night out, it was nice to pick out a movie from their DVD machine.

Aqua Waikiki Pearl Hotel is renovating so there is a lot of noise from jackhammers, etc during the day. However, you won't be sleeping at night either (even with the free ear plugs). A tree in the hotel parking lot is home to about a million birds that chirp deafeningly loud between the hours of dusk and dawn. Throughout the night, our room turned into a blown Roach Festival! I counted 6 roaches on the kitchen counter, 2 near the fridge, 5 in the kitchen sink, 4 on the desk, 3 in the bathroom sink, 2 on the bathroom counter, 2 in the bathtub, 3 in the bathroom trash, and 2 that ran out from under the beach slippers I had on the floor. As the night progressed, they became more plentiful and larger. I ended up refrigerating my belongings because I couldn't think of any other way to keep out the bugs. It's Hawaii, I can forgive 2, but NOT 29 roaches!!! You don't even find that many under a rock!!!When we checked out the next day, we had planned to take the advertised free Aqua shuttle to Ala Moana Center. Great perk if you can get ON the shuttle. This shuttle services other Aqua hotels so you may not get a seat. There were about 11 people waiting for this shuttle, 6 were already waiting 40min and when it arrived late, it could only take 6 so the 5 left over didn't want to wait another 30min, so we all took the city bus together to Ala Moana.Sincerest apologies to the Aqua front desk staff and housekeeping as they seemed helpful and friendly. But if this is your company's standards, I will NEVER stay at any Aqua hotel in the future.

We booked this accommodation for 8 nights through a package and were less than impressed when we arrived. The facilities are old and the decor is brown. There's a huge amount of construction which means it's not relaxing at all and sleep ins don't happen. My sister and I who are both nearly 30 were given a double bed to share and the bathroom was located on the other side of our parent's room meaning little privacy for all. It is not near the beach and just feels like you're in a broken down city- not Hawaii. We transferred to another hotel the next day.

We decided to have a two week holiday in Honolulu. We decided for a longer stay in cheaper accomodation. Before leaving we read about the construction going on next door so we asked for a room in one of the topfloors. At arrival they had put us on the topfloor in a room with a balcony which was a pleasant surprise.The staff was extremely friendly and helpfull, Mark and the others are an asset to the hotel.The room was clean and spacious. The beds comfy.The walk to the shops and beach is not very far, and with the international market next door being build next door, it is an exellent position. The free shuttle to the shopping centre is great, but we sometimes had to wait a long time. The free coffee in the lobby in the mornings is great and having icewater in the lobby is so nice after coming from the beach.It is not a luxery hotel, but service is great and we found the room not too bed for what you pay for.I would not hesitate to stay here again.

This place is very well located. At the present time there is construction works next door, but that is during the day and not too noisy. Close to restaurants, 5 mins to the beach, courtesy bus to Ala Moana. The rooms were clean with a microwave and coffee maker. The best part was the staff. We received exceptional service from the Elite Concierge who was a wealth of knowledge. Recommend this place to anyone.

Firstly let me say that the staff here are extremely friendly and helpful. Also the hotel put on a little show with an islander singer who was very good. However the hotel itself looked like a motel. It was extremely ordinary. The location was very good however...within easy walking distance of many good restaurants, shops and the beach. There is an awful lot of construction work going on on all sides of the hotel but that is hardly the hotel's fault. I presume the resort fee was to cover the cost of hiring DVDs and for the little musical show that they had, but really that should be for free. However it is what it is, and the room was clean and the bed comfortable so I have no further complaints.

The only positive aspect of this hotel is the friendly,helpful staff.Besides that,the rooms and hallways are dingy, we did have a balcony but there was a terrible view so there was no reason to want to sit outside.But the worst thing was all the construction going on,horrible !I will agree with other reviews that the pictures of the hotel and the rooms are way nicer than what they are..also,the 15.00$ resort fee seemed like a scam.I suggest other accomodations,there are so many choices out there in a very good location.

It is not likely that we would return to this hotel. Before I explain why we would not stay here again, I would like to first point out a positive aspect of our stay: the staff themselves were VERY KIND AND OVERALL WONDERFUL (especially Ka'ele from the Elite concierge who was absolutely fantastic in every way and went above and beyond for us which was AMAZING and SO appreciated! However, we would likely not return to this hotel due to the fact that the condition of the hotel is far less than we had hoped it would be. The rooms looked nothing at all like they did on the pictures online. The hotel itself as well as the rooms specifically are significantly more run-down than the pictures show... The pictures I viewed before booking were unfortunately not an accurate depiction of the look or condition of the rooms themselves. The construction going on was TERRIBLE which made our stay very difficult to enjoy- especially if we wanted to relax on our vacation with some sleep in time... It was nearly impossible. I understand that it's certainly not intended to be a high end hotel, but we have stayed at MANY other budget hotels that were in far better shape and presented a far better value. Quite frankly, the rooms are just WAY too overpriced given the very old condition of the rooms and the hotel. Plus then the $15 "resort fee" seems kind of absurd considering there aren't any amenities whatsoever... So I'm a bit confused as to why we would be paying that fee when there is nothing to justify it. But I digress... In conclusion, although the staff were LOVELY, the next time we are in Oahu we will likely be booking somewhere with more bang for our buck.

The hotel is in an obscure location, the rooms were dirty and poorly lit, the construction across the way makes it look like you're on the set of slumdog millionaire. Overpriced for the hotel for sure, not worth the money. They tried to charge us for two days even though we checked out a day early at the front desk and signed papers confirming it. When the charge was made on my card they put me on hold for over 20 minutes and told me they would figure it out tomorrow. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

We came to the hotel for both work and vacation. The room was sufficient for the cost but is in terrible need of new carpet. I had to keep my shoes on in the room or the bottoms would turn black. I found a cockroach the minute we stepped in, not a deal breaker knowing the climate is very inviting for these nasty bugs. Right away we pulled back the curtains to let in light only to find there's no privacy curtain so every person walking by could look in on us. We were never told major construction would be going on daily. Jack hammering would start around 6am, extremely annoying when I planned on sleeping in every day. It would have been nice if someone would have at least mentioned it to us upon check in. Lastly, we paid a daily parking fee only to find there's not enough parking for all guests. We were told there's an overflow lot about a mile away that we will also have to prepay and then the hotel would reimburse. This was unacceptable considering my husband had to get to work early every morning and did not have time to walk to another lot located a mile away.

I have stayed at and recently reviewed this property on May 25, 2015. This hotel has improved its service is just 2 months.I decided to take a chance and stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl hotel to see if service has improved or declined in just a couple months. At first I was weary but hey - everyone including businesses do deserve a second chance right.Upon checkin we were greeted by Dee the guest service agent at the front desk. She had the best smile this time around - and acceptionally friendly. She extended the unique Aloha spirit one comes to expect at a hotel in Hawaii. Dee clearly explained all the benefits to the daily resort charge administered by the property. This time around I was not forced to take any unnecessary beach towel cards that charges $30 each if not returned upon check out. Again we were placed on the third floor. This time around was much quieter even though there is surrounding construction. I'm glad I decided to give this hotel a second chance as it was still quite comfortable and nicely located in Waikiki. It is wonderful having a clean and very spacious room with two queen sized beds and air conditioning is a must for our hot Hawaii summer days with temperatures reaching well into low to mid 90's. I'd definitely return again to this hotel. Management said they are looking into possibly getting VALET parking for guests as parking is very limited on the property and additional parking is roughly a block away.As a former employee in the hospitality industry I am well aware what service is for interaction with guests. This time around I was more than happy to experience that expectation. Hopefully my next visit I'll be able to meet the General Manager Lynette Eastman and say HI. Thanks for a wonderful stay. I look forward for more in the future.

The room smelt stale and the outside areas were very grubby when I checked in, trying to avoid the characters loitering in the lobby and outside the lift. A small room and the air conditioner was old and very noisy, so really couldn't be used while trying to sleep. Noise from the neighboring construction site starts early every morning apart from Sunday and will continue for a year or so, i understand - I tried to get out early every morning. A fair walk from the beach. Many rooms had large windows on to the walk way, allowing full view of everything inside and it seemed to be the practice to leave curtains open exposing luggage etc to anyone roaming the hotel. Had to specially ask for these to be left closed during the day.The additional charge for wi fi, a beach towel, manager's reception (which can only be attended on a Tuesday) and various other items which are free in other establishments is exorbitant and totally unnecessary. Watch out for incorrect after departure credit card charges.

This was our first time in Hawaii and our travel agent booked on our behalf. I am glad he picked this place. Although the rooms are outdated (requiring new carpet), our room was clean. We were upgraded from standard to a room with a balcony on the 7th floor. I was very happy about this. As this was our first time in Hawaii we really only needed a room for sleeping. The location is fantastic and very close to everything. The staff are always willing to answer every question you may have. The trolley to Ala Moana shopping complex is located at the end of the street. I suggest using their concierge and booking tours once you are there as there no agent fees like here in Australia. In addition to this the concierge was very knowledgeable and he was honest in his recommendations. Check in was quite lengthy and the lobby was very hot. Not the ideal situation when coming off a 9 hour flight. The female that we checked in with was fantastic and very friendly. She would have to have been our favourite staff member. I wish I knew her name. We were told at time of check in (2pm) that our room was not ready. The hotel stated they could take our bags and we went and had a drink in the bar while we waited another hour. We only had one staff member (female) who was somewhat rude when we came back to collect our room key. But this was our only poor example of customer service and we didn't really see her after that so we were happy. When we entered our room it was very cool and clean. The bathroom was clean and water pressure was fantastic. The balcony was great in the evening. There is construction happening but it did not really affect us too greatly. We were not told about the construction upon booking but as we booked with our travel agent the fault does not lay with the hotel. We were always welcomed back into the hotel by staff members. Overall if people are looking for luxury then pay for it. The Aqua Waikiki Pearl is not a top of the line hotel but the hotel is acceptable, is clean, the staff are great, the location is exceptional and we were happy with the hotel. The main downside is that they don't have a pool and the carpets desperately need replacing. We would definitely stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl again.

We booked 9 Nights but we left after one night. Massive Construction Site next to the Hotel.Very loud.Rooms are old, dirty and noisy.There were Cocroaches around.Dirt bags with waste at the floors is laying Outside.Nobody seems to care.The Staff sayed the Construction Site will be there for atleast another 6 Month. Such a waste of time and nerves going there.Don't be fooled by the pictures at booking.com.

Friends wedding was in town, so a few of us decided to stay at the Aqua Pearl. Our room was a one bedroom, separate living room and kitchen. Excellent condition and just what we needed for our stay. The room was clean, spacious and quiet :) coffee in room was delicious, the small vanity in between the kitchen and living room was very useful. Will stay again!

The pictures on the web site make the rooms look fresh and clean. To the contrary they were tired/dated and the rooms smelled stale. We were on the 2nd floor with a balcony over looking the road with a noisy pub not far away. We booked a 1 bedroom suite so my teenagers could have their own bed - 1 in a room and the other on the couch which folded into a bed. We unfolded the sofa bed and a few cockroaches skittered out and the bed had definitely seen better days with a big sag in the middle. There also small cockroaches on the bench and the cupboards. There were 3 air-conditioning units in each room with a remote but none of them worked. The very large bathroom was accessed through the master bedroom so not ideal for anyone needing the bathroom during the night. We arrived at 11pm at night after a 9 hour flight and were checking out early the next day to drive to the North Shore. We didn't complain about the issues as we were so late checking in that we just couldn't be bothered. We did go for a walk on arrival to stretch our legs and although fairly close to the main shopping area it was a pretty seedy part of town. Good points - the staff at check in and check out were very polite and courteous, especially with our late arrival. There was parking on site directly behind the building $25 per day which was convenient. We couldn't wait to get out of there and it was not a great start to our Hawaiian holiday.

I booked a 2 bedroom apartment in April for 3 nights in July.At the end of a very tedious check-in process I was advised that it was my lucky day as I was to be "upgraded" to a one bedroom apartment with a single room immediately next door. Not fully understanding what was on offer we went to the rooms and found that they were next to each other but not connected in any way. The one bedroom "apartment" had a foul odour (stale urine) which we reported to reception and asked to be resolved. The next day the smell was still there and so they sent a carpet cleaner in. Coming back 8 hours later we found the smell still there. We were offered a room change but that meant having two rooms on different floors so we moved into the room that didn't stink. How they could even let people into the stink room in the first place is amazing. Then not show much care that there was a problem, wow! Add to all this the carpets in both rooms were stained. The balcony doors in one room were corroded to the extent that they could not open from one end. The bath plug in the other room was stuck in place. On top of all this the hotel, without prior advice, levies a $15/day compulsory "Hospitality Fee" for DVD rental (not wanted), Waikiki shuttle(not wanted), daily newspaper in lobby(not wanted), in room coffee,(not wanted), in room safe, local calls (not wanted), water in lobby, coffee in lobby from 7am to 11am(!), weekly manager's reception (every Tuesday from 2pm to 3pm - are they serious?) + "complimentary" WiFi. On the website and in the booking process the WiFi is touted as free. I asked for a refund on the big room and was given a pathetic $145 discount amounting to around 10% which I had no option but to take as I was on my way to catch a plane.This place is a disaster. No one cares at all. Beware, big time.

We loved staying at the Pearl, it was clean and tidy well presented, lovely staff, who are friendly and helpful, towels provided for the beach and coffee and tea for breakfast. Great spacious rooms and comfortable bedding. There was a lot of construction going on around but it did not interfere with what we were doing. Close to shops and beach and nice and quiet also. We had a two bedroom on the 9th floor with a huge bathroom. Overall a great stay.

Arriving at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl we were just in time for the weekly manager's drinks and snacks which was a fantastic start to our holiday. The service we received from Harry at the front desk was second to none and I just knew we would enjoy our stay. I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. The staff were all friendly and helpful and more than made up for the fact that there was no pool at this Aqua hotel. My only suggestion would be that arrangements for the guests at the Pearl should be made so they could use the pool at a nearby Aqua hotel...

The rooms were not bad and was defintely big enough, but the service was awful. THere was maybe one competent person at the front desk (Ape) who could work outside the normal questions and had some flexibility. Mark was nice and help alot as well, but sometimes couldn't answer our questions correctly. Also, they often did not have enough people working the front desk, meaning that I would have to wait 10 mins+ for little things like getting quarters or returning my towel. The parking situation was atrocious and expensive. There was incredibly loud construction going on next door. If I had to stay in Waikiki again (we already live in HI) I would go ahead and pay the extra money to stay in a place that did not leave frustrated everyday.

The room was okay. It wasn't the greatest. The air conditioning was hardly on. It didn't cool the room.The service was okay. The room was a average size room. The cleanliness was okay. The value was okay.

Stayed here for a period of 9 nights, and really enjoyed it. They offered brilliant service and really looked after their guests. Had unlimited DVD hire which was an added bonus. However, there was major construction going on next door which started in the very early hours of the morning so got woken up every morning which wasn't ideal - but this isn't in the control of the hotel! Perhaps would've enjoyed some form of room service available or more kitchen amenities.Also got free wi-fi which was fast speed. Another thing, on my travel details about the hotel, it stated that they require the hospitality fee upon departure, but when we got there, they demanded it on arrival. Didn't personally bother me much but would have preferred the correct info.Overall, really enjoyed my stay and is definitely a good 'sleep n go' hotel. Cheers.
user_name:
gw95
Hamilton & Waikato Region, New Zealand

review_body: Our stay here was perfect. At first glance it doesn't seem like much, but we quickly learned that the quality was reflected by the hotel staff. Most of our interaction were with Mark--who was incredibly nice and accommodating--but everyone there was really helpful including one of the night security guards offering us some recommendations for late night dining. Everything was clean and simple, no frills, but just what we needed. This is definitely one of those 'don't judge a book by it's cover' type hotels.

Stayed here in a suite on the 8th floor and I would again. Glimpses of water are just that so if you are looking to see the ocean stay somewhere else. Why would I stay here again? The location is central, the rooms are spacious, the full kitchen was great, beds are comfortable but the best part is the people on reception - nothing is too much trouble from arranging long term storage of luggage (with Cliff at $5 per bag per day - great for when you want to island hop) to helping you find your way around. The hotel is old but clean. The only downside nearby construction starts at 7 - and they supply earplugs if that is a bother. Shuttles to and from the airport can be arranged as well.

enjoyed my trip plenty to do. Locals very friendly went to pearl harbour on day trip very humbling experience. staff at hotel very helpful. would recommend this trip but very long plane ride to get there.

poor parking..charged $25 a day for no parking..$15 a day for ammenities not used..surprise charges on your card.a lot of construction going on.no free shuttle from airport.not a good value at all....

Stayed 6 nights here. Good location to things but alot of construction going on around here at the moment so a bit noisy which is not the hotels fault. Staff were friendly, rooms fairly clean except for dirty carpets and birds trying to get in the room from balcony. It has free wifi and the beds were comfy. Having walked around Waikiki for a week now, I would probably stay somewhere else. Ok for price. 7/10

I am a former local here on Oahu. I have never been a big fan of Waikiki. I was booked here at the Aqua Waikiki via work and spent 11 days at the hotel. The parking situation is poor at best. Room was old but clean and the AC worked. Right smack in the middle of construction on all sides. But again, it was work so I was gone most of the day. Here comes the good part. Front desk Mark reminded me of what makes this place special. Every late afternoon, evening, Mark would be there and no matter how busy or not busy he was, he would bade me a welcome Mr. Solis, how was your day? I did not really catch a few other boys names there, but all in all, it was the staff, and especially Mark, who made this otherwise typical small hotel amongst the concrete jungle, cool. Mahalos Mark.

Pros: 8 minute walk to beach. Very friendly, helpful staff. Good housekeeping. Affordable rates. Scuba and snorkeling rentals just across the street.Cons: Carpet was old and stained. Low-flow shower heads. No ocean views. Overnight parking is expensive $25/night.
user_name:
jim2boston
New York City, New York

review_body: Arrived here after a 91/2hr flight at 9.30am to be told that our room would not be available till 4pm. Everyday we were there the foyer was crowded with people waiting to get into there rooms often asleep on the couches. The rooms are very large but very ordinary, with balcony view over a car park. The hotel is in urgent need of an update. An extra fee of $16 us is charged per day when you leave supposedly for the use of wifi and the cold water in the foyer?? There is a lot of construction work going on next door which makes drop off and pickups difficult. Would not recommend this hotel there are a lot of others cheaper and better.

The photos are quite deceiving - this is quite a run-down hotel in an apartment-style partially outdoor, layout. There's not much to look at when you exit your room except some construction work which you can basically hear 24/7 (which is probably why the room comes with earplugs.) I sleep soundly so it wasn't so much a problem for me. If you plan on spending all your time outside and only require a bed to sleep on then this is a reasonably-priced option. Location is quite good though - you can walk to the beach and there are many nearby shops & restaurants. On the 2nd day the concierge lady was less than helpful - literally laughed in our face when we asked if she could assist with making arrangements to visit the Dole Pineapple plantation. Don't try do things in a rush in Hawaii - they set their own relaxed and carefree pace. Otherwise the attendants at the front desk (not concierge) are very friendly, helpful and attentive, including the excitable bell boy who was helpful in arranging taxis and general crowd/luggage management.

This was the least expensive place we could find for the one night we were in Honolulu. We had two bedrooms a living room and a kitchen area. The only bathroom was huge and located in the master bedroom. The balcony was a nice size but the street view was not very pleasant to look at. Waikiki beach was only 2 blocks away so that was nice.  I marked it down because when we arrived we were told they had overbooked and would be sending us to a sister hotel. Since we had lots of luggage they called a taxi for us and said we would not have to pay but the taxi driver was not ok with that. It got complicated but finally got to other hotel only to find out they didn't have rooms with 2 beds that we needed. We got sent back to Pearl and finally got a room. It was a hard way to start our Hawaii vacation when we were already exhausted.

This hotel is very old, although clean and the staff were pleasant. Rooms accessed via communal verandah. Very noisy, old air conditioner. There was no pool, bar or associated restaurant in the complex. Free in room coffee only. No mini bar, but there was a nice machine on level 7.

My stay here was courtesy of the US Army. My time here was pretty long and I have to say it wasn't the best looking place and the elevator sucked, but I did enjoy the staff and the services. Parking wasn't all that great either but we made due most nights.

Although clean and nicely located in Waikiki - the surrounding area is filled with loud construction. Check in was alright, especially when you're FORCED to take (3) extra cards upon check in. One card is for movie/playstation rentals and two cards are for a beach towel program - even if you know you'll never use it. The girl at the front desk said we "need" to take the cards and we "need" to return them upon checkout or well be charged for $30 each towel card and more for the movie/play station card.I probably wouldn't stay there again - due to limited parking on property (roughly 20-22 stalls) and if you can't get those - you will need to park a block or so away and pay $20 CASH only and walk back. Not very easy for a wheelchair dependant person on a medical stay over.

My husband and I were there in October 2014. The week we were there is when the hurricane just missed the islands so it rained a lot. The staff was very friendly and helped us find activities to replace the ones that were cancelled due to weather.

My husband and I stayed here for one night. After having a couple of rude in counters with staff at other hotels it was refreshing to come here and deal with people we were nice ! Even with a huge line at the front desk the woman checking is in was pleasant and really wanted to make sure all our needs were met. The room was clean and we were upgraded to a room with a balcony which was fun. Good location, maybe a less than 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach. A grocery store within a 5 min. walk & lots of restaurants / shopping near by. Would stay here again. Parking is $25 / day in their small hotel parking lot. There is additional parking a little further away. The hotel will reimburse you if you have to park there.

Hi everyone, I've been here for 7 night in a double room.The room is nothing special, but very clean and with utility services inside...The position is perfect, just 5 minutes walk to from Waikiki beach and close to pub, bar and restaurant...A right thought go to the staff very friendly professional and available anytime...

Older in city motel/hotel. Very few facilities. TV,Shower,Bed,coffemaker,microwave. No pool, restaurant. The humour in itis they charge a resort fee approx 13.00, because they can, not because they provide a lot of value Downtown shuttle shared between other Aqua Hotels in Waikiki, beach towel.o you can walk 8-10 blocks to beach.Overpriced compared to value for clean room

it was fun for a stay cation. not the prettiest rooms but they were very comfortable and roomy. overall a very great hotel friendly staff and near pretty much everything. the staff here was extremely friendly and very helpful and they all asked if we were doing okay whenever we passed them by.

The staff was very helpful and friendly, however the hotel was lacking. The hotel is under construction so we were woken up daily at 7 am. I had requested a play pen and a king bed when we booked but they did not have a play pen and we were put in a room with two double beds. Not the end of the world but not what I asked for. Elevators were out of order almost the entire time. We would likely not come back to this hotel. The friendliness of the staff saved the experience for me.

Our stay at this hotel was excellent and would definitely return. The hotel itself is fairly modern, very clean and just ideal for people that are going to be spending little time here and enjoying what Hawaii has to offer. All of the staff are very helpful and will assist in anyway possible - 24 hour service is great. The location is perfect! only a short walk to the beach and popular shopping area. The only negative is it doesn't have a pool, which isn't a big deal when you're on one of the most exotic islands thats renowned for it's rugged landscapes and sandy beaches. Unfortunately, the surrounding buildings around the hotel are undergoing construction and can be rather noisy early morning and even late on the night. HOWEVER, this is out of this hotels control and should not be penalized for other surrounding buildings. This didn't affect my Vacation, as i was enjoying all of my time out of the hotel enjoying the Hawaiian life. Like everyone should be!!!!! Overall, my partner and I thoughly enjoyed our stay and for the price it was the BEST deal we could find. Its super low price definitely did not reflect on the quality and service of this hotel. Thank you for an amazing experience.
user_location: Kingston upon Hull, England, United Kingdom
user_name:
Bobby B
Kingston upon Hull, England, United Kingdom

review_body: The view is other hotels but for the lower price and hospitality it was worth it. Was able to spend way more on other activities staying here. Waikiki beach is a couple minute walk away and when the market place is done you'll have shopping steps away.

The staff of this hotel treats you like Ohana from the minute you check in. Nicole is the most kind hearted person I have met in a long time, Harry's smile will melt away any stress you have from traveling and Dee's gentle demeanor calms you and makes you feel welcome. The hotel is in a great location, it is very clean and the rooms are spacious and are updated. Many mahalo's for to this wonderful staff at the Waikiki Pearl!

The hotel is nicely located and has good prices for the rooms offered. The rooms had a Playstation 3, so that was a bonus. There was a DVD rental machine in the lobby. About 5 mins to walk to the beach, located next to a nightclub and a couple of bars.

The first day we arrived. We knew this was the place to be. Mark was especially helpful in getting us settled into a beautiful suite on the 7th floor. We will never forget him and the beautiful staff at Waikiki Pearl. We would recommend it to any tourist travelling for the first time to Waikiki. Thanks Mark ^_^From Melissa and Pat from Washington DC

The Aqua Pearl is situated just off the main road, next to Ohana West which is currently being refurbished and very noisy. The rooms are spacious and well equipped. The carpet needs tending to as there are a few stains. But it's the warmth and the kindness of the staff that is 7 star plus, especially Mark who went out of his way to help us. Nothing was a bother for any of the staff.It's central to the main road, the beach and Ala Moana shopping centre.The price was reasonable and definitely would recommend it to anyone. It's the one place that we will stay on any return visit.

Loved the Aqua Pearl, nice location near but not on the beach, friendly helpful staff especially Mark. I used it because of the value, thought about staying in an expensive classic beach front, but the flavor of the economy vacation to Hawaii is appealing, cause lets face it, it's all about being outside at Waikiki. Would have preferred a street side balcony instead of the inner courtyard with the huge banyon tree filled with loud chirping birds at 6 am, but got used to that & found it charming after a while. No it's not fancy and classy. I'de go back

We used this as a stay over before our flight home. Our first part of our honeymoon was spent at the moana Surfrider which is an amazing beach front hotel. Aqua Waikiki doesn't compare in terms of elegance but it was very clean and the hotel staff and services were actually better here than the moana and the Sheraton Kauai. Upon arrival front desk attendant Dee was very pleasant and without us knowing upgraded us to a deluxe top floor room. This room was huge with three bedrooms and a fully serviced kitchen, huge fridge and stove and oven. This would be a great affordable room for a big family. It was the only place that recognised our honeymoon and they left us a nice gift of chocolate macadamias and champagne. Really pleasant surprise from a hotel that was far cheaper than our other two hotels. They provide a free shuttle to ala moana shopping centre and also free DVD rentals in the foyer. Both other more expensive hotels wanted $20 a movie. Again a cheaper hotel with better services. It's only a street sway from Waikiki beach. Very happy with the hotel and can strongly recommend it.

Just got back from a 10 day, 9 night stay with family at this hotel 24hrs ago. Simply awesome.Don't get too caught up in the 2.5 star or 3.5 star ratings for hotels. Aqua Pearl is very clean, super friendly, and for the price and location, can't be beat. The lobby is bright and airy, with lots of natural light.Dee, Flora, the bell hops, the cleaning ladies, were always more than willing to help, say good morning every day, and always have a big smile on their faces whenever you see them. The Managers Reception every Tuesday 2pm-3pm was simple and hits the spot. Cool drinks, easy snacks, smooth and rocking hawaiian music. Steps away from great food like Marukame Udon, minutes away from Island Vintage Coffee, witch is packed every day.And to top it all off, awesome FREE, not pay, wi-fi in EVERY room, not just the lobby like most other hotels.
