Speed is super snappy, with max signal strength. For a techie like me, this was a mega bonus.So looking forward to coming back next year to stay here again.

This my third stay at this hotel, for a room to sleep in and be close to every thing it can't be beat for pricing. I have stay on the street side the first two times and found it noisy but stated on the back side and it is much quieter. Would be nice to have a place to rest in after you check out and have to wait for a red eye flight as being in the lobby for 5 hrs can be tedious. Staff as usual do all they can to help in any way you need. So if you don't need a five star room with all the bells and whistles this is the place. .

Just spent 10 days at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl Hotel and had a great holiday. Harry and all the staff are very friendly and helpful. We had a room with balcony, plenty of room ,free WiFi was very good.Location is excellent,plenty of shops and restaurants,and just 1 block from Waikiki Beach.Bus stop just around the corner.

The staff at Aqua Waikiki Peal was very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Location of the hotel was close to everything, the beach, restaurants and the stores. Everything was within walking distance.The hotel provided free beach towel, beach chair and shuttle to and from the Ala Mona Shopping Centre.Only downside to this place was that our room had this odor so every time we came in we always had to open our door to get fresh air.

The standard rooms here have no opening windows and overlook a corridor with people walking past so if you want privacy the curtains need to be closed making the room dark, so that you need a light on in the middle of the day. The air conditioner was loud and noisy. As there are no opening windows the choice was between too hot too sleep or too noisy. We spent two days here before travelling to the Big Island for a week. We requested an upgrade for the one night before our return international flight. The upgraded balcony room was much larger with quieter air conditioner. The cups in the room were dirty and we returned them to reception. It took over an hour and several phone calls before we were provided with replacements. There were hairs in bathroom shower and we had to call reception again to have the bathroom properly cleaned. On both occasions that we checked into this hotel we were made to wait until late afternoon for check in despite on both occasions arriving on early morning flights. We only returned on the second occasion because our room had been pre paid. The only good thing I can say about this hotel was they had very good internet reception and was central . I would never stay at this hotel again.

Aqua Waikiki pearl was good the staff was very helpful and friendly we had a great stay and would stay here again. Walking distance to the beach and restaurants. Meeting points for tours were all close to hotel. We enjoyed our stay so thank you staff

Big, clean rooms, nice beds, a/c works well, big bathroom friendly staff. Coin laundry available. About 10 minutes to the beach. I enjoyed my stay. While not modern and fancy, this hotel was very comfortable and a good price.

The staff of the Waikiki Pearl was very helpful and so freindly. Ms. Singh was very helpful with some reciept issues that my company had and made the lengthy transactions more understandable. Everyone at the desk, including the people who book the tours were very helpful. I asked Tiki about good food in the area and he named quite a few places and all of them were excellent. I would say that the manner of the assistance and attitude of the staff made me feel more comfortable there than in the Hilton. While I have been to major hotel chains that were pleasant and the staff was accommodating, they never felt as genuine as the staff of the Waikiki Pearl. Sometimes issues happen, the staff of the Pearl made things right and made me feel like they really wanted to.

Had a great stay. Room older and basic but comfortable. Staff are the best - excellent customer service. Only a short walk to the beach, shops, bus service only a few steps from the hotel. Only bad point was the internet service...wasn't able to pick it up in my room. Called the provider...did not make a difference. Need to have better service when charging a resort fee

My husband and I chose this hotel because we thought It was reasonably priced for Kamaaina. We got to the hotel at around 11pm and found that the entire hotel parking lot was full!! BE AWARE: they have 20 stalls, parking is $20 a day! The only stall open was the one under the tree in which dawn (check in clerk) told us that it's the doo doo stall where you'll wake up with bird poop all over your car. So we had 3 options, to pay the meter all night, park on the alawai street for free but get up to move it before 8am for street sweeping, or park 3 mins away at the trade center and pay $20 overnight. We got checked in and dawn was pleasant, however we got to the rooms and it was disgusting!!!!!!!! We didn't feel clean from the moment we walked in! The sheets were filled with hair, the bathroom filled with hair, I mean come on, we had to sleep with no blankets because the hotel was fully booked and we couldn't change rooms!! The bed is uncomfortable and we found ear plugs on the night stand, only to find out what they were for in the morning, construction noise woke me up and no one mentioned this to us!! Very upsetting!!!! Very disgusting!!! We will never book this hotel again! We checked out the next day and thank goodness we did!! I do not suggest booking this hotel! The location may be close to Waikiki but with clubs and bars around, it didn't feel safe, it was ghetto to say the least.

This is very basic. Sports bar and Starbucks right there. Friendly staff and lots of information from the front desk. No pool but close to the beach. If you all you want is a safe functional place to stay this it, no frills.

Our party of 4 adults and 2 toddlers arrived at 7 am and were unable to get into our room until 4 pm. There were no early arrivals' facilities except for a coffee machine and water cooler; certainly nowhere to change a nappy. The room allocated was not the two bedroom unit with bath that we booked. There were not enough chairs, cutlery, crockery or towels for a party of six. It was filthy and noisy with the garbage trucks collecting skips at 5 am and the bar remaining open until late and barking dogs in other units. I would strongly advise against staying here. We made a formal complaint to our travel agent when we arrived home. They gave us a voucher for $100 for a future holiday. We will not be using this voucher as we will not be using this agent ever again.

The front desk especially Mark went out of their way to make the stay pleasant.The only complaint was the noise in the morning from the motorists.Wonderful location. Very clean accomodations. Nice freebies. Loved the apples!

Absolutely loved our stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl Hotel. We arrived to extremely friendly staff and we're lucky enough to receive a free upgrade to our room. Harry and Mark who worked on the desk were great to deal with and very knowledgeable about the city. There was a 15 dollar hospitality fee that was completely worth it, unlimited DVDs, free shuttle around Waikiki to Ala Moana, use of beach towels and chairs, unlimited wifi, free coffee in the lobby each morning, room cleaned and bathroom essentials topped up daily. Staff were friendly and always willing to help or to go out of their way to make your stay a great one. Would return to the Aqua Pearl again!

The Aqua Waikiki Pearl is very centrally located. It is only 1 block back from the main drag where the high end shops and numerous restaurants are. The hotel doesn't have any eating facilities in house. There is a sports bar on the ground floor but I didn't feel comfortable with the clientele. There is a Starbucks cafe on the corner about 30 metres up the street.however, the hotels room was disappointing. Whilst the room was clean and serviced daily, the carpet was greasy. The shower had poor water pressure. The air conditioner was a box type unit and was so noisy it woke me up every time the compressor came on. A pair of ear plugs were provided but when there a two in the room. Twice the police attended the hotel, one for a multiple stabbing in the room across the hall from my room. The staff were very helpful and efficient.i would not stay here again.

Honolulu is not noted for low-cost hotels, but this one is reasonable by comparison. Hotel is getting on, but is well maintained, very good sized room, clean & comfortable. Nearby construction noisy, but ends by evening. Hotel is in a busy area of Waikiki so some street noise, but not bad, and of course well located for restaurants and downtown shopping. Staff friendly.Parking a bit of a production, but tolerable once you get used to it. We would stay again.
user_name:
Doug R
Kelowna, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: This is the second time that we have stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. The first time was in 2012 and then again in 2015. Each time the stay was above our expectations. The staff is very friendly and very helpful. All staff, from the front desk, the porters and the cleaning staff go above and beyond to make your stay the best they can.Any problems, and we only had one small one, was looked after immediately.Would highly recommend this hotel and will be staying there again in the future.

This was was a great location In Waikiki without paying the huge prices of the hotels closer to the beach. Located 2 blocks from the beach it is easy walking to the Main Street , beaches and shopping. Around 200 metres from the bus and trolley stops. The rooms were very large with own kitchen which reduced food prices substantially . The area is noisy at night however the guests are provided with ear plugs.There is a $15 a day fee for towels, DVD , room safe etc which I had forgotten about. This also includes free wifi in the rooms. Staff were friendly and helpful with booking activitiesThe room was clean , with toiletries supplied. Overall a good experience and I would stay there again if I was on a tight budget

Maybe this hotel needs an update, the room was a little old fashioned. But super spacious, big rooms, dining area, and best of all a nice balcony patio.I liked being right in the middle of Waikiki, with all the tall buildings, lights and noise, but it might be too much for some.The front desk staff all really nice and helpful!

Old, but in a very goog location. Front desk agent Harry helped me so much. Beach towels and chairs , stroe in front of the bulding, Starbuks in the corner , traditional Japanese Rest near by. The beach is very good, there u can find a lot of activities. A lot of stores near by, and 1 Dutty Free Mall.

I enjoyed my recent stay in the Aqua Wakiki Pearl. It is just a couple blocks from the ocean, which makes it really convenient for exploring around Wakiki without being overly crowded or expensive. One thing I really liked is you could return beach towels from the hotel, which was a great feature, especially if you are traveling around and not wanting to pack wet towels. Only had two criticisms of the facility. The first is the parking - it is a tiny lot. However, they do have a deal with another location, but you have to pay cash there and then they will take that amount off your bill. Parking is also not free, so take that into consideration with the cost of the hotel if you have a car. Second complaint is we had to slam our door to get it to close, which I felt bad doing, especially late at night. But, overall, if you are looking for an affordable place to stay in the Wakiki area, it is a great option.

Just returned from a 2 week stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl Hotel with my family. This was a return visit to this Hotel, as we stayed here for 3 weeks in December 2011. Hotel is clean, centrally located in Waikiki and very close to the beach, the night market and the Food Pantry (only one in Waikiki). Staff very friendly and always assisted when necessary. We were upgraded to a suite with a Kitchen at no extra charge. Room has excellent Wi-Fi access and the free shuttle service to the Ala Moana shopping complex was very handy (departs every 30 minutes from the sister hotel Aqua Wave across the road). Great hotel at an affordable price.

You get what you pay for. The staff was great and the room was clean. It's located in a decently central location and close to the beach. The WiFi, views, and amenities aren't great. It's cool if you are on a budget.

My room was comfortable and quiet. I had a couple of special requests, which the staff quickly responded to. Mark was super helpful, and the 'IT guy' (sorry, I don't know his name) showed this nearly 60-year-old woman how to use the video game player in my room to watch a movie. And Mark gave me cookies. ;) I'd definitely stay here again. The only disappointment - and this was NOT the hotel's fault - my window opened about 8' from the next hotel's lanais. Kind of uncomfortable looking out my window and right into the guy's room a few feet away. But that's Waikiki / Honolulu - the hotels are totally right on top of each other. This may not have bothered others, but the A/C unit above my room's door sounded like a jet plane taking off when it turned on - jolted me out of my sleep several times. Then I figured out what the pair of earplugs were for on the night table.

Great hotel for the price. Room was large and very clean. The staff is what turns this hotel into a gem! Especially Mark! We had to ask for some special requests during our stay and Mark and staff, made sure each request was taken care of quickly. Lots of construction nearby so lots of noise until pretty late at night. Good location for shopping and places to eat. Short stay so not sure how far from the beach.

Recently stayed at the Aqua Pearl for 10 days. The staff went above and beyond to help us whenever we needed it.Our room had been advertised as an ocean view, but we had a street view. It was extremely noisy, starting around 6 in the morning until very late evening! The room was good.Very large but could have had more furniture....another chair...maybe a small table. The was very dirty and stained.There was some places higher up etc. that could have been cleaned better.When I did laundry on the 3rd floor the washing machines were filthy and I had a hard time putting and taking the clothes out so they did not touch the dirt! On top of this, it was 3.00 per load for both washer and dryer. Cost me 12.00 to do 2 loads of laundry! Overall,our stay was good! Liked the safe in the room and we had Wifi the entire time.

we have just recently visited Oahu and decided to stay at Aqua Waikiki Pearl. I was bit worried but after reading reviews from other travellers I gave it a go.If you expect nice and modern - not for you - keep lookingIf you expect nice, clean (beds done daily, fresh towels daily) - you found it!We had nice room with fridge and microwave from street's side with a balcony. During the day view was so so but during the night - loved it! we have asked to accommodate us on higher level (8th floor) as it is getting quite loud in the night and starts again around 6am - but you are in the heart of Waikiki - so do not expect any different! Hotel has shuttle to drive you around, free beach towels, chairs and DVD renting machine because you have Xbox in your room!. Staff was friendly always happy to help. Desk is attended 24/7 which is really good. They told me where to eat good food, how to get everywhere (even printed maps for us) and answered 100 other silly questions we had. Thank you guys for great stay - we have enjoyed it! Will definitely see you soon:-)

The room was fine - although we had a double and a queen bed - 2-4 people - and there were 2 towels.... I was annoyed at that because *I* use 2 towels - my husband and any children we might have had would have had to use hand towels..?There are about 20 parking spots total for the 6 floor hotel. They do have back up parking 3 blocks away. Check in first to ditch your bags so you don't have to haul them thru the city. When checking out, get your car, pay the $20 parking fee in cash, if you use a card to pay its $23, then bring your receipt to have that $20 credited back to your overall bill - if you've paid the parking with the card and paid the $23 they will only reimburse the $20. I found this incredibly inconvenient. More so because these were surprises upon check in. It was a lot of hassle. We came from Maui so only had a backpack - if we would have had actual luggage, I would have been beyond irritated. They charge a $100 damage deposit upon check in as well as a $35 hospitality fee. The $100 was refunded but it usually takes "7-10 days".I get that it's Hawaii and you're going to pay more for things and additional fees and probably feel inconvenienced, but come on.... Let us know before we book the room. The second floor room we had was loud. Street noise as well as parking lot noise. Birds are part of being in Hawaii so that was expected. The staff was very friendly and the water was hot - that's about the only positive about the place.

The hotel itself was nice. It's clean the staff is friendly. There is no pool and the street it sits on is very busy with a lot of police calls. The nights are noisy with with sirens and you will see a lot of drug dealing. I would never visit this part of Waikiki with small children.

Really good for the price. The staff is very friendly. A lot to do in the neighborhood! Near of market, fairs, stores like Forever 21, Macys and other attractions! They have microwave and refrigerator in the room, so you can cook a bit and have some beer and cold stuff!

Dee was a very helpful and friendly person at the Aqua Waikiki. The other team members were great and efficient. It was a pet friendly hotel and was very clean; cleaner than the not-so-pet friendly hotel I had been at. It was a great rate and close to everything I needed. I would recommend in a heart beat.

This hotel is very well located in Waikiki very close to beach and many dining and shopping amenities there is no pool and the parking is very limited and expensive 25.00 a night but it is standard at most properties in the area the hotel staff are excellent and the rooms are very large with a coffee machine microwave small fridge and a safe for valuables a nice sized balcony and efficent and quiet air conditioner large flat screen tv and a playstation 3 to watch the free and good selection of movies and games the 15.00 a day resort charge is fairly standard and usually i feel i get nothing for it but with the newspaper lobby coffee, beach towels and chairs great selection of movies free shuttle pass and other small perks and wifi which is really only accessable in the lobby, I was not able to connect in my room you feel like you get some value for the daily fee. The only downside is the noise which realistically the hotel cannot do anything about but they do provide earplugs in the room if you are a late riser on the street side there is the garbage trucks that service the area starting at 6:45 some mornings after the first morning i realized I did not have to set an alarm so they were my wakeup call hey your in a large city there will be noise get up early and enjoy if not go back to bed after they are done on the rear of the building it is a very large group of noisy birds in the morning and early evening once again paradise has its drawbacks.There is a store on site and across the street and a sports bar in case you want stay close to home. I usually stay at much fancier hotels but this place for the money was perfect.

It was a good value for the 6 nights I stayed. Staff was really friendly, the free shuttle service and unlimited movie rental service was a pleasant surprise I didn't expect. I parked my scooter for free which helped save some money. The hotel has a small lobby, no views and no pool but they provide beach towels and a concierge.

As I had read before booking this hotel, the service was very good from the staff here. Here is what I have on the plus side:Great serviceLarge rooms Fridge and microwave VERY handyBalcony is large Location is very close to beachFree shuttle to ala moana mall is very handy!Negatives:Very very noisy: construction and the bar downstairs make for very noisy late evenings! Windows and walls are paper thin.No pool- I didn't see this mentioned, and would likely have stayed somewhere else as this is important to meAlthough the rooms were large, there wasn't much advantage as there isn't much furniture to fill it. I give this 3 stars because the service and location are great- I would recommend if you are on a budget and don't care about a pool or noiseI would not recommend if you are wanting lots of amenities and luxury suites. Also, if you are sensitive to noise or a light sleeper, try to stay in a room far away from the bar.

The rooms and bathrooms are hugh, but nothing special. Could of used more furniture. If you are not looking for a Ocean view and need a somewhat cheaper hotel it is in a convenient location and was good for an overnight. Nice friendly staff.

This hotel is in a good location, the rooms are fine for the money (in Waikiki terms) but what made it for us were the helpful staff, in particular Mark on reception. Mark managed to get us to the airport on time despite the shuttle bus being full and mayhem on the freeway. Thank.

A very tired property with old rooms but they have tried to make up for it with nice lighting and decoration in the lobby. Compulsory porterage fee of 8.50 per person per night plus taxes is completely unnecessary as no actual porterage services were provided. Good maybe as a budget place to stay but it wasn't really all that cheap either. Mgm grand in vegas is cheaper to stay at than this 2 star place. But friendly staff made this place more livable.

Stayed a couple of nights at this hotel organised by Sona Tours Ltd, UK while on return journey from Hawaii cruise, great location as central to Waikiki, the main shopping area and beach is just a stones throw away on foot. A cheerful hotel to stay at, very friendly staff.

very good location. The staff of the hotel is very helpful and friendly. The cooking smell from around floor restaurant comes up to the balcony was a bit disappointed. Otherwise all are very good--worth to stay again.

Great location!! Rooms are big and not too expensive, with a lot of facilities inside such as Kitchen , fridge, microwave, tv, PS3, etc. Nice balcony, good service. Free wifi. They offer a free shuttle to Ala Moana Shopping Center, towels for the beach, movies and games for PS3.

We spent 3 nights at this hotel in last December. You can find local supermarket just round the corner, shops and loco rrestaurants are no probs.The room was very standard but nice modern Decoration and large rooms. The only negative fact was that the the room we stayed was facing to the street and a bit noisy during very early morning due to garbage truck running back and forward in front ofthe hotel.staffs were so friendly and very kind. Will back again this year.

We had room 914. It was a 2 bedroom suite. The suite was very spacious, but the layout was poor. There weren't any closets in the large bedroom. The large bedroom had the only bathroom, which means users must enter the large bedroom to get to the only bathroom. It was not very convenient. The kitchen had minimal kitchenware. It had a large balcony. We were lucky to be able to park in the hotel parking lot each evening as others had to park 2 blocks away. The staff was friendly and helpful. The property is dated but conveniently located. Traffic was horrendous in Honolulu during the Christmas holidays. The highways were always jammed up during the days.

Arrived early in afternoon & because they had a heads up, it was my birthday, they upgraded our room, but not only this, when we arrived back @ the room after hitting waikiki, they had left some champagne & chocolates. It really was a treat. parking in waikiki is always a chore, but they do have a small parking lot for guests @ the rear of hotel & if unable to secure one there, offer more parking @ waikiki trade centre. Cost is $25 a night for parking as well as a room tax of $15 a night, so be prepared to pay that on top of your room rate, but compared to other hotels, this is a good rate. The room was clean & spacious with all cooking facilities. We only stayed one night & found Harry at the desk when checking out, to be so friendly & personable. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, especially to local peeps who dislike going to waikiki, because of parking & over inflated prices. I have friends visiting in march 2015 & will certainly recommend this hotel to them. Everything is close by & within walking distance. Mahalo to the staff for making my birthday memorable. Di & Bill :))

I was forced to stay in a hotel for a few weeks while my apartment was being fumigated and hte staff at the Pearl were very accommodating. Everything was clean and they were happy to help me with whatever I needed to make my stay less stressful. I want to especially point out that Dee was especially helpful regardless of the time of day or trouble it took. I'd give the place a better rating except that not having the parking at the hotel was frustrating and annoying and my car was scraped up in their garage due to substandard sized spaces and inadequate space for turning. Now I have an insurance claim to deal with, too.

This property has definitely seen better days, and the location is not the best (we heard shouting and fighting outside the window during the night from the bars nearby). Still, it is close to much better areas of Waikiki, and if you don't want to shell out for a beachfront hotel, this is a decent option. Limited parking on-site, but they have an arrangement with a garage a block or so away that costs $20 per night (as opposed to the $25 they charge for one of the spaces at the hotel).

This is our second visit to the Pearl, we stayed there for a week in mid December 2014 and our previous visit was for two weeks in January 2013.Both times we stayed in a three bedroom apartment. What you must remember to ask for though is a 3 bedroom apartment with 3 defined bedrooms. We didn't do this on our most recent visit and when we arrived in our room it had 2 defined bedrooms and the third was a room off the living area which was divided between the living area by a curtain! We went down to reception to request a 3 bedroom apartment with 3 defined bedrooms but unfortunately one wasn't available for 3 days. The staff were more than accommodating and said they would be more than happy to assist our party of 6 to move rooms. On the morning the apartment became available the staff were true to their word and had the new room cleaned and available and assisted with the move.One other tip is that if there are more than 4 people staying in your room you will need to request extra plates and cutlery as the apartments are only set up for four persons. Since our last stay the International Market Place which was located just at the end of the street has been demolished and a huge construction site is now underway. Our first room was located down the same end as the construction site and we were awoken each morning to the sounds of construction, when we changed rooms the noise certainly was not as bad. So request a room at the far end of the building.The kitchen was adequate with a large fridge, two hot plates and a microwave oven. Our room was serviced everyday with fresh towels, bins emptied and our beds remade. The staff from front reception to cleaning were always polite, friendly and helpful.Starbucks is located right next door and good for the morning pick me up with the Food Pantry just on the next block for all your food supplies. The trolley and bus stops are also just around the corner. Hopefully these tips will help with your holiday.

* Super noisy (they even provide you with ear plugs!)* Very old rooms (it's a converted apartment building)* Only a few parking spaces - you always need to park a few minutes walk from the hotel* Super slow wifi (even "regular" websites are slow to load)* They always add a surprise mandatory "Resort fee" of $15 (on top of what you pay hotels.com or Hotwire)

I would stay here again because of the location, Waikiki Bay was a shirt walk which I took advantage of by taking a swim each morning. The water was pleasant in December at 6.30am. Top of Waikiki a great restaurant was another short walk as are all of the shops. There are convenient shuttle services and the room was clean and comfortable. Staff we're welcoming and helpful. The only negatives were the noisy air conditioning and the conditioner did not condition my hair. The free DVD rentals were a nice bonus. Beach chairs and umbrellas were also available with the beach towels.

The main reason I rate this hotel as "excellent" is because of their "pet friendliness". My dog tears up the house when I leave her alone, so I had to find an affordable hotel where I could have her with me. This hotel is located in the heart of Waikiki so, yes, there is a lot of construction going on nearby and it is surrounded by other buildings... No ocean views. But being local, I don't need all the frills. I know all the cool spots already! The rooms are comfortable. The staff is very friendly. Extra amenities (blankets, coffee, etc.) upon request at no charge. As we all know, room rates can change at the drop of a dime. As it is the Christmas season now, rates are up. I stayed here on DEC 22 and my room was $77.00... Looking online now, I see the same hotel at $307 on DEC 26, meaning the hotel has rooms, but is near capacity for that night. TIP: BOOK EARLY TO GET THE LOWER RATE!
user_name:
Steven T
Waipio Acres, Hawaii, United States

review_body: The room that we stayed in had two bedrooms, a kitchenette, a balcony, and a wonderfully spaced living/dining room! However, the spacious, surprisingly lovely room is not what I would like to rave about. It was the customer service I received at the front desk. All of the employees were exceptionally kind, helpful, and overall professional. There was one employee I MUST commend in particular. His name is Harry and he honestly is the reason I will be staying in this very hotel in the future. He was extremely friendly, patient, helpful, kind, and VERY accommodating! If there was ever a time that I felt the need to recognize someone for their customer service, it's this time, for this man. I usually don't write reviews for businesses but I just needed to shed some light on a hard-working individual who probably doesn't get the recognition he deserves. Like I said earlier, I look forward to staying at this hotel in the near future (since I live on the same island) and receiving excellent customer service from everyone--especially Harry!!! :)

My daughter and I stayed for 10 nights! The staff were friendly, the room was clean and the housekeeping staff were fantastic! The 'Pearl' in only really a block or so away from the beach and the shopping in Waikiki but the Aqua group offer a shuttle service to Ala Moana shopping mall which is great for shopping! Value for money - I was more than happy with the accommodation! Apart from a nearby building site and a tree full of birds that made a racket at dusk and dawn - there was very little street noise from our room! We did not have a view but were not in the room long enough to enjoy it anyway!

I was very disappointed when I saw the room. The bed has hair strands and the carpet was old and stained. The windows were dusty and the AC was blowing dust. I didn't stay there that day and they charged me full price for that day.

Save yourself the trouble. This hotel needs work. The parking alone is bad. $25 for a spot each day. Fire alarm went off around 11:30 pm. That was fun - It stayed on for at least 10 minutes. No idea why.Birds covered my car in berry filled poo in the parking lot. They have a nesting problem. And a tiny lot to park in. It's not exactly close to the beach either. It's closer to the canal (so gross). It's basically an overflow sewer to the ocean. That runs through Waikiki. My room was situated in the backside of the hotel. One king bed but it's hard as a rock, with the worst pillows I've ever used in a hotel. And apparently next to a maids closet?The AC unit is a rambling old clunker from about 4-6 years ago half installed in the wall. The TV has horrible reception and no channel guide. This hotel is on the back side of the construction site for the new mall. Until that is finished and filled with better options for dining and shopping I won't stay at the Aqua again. I did find a good deal online however - even with a promo rate I could have found a better hotel option.

We stayed at the Waikiki Pearl for the second time from 27th November for 8 nights. It is centrally located and all the staff are the friendliest you will find in Oahu. We stayed in the Junior Suite which is spacious and very comfortable as we prefer to have the extra room. If you're going to Honolulu this is the place to stay.

We stayed at the Waikiki Aqua Pearl for five nights to start our Hawaii vacation in Nov 2014. The hotel is about two blocks from the beach. Therefore prices are affordable compared to other places in Waikiki. Just around the corner is a Starbucks and a supermarket (there is a frudge in the room) - there is no breakfats provided at the hotel. The staff is really nice and helpful. The rooms are a little bit dark, but clean. They do not have the most fanciest furniture but who cares - you are certainly not to stay long in your hotel in a place like Waikiki.We had a car for two days. The hotel offers overnight parking - if the parking lot a the hotel is full there is a park house within walking distance (5min). But as everything in Honolulu, it costs a bit (25$/night). But at least you got something for your car.

Aqua Waikiki Pearl is the best hotel with the best "Customer Service"! I receive great service from Kathy, Tasi, Charity, Nicole, Dee, Mark, & RJ for the front desk staff! I also receive excellent service from the Housekeeping Department. I recommend this place to all my family & friends.

Rooms were clean ,staff was very helpful & friendly,not far from beach ,I just got a basic room ,Just somewhere to sleep and shower when on holidays as we didn't spend much time in the room . I would stay there again.
user_name:
Jimmy B
Albion Park Rail, Australia

review_body: The hotel is clean, updated, and safe. It is centrally located so that it is easy to walk to just about anywhere in the city. The staff, Dee, Charity, and Dawn, were extremely helpful and cheerful. They helped us to figure out our itinerary and had great ideas as to what to see and do with the short amount of time that my daughter and I were there. They made our stay in Oahu happy and memorable.

Very helpful staff. Room was clean I choose a junior suite it was very comfortable quite large. It was clean. It had utilitarian décor but bed was very comfortable. I would recommend. Parking was limited.

Like others mentioned staff friendly, handy location BUT we shared our accommodation with MANY cockroaches which we felt was disgusting. Management assured me you are staying in the tropics and you are too expect this. I don't think so, even in the fridge the cockroaches so paid for kitchen facilities who would eat their.!!! Beds very hard and We definitely would not stay there in the future.

This hotel is spot on and ideal for all you need, your a couple blocks from the beach, you have all sorts around the hotel and the help you get from the concierge sorting trips is amazing. And the staff at reception to the cleaners are the most friendly polite staff I have come across, made us feel very welcome. The rooms are ideal with kettle fridge and microwave and it was all very clean and spacious could not ask for more, if I ever manage to get back here again would not think twice about staying here again. would recommend to all my friends and family.

Like others we were a little apprehensive upon entering the lobby, as the building is old. But each day we liked it more and more. The friendly staff and security made us feel at home and was very helpful. Everything in the rooms is newly renovated,comfy beds, very clean and felt safe. Close to everything. If you aren't back at night by 5 pm, though, the parking lot is full. They offer overflow parking a block or so away, but offer a $5 per day discount for the trouble (which was really no trouble.) If you want amenities like a pool and breakfast, this is not your place but if you want a nice, clean place to sleep and friendly, helpful staff for a good price, Aqua Pearl is great!

When I pulled up outside the hotel I was a bit shocked by the appearance but as soon as I entered the lobby all apprehension disappeared. The hotel has a great location, huge rooms, great beds and showers (always essential) and fantastic staff. I felt welcome as soon as I entered the building, in fact for my whole stay, and in spite of all the people coming and going, they seem to remember everyone.I definitely want to stay there in future.

Staff were very helpful especially RJ who has the best tips on all the places the cool kids hang at.Only downside is the car park, it sucks big hairy balls at an extra $25 a day.I rate the staff (RJ) 5 starsand the car park 5 sweaty hairy balls

We stayed for 6 nights, and we got a room on the 9th floor. The hotel is well located in Waikiki, close to amenities (there is a grocery store called Food Pantry nearby, on top of those ubiquitous ABC stores; plenty of restaurants within 5 minutes' walk; and if you don't drive, TheBus and trolley bus stops are 2 minutes' walk away). The beach is about 5-10 minutes' walk from the hotel.The staff are friendly and professional, especially Mark who helped us a lot (for example, he gave us some handy tips and printed our boarding passes for a day trip to Kauai). The staff at the tour desk (if I'm not mistaken, her name is Lydia) is also very helpful, she answered my many questions and booked us to a luau trip.If you are a light sleeper (like me), bring earplugs, you will need them because there are loads of noises (the air conditioning unit in our room is very loud, there are birds chirping very early in the morning, and every now and again you'd hear car alarms). There is no swimming pool in the hotel, but the beach is a lot more fun alternative anyway :)We didn't spend too much time in our room because there are so many things to do and see. All in all, we enjoyed our stay, thank you...

i'm a travler from China, & it's my fist time here, the paradise, HONOLULU! MARK always help guests a lot! THANK YOU MARK! U really made my stay much better! Sorry for my english, but MARK still paid a lot of patient to help me!

The desk clerk at night didn't know what she was doing. We arrived late at night (midnight) and she wanted a credit card for a deposit on our room. She told us our cards would not process the transaction. I called my Mastercard agent and she told me there shouldn't be a problem. It still didn't work so we had to put a cash Deposit down. There shouldn't have been a problem. We straightened the situation out the next morning. The manager did not admit a mistake or say the hotel was sorry for this problem. This situation I believe could have compromised my credit card. The hotel needs some work. The lobby furniture and decor needs to be up graded.

The staff were great, the location was great, but the rooms were sub-par. The balconies sliding windows were flimsy and noise bellowed through them throughout the night. The a/c unit was not properly sealed allowing not only air in and outside bugs. The carpet looked as is someone was murdered all over it, and the room was barren, no seats. Just two beds in a oddly large room. There is a bar that is so loud on the first floor you will be lucky to get sleep if you are sober.I will caveat this with the fact that we did have pets, and I assume it was a pet room, but this was not a great hotel on the inside. The staff were nice, like super nice, but as far as the room went....not a winner

This hotel is great value for those who aren't looking for all the frills - the room we had was on the 10th floor, had free WiFi and a PS3 and was kept spotless by housekeeping.The staff at the front, especially Mark and RJ, were very helpful for newcomers to Waikiki. They always had solid recommendations and were able to point us in the right direction.Great stay and exactly what we needed as an active couple on a budget.

This is our second stay at this hotel. Mark at the front desk is friendly and welcomed us from his heart. The housekeeping staff are wonderful. We had a jr. suite and my daughter is in a wheelchair. I requested a small table and another chair plus a toaster. When we came back to our room, to my surprise items requested were in our room. Housekeeping always replenished our amenities, linens and towels. Mark I would like to give you five stars for being there for us. The only thing is the hotel charges $25.00 for parking. Maybe it may be a thought to drop the price or give kama'aina's a price break for parking. I tried to get street parking most of the time. At $25.00 a day for parking, this was a little much for a two week stay. We come to Honolulu from the Big Island every month, so every little savings help.  I did noticed several times that I was in the lobby that Mark was swamped with guest waiting to check in, late afternoon-early evening. Maybe someone else could be at front desk when they are more check ins at these times. Although Mark handled each check in with his friendliness and apologized for the wait and thanked each guest for waiting. Great job Mark!! Keep smiling.

Location.... location..... location......This apartment is the place to be for staying in Waikiki. Is centrally located and easy to find anything within 10 steps from the front door.Mark and the team so helpful and very friendly. We booked all the tours with them. The lady in the tour front desk so helpful with organising our tour, speacialy the helicopter ride with blue Hawaiian. Once again Thank you Mark and the team for making our Hawaiian holiday memorable.

I have been to Honululu on a few occasions. This is definitely the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in the island. The standard rooms do not have a view. The carpets are stained and smelly. The cleaners do not do an adequate job in cleaning. There were hair everywhere in the bathroom from previous attendants. The A/C makes gurgling noises that will keep you up! WiFi is free but don't rely on it because it is so slow it pretty much does not work. Don't ruin your vacation! Spend a little and upgrade to a better hotel.

We had checked the reviews prior and as we couldn't get into our first choice we thought this to be a reasonable place to stay. We were advised to get a room either on or higher than the 7th floor as there was traffic noise. Were we given the 7th floor and we still heard it - every morning at 5.30am the garbage truck collecting from next door would bang up and down for over 10 mins which became our alarm clock during the week there. The WiFi was a little suspect most of the time so thankfully we had a Starbucks three doors up and since I was up at 5.30am with nothing better to do I used to pop down and get a coffee and do my emails etc there. Having visited Wakiki many times before I would suggest there is far better accommodation than this in the adjoining area. Before I go I would like to say how wonderful the staff were and that they really tried hard to make our stay comfortable and were very professional and respectful to us at all times throughout our stay.

This is definitely a budget hotel -- nothing fancy and some distance from the beach. We had difficulty checking in due to some odd problem front desk was having with credit cards (card company assured us there was no issue at their end). This was a late check in due to our flight and we had to wait until after 9 am the next morning to get it straightened out. Always seemed like front desk was understaffed. The staff was friendly however and making an effort. The room set up made it impractical to open the curtains because the window was on the public outdoor hallway. All around, next time we would ante up the extra bucks for a nicer property.

Arrived from australia to a but of a disappointment! Our travel agent recommended this to is and many other people and I don't know why! We arrived early and were told thy had our room ready so we started to wind down all to have the lady come back and say no sorry it's dirty I can upgrade you! Beauty so we took it but got charged another $200+. The noise from the street was horrific, a fridge can truck pulled up out front every night without fail and stayed for a few hours and boy it was LOUD!! Every other morning the rubbish man came at 5am ish now we were on the 8th floor and it sounded like the rubbish man was coming in our room. Our toiletries never got replenished, our rubbish never got taken from our room, nothing was cleaned but our bed was made. I read on here ppl say they had to pay for wifi, I didn't! I connected up to the waikiki aqua pearl wifi and away I went!Will I stay here again, NOPE

I booked this hotel because it had a 3 star rating- lowest I'll go. Imagine my surprise when we got to the hotel and the front staff summarily told us that we had been moved to their "sister" property a couple of blocks away- the Hokele Suites. Well, I can't venture an opinion on this hotel but the Hokele Suites was a real dive and should be an embarrassment to the whole "family". I had booked and paid extra for a king bed, yet got a crummy double bed in a crappy hotel that resembled a minimum security prison. So beware, if you book at the Aqua, you may not even be allowed to stay there- and guess what- they charged me the same rate. Lovely.

We had the 2 bedroom suite with a kitchen and we were shocked upon arrival in the evening to find about 15 cockroach running about in the kitchen and washroom. One cockroach was found squished in the fridge. When we told reception they were in no way helpful or apologetic. We quickly booked another hotel not far called Aqua Waikiki wave and it was much better there. Don't waste your money on this poor hygiene and poor service of a filthy Mcnasty. When we wanted to checkout the next day, we were told we couldn't complete the checkout with the manager who they said would call us back. they never did call us and we even left a message and still no call back. We had to return the next day and wait till 9 a.m. To speak with the manager. Terrible place.

Great room for the price, quiet and a good safe location and very friendly front desk person. Nothing about the room is awesome or even 4 star except for the size, but it was great for the price. The only real problem was almost no parking. The do have a overflow parking agreement with something a block away and it's $5 cheaper than anywhere in town.All in all, if your not a snob stay here and save some money for a dinner.

If you want to stay in a conveniently situated, budget-ish hotel in Waikiki, this place is a very good bet. Decor/carpets tired/dingy but rooms are spacious and bed comfortable. The enthusiastic and efficient service of the front desk guys (and one gal I met) stood out to me. Rather than nickel-dime you like some hotels with a lower price tag might, these guys were the opposite of that, rounding down the days I owed parking fees. Paying for parking is just reality on Waikiki and the small lot behind the hotel is handy. If you arrive late, the lot may be full in which case they would direct you to park nearby instead, no big deal.I mention this only because orher reviewrs complain about it - keep the window closed and A/C on if your room is in the back and you're sensitive to trucks emptying dumpsters early in the morning - I heard them 1 day but just rolled over and went back to sleep.I would almost rate the place a 5 but (i) the carpets are too old/dirty and (ii) I am too cheap to celebrate a $300 bill (base rate of $107 plus parking, taxes, fees) for 2 nights.

So I went to stay here the night I got in to Honolulu. I was shocked at the hotel! The lobby was smelly, drab, and hot. We got our room keys after finiding out we had to pay $25 a day for parking, and that the lot we would be parking at was 2 or 3 blocks away. The bed was hard as a rock, the AC was awful, and you had to pay for wifi. Also, come to find out they did not offer any sort of breakfast ammenities other than coffee on top of the high price tag. You are basically paying for a crappy room, and thats it for a high price. Also, the walls and windows are paper thin, so my husband, who is a super light sleeper got about 4 hours of sleep total from all the noise coming from downtown and the bars, and also any vehicle that decided to rev up the engone a little down the road. Horrible, I would never recommend it.

Really good service. They offer towels to bring to the beach, ps3 and blu-rays of movies and games. Nice and polite staff that help us with everything like Mark. Easy to check in and out. They also keep our luggage for us in the last day we were not booked in the hotel while we went to the beach until we came back.

Let me start off by saying, this Hawaii trip was a budget trip. My sister and I went mainly to see my daughter, who is in the military.This hotel is on Kuhio Ave., which is very close to souvenir shops, drugstore, Starbucks, markets (which came in very handy for buying yogurt, milk, fruit, etc. for cheap breakfasts) and a short two block walk to Waikiki.We were on the 8th floor in a junior suite, which had a lanai, microwave, medium sized refrigerator and nice counter space. Bathroom was updated and clean. Sheets were clean. The only thing were the carpets, which could've been cleaner.This was not the hotel's fault, but the trash is colleced in Waikiki every day EARLY and there is construction right across the street. The higher up you can stay, the better for noise pollution. Parking spots are sometimes hard to find, but they have a deal w. a nearby big garage.Housekeeping was awesome - polite and generous.The front desk possessed true Aloha spirit - Mark, Tiki, Harry, Charity. Nothing was ever a problem for them! I stayed for 10 nights, so I felt like I was leaving my family when I checked-out. I would stay here again. Mahalo.

We stayed here for our first 2 nights in Hawaii after a long flight. Room was tidy enough yet quite dated and the air conditioning unit was quite loud. The most frustrating thing about our stay was our room key continously did not work which resulted in many trips to reception, where I was forced to wait for what seemed like 10 minutes each time due to other guests complaining about other matters and the incompetency of the front-desk staff. However, the gentleman who helped us check out (can't remember his name) was very friendly and helpful, due to him this place gets 3 stars from me instead of 2.

My sister and I searched for a hotel in Waikiki that wasn't asking for "an arm and a leg" ($$$) for just one night. We wanted a hotel that was decent and also affordable.The Aqua Waikiki Pearl was exactly that!! The hotel was easy to find, the the staff was extremely friendly and the rooms were decent! From the moment we arrived, RJ and Mark were very attentive and even upgraded our room.The one downfall of this hotel is that the parking is very limited (approximately 15 stalls). Overflow parking is located at the Waikiki Trade Center, which is about a block away...not too convenient if you have lots if luggage and a family. However, in our case it was just the two of us. We lucked out and were able to find parking in back each time.If you're looking for something affordable and clean, the Aqua Waikiki Pearl is the hotel for you.

I am very impress with the Hotel Staffs. They are extremely friendly. One of the front desk staff, Mark, he enjoyed and love his works very much. Mark enthusiasm and caring about hotel guess is a plus along with his cheerful personality make you want to stay at this hotel each time you in Hawaii. Furthermore, the room is clean, the beds are sizable and comfortable. The location is very near to all the shops and the beach. The Wi-fi is free compare to the previous Hotel I stayed, the rental fee for Wi-fi box is $7.00. I would recommend this Hotel to everyone! Reasonable price , free wi-fi and Aloha Hawaii!

Excellent staff, friendly, courteous, and the definition of the Aloha pirit. Great customer service. Parking not so ideal so try to get in as soon a you can or you'll need to park a block away. Hotel located in a great area. It's a great place for Kama'aina who need a stay-cay with reasonable price. I would definitely stay here again and refer friends and family.

Located behind the former International Marketplace, The Aqua Waikiki Pearl is an excellent choice most any type of traveler. The hotel is clean, the staff is fantastic: A special shout out to Harry. The rooms are clean and it is quiet,There is a $15 hospitality fee, which I wasn't too pleased with but that's the standard in Waikiki now. The hospitality fee covers beach towels, Wi-Fi access throughout the hotel, use of imac in the lobby, among other things. If you use the services covered under the fee it's worth it. It is clearly listed on the website and in booking through third party sites that the hospitality fee exists, so there are no surprises.I was allowed to secure a late checkout the day of departure (6 p.m.) by paying for the additional night. Of course, this is based on availability.The only glitch in my stay: The internet was not working well: very slow, difficulty staying connected. One conversation with the front desk produced a phone number for their ISP, Shakanet. The issue was resolved without even having to make the call. After my complaint, I went upstairs and the internet worked flawlessly the rest of the trip.There was an issue the last night of my stay. Some joker apparently pulled a fire alarm or was smoking in their room, which set the alarms off at 2 a.m. I thought there could have been more direction and this situation could have been handled a bit better. Hard Rock Café, Duke's, The shops on Duke's Lane (some of the old International Marketplace), Top Waikiki, Tony Roma's among many others all within walking distance. I've read several complaints about slow elevators, dirty bathrooms, noise. I saw none of this. It is true linens are changed every third night, again detailed in the information that is provided in your room.This hotel is also pet friendly. There was more than one guest who took their little dog on vacation so their furry friend could enjoy a good dose of the Aloha Spirit. Bottom line: This was a fantastic experience and I would stay here again.

It was an awesome experience staying in this hotel. Has a comfortable beds,good size room, a lot amenities and the warm welcome of the workers from maids to bellmen are excellent. Highly recommended to visitors that are looking for a hotel with few steps away from the main street of Waikiki shopping malls and beaches.

Stayed for 10 nights got in early after a night flight and they had our room ready early .Our air con wouldn't work very well and we were up graded to a bigger room Right near restaurants .Very friendly staff would stay here again.

This is a good budget option for staying in Honolulu. The rooms are a little "tired" but comfortable and clean and the hotel is just a short walk from the beach. The staff are great - warm, friendly and very helpful. We stayed one night at the start of our trip at the back of the hotel which was a bit noisy but the second time at the end of our trip we stayed in a suite at the front on a high floor and it was completely quiet.

Tim and Nichole at the front desk were very helpful when we registered. There was a discrepancy with what the reservation promised on the phone. The individual on the phone was asked directly if there would be any charges beyond the quote. The service said, "no". At registration an additional charge of $15 each day was imposed. This fee was ultimately waived by the manager. Rooms are old. Window air-conditioning units service the room sufficiently. Rooms have coffee makers and refrigerators. Off the beach by three blocks. No pool and parking is chancy and expensive, $25/day.

My wife and I decided to choose somewhere cheap and central as we only had a one night stop over in Honolulu so we decided on this place. It was very central and only about a 5-10 minute to the beach with plenty of restaurants (both fine dining and even take away) surrounding it. Only a block or so away was all the big brand retail players such as Louis Vuitton, Chanel, Cartier etc... but I guess if your staying somewhere cheap like here you'd only really be window shopping like we were. Anyway, as for the hotel, we received a free upgrade upon check-in which involved being on level 2 with a massive balcony that faced the street. We initially were quite chuffed and happy with the upgrade given the size of the room (it had two queen beds with one completely in another room, couch, kitchen, kitchen table etc... basically a two bedroom apartment with a huge bathroom). The was room way too large for just my wife and I but we didn't mind. We realised this was perhaps the noisiest room (room 202) as it was directly above the "Legends Bar" and you could also hear all the traffic running in the street and connecting busier street... the worse of the noise was the garbage truck that stumbled through at 4 am... If you're after a cheap, reasonably comfortable (however, don't stay in room 202 if you want a proper undisturbed sleep) and very well located place, you probably can't beat this place.

I'm Staying in this hotel at the moment and wish I was anywhere else. I Can't sleep for being bitten and it's possibly one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. It is noisy and there is a building site out side the window. We paid for a upgrade to have a balcony and what a waste of money that was you can't use it for the noise. The view out of the window is of a near derelict block and also out of the room door is another view of derelict block. If you have any other choice give this place a wide berth.

this hotel was really a pearl in the heart of Waikiki. it was so affordable and had so many great walkable places nearby--starbucks, a pharmacy, great gift shops and great restaurants (I highly recommend surf and turf tacos!). the staff was great-- mark, tiki, and harry. I wish I could remember other people's names that worked there, including the maids. the maids were so fast and very accommodating with our requests! my family and I were on the 8th floor and we had heard that the higher up you are, the better the noise level is. that is true, except because of the construction of the new international market, that caused a lot of early morning construction noise, so bring your ear plugs. but we couldn't hear voices from the hall, or people running in the halls. I hope the pearl remains affordable in the future. there are plenty of super-expensive places in Waikiki, but they need more places like the pearl that the average person can get a comfy and clean place with great staff.

The staff at this hotel were extremely helpful & friendly. the position of this hotel was excellent, in the centre of everything (only a few minutes walk to anywhere). A free shuttle van available to take you to anywhere you want (within the "city" area). We were also provided with towels & chairs for our beach trips. The room was excellent. staff excellent, position excellent. Would stay here again without hesitation.

Central with ready access to all activities in Waikiki. Room spacious and clean though a tad tired.On third floor front of building. Extremely noisy at 5am when rubbish Is trucked away. Good deal through Expedia and would stay again but only on a floor much higher up.Staff were always warm, welcoming and helpful. Dee went out of her way to assist resolution to my power adaptor frustrations. Top form Dee, many thanks.

The staff is very helpful, ask for Mark, he did a great job letting us know how to maneuver around in Wakiki. The room was well kept and clean. We didn't have a tv in the room with our beds but you are so just who has time for TV?! It's about 2 blocks from the beach but they will let u use their chairs and beach towels if u don't mind carrying them. Plenty of places to eat and shop close by, check out the small flea market on dukes lane.

The staff was very helpful and friendly. Other than that I was threatened with $350 room cleaning fee for smoking outside on upper deck. My room smelled like an old smoking room though we did not smoke there. No non smoking signs anywhere in room or hallways. Nothing written anywhere but on the contract you initial when you rent the room. My husband rented room so I did not know. If you want no smoking anywhere maybe invest in some signs and maybe placards in rooms like every other hotel. But the staff was very nice and did show No smoking policy when I asked.

After a 10 hour flight from Sydney, all I really wanted to do was check-in and get settled into the hotel room I booked for, but the room wasn't ready and they said that check-in time was at 3pm. I was allowed to leave my luggage behind the counter so I could go exploring without the baggage but at 9am after a 10 hour flight with little sleep, there's not really much that you want to do except grab a bite and knock out for a power nap. So I did just that in the lobby. I know it sounds strange, but I felt really safe and the staff even greeted me when I woke up!The hotel had lovely and warm welcoming staff, who were extremely helpful. I had chosen the room with the 2 beds and lanai (balcony) for 3 nights, which was very spacious. The bathroom was pretty big, however during my stay, I had a bathroom problem with the toilet (it was like it never flushed properly). After I mentioned this to the front desk staff, it was fixed quickly without question by the time I had returned back. There's a small kitchenette with microwave and the television was working. Location wise, the hotel is located two blocks away from Waikiki Beach and everything is within walking distance or close to transport.Overall, my stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl has been lovely and I would definitely recommend this to others! I can't wait to go back! Mahalo!

We have just returned home from a nine night stay. We found ALL the staff to be helpful and friendly. Our room was a Junior suite with Lanai on the second floor. Although there was street noise in the mornings with the rubbish trucks and the construction at the International market this is not the 'fault' of the hotel . When staying in a busy city you expect some noise and this did not detract from the stay.The location is perfect for the bars, beach, eateries etc. The front desk and four desk staff were excellent in arranging any transportation we required.The key card access after 10pm is excellent for security, the elevators are efficient.

I booked the 2 bedroom suite with kitchen (through their own website) and when checking in, I was given 2 separate rooms! We were given the 1 bedroom suite with kitchen and a junior suite with a lanai. The whole intent of us booking the larger room was to have everyone in one space together, but instead, we had to leave one room and go down the hall just to visit with the other people in our party. NOT WHAT I BOOKED! When I brought that to their attention, they didn't even try to make it right or find another option. The front desk was completely unhelpful, it was almost disrespectful! The only thing he kept saying to me was that we're getting another balcony...like that was going to make up for having two separate rooms? I think not. We couldn't even get into the smaller of the two rooms until 3 hours after check in because they shampooed the carpets and they were still damp. I had to go down to the front desk and demand the keys for that room. We had a party of 8 girls and needed that second bathroom to get ready. I asked to speak to the manager, but she wasn't there, so they told me to call back the next day, and when I did she never returned my call. Extremely disappointing!I don't even want to get into the uncleanliness of the rooms. The initial check in was reasonably clean, but that's where it ended. Housekeeping came through, but never changed the sheets, never gave new toilet paper, and never changed the towels. I had to chase them down just to grab the essentials that should've be done everyday. I even had to call the front desk just to get an ice bucket! The only positive thing about that hotel is it's proximity to everything. It's so centrally located, you can walk pretty much anywhere. I wish a spent the extra money to stay at another hotel, since we needed the larger room for the size of our party.

We didn't have reservations when we arrived in Hawaii and started searching for a place. We found a great rate here and decided to stay for a couple days. We were greeted with a warm welcome and were advised that our room wasn't ready, but we could leave our bags until it was ready. We changed clothes, were given beach towels and headed out. When we came back at 3pm, our room was ready and we were able to check in. We had upgraded the special we got for $12 a night and it was worth the upgrade. The room was spacious with two very comfortable beds and lots of floor space. There was a large flat screen tv and a little kitchenette area with micro and fridge and a good size balcony. It was on the 8th floor. The bathroom was updated and the water hot with good pressure. Every time we interacted with the staff we were greeted warmly and made to feel like family. They have beach towels and chairs you can use for free if you're staying here. I would definitely stay here again if staying in Honolulu.

Aqua has limited parking and a way to aleviate the stress of parking is that they require you to park larger vehicles (it specifically states SUVs and larger vehicles) at the trade center...well being that we drove a compact we thought we would have a better chance...not the case. We drove to park and there wer 9 SUVs and minivans parked there...plus there were several cars double parked and one was blocking an empty handicap space. Please enforce your own rules and do not dismiss someones complaint about enforcing your own rules...

This is the place to stay if you are budget conscious but value quality, service, friendliness, and location. Staff was very gracious and helpful, room was better than decent, and everything worked well. Complimentary daily newspaper was a big plus, and went well with free coffee. Mini-fridge worked very well, as did the microwave. Starbucks, a mini-mart, a dive shop, a juice bar, and a neighborhood store are adjacent the hotel, as is a small sports bar. Everything is within short walking distance, including the beach! Hotel offers free beach towels, too! Negatives are inferior wi-fi and on-site parking is nearly non-existent; a parking garage, though, is down the street a few minutes away, and you can also hope to grab an on-street parking slot that charges $1.25 an hour with two hour max until free parking after 6 pm and free on Sundays and holidays. We would definitely stay here again if we can't afford a super luxurious hotel.

This is probably the best value for the money Hotel you can get in this area. Clean, good localization, and relativity cheap. The only problem is the Internet connection that is the worst!!!! But there is a Starbucks a few meters away and you can easily go there:)Parking is on average for this area ($ 25)

I recommend this hotel to everyone. Me, my wife, and kids stayed in this hotel for a week. The house keepers were very nice always checked up on us to see if we needed more towels, toiletries, blankets. The front desk were very friendly. I would come back again and bring my family here again.

Really the only good thing I can say about staying at this place is the location. It was close to everything but the actual hotel experience was below average. We were on the 4th floor and the noise from street below sounded like it was right outside our window. The aircon was so noisy, it sounded like a tractor was in our room - if you we wanted to TV on with the aircon, the TV needed to be at full volume. Would not stay again.

We stayed at Aqua Waikiki Pearl after spending 2 weeks cruising the carribean. Although the service was good and the room clean and most stuff you would get in any hotel room ,the view opposite was atrocious . Every morning about 5.30 -6.00am we were woken to a loud car or truck heading off to work.Then a bit later about 6.15 the garbage truck would come and make ungodly loud noise ,clanging and bashing,manourvering with reversing beepers going off every 5 minutes .This lasted about 20 minutes.We asked to be moved but the reply was that we would be better off where we were.We were on the 4th floor.Our travel agent will get a copy of this as well.

Centrally located in the heart of Waikiki and affordable. Easy access to restaurants, beach and shopping. Every staff we encountered gave us friendly and accommodating service with special mention to Melba Famisan.
user_name:
Gloria R
Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: I love this hotel. It was conveniently located right in the middle of Kuhio Avenue. The rooms were very spacious and quiet. The free wifi was a big plus! Most importantly, all the staff who were on duty provided great customer service especially Ms. Dirk Temengil who was very pleasant, extremely helpful and always has a beautiful smile on her face. Thank you Ms. Dirk Temengil and all the staff for making my stay in your hotel a pleasant one! Will definitely come back!

The room was basic but was clean and well kept and the beds were very comfortable. The location was excellent, close to the beach and and many restaurants and shopping locations. Transportation was very accessible.The staff could not have been better, they were very friendly and helpful for our entire stay. For the price you would have a hard time finding anything better. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends.

We booked a king sized bed, non-smoking room, but when we checked in they were sold out. So lucky us, we got a free upgrade to a Junior suite with a balcony. The hotel is located on Nahua & Kuhio, in-between the old International Marketplace (which is currently being renovated) and the Ala Wai. It is not a beachfront hotel property, but it's only 2 blocks away from Waikiki Beach. It is conveniently located in the middle of Waikiki which is a plus, the minus is the close proximity to the major street Kuhio. So it is pretty loud and bustling at night. The hotel was renovated and definitely a lot cleaner than most older hotels in Waikiki. The hotel offers Free wifi and our suite came with a microwave, safe & mini fridge. The bed was very soft and comfortable and had nice clean, white sheets. The bathroom could have been a bit cleaner though. They also give you beach towels to borrow which is great so you don't have to bring your own. There are a lot of shopping and restaurants nearby, plus the public transportation bus runs on Kuhio.

Great location, good accommodations for the money…comfortable bed, very large room, good A/C, large balcony, good shower and terrific helpful, knowledgeable staff. Good choice for budget accommodation in Waikiki.

My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Aqua Waikiki Pearl. We got a great last minute deal and even better upon arrival Nicole upgraded us to a higher room with a partial view. The beach was less than 2 blocks away. Great local places to eat, a small marketplace to get goodies to take home, and ABC stores all around. Any place we wanted to go around Waikiki we could pretty much walk to. Also we downloaded Lyft for our first 10 rides free. If your looking for somewhere inexpensive, simplistic, and still has updated features this is your place! Aloha

West Jet booked us in a standard room instead of a suite what we paid for, since all rooms were taken, we end up with a small one for the night, the front desk was trying to easy my displease by promising a better room for us next day!With one bedroom that come full kitchen was provide next day at 11:00am,that was double size our original booking, the beds are very comfortable, room was learn and very roomy with balcony facing the street, I was happily accept this contract.Location: close to buses stop, there are many restaurants in the Surrounding, ABC stores almost in every comers of the street, which you can get snacks, sandwiches, and bottles H2O. Shopping Center is nearby …and 10 walk to the beach.Noise: From International Market tearing down and rebuilt to new high rise, from the Garbage truck in the morning, and from the Scuba diving school cross to the front of Hotel when they are transferring the O2 tanks. (These are not the hotel’s responsibility)Service: excellent from room to the front desk staffs, beaches supplies: chairs, towers, sandals. Sunglasses, to all guests as complementary. Internet was working well for our kids.During our stay , they had “buds spray “ but we refused this request, and I have seen some buds crawling around the kitchen, this is a tropical weather, we have to except . If you need a comfortable stay within budgets and use the cash for others execution (we did a Volcano tour cost $$$$ but worth). Come to stay at Aqua Pearl, their friendly hostility will be the key to bring us back!Stars rating : five stars service. Four stars for room. Three stars for hotel

Had a very pleasant stay at the Pearl. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the room was very spacious with nice, quiet air conditioning and a lovely bathroom.The hotel is very centrally located in Waikiki and is a very short walk to the beaches and many of the nicest restaurants and bars in town. Would definitely recommend this hotel to people travelling to Waikiki!!

We really enjoyed our 2 night stay here. The staff were very friendly & enabled us to check in early after a long flight. The hotel is in an excellent location - close to several restaurants & public transport. It's a short walk to Waikiki Beach. There is free wi-fi and a computer in the lobby if you don't have your own tablet or laptop. We stayed in a Junior Suite, which has a balcony. I think I'd just book a standard room next time as we didn't use our balcony at all. You really can't get a better value hotel in Waikiki.

Good service!! Thanks to charity. For sure will return for vacation with family.I will recommend this hotel for anyone who will come for business or just vacation. Free wi-fi, walking distance to shops, entertainment, and restaurants, and even grocery store. Friendly staffs.Convinient with laundry facility.Felt safe with security at night and main door locked at 10pm. I only wish there was swimming pool and recreation gym. Very close to starbucks.
user_name:
Rhacelyn
Koror Island, Palau, South Pacific

review_body: This hotel is in a very good location central to everything 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment which was excellent choice for 5 people the apartment was very clean and very spacious was serviced on a daily basisEven though this hotel is getting a bit dated it was still very comfortable The staff on the front desk were very helpful with all our needs For the price we paid I think we got very good value for moneyIf you ever you stay at this hotel try the Korean restaurant on the corner

Our flight was laying over for two nights in Hawaii for two days, so we picked a hotel that would be near the beach. I picked the wrong one. I booked a room for 4, and got a room with one bed. They said i booked it that way, but i checked my confirmation later and i was right. The room only had one small window that was half taken by a window air conditioner. They say they have on site parking, but they have enough for their staff and maybe 10 cars. They have an overflow at a parking garage 3 blocks away. It Would have been nice to know the truth. The room i got was a little bigger than a closet, and had uncomfortable beds. I asked 3 times for an extra pillow, and in two days it never showed up. They staff is friendly, but seems to only tell you what you want to hear so you will go away. If you are looking for a comfortable place to stay, keep looking. It's outdated, and not a convenient place to park if you come to the hotel after 3 pm. I guess you get what you pay for.

We stayed here recently and were very happy with our choice. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and spacious. The location was ideal, close to restaurants, shops, Waikiki Beach and public transport. Would definitely stay here again if we return to Honolulu.

Staff were very friendly,but rarely helpfu.l I had to ring three times-several hours apart, to get a maintenance person.Had to ask twice for a luggage trolley to be sent to room. It was not busy. Laundry was expensive and machines were not clean. Housekeeping did not replace tea/coffee etc - had to ask for more after the 2nd day. Noisey AC.

This was our second stay at the Pearl. It is the perfect kind of hotel to me - it was conveniently located, clean with comfortable beds and very nice and helpful staff at a really good price - great value. Personally we don't spend a lot of time in the hotel, and while I do like a nice fancy hotel, I'd rather spend my cash on experiences/activities, culture and food - so we generally stay in this type of hotel. There isn't a pool or hot tub, but I wanted the beach....Staff is excellent.

Great hotel, friendly staff, kudo's to Harry at the front desk, always cheerful and ready to say 'yes' to any requests and also the rest of the staff who were equally friendly and cheerful.Quiet little street noise, close to all amenities.

Mark is by far the best receptionist that I ever have met in a hotel. Kind and street savvy, he is the perfect person to welcome people to a new area. He knows the ins and outs of Waikiki and is always wiling to share them with you. He will do everything he can to make your stay as comfortable as possible.
user_name:
davidbU2317MO
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My family and 2 year old arrived after a 10 hour flight from Australia to the Waikiki pearl. We were really excited for our first time in hawaii but exhausted and were looking for someone where to freshen up,or relax ie our room. Unfortunately we arrived at 7am and the check in wasn't till 3pm! I was majorly pissed off because what was I supposed to do for 8hours with a 2 year old?? Anyway we had overlooked that on itinerary so I accept that. What I didn't like was the factory-like, not in the slightest empathetic response from "Harry" or "Henry" at reception. I don't think he could of given two hoots about our situation and casually waved his hand at the reception area and toilet area to wait for the next 8 hours. My dad was understandably upset as he was here to celebrate his birthday and didn't care to be spoken to like a backpacker.
