I was so distressed with the way Henry or Harry handled us I couldn't speak to him for the rest of our stay. All that aside, they manage to get us a one of our rooms out of three at 2pm which we were grateful for but I must say on level 7 the rooms were extremely mediocre and so were the amenities. They said they would call us when the other rooms became available...and they didn't. When we went down to find out the problem there were a bunch of other people suffering the same fate as us amongst other problems. This was not looking good. Apparently they had overbooked the hotel and as a result we did not get what we paid for which was one 2 bedroom suite and 1 bedroom suite with kitchenette. The best they could offer us after my dad had to come down and sort it out was the 1bedroom suite and two deluxe rooms. We relented as they were struggling and their was no point going on about and their was nothing we could do now. We were just becoming more and more devastated. To cut a disastrous and majorly long story short- the girls at the reception were extremely apologetic and helpful and tried to make best of the situation at hand. The rooms on level 4 & 7 were very budget and the hotel I believe is more like a two star- very very basic. It's ok in terms of location but I would just spend the extra and stay on kalakauka drive if you want to experience the real hawaii. We ended up checking out if the pearl and checked into the Aston beach towers.....so worth the extra money!!

Our room was comfortable and clean and large enough for two people. We asked for and we're supplied with a kettle to boil water for tea. The rooms have a coffee maker, fridge and microwave. A convenience store was located directly across the street for snacks etc. Airconditioning was good and kept the room cool. Hotel location was an easy walk to the beach (towels supplied at front desk). Five minute walk to the main shopping street and lots of restaurants close by. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Booked a couple of excursions with the concierge which was very handy.

A hotel with a good location with the rest of Waikiki. Close to the beach and the shopping centers. Nothing fancy in the room but it had everything we needed, including a water boiler and a micro.The staff was very friendly and we were able to leave our luggage in the reception when our flight was later in the day. We tok a shuttle/taxi to our hotel from the airport and it was very convenient and easy to get there.There was no pool like that in the hotel but because of its location to the beach we did not feel the need for it.

Nothing fancy in terms of décor or other amenities such as pool etc. but very clean and accessible. Friendly staff (particularly Harry on the front desk) made the stay enjoyable. Good location with food stores, eateries and beach all within walking distance and bus tour pickups very close by. Coin operated laundry, small fridge in room and free wifi make it good value for money for the level that it is.

The rooms were very basic and outdated, but clean. Which is all you can expect when on a budget.The location was great, Starbucks just a 5 meter walk on the corner which opens at 4.30am! Which was perfect as we were up at 5am most mornings preparing for our activities.The standout was the friendly staff who went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable and safe (they lock the reception doors from 10pm-early morning and have a security guard). They were also very knowledgable about the area and things to do and helped us get the most out of our Trip! Genuinely nice people who stopped and had a chat to us to get to know us and all about our holiday adventures! Dee, one of the reception staff was lovely, even at 4.45am when we had to check out!! Will stay here again for sure!

It is a nice, simple place to stay. It doesn't have as much as other hotels but it was good since most of the time we were out and about and only used the hotel to sleep. It was nice and close to everything, and the staff were all extremely helpful.

Me and my friend stayed here after it being recommended by flight centre. The first day we arrived, without even sleeping in the beds yet, the sheets were disgusting and stained, so we called reception for them to be changed. The new sheets still were gross but we decided to just put up with it as we were super tired from the flight. There was what looked like to be blood stains on the carpet. There was hair all around the shower and plug hole. There was mould on the shower head. Dust and hair all over the bathroom floor - clearly they do not vacuum the bathrooms. Later that night we found cockroaches in the bathroom. I advised my concerns and utter disgust in how filthy the room was and asked to be moved. Later that day we were moved to 910. The room was slighty a bit cleaner. However again the bathroom had hair on the floor. House keeping came at 8.30am!!! Had to tell them to come back as we were still sleeping. Who starts cleaning the rooms at 8.30am??? When check out is at mid-day?? My friend also got attacked by bed bugs on the last few nights of our stay, which must have been transferred via the sheets. When we advised reception of this the manager on that day was not concerned about it at all. The only two good things I can say about this place is about the one manager which was extremely helpful and always kind her name I think from memory was Chantelle? and the location, that it is close to places and good walking distance to get to the beach. Would not recommend this place to anyone. The only reason why we didn't move was due to limited funds left from our 3 week trip.

The rooms were a bit outdated but clean, the beds very comfortable, no outlook at all but made up with a great location with walking distance to Waikiki Beach, shops and restaurants. Really can't fault it.

This hotel is what it is, and I am thankful for that. It is a very fairly priced hotel, which is dated and dingy, but with all of the amenities that you need to enjoy a vacation at Waikiki: Refrigerator, microwave, beach towels, reasonably priced parking, and a great, central location. The staff were super-nice, and very accommodating. When we arrived, our room was 84 degrees, but the little-air-conditioner-that-barely-could got it down to the low 70's by the time we went to bed.This is not a romantic hotel, or a resort by any stretch of the imagination. It's a no-frills, cheap hotel in one of the most expensive beaches in the country. It serves a segment of the traveling/vacationing population, and if you are in that segment, enjoy!

The toilet was blocked, the lights didn't work in our room, the safe battery was dead so we couldn't put any valuables in it.. it was super NOISY so we had barely any sleep as it is right next to a busy street and bus stop. The defining moment is that they called our room phone at 12am on the first night we had arrived (very jet lagged) and when I answered they said they were testing the phones..who does that?!! and then one hour later and they called again at 1am!! Needless to say my husband disconnected the phone for the rest of the stay. We stayed here as it was chosen by our travel agent but we will never be staying here again. on our first night there we almost packed our bags and booked another hotel.. we first stayed at the Hawaiian Hilton Village and it's the best by far. The only thing stopping us was that we had limited funds as we had already booked the rest of our holiday and were not there many nights. There were many other Australians there who also said they were disappointed, my guess is that the travel agents in our country get a nice commission from them. The only positive was that the staff were friendly.

We stayed in a junior suite for our trip to hawaii after Flight Centre recommended this hotel. Walking into the room its dark and smells musty. There are stains on the carpet including one that looks very similar to blood. We had to call the front desk to get our sheets changed as there were stains all over them before we even used them. The shower had hair in the bottom and around the plug & the shower head is covered with shower gunk. I am severely unhappy about this room and hotel.

The room was very good and it felt like home. There was a full kitchen, 2 bedroom, and one master bedroom bathroom. The price was less than 100$, it was a special. Parking lot is in the front or garage for $26. We really enjoyed our stay. The ac worked great and rooms were clean. We didnt have time to go to the pool.

The hotel is "no frills" but was in a great spot with clean rooms and helpful staff. We got upgraded to a larger suite (way bigger than we needed) which certainly helped our experience. Nevertheless, we were there for 2 days and had a convenient walk to the beach, shopping and eating as well as convenient to the bus to diamondhead. Shuttle services picked us up to the airport and to Pearl Harbor so we really felt right in the middle of everything for a good price.

We stayed here for 9 nights as a family of 5 in a 1 bedroom apartment. We had lots of room in the apartment and also had a great sized balcony. It was neat and clean with good cooking facilities. Location was great, 2 blocks from the beach and within walking distance to great shops, restaurants and supermarket. The staff were very friendly and welcoming allowing us to store our luggage as we arrived before check-in time. Staff were also very knowledgable about places to eat in the area and activities. Beach towels were also provided each day. Harry was very friendly too.

We were travelling with a family group of 8 (6A + 2C), we booked our accommodation in September 2013 and requested to be on the 10th floor, which was confirmed by the email, only to find that we had to spend 1 night on the 8th floor in a similar room and then relocate to the 10th floor the next day...not impressed to say the least. The room on the 8th floor (room 814) was horrible, old and in need of lots of maintenance. Once we relocated to the 10th floor (room 1001), we were greatly surprised with the different standard of apartment, there was a major difference it was a lot more modern and had a better layout. When you are travelling with a large group you need space. The downside was that there was only 1 shower, but we had 2 toilets. The staff were very friendly and Charity was more than accommodating to our needs.

We went to Waikiki for 4 nights and the hotel was great. It is two blocks away from the main beach of waikiki and just steps away from famous restaurants and stores. The people is very nice and kind, every time we needed something they did it for us. They also have a tour desk and the girl is super kind, you tell her what you want to do and she finds the best tour for you and your budget.The hotel is very clean with a mini fridge, air conditioning and TV. For sure I will stay again here. They have beach towels and chairs for free, just ask the front desk. Thank you for everything. We really enjoy our stay in Hawaii.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and we enjoyed our stay there. We booked the junior suite and it was very clean and spacious. It had a microwave, coffee maker, fridge etc. The hotel is in a good location and it was easy to assess the beach and other parts of the area. Hotel staff were also friendly and ready to help at any time. We would stay here again.

The rooms were great, the air conditioner worked perfectly. They lend out the beach towels and chair at the lobby. However the birds start crying at around 5AM from the nearby TREE (a huge tree within the hotel's area) and my colleagues complained about the noise... but I had no problem!The location is great, located only 10 minutes slow-walk distance from the waikiki beach.

this hotel was clean, beds ( there were 2 queen beds) were comfy, room was very large with large sllding door on to balcony, refrigerator microwave Staff were all very friendly and helpful. close proximity to waikiki beach, not the top of the range but clean for a very good price, Would stay here again. Some glimpses of the ocean but manly looking out on to roof tops but we did not want to spend alot of time in the room.

I got this hotel for cheap, below $100 a night. The room was nice and renovated. But there were 2 things I really did not like. 1. Unless you have a suite, the only window in the room is in front of a common pathway, so people passing by, will see you in your room, unless you completely close the light. 2. Again, unless you have a suite the AC is a window AC and it is very very loud and it is difficult to sleep even with earplugs. I guess the high rating of this hotel mostly of people who stayed in suites.

My daughter and I were so disapointed by this hotel as it was our first time in Hawaii and we wanted to have a nice time to celebrate her graduation from school. It was close to the beach but it is an old tired building with a sports bar located at the entrance with many strange characters hanging around. The room was clean and the beds were quite comfortable but the room was basic and the TV channels very limited. The bathroom was basic but clean. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, rather pay a bit more and have a good experience. It is a basic bones hotel, no breakfast, no pool and nothing very nice about it.

Great little Hotel, walking distant to some shopping and the beach. It was always clean and provided much needed towels. Down side most of the time there was no spot to park in their parking area. We would have to park at a different location and walk to the hotel.

This Hotel is located in the centre very close to every thing, shopping, beach and entertainment. But due to its location in a smaller road its really quiet, especially compared to the Aqua Waikiki Wave which is half block away on the main road and next to a really big construction site.The personal is really nice and helpful at anytime (24 hours Service). Internet is for free and functioning well and I have seen the first time a psd box in a Hotel Room. Of course laundry and drink machines are available, a small super market is cross the street and downstairs in the same building you find a sports bar.Best place up to now in Honolulu, but I guess the airport hotel does not really count.

We were appalled at this hotel. We arrived on May 25th and checked out May 30th. On arrival already paying for a 3 bedroom suite, reception told us they had sold out so the family was split up. They could only offer us a 1 bedroom and a separate 2 bedroom. This is not okay. We booked this accommodation 6 months ago and paid up front for a 3 bedroom suite. We didn't want 2 separate rooms otherwise we would have booked it like this. if you can see someone has it booked for those dates and paid, I don't know why this was double booked??? The rooms were filthy, carpets hadn't been cleaned and the bath on arrival was full of hair. I went to reception to ask if someone can please give it a big clean as it was disgusting. When we came back to our hotel later that day, we still had sticky stuff on the tiles and the bathroom was still dirty. House keeping never changed our bin even though it was overflowing so we had to make it more obvious and put it in the middle of the kitchen so we knew it would be changed. The suites come with a full kitchen however there were no clothes or detergent to do washing up. Very disappointing hotel and wouldn't stay there again.

My husband and I had the opportunity to stay at the Waikiki Pearl on our recent holiday to Hawaii. Although The Pearl is a little over a block from the beach, we found the location great as it was central to everything and a little out of the hustle and bustle of busy Waikiki beach. We stayed in a Junior suite which was really spacious and the room was spotless and very comfortable. There is a little road noise at night but as we were on the 8th floor it wasn't enough to worry us or stop us from getting a good night sleep. The staff were amazing. All so friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. The concierge, Jasmine helped us with all our bookings for excursions and we can't thank her enough. Everyone went out of their way to make sure our stay was as comfortable and enjoyable as it possibly could be. A special mention to Mark and Dee, two of the nicest people we have ever met. We can't praise them enough for their professionalism and for making us feel so welcome. Their knowledge of the local area was outstanding. While this hotel is not as fancy as others in the area, we found all the amenities and facilities of a very high standard. If you have a budget and don't want to pay for too many fancy extras, this is the hotel to stay at. The hotel was great and the staff were outstanding.Once again, a big thank you to Mark and Dee... you are both fabulous :0)

After a long sleepless flight it was a bit disappointing that there wasn't the option to check in before 3pm. But I used the restroom to change and stored my luggage for the day which was helpful. After spending the day exploring I came back and checked in. My room was lovely. I had taken an upgrade option on the website so for an extra $3 I was in a spacious King sized room. Very nice indeed!I would like to thank the staff for making my stay enjoyable especially Dee who was extremely helpful and friendly.

Spent a night here as flight landed late in the evening and we did not want to drive to the other side of Oahu at that time of night. Room itself was exactly as we would have expected for the price - clean, spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was slightly old but still clean and fitted our needs perfectly. Hotel also provide beach towels and chairs if needed - we did not use this but would be useful if staying for more than a night.Our main problem with the hotel was the noise - our room was on the 2nd floor and neither of us were able to sleep for more than a couple of hours due to constant noise of cars and what sounded like a massive generator directly outside our window. Our main reason for staying was to get rest so we could make the most of the next day in Oahu and we didn't achieve that. Maybe it is quieter on a higher floor but I wouldn't recommend the 2nd floor.

My extended family and I spent 9 nights here in April. The biggest factor in choosing this hotel was the price; it is significantly cheaper for a large group than many other hotels in the area. We knew it was a huge risk going for the cheap option, but we were very happy with the value we got for our money. It was 7 of us in a 3-bedroom suite; our room was very clean and comfortable, everything in the room worked as it was supposed to, and the staff was always friendly and helpful. The hotel isn't first-class luxury, but that's not what we were looking for in staying here.The only issues we had were trivial. The wi-fi was sometimes spotty during the day (presumably when more people were using it), but who goes to Hawaii to sit in their hotel room browsing the internet? At night it was much faster. Also, sitting on the balcony there was a lot of noise from the street, but none of our bedrooms faced the road so it wasn't noticeable while sleeping (at least, not from the 8th floor).What I would not recommend though, is staying here with a car. The parking lot is very small and was full most nights, which probably means there are many people who had to look for spaces elsewhere. However, in my opinion, if you're a tourist staying in the Waikiki area you don't need to rent a car except maybe for a day-trip of the island; bus stops for public transit and tour buses are all within a block, and they will take you anywhere you want to go. Just about everything we needed during our stay, including the beach (who needs a pool?), was less than a 5-minute walk away, and we were easily able to make ourselves at home.In summary, we had an entirely positive experience here, and would definitely recommend it to groups who don't need a lot of bells and whistles in a hotel room, and especially for people who don't want to break the bank on accommodations. We will be back.

stayed first week of may , not crowded , stayed in two bedroom plenty of room , parking can be a pain if you get back late have to park across street in public lot, nice rooms front desk helpful, would stay again

A pearl indeed! Booked a junior suite for my family of four and a 7-day vacation. Check-in was efficient; the specifics--ice and vending at the 7th floor, laundry station on the 4th, cards that you exchange for free beach towels and vice versa, hotel entrance close by 10 p.m. (room key gains access), complimentary coffee, water and apples in the lobby, and free wi-fi (no password needed). Room was spacious and clean, well-kept actually considering the number of visitors here. Cable TV even had a Filipino channel so we were up-to-date with current events. A/C easily controlled by remote. Ref and microwave come in handy. Balcony even has a blower to dry your swimwear really fast! My family slept so soundly we needed a daily alarm to get us going. And now, the location. Starbucks, Subway and Chili's just a few steps away. Food Pantry for groceries, a pharmacy, an ABC store just around the corner. Histeaks inside Food Pantry offers quick hot meals, our constant source of rice and newly cooked eggs. No wonder the hotel does not have a restaurant, none needed. Ross and the Hawaiian Royal mall (Macy's, H&M, Cheesecake Factory) as well as the "night market" just a couple of blocks away. Bus, shuttle and trolley stops within a minute, Waikiki beach within ten and the zoo and aquarium within twenty. Your hotel card gives free entrance to kids and discount to adults in the aquarium. Posted in the hotel elevators are daily weather forecasts and free activities and shows very helpful to tourists. At the lobby is a tour desk that can arrange practically anything from helicopter and submarine tours to shows. We watched The Magic of Polynesia with acclaimed illusionist John Hirokawa and enjoyed it immensely. We also tried the Waikele premium outlet (round trip pick-up by shuttle is 15 dollars) and found the store selection quite limited; there is a K Mart and a Lowe's as a consolation. Finally, must make mention of the hotel staff who were always helpful, polite and hospitable. Dee and Mark were the best. When traveling you really never know what to expect but when you discover a pearl it will always remain in your memory. Forever.

Stayed here one night. We upgraded to a king suite, The room was very large and clean with a lanai overlooking the street. The bed was hard which is what we prefer. Nothing fancy about the place just a basic clean room. The desk clerks were all very welcoming.Our friends had a regular King room and when we went opened the door the room was very dark and smelled. They immediately went back to the check in and asked for another room. They had no other King upgrade other than a 2 bedroom suite. They choose this room as it was well lit and didn't smell. They however had to pay an extra $50? for the room upgrade. We only spent one night which was ok but I would not stay here for more than a day or two. They have beach chairs and towels at the front desk free of charge. That was a nice touch to have beach chairs. All in all it's ok but nothing special.

I've been a regular guest at this hotel for more than five years, the rates have increased, perhaps to cover the renovation costs. I do like the renovated rooms. They appear to be cleaner, especially the bathrooms. The counter and sink are very new, clean and simple surfaces, a nice touch. My overall impression is extremely positive, I do alert you, see below, on the noisy pub next door.

Our first time to this island and we were very pleased with our accommodations. Clean, comfortable, great staff, fresh apples, coffee and ice water in the lobby along with the daily newspaper. The location was great for walking and taking local transportation. A very short walk to the beach. The bathroom had a roomy tub and shower with quality towels, beach towels were available at the front desk. All at a great price. We will definitely be return visitors.

4th time I stayed at this hotel and still haven't disappointed me. Ohana staff speedy response when it comes down to needing towels or house keeping. Great location from the beach just a 5 min walk your minutes away from all the site seeing. Will recommend to others

i spwnt here 1 week and i was really happy of my choice. The price is really convenient for the room, for the location and for service. It's not so far from waikiki beach but you can reach 10 minutes walking. Good place!!

Let's be honest, you don't come to Honolulu to spend a great deal of time in your room. My only criticism of this hotel is that when we arrived after a long flight the lifts weren't working, so we had to schlep our bags up to the 5th floor. This was totally our choice, the person on the desk asked if we wanted someone to bring the bags up once the lifts were operational. The room had a microwave and a fridge. It is located a short walk from a "Food Pantry" store so we ate breakfast and dinner on the balcony of our room. The only noise we heard was the garbage men in the early a.m. Harry and all the front desk staff were always most helpful and friendly. The coffee machine was great for a start to the day and there was coffee in the mornings in the lobby to sip while you waited for your cab/bus tour to pick you up. The Aqua Pearl is a clean, safe place to stay.

This is a basic budget hotel located in the heart of the Waikiki tourist area. Rooms are fairly simply decorated with pretty straightforward furniture. The bed and bedding are clean, but only average comfort level. The room windows face a common outside walkway, and so you will hear noises from people as they walk by. The lower rooms have almost no view (see photo), while the upper rooms face to other hotels. The bathrooms are equally basic. The bathtub in the first room that I was in was less than clean (see photo), while my second room was a little bit better. Note that there is a bar located on the ground floor of this property, so if you are on the lower floors you will hear it (especially on the weekends). Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The location is convenient to the entire Waikiki tourist area. A bus stop is very close (at corner of Nahua Street and Kuhio Avenue), which is also helpful for getting around. Look online for deals and good prices on room rates.Pros: convenient location and close bus stopCons: average room, average bed

Great value, great staff. Front desk is very helpful and nice. The location in my opinion is perfect at least for what I was looking for, a couple of blocks from the beach and plenty of stores around.
user_name:
Flyingcav
New York City, New York

review_body: I enjoyed my stay at the aqua waikiki pearl. the hotel is conveniently located close to the beach and shopping area. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The staff are friendly and accommodating, I would definitely stay here again because of the staff and clean spacious rooms, I truly loved it. The reason I rated it an average is because of the lack of amenities at the hotel (no pool, no restaurant, and no lounge area). The street level noise is very loud, especially in the morning because of the construction happening across the street. However, overall it was a pleasant experience and a good price for the stay........  FYI we ate at the makino makitti buffet restaurant close by , I DO NOT recommend eating there, the food was beyond horrible.. do not believe the advertising of rated no#1...

My place away from home. Loved everything about it, great location, friendly staff & spacious clean rooms. Definitely my home away from home when visiting Hawaii. Thanks everyone for making our stay comfortable & enjoyable, we love you all & looking forward to seeing everyone again Soon! keep up the good work guys.

While enroute to Sydney. Australia, we stated 2 nights with the Aqua Waikiki Pearl, and this is a well kept secret!The hotel property itself is about 1/2 mile from Waikiki beach. We walked 2 blocks to the Sheraton, through their breezeway, looked at the beach, and had a coffee. The Aqua Pearl does NOT have a restaurant. HOWEVER, there is a GREAT breakfast at a diner about 1/2 block away. It was a FULL breakfast (fixed meal:2 eggs, bacon, and toast with coffee), but was great. The second morning (due to jet lag) we awoke at 5 a.m. and ate at an IHOP about 4 blocks away. Perfectly safe. We had dinner in the Holiday Inn's restaurant. Again, a walk of less than 1/2 block.So location for the Aqua Pearl is great. What is the best secret is that the rooms are HUGE. There was a microwave and small refrigerator. We could have cooked our own meals and there is a grocery store just around the corner. We met a guy who said that he lives in the hotel for about 5 or 6 weeks each year, and cooks his meals in his room.So you could stay on the beach and pay a lot of $$$ or stay at the Pearl and save that money.The staff for the hotel could not do enough for us. The check in clerk was great and whenever we needed help, we got it. I had problems printing my Qantas boarding pass, and the desk clerk literally spent about 30 minutes helping us out and printing our pass.This is a wonderful hotel to save money. If you want all of the amenities of the Hilton or Sheraton, you may not enjoy this hotel. If you expect to walk and shop in Honolulu, spending only a little time in your room, THIS is the hotel.

We was in Hawaii in March 2014 stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl, and I must everything was great with our stay from when we arrived for check in to the time we checked out. Room service was great, smiling faces and cheerful attitudes that made it more memorable for my family. The room we stayed in was wonderful and big my kids enjoyed that they had space to lay around and be kids when we were not out. Room was nice and clean when we checked in. Front desk clercks were helpful and great. The hotel is surrounded by many shops, resturants all in walking distance. Thanks to the manager Miss Silofa for making us feel welcomed with the aloha spirit becasue Hawaii was not our home.

Customer service is great and very accommodating to the needs of the customers. Perfect location and only steps away from the gorgeous beach of Waikiki, restaurants, and of course all the bars for a few cocktails:) Rooms were clean, spacious, and reasonable. We will definitely return to Waikiki Pearl for more stays.Luise

Our weekend stay was the best. The service and workers had a lot of aloha. The kids had a blast.Our room was big. Enough room for all.The location is good kind of in the middle. Starbucks on the corner. Foodland a block away. Dee was the best.we plan to return soon.Manuel Pajela

Everything was great with our stay from check-in until check-out. Service was excellent, every time we called for extra towels & blankets or pillows, it was brought up right away. Rooms we're clean when we checked in and and the location is perfect. It's walking distance to restaurants and shopping areas. The staff were very friendly and always assisted in our needs.

Very central and close to Waikiki Beach (unfortunately no see view), big room and a fascinating view from the balkony (from the 9th floor). Very friendly receptionists and securities. Bars, Beach, Shops, all you need very close to the Hotel. If you be lucky, you will get a parking lot behind the Hotel. Special Thanks to Harry, the very lovely and friendly receptionist who checked us out. We stayed there from 09/12 until 09/17/2013.

We always stay here given central location in Waikiki-no water views but only a block away. We stayed on the 4th floor on our first 2 day visit -room well appointed, clean & comfortable. After a 7 day cruise on Pride Of America. we spent a further 2 nights on the 10th floor in a kitchenette unit with separate bedroom. One factor worth considering is if you arrive tired after an early morning flight be prepared to wait up to 3pm for room availability. No real flexibility by the hotel in this matter. Complimentary coffee in the lobby each morning for 2 hours. Previously pastries were also provided but no longer.The Bus-Honolulu's bus network is cheap ($2.50 no change given with return free transfer) & efficient & bus stop is very close to hotel. Sports bar next door showing on cable TV's (scattered throughout the bar)all main international sporting events including Aussie N.R.L & A.F.L codes. One significant past attraction with this hotel was its very close proximity to the world famous tourist attraction - International Market where Elvis even appeared there in 1974 for a few film scenes there for the movie Blue Hawaii. The market unbelievably was totally demolished in October 2013 for a high rise development scheduled to open 2015.What a crazy decision by those involved. We were told the market's traders were given only 3 weeks notice to vacate. Accordingly hotel's location no longer has the same appeal for us without the market as other nearby tourist attractions are very limited & of little interest. It's time for us on any future visits to Honolulu to find a convenient & different location in Waikiki that offers more nearby attractions to see & visit.

I went to Honolulu with my friend. The first night we were sent to a updated room. It was fine. From the 2nd to the 7th night we were arranged to such a small room near a big tree. The were many birds on the tree making quite loud noise daily around 6-7 am, you can not sleep well at all. The cleaning is fine. But the coffee machine is quite old and dirty marks and stains all over. I broke the pot of the coffee machine by accident, and called reception immediately, asked how much I have to pay for the pot. A few minutes later, was told I have to pay US 40 for the quite old, made in China glass coffee pot. I wanted to talk to the manager, the male receptionist always said the manager is on the phone. I asked for the purchase list when they bought the coffee machine. Quite a long time later I was given a list for a much newer style, different style and much moderner at all. Actually I checked the price from the internet for the same style that I used, it was only USD9.99, of course that the hotel maybe did not get the one from the place I checked. But the pot with the machine is out of age should be disposed already, after talked with the finally showing up manager, she charged me USD 20, do I satisfied with this hotel? Of coursed not! Anything to be paid must be reasonable, do not think you could ask for everything because I am a foreigner.

Harry at the front desk was great. The rest of the staff was very nice and helpful. The location was awesome. Get a great breakfast for $4 just a block and a half away. The beach just a ten minute walk. Great place for the price! !

I don't know if they can adjust the doors, but you can feel them shut really hard when they close as they vibrate the bed headboard....especally when it's 3 in the morning and the noise will wake you! There's construction down the road during the day, so that was making noise earlier this month, hopefully it's quieted down as it's suppose to last a couple of years I read.Otherwise, the rooms were very clean and large with coffee makers, microwave and larger than some hotel's refrigerators.Location great: Waikiki Beach just down the street, ABC stores (most everything there) on every corner along with lots of restaurants, bus/trolley stops just down the street. The Pantry grocery store is also close by with food and items at a good price. No gym or pool (but who needs it with the ocean near by?)

In the heart of Waikiki beach, clean rooms, decent rates, however no amenities such as pool, gym, business center, restaurant, etc. We stayed in room 311 and had to keep window shades closed at all times because hallway faces the windows. No natural light if you want privacy.
user_name:
worldcitizengirl
New York City, New York

review_body: Value for your money. Clean, comfortable, spacious junior suite and super friendly and helpful staff that will make or break your vacation. A special shout out to Robbie. Thank you for your selection of the room and arranging at the last minute room upgrade. The room was perfect and the all the staff were friendly. Thank you so much.

Found this hotel that is close to the beach and a reasonable price. It was comfortable and near many restaurants and nightlife. Watch out for booking with bookings.com when we got there it was sold out so we had to get the suit but it was not much more in price. Call the hotel to verify room availability

Iv been to Hawaii twice now and iv always stayed in the same hotel the staff are very friendly, rooms are cleaned im definetly going back to visit and will stay here again good pricing as well :) i highly recommend it!

Great hotel in the centre of Waikiki. Dont be fooled by the external appearance, which is a little dated. Rooms are very generous in size, with balconies, staff are fabulous & helpful, and you are 1 street off the main shopping area. Lots of eateries within a short walking distance, and local bus stop in on the corner, approximately 100 metres away.

Friendly Staff, specially Dee ( she's awesome) , room clean, hotel laundry open 24/7, perfect location, good price - nothing negative about it! I would highly recommended ! :) Best regards Marta from California !

We just got back from a last-minute trip to Honolulu, and because we didn't have time to look for hotels, we settled for whatever was reasonable and available for the days we were there. While the hotel itself is quite old, renovations to the rooms made them quite comfortable. I was surprised at how spacious the room was, and the fact that it came equipped with a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker made for stress-free mornings. The balcony was quite large as well, and offered a pretty good view of the city. The location was very convenient -- very close to the beach, restaurants, shopping. Having the Food Pantry close by let us pack healthier food options to the beach. We especially felt at-home because of the hotel staff -- always very friendly and accommodating. Special shout out to Dee for helping us with restaurants and directions and bus routes. She made us feel like family. The only complaint I have is that as the International Marketplace was being torn down, and the trucks and heavy equipment would start working early in the mornings. The sliding doors didn't do a good job blocking the noise out.

I have stayed in Waikiki many times usually at the Marriott or the Hyatt. As this was a last minute getaway at spring break I was having a difficult time finding a room that was affordable and available for the entire week of my stay. I selected it from the secret hotel deals. When the shuttle driver turned down the street i knew that i was probably going to look elsewhere. However it was late and raining heavily and I was exhausted. The front desk clerk was friendly and the lobby was bright and inviting. my room was large with a full balcony microwave coffee maker and mini fridge. But that is it for ameneties, there is no pool or shops however, the hotel is clean and the staff was very helpful and quick to address my questions and even arranged a tour for me. What the hotel lacks in extras it makes up for in service and location. Because it is located on a side street the view from my room on the 8th floor was mostly old rooftops and trashcans but the location was convienent, a block and a half from the beach, a few blocks to shopping with a Starbucks 2 doors down and Legends sports bar on property. I was concerned about noise but while i could hear music from the ground floor, my room was very quiet even with the lanai doors open. There is also a convienence store and scuba shop directly accross the street and a full grocery right around the corner and lots of fast food restaurants to choose from. While the street that the hotel is located on (Nahua) is basically quiet in the evening there is construction on the corner as they are building a mall and it starts early in the morning with the noise and lasts until about 6 pm. I was out of the room most of the day so it was no bother. , if you want night life it is easilly accessable just around the corner. The Makititi offers a full international buffet with a polynesian show for 19.99 the show was pretty basic but the seafood buffet was excellent with all kinds of fresh choices. close to the Zoo, Aquarium, and about 30 minute hike to Diamond Head For the price I went twice during the week i stayed. Clean Basic Great Staff Good location, .....I would stay again for the price.

Clean, comfortable room and bed, friendly helpful staff. Very spacious bathrooms in each room I've stayed in. Refrigerator and microwave big bonus for us thrifty Island visitors. Second stay at this hotel was as good as the first.

Desk clerk Harry on Day shift made this a very nice experience.The hotel is older and the interior is not the best and not the worst,,but the customer service from Harry and his Day crew were were outstanding. They deserve an A+ in their rapport with customers.Always friendly and ready to assist in questions or problems.The customer service outweighed the fragility of the hotel.Housekeeping was just as outstanding and cooperative.Booking this hotel was a last minute deal for us and we were not sure,but it turned out great.A special "Thanks to Harry and the hospitality.of his shift."

Staff were friendly. Rooms were clean, a little small but the price was great. The self service laundry room was nice to have too. Wifi speed was excellent. Some hotels i've been too have very slow internet or bad signals but the access point is in each room so speed and signal is excellent. Thanks for a great trip :-)

Basically, this is a standard Waikiki hotel. The rooms are not too spacious, not too modern, and not too fancy equipped. You get a reasonable room at a reasonable price.What makes the hotel outstanding, however, is its staff. We only stayed here for one night on a stopover in Honolulu, yet I still remember the name of three employees (Dee, Nicole and Sai) due to their commitment. The staff members were not only charming but helpful in any possible way. You would probably not normally expect this level of hospitality, even not from a much more expensive hotel.In our view, this distinguishes the hotel and we clearly recommend it.By the way, the hotel is not directly at the waterfront. As long as you are not a lazy walker, its location is convenient. You reach most of Waikiki’s touristically interesting spots in just a few minutes’ walk!

We stayed at the Pearl for the weekend. The rooms were spacious which is what I expected from the website, but what I didn't expect was the excelent outstanding customer service. The front desk staff was awesome! They made you feel welcome the moment they greeted you at the front desk and they never forgot us through out our stay! Great location in the heart of Waikiki, walking distance to the beach, clean and spacious rooms but it would not be the main reason for my return to this hotel. The customer service is what will bring us back!

I recommend this hotel to everyone... Great location,,, great staff frOm the fRont desk to the housekeeper... Price is reasonable... I would like to thanks to the housekeeper who cleaned our rooms ROWENA, ELIZA, and PEDRO, they were so friendly and approachable:)

Stayed in this hotel for two days and two nights.Their room have great quality, and very much cleaned.I would prefer friends and family about this hotel. The house cleaner Rowena, Eliza and Pedro are good workers and very friendly workers. I can't really say anything bad about the workers in aqua.

Stayed at this hotel for one night and had to move. If we didnt have a late check in we wouldn't have even stayed one night. The hotel is grossly dirty, the room has stained everything, floors , walls , duvet, worn out stained bath tub. The neighborhood is scary at night my wife and I felt we had to hide our wedding bands when we went out for a late night snack due to our 11pm check in. The neighbour hood is littered with young drunk kids and vagrants. In fact when we checked in the kid at the front desk bragged about a bar fight we just missed at the bar that is attached to the hotel. The street noise we could hear when we were in our room was outrageous. Transport and garbage trucks start traveling around the hotel at 5:30 - 6am and the noise is unbelievable, when laying in bed it sounds like there is a truck idling and honking its horn right beside your head. It was so loud we couldn't sleep. We paid for an upgraded room, I only wonder what a standard room is like. This hotel comparable to a poorly maintained hostel.It is so dirty I was worried about the chance of contracting bugs and am in the process of thoroughly checking my luggage and all its contents.I travel alot , for buisness and pleasure. I spend around 70 to 90 days a year in "economy" hotels all accross the U.S and Canada and this is right up there with being one of of the worst I have ever encountered.

If you're after a 3 bedroom place, ask for room 1001. It was recently renovated and is much better than the other rooms. 10 mins walk thru waikiki to the main beach, good service, close to food/shops.

If it wasn't for the excellent staff, I could have missed my flight. But they're concern for the welfare of their guests is legitimate. And this is what sets them above the fare in Waikiki. The location is good and the room sizes are exceptional compared to other hotels in the area. But if nothing else, go for the service. You'll be glad you did.

Nothing overly fancy about this hotel, but the staff were absolutely exceptional in every way. Always in great spirits, very knowledgeable about the area and never hesitated to print out bus routes when we inquired about various destinations. Great value for the money!

This isn't a fancy hotel by any means. It is sort of tucked into a street, and there is limited parking. However, the customer service is top notch. They held our luggage for us before we could check in without a cost. Check-in was easy. They gave us a free roll-away without charge. If I went back to Oahu, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

With so many hotels located in Waikiki, it was not easy to find one that could be both good and not expensive. But in the end, after comparing many reviews, we made up our minds to stay at this place and this was definitely a good choice. We really liked its location in a side street of Kuhio Ave. but still within walking distance of Waikiki Beach. This makes the place to be quiet enough but also to be close enough to all the action, shops, restaurants and so on.In case you don't hire a car when you arrive at Honolulu airport, an easy and cheap way to get to this hotel is by public buses 19 or 20 (they allowed us to board them with our luggage :-)). It is true that the ride takes an hour and fifteen minutes (or maybe a little bit more) but it just costs 2,5$ (you must have the exact amount when boarding the bus because no change is given if you only have bigger bills). These two buses have a stop in Kuhio Ave. just before Nahua St, where the hotel is, so you only have to walk a couple of minutes to get there from this bus stop.The staff that welcomed us was very friendly, helpful and cheerful, so it looks like they have fun doing their job. Good for them! By the way, it is here, in front of the front desk where they have an Apple computer for guests who do not travel with laptops or other devices. We always appreciate that (we also appreciated the self-laundry they have). The only thing that we could not enjoy was a complimentary breakfast because this hotel doesn't offer it. They do neither offer a swimming pool but well..., who does want a swimming pool when Waikiki Beach is just ten minutes away? Conversely what they do offer are big, comfortable, clean and well equipped rooms (at least our was very big and fully equipped with refrigerator, microwave, tea/coffee facilities and a good and not loud air-conditioning). Our room had also a spacious balcony over Nahua St. which was not noisy at all. These are then the reasons why we are very pleased with our choice and there's no doubt that we would stay here again.

Booked this hotel online after reading 3 star reviews in October of 2013. We arrived in Oahu (2/11/14) 5 days before our reservation here at the pearl and dropped by on the 13th to see what the room would look like. The man at the counter said I couldn't look at the 3 bedroom suite because it was occupied, I asked to see any room and he said I couldn't which I thought was odd but I confirmed our reservation for the 16 th. When our family arrived, they said they no longer had the room I reserved and paid for because they had overbooked. They said they would check other sister properties but supposedly none were available so we were stuck in two rooms down the hall from each other. The room (which it says was recently renovated) was not what I expected for the price. The carpets are stained, the sliding door won't open without extreme pushing, lamps don't work in bedroom, two burner stove wrapped in aluminum, noisy all night! (4 am and still loud downstairs) no blankets,except one thin one on bed, barely any seating in living room and what is there is old style. There is only room for a few cars and it is $25 day. (Which I have to add they comped for the mix-up) and there is a charge for cribs (which they also comped) Normally, I would say it's no big deal but they charge a lot of money (even through hotels.com it's over $380 a night) for what you are receiving. The only bright light is that the staff are very friendly and apologetic and why I didn't insist on moving us somewhere else but I think buyer beware if you are a family with kids that won't sleep through the noises from thin walls.

Aqua Pearl's friendly staff was always at the ready with a smile, greeting, and helpful tips! We stayed for 3 days and the room was clean and fresh! Towels and linens were fresh, beds comfortable, and bathrooms were tidy! The hot water and shower was perfect! This hotel is about 2 blocks from beach in the heart of Waikiki. Close to all the shops, restaurants, ABC stores, small pharmacy, and a food mart around the corner. The sports bar had nice TV's and all the games posted. The bar was clean, nice local people hang out after work for a beer or cocktails, that mixed and mingled with hotel guests. Many Draft pint specials and The Best $3.50 All Day/Night... Mai Tai! Was a great place to wind down at the end of the night! I particularly want to thank Robbie and Nicole - Very helpful, courteous and greeted everyone with a smile. Thank you guys! Keys to success try to check in early! That way if you find a problem with your room - possibly they can fix it or put you in another room. My room was ready at noon on the 8th floor, was very quiet, and comfortable! Didn't stay there for the view!
user_name:
Greg L
Rapid City, South Dakota

review_body: So this is no five star hotel or anything like that but it is a great place to stay and reasonably priced and right in Waikiki. The hotel rooms are not fancy, they are very clean though. The suites are huge with a nice sized refer, microwave and a small coffee maker and a lanai (or deck for you mainland folks) Starbucks is right in the corner too! Just remember to book a suite for all this stuff. The regular rooms are smaller and no lanai. We have stayed twice and both times the room has been super clean. Parking is limited on the property only about twenty stalls available. They do have an over flow lot a block or two away with a clear map of how to get there it will probably takes a minute or two to get there so it is really not that much of an issue. Both locations are pay for park, just how it is.The staff are all very nice and helpful. Nicole at the front desk really sticks out for us. She was friendly and helpful from the get go. We even set up a stay already with her when we come back again in a few months. That is how much we like to stay here.Many food options are close by, McDonalds, IHOP, all kinds of local style places and bar and grills. The main drag of Waikiki which, Kalakaua, is two blocks away. Which means the beach is that far too.The night life is a little less than appealing when the sun goes down i.e. Prostitutes, drunk people, and many other shady types. We never had a problem and there is a lot of foot traffic so we never felt unsafe or anything just putting it out there for you to know.No pool as far as I know. There is a bar downstairs, we did not go to it so not much to comment on that one. It just looked like your average sports bar.Just remember it is not a luxury place but it is very nice and it is clean and it is nicely priced for Waikiki. (We get a discount because we live in Hawaii) I give the five stars based on the class of hotel this is and the service.

We were booked in to this hotel for a week and only managed to stay one night and only because we arrived at 11pm with no other choice. The two bedroom suite consisted of one bedroom and a bed with a curtain round it. The preparation of the room was awful, with two of the very few lights not working, the sheets being unclean (one bed had blood stains), the floor was sticky and the carpet had been very badly stained, while the bathroom had not even been wiped over as previous guests hairs were found throughout the shower and bathroom. The only good part of this hotel was the reception desk who apologised and agreed to a refund for the week we had paid for. I recommend spending your holiday elsewhere as this hotel was definitely not providing value for money service.

This hotel is about 2 blocks from beach in the heart of Waikiki. Close to all the shops, restaurants with food mart around the corner. We had a corner suite with full kitchen. Very spacious even with six of us. It only had views of city. No swimming pool but we new that.I particularly want to thank Nicole and Robbie for being so helpful, courteous and greeted everyone with a smile. Thank you guys.

Stayed for 5 nights back in May 2012, Room was decent nothing fancy for the price but the customer service was top notch, the staff is happy to have you at their hotel and is really welcoming.Down said to the hotel was the parking, only 10-12 spots and if u were out at night you would have to park 2 blocks away at their overflow allotted lot and the parking at the hotel would fill up early in the evening, so be prepared for that. The good thing about this hotel location was the few minutes’ walk to the beach, stores, markets and restaurants. So u don’t need a car if you are going to be staying closes to the hotel proximity, but if you want to explore the island a car is a must have. We drove all over the island in the time we were there and some of the location we checked out were: North shore, Hanauma bay, Turtle Bay Resort, Dole planation, and may more. It’s worth exploring the island a lot of neat places to see and explore. Overall, we were satisfied with the experience we had and would stay at this hotel again because of the reasonable cost of the hotel compared to the other hotels in the area as well as the location which is pretty central to everything around us.

Stayed here for the location and price. Not fancy, but not a dump either. Room had a microwave and small fridge. No pool. Front desk was real friendly each time I passed through. The wifi worked good. Was able to get free use of beach towels each day which was nice. Did not have any issues with noise on the 8th floor but I also wear earplugs every night while sleeping. The only issue I had was with the room key which apparently gets demagnetized easily. Had a real hard time getting into the room on my initial trip into the room but as the week went along, I figured out the way to open the door on the 2nd or 3rd try. Other than the door, all was good for me.

We had a 3 bedroom suite, which was more than adequate for the needs of two couples for the week we were there. It was very spacious, a huge living room, good sized bedrooms, huge master bathroom, flat screen TV's in living room and 2 of the bedrooms, and had a kitchen with basic dishes included. The location was ideal too, being a short walk to the beach. The only negatives were in the living room, the only furniture to sit on was one small couch. It could have used another couch or a couple more chairs. Also the water pressure in the showers were barely more than a trickle. When housekeeping came they didn't do the dishes or clean up the kitchenette at all (not sure if that's even part of what housekeeping is supposed to do) It was definitely nothing real fancy but clean, comfortable and had very friendly staff. Oh and they also gave us coupons for free mai tai's at the bar next door! I would recommend it!

I was in Honolulu on my own for six days to attend an education conference in early January and enjoyed my stay at Aqua Waikiki Pearl. I found the customer service and friendliness of personnel in this hotel refreshing especially coming from New Zealand. The location was ideal as it was only a 10 minute walk to the conference venue and close to most other facilities. My room was spotless and clean throughout my stay and I valued safety and security provided. This hotel has a boutique feel about it which is an advantage in making conversation and/or friends for a lone traveler. Finally, a saving was made staying here and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to friends.Max GaluUniversity LecturerAucklandNew Zealand

We stayed at the Aqua Pearl for a week and found it very clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful with our requests for additional items (such as extra dishes and silverware). We thought we were getting a 3 bedroom condo, and there were definitely 3 beds, but the 3rd bed was part of the living room and only had a curtain for privacy, but it worked fine for our family. Beds were a little hard for my taste. It was about a 10 minute walk to the beach and we loved the International Market Place nearby - so sad to find out it is being torn down. The connection to our TV was broken and when we mentioned it at the desk they replaced the TV the same day - downside was that it was half the size!Parking is very limited (maybe 10 spaces available) and once it fills up you need to park a few blocks down at a parking garage.

This was a very bad choice we made in Hawaii: the only good point about the structure was the location, very central. The rest was not nice at all: the room was very small and stinking, like there were moulds (there was a air conditioner looking old and filthy, maybe it was coming from there. Room was vey dark too, with a small window, and in general, it gave us a very bad impression. My advice is, choose something else, even if you've to maybe pay something more (this hotel is pretty cheap), you'll bless that money!! The second star I gave is only because of the staff of the hotel, which was very friendly in a difficult situation we had - but I think it's not enough to recommend this structure.

We have stayed here for two nights and the service at the front desk reception was the best I have ever experienced across the world. Nothing was too much trouble - they (both Nicole & Robbie) were always happy to help no matter how minor the need. Location very central and view from balcony and balcony size on 9th floor facing the beach had water glimpses which was nice. Would recommend for space with a travelling family and friendly staff made it most enjoyable.

We stayed in 214, two bedroom with Kitchenette. We were upgraded so that our adult children had their own space and we all appreciated that very much. The furniture is dated, and the carpet had terrible stains. It should be replaced...wouldn't cost much. The room could use a couple of comfy armchairs as there was no where to sit once my husband got the couch. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The location is superb, although sadly, won't be as great once the construction at the International Marketplace begins. It did get noisy on a couple of occasions, but it is Waikiki and not Maui. I loved the size of the unit but a larger table to eat at would have been better.

I stayed Aqua Waikiki Pearl during my Christmas vacation for 4 nights.The hotel is located just two blocks away from the Waikiki beach and it is easy walk. I really enjoyed staying there because the hotel is clean, comfortable and has everything I for family travel with reasonable price in Waikiki. Especially, Nicole was very helpful and very informative. She is super kind and has lots of information about the city, parking and how you can enjoy Waikiki. Only one concern would be that it gets a bit noisy on Friday night due to the sound from the pub at the first floor. But, other than that, the room was clean and tidy. Parking is a bit tricky, but ask Nicole for advice.

if you are looking for cheap accommodation- this is the hotel. location is good. barely a 10 minute walk to waikiki beach. staff are very friendly and always willing to help. situated off kuhio rd (most of the buses stop on this road. though, condition of hotel is very old and the aircon is old and noisy but still works fine. we only came back to hotel to rest at night anyway so we didn't need much from it. had the basic amenities like microwave and kettle but i think there are also apartment style rooms with kitchen and sink. also has a tv. this hotel is for people who only need the basics so don't be expecting anything luxurious!

This is our 4th stay in Oahu. We stayed for 9 nights at this hotel after booking at the very last minute (4 days prior)- so we knew we were not going to get a great choice. The hotel is old and many of the standard rooms are tired and fitted with old style air conditioners which are VERY noisy, however at the time of booking this was all that was available for our length of stay. Our rooms was small and drab but clean. After a few night we asked for an upgrade which we got for just $25 a night to a junior suite which was plenty of room for our family of 3. This was a much better room. I recommend you go for this kind of room if you are staying unless you are really on a tight budget. Staff are really friendly and helpful. Beautiful touch as we were there over Christmas and New Year was a gift left in our rooms. A handy carry all bag for Christmas and for New years a bag of tasty good quality snacks. This was a lovely touch. The location is very convenient to everything in Waikiki across from International Markets (which were closing down at the time of our stay to make room for the Saks 5th avenue complex). Some street noise but so has other higher class and price hotels we have stayed at. I am not sure what the plans are the hotel to match the new upmarket neighbours, but a facelift would be good. However for the budget traveller this is a good hotel for the price if you upgrade to the better rooms.

Friendly and helpful staffs, clean and spacious room, great location to explore Oahu. Free beach towel you can get from counter, free Wi-fy , you get everything you need .Definitely recommend this hotel for your stay.

Room is quite big;Price is reasonable, under 100 bucks if booked earlier;Location is great and easy to Beach, City center,Downtown,Diamond Head, and other many attractions;Service is great and hospitable;Only problem is that the noisy night club nearby....

The 'Pearl" was clean,comfortable hotel. My family of five rented one of the two bedroom apartments and satisfied our needs.For an older hotel the room was refurbished well , beds comfortable, bathroom clean. It is located central to most things and value for money.The staff were very friendly and helpful

The room is pretty awesome. I had a comfortable experience here. The location of this hotel is also pretty good. It is close to the Waikiki beach park, and there are many bus routes passing by the nearby bus stop. So, it is easy to go to downtown, airport, diamond head, hanauma bay, and so on.

Awesome place to stay, either with family or friends. When trying to find an affordable place to stay near town and the beach, Aqua Waikiki is an excellent option. We've been really pleased with their staff members, they were very helpful and kind with us!

Just spent two weeks here and was very impressed. Been to Honolulu many times and have spent alot more money on other hotels that could'nt come close to the experience I got here. The staff here makes you feel at home and will go out of their way to help you with anything you might want to do. It is an older hotel but was very clean and well kept. Perfect location for anything you might want to do. A small bar downstairs shows all sporting events and every NFL game. Can't wait to come back.

We went to Honolulu for the marathon and wanted to stay near the marathon start/finish areas. This hotel was perfect! It was a 15-20 minute walk to the start and was a 10-15 minute walk from the finish (Honolulu Zoo.)From what I recall, it is not a resort so a resort fee was not added on and thus made the price within our budget. Overall, the hotel is clean, quiet, and has all the necessities people need. I didn't think it was a luxury hotel but the service provided by the front desk receptionists and cleaners always exceeded my expectations, hence the 5 star rating. As for parking, it cost $23/night if you parked at the back (which was quite small and had a tendency to be full after 6pm.) They have an agreement with a parking garage at the Waikiki Trade Center where it cost $20 cash (but you have to show your Aqua Pearl Waikiki parking pass when exiting.) The garage folks then staple a receipt on it and you have to show the parking pass and receipt to the front desk of Aqua Waikiki Pearl so they can delete the $23 charge on their system for that night. Just an FYI.Overall I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Waikiki beach was a 5 minute walk and while there, you'll find vendors trying to give you a free surf lesson, free ukelele lesson, etc. (similar to what the 5* hotels in the area offer to their guests for free.)

Location: Near shopping malls, beach and there's a starbucks just a few steps away. Bus-stop is nearby which has buses that bring you to Mauna Loa Shopping Mall, Pearl Harbor (Bus 20/42), Hanauma Bay. Service: IMPECCABLE. We were impressed especially by their warm and friendly counter staff. We reached the hotel early at 12pm and was allowed to check in. They showed us how to get around town and even provided a free map and bus service guide. Room: We had a free upgrade to a junior suite and it was spacious enough for both of us. A gripe was a faulty lamp that made the room much dimmer at night. Room service was daily at 930am and the room was well-attended to. We highly recommend this semi-budget hotel to anyone who wants to visit Honolulu. We will definitely stay in Aqua Waikiki Pearl in our next visit :)

For the price (less than $100 USD) this hotel is very good. The location is excellent (2 blocks from the beach), next to restaurants, a market and a pharmacy. The bedroom was OK, two comfortable beds, a good shower head, fridge, coffee machine and a microwave. The staff was nice and helpful. It's a good option if you're looking for a room for less than $100 USD in Waikiki.

We loved staying at Aqua Pearl. It's in a great location, reasonably priced and friendly staff. Gina, our cleaner did a great job each day, and Harry and Robbie on the desk were great. They organised our transport to the airport and answered any questions we had. The room was a little noisy at night, but nothing a pair of ear plugs couldn't fix! We would definitely recommend this place to our friends.

I will start with the positives of this hotel. Great location! Just a short stroll from the beach, Waikiki shops and restaurants. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The room has everything you expect and need out of a hotel room.Negatives- This hotel is NOISY and there is absolutely no noise proofing on the windows! There is a pub just under the hotel which gets pretty rowdy quite late. Motor bikes are constantly driving by. Up the road there is a club which pumps music till the early hours of the morning. This club was open every night we were there (10 days), so it is not just a weekend thing. Once the pub and club noise have died down (around 4 in the morning), the Italian restaurant across the road has its deliveries at around 6am in the morning. The reversing noise from this truck is constant and it will definitely be heard!Last negative. If you are traveling as a pair of two couples sharing an apartment- don't. We moved from a two bedroom 'apartment' to two separate rooms because the rooms were separated by a curtain. You have two options when selecting a two bedroom apartment- either have rooms separated by curtains or have actual walls but have a bathroom only in the master bedroom. This would make it a little awkward going to the toilet in the middle of the night....Honestly, I would stay back at this hotel if they invested in double glazed glass windows. Once we had moved to separate rooms our lack of sleep was the only problem! Everything else was great.

Point form:I would stay again, cause of its locationmost of the postings are repeated.I give this place 2.5 stars.On 2nd day, they miss giving me face towels, maybe cause I did not tip.saw lots of hairs in shower stall. I stayed Room 915, facing back alley, was OK.Heard birds Churping about 5:30 am, lasted about an hour, did not hear traffic or dump trucks.staff like Robbie/Nicole was cool.I rented a bike (hybird, with basket) for a day @ $23, parked at back, best way to see the area. like the watermelon water at front desk.Go to Food Pantry (1 block away) and get your supplies.loved the subway and Marukame Udon within a block there.Cheers

We go to Waikiki every year and usually pick our hotels based on moderate price range. This year we picked the Waikiki Pearl. It is a updated older hotel that is close to the International Market (which will sadly be gone in Jan 2014). Location is good short walk to the Waikiki strip and other ammenities. Overall the hotel is decent for the price, the staff is friendly and helpful. The parking is a bit tight but this is common for older hotels in Waikiki. For the price I would say its a nice choice.

Enjoyed my stay here-upgraded to junior suite and worth it (room 608). I would stay here again. This hotel is very affordable, clean and convenient. Pros: Spacious bedroom & bathroom. 2 comfortable queen size beds with good quality linens. Large closet with mirrors on doors, ironing board & iron inside. "Kitchen" area - refrig, microwave, coffee maker with good size counter space. Ceramic coffee cups & glass drinking glasses (no styrofoam or plastic). Dresser area - 4 drawers, good counter space and LED TV. Great location - @ 2 blocks from middle of Waikiki Beach, across the street from soon-to-be defunct Int'l Marketplace; Chilis, Jamba Juice, Subway & 2 Starbucks close by. Two "The Bus" stops close also. A Food Pantry market is one block over. Meals are expensive here. Hotel has no pool, but didn't need it anyway. Staff is friendly and helpful; Robbie helped me with using "The Bus" route & printing out the directions. Cons: Carpet is very worn and could use replacing; room could use more electrical outlets. Lots of dust on floor lamp bulb. It can get noisy at night with the street traffic and sirens but after all, you are in Waikiki and there's a lot going on. If you have a balcony, you don't get a view of the ocean but it's still a nice view at night of the lights of the city. Small stuff. I was VERY happy with my stay at this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Spacious room and large bathroom- clean and bright, in a great location very near the scenic canal, close to shopping and restaurants and near the beach! Good price, too. Will likely stay there again next trip to Honlulu!

I booked directly on the website, and got a great deal. This is a good option for those that want value and a basic place to rest your head. The room was biggish, bed comfy and wasn't too dirty/worn. Only complaints would be the walls are thin or it's just real loud outside, and there was just a little black mold on the tile in the shower behind the curtain. All in all, you can drop more cash for way less. I noticed some of the rates around $300-400 Christmas time which is just unreal to me. Location is great, they charge for parking like $25ish.

Stains on the carpets, varying hairs all around the bathroom and air conditioning that sounded like a lawn mower. The room was incredibly disappointing. The room service each day was sporadic and poor. I'm making the assumption that some rooms have been updated and we were unlucky and had one of the older ones. It was shabby with no balcony and smelt mouldy and dampThe staff were friendly, but lacking in local knowledge, or maybe just reluctant to help. I didn't feel that they wanted to assist us with our stay Good location, Starbucks on the corner and restaurants all around. Just a couple of blocks from the main shopping area.

When we first got there, I didn't think we made a very good choice. But, the next morning and the rest of the time we spent there was great. Two outstanding employees were Robbie and Ese. Robbie check us in and held get a great room when we added another day to our stay. Ese we meant the next morning. He was a very cool dude. I think he would have given the shirt off his back if we asked him for it. We were there to meet my daughter, who's ship was docking at Pearl Harbor. We were leaving with her on the destroyer ( USS STOCKDALE (DDG 106) the next day to return to their homeport (San Diego) after a ten month deployment. The whole trip was great and it started with the Aqua Waikiki Pearl.

We three shared a street facing room in October, we were so pleased with the spaciousness and comfy beds. The street is a bit noisy especially as we were on the third floor but that's the location, just a hop away from everywhere. The staff were great, holding our luggage for us after check out while we were at very nearby Waikiki beach.

It was our third staying in this hotel and everything was great as usual. Our room was facing the back of this hotel and had a view of other hotel units but it was much quieter than the room with facing front. Great location with great staffs..Always welcoming the guests in and out and very friendly with great smiling. Our family enjoyed this hotel a lot and will stay there again. The only one inconvenience was parking situation..Thank you everyone in ,Aqua Pearl!Cheers!

Fun, friendly and helpful staff.They made our stay so enjoyable.Large clean rooms.Remote controlled air conditioner.Nice T.V.,mini fridge and microwave. Comfortable bed and pillows. Great shower head and plenty of hot water.Located close to the beach. Lots of great local places to eat and a food court market place nearby. Again, I can't say enough about the staff.
user_name:
Allan S
Gulfport, Mississippi, United States

review_body: We are a family of five and stayed in a one bedroom apartment. There was more than enough room for all of us. We are Kiwis from New Zealand and after a long flight (and grumpy kids 17y, 9y, 7y), we were greeted by friendly and knowledgeable local staff. For complete foreingers like us, that was awesome! We were there to meet up with a group of friends from Las Vegas, Australia and NZ, and the Legends bar downstairs became our "local". We didn't find any faults with anything, the room was clean and tidy. Our days were filled with swimming, shopping and touring around Oahu with our friends. So we were gone in the morning and back in the evening. We Kiwis are not fussy and when we travel all we want is a clean place to lay our heads down, after all we're not there to spend all day in our rooms! But we cannot stress enough about the service and the friendliness of the staff, always smiling and would talk to our kids about their day. Aqua Pearl is right in the heart of Waikiki and close to all the restaurants, better still, its only 2 blocks from the beach. Overall I'm glad we stayed here, we had the best holiday and would do it all over again!

Due to the horrible scheduling on AA to Kona we choose to spend two nights in Waikiki, having not done so in a very long time. We weren't looking for luxury but price wasn't a driver, either. The Pearl seemed to fit the bill and did. Warts first. It's an older building in a mixed neighborhood of "affordable" (for Waikiki) apts, high rise condos and mid range hotels. This is a weird bird. Most often you see apts shaped from motels but this seems to be a hotel shapped from apts. it's well done but seems odd in places. I reserved a non-smoking and there were no signs of smoking but the room had that aroma like my mother's house, even 30 years after my father died. Sheets in particular. But we choose not to complain because it was way late for us (after 2 am back home) and it was only two nights. So I'm to blame for not getting it "fixed".The good stuff. A couple of blocks from Kalakaua and a bus line on each end of the block. Plenty of restaurant choices in your choice of styles and prices. An ABC at the end of the block. And down the street. And ... (Vetern Hawai'i visitors get that one). The staff is dynamite. How about "no mam, thank you" to a tip!!!Were I staying in Waikiki again for a week or so with our budget this wouldn't be my first choice. But a night or two, say pre or post cruise or as a jumping off point, or if you do need to watch your dollars and this would be a great place.

I stayed here for one week on a business trip and was very disappointed. Here is a list of the things that I found that I did not like:Parking - Not enough onsite parking. This was after paying $23.00 to park my car.Bathroom sink would not drainBathtub would not drainBathtub drain stopper closed each time I turned on the shower - resulting in water up to my ankles. Finally stuck a package of soap under it to keep it open. Toilet would not flush correctlyRoom smelled liked bleached urineTV was a 17" LG computer monitorStains on carpetSmall ants everywhere in bathroomAC did not get the room coldHad to stand on a chair to reach the AC temp adjustmentAC leaked waterAC was loud and rattledHere are the things I did like:The staff was VERY friendly and nice to work with!Great locationStarbucks serving real Kona coffee on the corner. YummyBottom line - I won't be staying here again

We initially booked two nights here based on the good reviews posted on Trip Advisor. I hesitated to believe it possible because our nightly rate here was 30-50% less than the "specials" most 2.5 star hotels in Waikiki were advertising. But Aqua Pearl turns out to be a good find.Book direct via their website. You get an additional 12% off the lowest advertised price with their Kamaaina (welcome) rate, and you can request an upgrade for just a few bucks if they have availability. Aqua Pearl is three blocks from the beach, directly through the center of the International Market (which happens to have a U.S. Post Office branch, fyi). It's also half block from the east edge of the tourist shopping and restaurant district, which is perfect because you can sleep at night removed from the noise.
