You can get anywhere on the island via the local bus service for $2.50. The bus stop is 1/2 block from the hotel so you don't need to rent a car, which saves lots of money on daily parking fees.Almost all of Waikiki's hotel construction is from the 1950s-60s, so everything is either old, renovated, or torn down and rebuilt. Aqua Pearl is in the renovated category. Now in our fourth night, after twice extending our stay, we find our room very satisfactory. We did get the upgrade to a junior king suite. The room is huge, with minimal furnishings. Though we've had our suitcases strewn all over the floor all week (because we didn't unpack thinking we might move) there's still more than enough room to bring the patio table and chairs from the balcony inside, so you can dine in air conditioning.The junior king room comes with a microwave and mini-refridge, which are both important if you can't bear to eat restaurant food every meal. We found a grocery store in Honolulu and stocked up on fresh fruit and veggies, yogurt, green tea, organic half & half, etc. The room has a coffee maker, but you need to bring your own cream, as only the powdered kind is provided. Toiletries provided are shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, and bar soap. (No idea why every hotel on the planet doesn't provide body wash instead of goopy soap.)There is no pool or fitness center, but you can get a discount pass at 24 Hour Fitness (about 4 blocks away) if you're staying at one of the Aqua properties.The front desk staff and housekeeping staff are very friendly and accommodating. I really like the chilled watermelon water available in the lobby all day.The king bed is very comfortable, as are the pillows. Blankets aren't necessary here, and you can sleep with your balcony door wide open weeknights when it's quiet. There are literally no bugs !We have an astonishing view from our eighth floor room of Waikiki city lights after sundown. The balcony is enormous and it's very pleasant to enjoy a cup of coffee outside as the sun is rising. The bathroom has been renovated with granite counter, shower/tub enclosure, and a pretty mirror. The hotel skimps on bath towels (two per day), but that's understandable because I'd guess that guests take them to the beach and lose them or ruin them. I love the full length mirrors on the double closet doors in the bedroom. The flat screen TV is only about 27" so you can't see it from across the room (no watching TV in bed), but then who comes to Hawaii to watch TV ? Our only complaint is the free Wi-Fi. It's difficult to impossible to get connected, and then if you do find a connection, browsing is approx. the speed of dial-up. No exaggeration. So forget hotel Wi-Fi. Starbucks is 1/2 block away, and if that one happens to be crowded, there's a second Starbucks one block north. I don't hesitate to recommend this hotel for people traveling on a budget. You can pay a whole lot more for a whole lot less in Waikiki.

My husband and I stayed here for a week and were VERY surprised at the close proximity to all the wonderful sights there are there. The staff was knowledgable and quite pleasant. the street noise might bother some but hey, Its summer all year long!!

We recently had a week at the hotel and I would recommend it to anyone. The price was reasonable, the location was excellent - walking distance to most of the attractions, shops. Lots of cheap eating and drinking places nearby. The staff were very friendly and helpful when we had questions about where to catch buses if we needed to. There was a fridge and coffee machine in our room and a safe for our valuables. I would certainly stay again next time we are in Hawaii.Jane and Greg Brisbane Australia

we loved the Aqua Waikiki Pearl situated in heart of Waikiki close to shops, public transport, tour buses outside.Facilities where good they had thought of everything to make your stay relaxing and comfortable staff very helpful and friendly.We will return to this hotel on our next visit to Hawii.

Stayed here for 4 nites in a balcony king room. Stayed on the top floor (10th) with a balcony. The room was good for the money and the staff were very friendly and nice. The location is great and convenient to food, the beach, and shopping. There's a coin laundry room on the 3rd or 4th floor as well, so that's convenient for anyone needing to wash dirty clothing. The parking lot is tiny and you'll most likely end up parking somewhere nearby, or street parking if lucky. Road noise could be a potential problem for some, but for me it was fine. We were facing a direction away from the main roads.
user_name:
sham3n
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a 2 night stopover here between Big Island and going back to the mainland. The hotel gave us what we were looking for, which was an inexpensive and quiet location to base ourselves. The room we had was slightly above identikit chain hotel standards, with a fridge and a spacious bathroom, but otherwise there was not much to make it stand out as excellent in any regard. The staff were friendly and helpful, giving good advice. There are innumerable hotel options on Waikiki beach with better views and more facilities, but you will of course pay a premium for them.

Our 3 bedroom plus kitchen apartment was on the 10th floor. It was light and airy and very comfortable. Serviced every day for the week we stayed. Older style building that has been renovated . Excellent accommodation for price we paid. Harry attended to any enquiries we had without delay and with his unique sense if humor . Esse , Rachel and all the staff were so friendly and obliging . We will definitely stay again and have no problem with recommending Aqua Pearl as a top place to stay in Waikiki. Central to everything from International market place to the beach , great places to eat and even bus stops. You can't go wrong when you chose to stay at Aqua pearl. Deb & Ron B

for a hundred bucks a night, this average hotel in an older building is very well maintained and rooms and facilities are clean. no pool, small parking lot, and some street noise... but the beach is not too far; and it's a nice walk; i can deal with the noise...for me it adds excitement to the trip... it's generally a safe area... busy with lots of tourist traps... part of the fun when going to places like this. the staff is top-notch! very friendly and helpful... i can tell that the staff go the the extra mile to make their guests have an enjoyable stay. basically, it's 5-star service from a 3-star hotel!

We stayed here for one night on the last night of our trip. We stayed on the 6th floor. The room was very nice and spacious. It was quite modern and the balcony was the highlight. The only problem was the noise. Not sure if it was because it was a Friday night or not, but we found the noise from the road below horrible. We could hear trucks and motorcycles coming and going and also people talking and laughing, plus bongo drums (no idea from where). I would definitely stay here again but only in a room away from the road. The room was clean but there was rubbish behind the bed side table left from a previous guest so perhaps the cleaners attention to detail isn't too good. The hotel charge to leave luggage in storage. $5 per bag per night with a minimum charge of $20 which I think is crazy.

Make sure you ask for a room with a balcony, although watch out for the pigeon poop. We stayed once on the way to the US and once on the way home. Rooms were clean and comfortable but maybe a little dated. Position - excellent. Price - taking into account that they charged us for each night separately (4 nights & we prepaid) and therefore we had a ridiculous amount of credit card exchange fees not counting the ridiculous transient accommodation taxes that should be built in, the price was okay. The boys on the desk were always friendly and helpful. Internet was good. There is no pool and for anyone who likes a cup of tea take your own travel kettle. Watermelon water at reception was great and for those who like coffee that's also served at reception in the mornings.

First and foremost the most enjoyable part of our stay was by far the outstanding staff we interacted with while we were there. Dexter, Ese and Harry handled all of our needs and questions with a courteous smile and great service.As is the case with most Waikiki hotels, this is an older building but it seems management has done a decent job at keeping things updated and clean. We were in a 3 bedroom suite on the top floor and had no issues with noise from below or neighbors. Both elevators were running and we never had to wait more than a minute for one to arrive.Our room was well kept and clean overall. The room featured a full size fridge, stove top, microwave and TV in the living room as well as two of the three bedrooms. There were two bathrooms; one in the "master" bedroom and the other in between the two smaller bedrooms (a Jack and Jill type setup). Overall the room was more than adequate for our needs however we had four minor issues with our room/stay:1. The sliding glass door going out to the balcony did not have any type of childproof mechanism2. The room only had place settings for four people instead of the max occupancy of the room3. The wifi access in our room spotty at best4. There are a very limited number of parking spots onsite (22 if memory serves me correctly)The parking issue has been discussed at length so we knew that well in advance and parked in another location for our stay. I was glad to see both elevators were working for our visit and the location just a few blocks from the beach was fantastic. Overall things were more than adequate for our stay. The room more than met our needs and the staff we interacted with were all courteous and gave us the impression they really cared about our experience at their hotel. We would not hesitate to stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl again in the future.

Upon arrival the front desk was excellent, both friendly and helpful. This great service continued on throughout the stay. They helped with the tour confirmations and were always great when we had questions. The free beach towel loans and free wifi were nice touches.The location was great we could walk to everything which helped with all the great food we ate. There are a couple of coffee shops within minutes to grab something quick for breakfast before tours and the trolley stops are just around the corner.The room was large, clean and comfortable. The bathroom had plenty of space and the bed was really comfortable.The only little issues we had were that one day we received sheets with a small tear, the air conditioner was a little loud and the balconies from a neighbouring hotel look straight into the room. These little problems were not enough to offset all of its great points.We would highly recommend this for anyone looking for a great value comfortable room in a good location.

We were recent guests of the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. Our stay was very enjoyable and we wanted to recognize two specific employees – Robert Helsham and Dexter Tuigiamala.Both Robert and Dexter went above and beyond their regular responsibilities to make us comfortable during our stay. They made suggestions about local restaurants and activities, printed maps to all of the locations, had extra towels delivered to our room and greeted us with warm conversation each time we entered and exited the hotel.A lovely, clean, affordable hotel with wonderful employees that made the vacation awesome!

This hotel offered great value and location for the money. It's located 10 min walk from the beach and 1/2 block off of the main strip in Waikiki. Harry and the front desk staff were great during check in and check out. They gave us an upgrade and the room was very spacious. The WiFi also worked well in the room and was FREE! I look forward to returning to Waikiki soon and will definitely stay at the Aqua Pearl!

This place is fabulous. The staff are so friendly and welcoming. The rates are really reasonable and it is just a few blocks from the beach. The room was clean and very modern. The shower had great pressure. the beds were very comfortable and had great clean and fresh linen. There is a carpark but you have to pay so we found parking on the street.

This small hotel has no great view from the second floor but puts you smack in Waikiki. You can walk to everything. Paid Parking is limited on site and on a first come first serve basis. The offsite parking available is an inconvenience. The bed linens I checked as soon as I got in. They were clean and no evidence of bugs. Great. I left to see family. Came back late and found out that my carpet was really filthy. Had white paper slippers I use to go through airport security in my bag and they were black in about two minutes. I did bring all my issues to management and they responded quickly and appropriately and have also offered me a free upgrade if I choose to stay again. Apparently they are in the process of upgrading the rooms. I hope so because the view may not be great but the staff really is and the location is great. I think from the swift response I received (a few hours from my email) that they will address the issues. The fact that they responded so quickly and have such a well trained staff tells me they are moving in the correct direction. Would I stay again? I am not sure. Some rooms do show "recently upgraded" on the website. I have had a pleasant stay in an Aqua resort before. We shall see. I'll let you all know what happens here!

Stayed for one night. Parking lot was full so I had to find street parking. Waikiki is a busy area on the weekends. Staff was great! Checking in was a breeze. We were surprised when the clerk at the desk, Dexter, upgraded our room to a suite. SWEET!!! Thanks Dexter! (Go GOVS!!). Room was clean and cool. Location of the hotel is perfect. No breakfast or pool, not a problem! Less than a 5 minute walk to the beach, shops and restaurants everywhere, just perfect. Looking forward to my next stay-cation at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl.

Best service all round For the price you pay the rooms are clean and spacious. Facilities could be improved within apartments but nothing that was un comfortable. The receptionist were helpful and friendly. Would recommend to anyone

We stayed here for a night before our cruise and was very happy with the hotel, especially the staff most notably Ese and Harry. Don't be expecting the hilton but the rooms are clean and tidy and the locations of the hotel is a close walk to shops and restaurants.

The hotel itself is nice enough. We stayed in a simple room with a Queen and Double bed (no kitchenette or lanai). Everything was clean and let me tell you, the housekeeping staff know how to tuck in bed corners!. The hotel provides beach towels at the front desk which was an added perk! (Wish we would have known that before we packed ours all the way from Montana.) Our only complaint with the room was the shower water pressure which was weak. That might be because we were on the 10th floor. Another added perk was the safe provided in the room's closet! No continental breakfast is provided but there are several places to get breakfast within a close walking distance. We also enjoyed the hotels location...within walking distance to a lot in Waikiki. What makes this place special is THE STAFF!!!! They went out of their way to answer our questions and were so kind and helpful! Dish out some friendly teasing and they dished it right back! =) They were kind, funny, knowledgeable, and helpful! One staff member Ese, even went and bought us a Hula Dog with his own money!! We were waiting for our shuttle to the airport and when he heard we had not tried a Hula Dog he quickly ran and got us one. It was delicious!!! What an extra special act of Aloha Spirit!!! Thank you, Ese!!!! And thank you Rachel, Robbie, and Harry too!! You guys ROCK!!!!!!! Mahalo!!

Very kind, knowledgeable, helpful and fun staff! The room we stayed in was very large and clean. Great shower pressure and water temperature, air conditioner worked very well. The view from the balcony was amazing (stayed on the 9th floor, could see the ocean to the left and the mountains to the right). The only down sides were the Sports Bar in the building downstairs is loud until 4 am and the parking is not sufficient for what they need, so we had to park several blocks away most nights (they have alternative parking at the Convention Center at a discount price).

We stayed here for 5 night on our way home to Australia. Great little hotel. The staff are friendly and extremely helpful. Room are always kept clean - air-con is noisy but you get used to it. We didn't have any problem with street noise.The only thing that would make this a great hotel would be a pool.

I wasn't sure what to expect when I arrived for my stay, as the price seemed too good to be true for the location. I certainly wasn't disappointed! The staff were so friendly and very helpful. The facilities are recently renovated, and very clean. The bed super comfy, and the location pretty perfect :) Yes, it isn't a luxury resort, but you do get what you pay for, and I think in this case, you get more than what you pay for. At time it was noisy, but any hotel in central Waikiki would be the same. I would recommend!

Just spent a week on Oahu staying at the Waikiki Pearl.The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the hotel was very clean, great location and very well priced relative to other hotels.Only reason why this isn't a 5-star rating is the parking is bad. There's only limited spaces for a hotel of this size, when it's full the overflow parking is 2 blocks away on the Waikiki Trade Centre. The problem is the traffic during those two blocks can get pretty bad.Overall, I highly recommend this hotel if you are not renting a car.

We stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for 3 nights prior to a cruise and we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable, the sheets were crisp and the towels were like new. The staff was knowlegeble and helpful, especially Harry. Some folks have written about street noise at night, but we were on an upper floor and we wear earplugs while we sleep, so noise was not a problem.The Pearl is located a short walk from Waikiki, just 50 yards from the International Marketplace (try the Bluewater Shrimp there). Enterprise rent-a-car is only two blocks away.

This hotel was very clean. I was able to get a room for under $100 a night with fees which isn't bad for Waikiki. It was really noisy, but then again, any hotel in that area would be. It's an extremely short walk to the back entrance of the International Market which was nice. The watermelon water at the front desk was a nice touch.

Excellent service from staff had booked with them as they were cheaper compared to others in Waikiki we were even upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite free of charge. Only downfall is they don't have a pool but the beach is only a short stroll down the road.
user_name:
Krystal A
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: This place showed up on a Dog Friendly website, which was way overpriced then when I spoke to someone (Dexter) at the Hotel. He was courteous and patient with my questions about staying the night with our dogs. We were worried about our dogs being welcomed, but that wasn't a problem. From the time I checked in I felt the Genuine Aloha Spirit from (Robbie) the front desk. The Bell Man and even Dexter came out to greet us!The room (2 bedroom suite) was just as we expected and it was comfortable all over. The only thing that could've been better was the dining room table, it was enough to fit 3 people and no plates.I would recommend anyone wanting a little escape to Waikiki to stay here, especially since there are so many places to eat around the area. It was a GREAT Staycation for our Ohana!!

We had an unpleasant experience at a hotel nearby so we stopped in to see about availability and rates. The evening staff was very helpful and they allowed us to see the room before booking. They gave us a great rate and an upgrade. They were very pleasant to work with!

Central Waikiki is an expensive area. This hotel is a lot cheaper than most luxury hotels in the area but note this is not a luxury hotel, so best to compare apples with apples... It is clean, has a rather good bed and good enough bathroom. Very friendly, positive staff at reception. I especially appreciated Dexter's service. The rooms have a fridge and micro wave which is good and bad... A lot of guests bring in take away food which is not making the rooms any cleaner I guess...I had a standard room which means view to another building with plenty of windows meaning you have to keep the curtains closed day and night and yes, the airco is loud... To give you an idea, the airco prevents you from hearing the tv unless you turn it up significantly.... Make sure you tip the cleaning lady daily. if not, the number of towels, replacement of soap, etc are reduced to a minimum. Also it seems that a lot of rooms are occupied by 4 people, plenty of them making a lot of noise in the hall way in the evening and night....If you are looking for a cheap(er) decent and good place to stay in central Waikiki, this is your hotel.

The hotel is well maintained for its age. Although our room was clean, the view was another hotel. The room had an older a/c that was noisy, but cooled the room despite the humid warmth of Hawaii. We stayed a week, but used the room for mainly sleeping. No pool, so what? After all, if you are in Hawaii, outdoors in the fresh air, beach, ocean and sunshine is what you crave. Hotel was situated very near Kuhio Street, a lively touristy thoroughfare, where you can buy sundries, eat at nearby restaurants and enjoy Honolulu nightlife. All the front desk staff we met, day or night were Aloha friendly, warm and accomodating. Mahalo to them. We saved some parking fee by overnight parking elsewhere for $15, and walking about 3/10 mile nightly back to Aqua Waikiki Pearl.

The Hotel is not a resort THIS IS A VERY CLEAN HOTELTHE STAFF IS THE BEST Better than many 5 star I've Stayed at. It does not have a pool. With Waikiki Beach 1 block away who needs a pool. If you wanted to be at the pool you could go anywhere. We stayed two weeks here.

hotel is very good for the price and close to the international market. The staff were great and so helpful especially when we were held up getting onto our cruise. They went out of their way to get us there on time. Else,Eric and Ricky became like family could always have a laugh and a smile with them. They also allow you to leave luggage with them after check out if your departure is later in the day and didnt charge. Can also shower and change if required once again now charge. A very pleasant stay all round
user_location: Coffs Harbour, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
SusanB583
Coffs Harbour, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Just spent a week on Oahu staying at the Waikiki Pearl.The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the hotel was very clean, great location and very well priced relative to other hotels.Only reason why this isn't a 5-star rating is the parking is bad. There's only limited spaces for a hotel of this size, when it's full the overflow parking is 2 blocks away on the Waikiki Trade Centre. The problem is the traffic during those two blocks can get pretty bad.Overall, I highly recommend this hotel if you are not renting a car.

The best part about the hotel is the personable staff members. Ese, Ricky, and Dexter greeted us with a smile everyday and were extremely accommodating. Great value and prime location! If you find a food deal make sure to book it right away as the rates can increase within days. The rooms are clean and decent, and of good size. The bathroom is spacious, but does not have a clothes line to hang wet wear, and there is no fan. Expect to hear some noise in the evening. If you plan to catch a late flight, you will have access to 24 fitness at Pacific Hotel to use their facilities ($10). If you only plan to use their shower after surfing, they may not even charge. They will only charge 50 cents for a lock. If you are looking for an affordable hotel filled with happy staff members that spread good vibes, this is it!

After reading some of these reviews I wasn't sure I was going to like my experience. Im glad I was pleasantly surprised!! The moment we arrived to the Aqua Waikiki Pearl we were made to feel welcome. It was our first time in Hawaii and to have everyone be extremely friendly made the experience so much better. Even though our check in was at 3 pm, we were able to check in at 12 pm. We were also informed of complimentary beach towels to use at the beach. The beach was only a few blocks away and the location of the hotel was right in the middle of Waikiki. My husband and I commented that the hotels right on the beach are more than double what we paid and youre only a few blocks closer. We didn't get a room with a lanai but I still didn't have any complaints on the room size. We were able to fit my daughters stroller in there without a problem and she's 3 months old! You also get free wifi in your rooms which not many of the other hotels in Waikiki have. The reason I didn't give this hotel a 5 is because of the lack of other amenities like fitness center and pool. Overall if you are looking for an affordable hotel close to the beach with friendly staff and decent rooms, give Aqua Waikiki Pearl a chance! :)
user_name:
Melissa R
El Cajon, California, United States

review_body: The staff at Aqua Waikiki Pearl is the 'ohana I choose. Stayed a couple of times in the Summer and just now in a time of transition. Staff are personable, caring, effective, attentive to every detail of your stay be it vacation or moving to and from places on island. The suites with an extra side bedroom and kitchen were great for extended stays. If ever returning to O'ahu, I would always choose Aqua Waikiki Pearl for the very exceptional staff that they keep. Where else would someone remember a face, a person, a story--and on top of the many tasks staff track, offer several slices of pizza as you rebook a flight in the lobby? Perfection! Big thank you to; Rachel Agasiva, Robbie Helsham, Charity Reyes, Dexter Tuigamala, Eric Petersen, Harry Matsushima, Tasi Singh, Dawn Baker, Ese Faumui!!!

We experience a last minute vacation and we are so thankful that we had the chance to stay at the Aqua Waikiki, the staff was so friendly and helpful at all times! We walked everywhere and there was plenty places to eat nearby and affordable for our price range (it didn't kill us). We stayed in the one studio room and it was great, with all that you could need if you had to cook in room and it was roomy. We will be back, and have told our friends as well.

Overall we loved our stay! Everyone at the desk was extremely nice and helpful - mainly Eric (who checked us in as a late arrival) and Dexter (who had great suggestions of hikes to do). Robbie was our go-to person. He knows the area very well and was very nice to us throughout the stay. (Thank-you guys. We were unable to thank you in person before we left. We really appreciated everything you did for us.)Pros: The friendly staff, the location (you're right in the middle of Waikiki), beach towels provided by the hotel, cleanliness and efficiency of the housekeepers (we would leave early in the morning and return around 2-3 pm and the room would ALWAYS be clean upon our arrival).Cons: There are two things that kept me for giving them 5 starts. One is the parking - the lack of actually. They have limited parking that is by the hotel. If you arrive too late in the day, you have to park in their overflow parking which is about a 5 minute walk away. Paying $23 a night for parking, I'd expect to have parking at the hotel, which was not the case 3 of the 6 nights we stayed at the hotel. The second is the air conditioning. The air conditioning worked fine and would keep the room very fresh, but it was extremely noisy. It is a little difficult to sleep with it on, but it's something that you can ignore if you're very tired (which we were).Overall, we were very pleased with our stay and will definitely be returning during our visits to Oahu.

We arrived at 10.00am in the morning and were greeted with smiling faces.Our rooms were not ready but we could change and freshen up before we went sightseeing.Eric advised about the free wifi which were were able to contact family that we arrived safely.Eric also advised where we could get phone cards and where to go for shoppingI have already recommended Aqua Pearl to others

great location in the heart of waikiki , next to all the food and shopping, very clean rooms, free wifiand the staff at the front desk is the best i have ever encountered , they are so friendly and helpful even if its 3-4 am when we check incant thank and praise them enoughwe were there on transit and stayed twice,thanks againavi from niue and paola from tonga

I am definitely surprised by this hotel! The room was very clean, we really enjoyed the staff (particularly Harry was very nice to us in the lobby) and it is in an AWESOME location! Just about 2 blocks from Waikiki and just a couple blocks to the beach also! The only thing that kind of sucks about this hotel is the parking situation, if the lot is full you have to park a little bit further away and pay to later be reimbursed when you check out which is fine. But all in all the price was good and I would definitely recommend staying here if you are coming to Oahu :)

I have stayed in a few dozen hotels in Waikiki and if you don't want the glitz and tons of tourist walking through your hotel, then this is the place to be. The lower floors can be a little loud from the street noise, but this place is close to everything...The Pantry grocery store, Denny's, Starbucks, a great all you can buffet 2 blocks away, International Market place, and dozens of places to eat and even a few convenience stores to chose from. Parking is first come, first serve for $23.00 a night, However, all the hotels charge parking at $25.00 a night and often you pay amenity fees. There is not pool, but the beach is just a really short walk. I brought my little dog on this trip and things worked out really well. I will come back again.

Arrived on Aug. 26th at 1pm and I had requested for an early check in when I booked the room. Harry, the front desk guy, accommodated me immediately and gave me a room based on my request, which was a queen size bed. Room given to me was at the very end (715) which I liked. However, room 714, was undergoing some renovations, and I did not enjoy the door slamming at 7am the next day.Room was spacious for a single person. Good to have a refrigerator, microwave, and coffeemaker. Bathroom was clean and with an adequate space. Shampoo and conditioner smells nice =)Robbie, the other front desk person was a cheerful employee, who always gave a smile when I'd pass by the lobby. Nice Aloha touch! Great location!

Stayed at the Pearl with a few friends and found the rooms better than what we were expecting. Plenty of room and the kitchen had everything we needed. Beds were comfy and had a home feel about the room. Didn't like that we had to wait all day, having arrived after a long flight from Australia, but I can't really blame the hotel - they were gracious enough to look after our bags while we shopped.Not a fan of the location, close to shops and international market place but not close to the beaches. Parking spaces are few and you had to pay for it if you could get it.Average rating mainly due to location would have been a very good had it been closer to the beach

Certainly not from the third floor. I'm looking across the street at a crappy looking apartment building, and the noise from the street is terrible. I'll eat the cost of the next two nights and move to another place.

Although the hotel is on a side street, this gives tranquility in a busy Waikiki, but not far from the hustle and bustle of tourist actions. Rooms are clean and fair in dimension, given the premium of real estate in Honolulu. The hotel offers free WiFi, but charges $23.00 per day for first come first served parking; so, return early if you want to park. Otherwise, you will have to hunt down a parking space in Waikiki - a monumental task! The hotel will compensate parking fee. Cost of hotel stay is affordable; the best part is NO resort fee, which can be as high as $30 per day. Staff are friendly, helpful, and most of all - very patient - a value that is hard to come by.

This was one of the cheaper hotels within 2 blocks of Waikiki beach. It got good reviews so felt safe to book it. It was older than I expected and the doors to the rooms were outside entrance as well. It was clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was very big. We always had clean towels and garbage was emptied. There is a coffee maker with Kona coffee everyday. Also a fridge and microwave which was very handy. However the indidvidual air conditioning unit rattled constantly as it was installed over the door on a shelf attached above. It was quite noisy but to be fair we didn't complain being the polite Canadians that we are. It was very efficient in keeping the room nice and cool.

While the room we had was an odd shape, thats all that was strange. The hotel is situated directly off one of the main streets and all you need is right there. The beach is one block away. Staff very helpful.

We did a thorough search on all hotels in the area & this was best value!We were happy with rooms, as they were what we expected, but to our surprise, the location was Perfectly situated right off the main party street!But our main highlight was the Super Friendly Staff which were always greeting us every time we left & arrived, gave us heaps of helpful advice and not to mention some great conversations late at night!Will definitely be back and recommend to everyone & everyone!

The hotel is near many smaller and reasonably priced restaurants and souvenir shops. Our room was spacious and completely acceptable. The staff was courteous and accommodating. We took advantage of a reasonably priced extended stay option to rest in our room until our late evening flight to the mainland. We will stay there again.

My family of five chose this hotel for their 2 bedrooms suites with kitchen. We arrived at night and they greeted with the news that the hotel was overbooked and that we would have to move to another hotel saying that we would be upgraded. They LIED !!! They sent us to another hotel (Aqua Waikiki wave) which has no 2 bedrooms suites with kitchen. They gave us a one bedroom room with 3 beds in the Aqua Waikiki wave (see my review on this hotel). It is unacceptable to wait until we show up to tell us that our room is no more available. I reserved my room long time in advance by internet booking. The staff did not make excuses for the situation and they were not concerned that i had kids with me. I was very disappointed.

Stayed at this 'pearl' at the centre of Waikiki on 31 July-5 August 2013. The staff was very helpful.The housekeeper Evelyn did an excellent job of cleaning the room every day. We took the Waikiki Trolley bus at the DFS Galleria (which is 200 m from the hotel) to sightsee all the tourist attractions and shop in Honolulu for 2 days. We went for the Legend Concert called Rock A Hula at the Royal Hawaiian Center and enjoyed thoroughly the evening with lovely 'oldies' songs sung by good singers impersonating Elvis, Madonna, Michael Jackson and Steve Taylor. Don't miss this concert! The USS Arizona Memorial and Battleship Missouri Tour was awesome and worth every cent of your money.

I requested maintenance in for a plugged toilet at 5pm. The housekeeping did not come until my second phone call request at 10pm.Parking was horrible, there is only 22 designated parking stalls for the entire hotel. I was charged parking fees and had to park 3 blocks away for an additional $20 per day. I had to be reimbursed from the hotel for their parking charges as I was unable to park there. After parking three blacks away, you have to walk back to the hotel from parking plus walk three blocks back to your car. Through the walk to and fro we were encountered by many solicitors, a drug dealer and a prostitute.

Myself and my partner stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for 7 nights last month August 2013 , Robbie at reception was very helpful and friendly and nothing was a problem, The housekeeper Lewellyn was friendly and did a great job cleaning the room each day. The Location was great and the rooms were very clean.The only disappointment I had was the air con's motors were loud when running and if we switched ours off at night to sleep you would still hear other motors running from other rooms and their was no pool.

The most nerve wrecking thing is to find the right hotel to stay at when your vacation is for 4+ days. I believe that my boyfriend and I have made a pretty good choice. The best aspect about this hotel, in my opinion, is the staff. Extremely personable and helpful. I didn't feel as if I was talking to a robot every time I called to make a city inquiry or passed by the front desk. And especially, thank you Rachel for making my first night so welcoming!!

Last minute booking due 2 day early arrival. The front desk personnel were professional and genuinely friendly and very helpful (At+) ! Location is in the center of Waikiki, the Aqua Waikiki Wave was nearby across the street. Perfect stay if you don't need to stay right on the beach at Waikiki (nearby 1 block over). Easy access in and out of the hotel using the Ala Wai and Kuhio. Nice to have late night security "hotel key only" access to the hotel and the front desk was also staffed. Parking was the only issue, very limited and overflow option was costly at the Waikiki Trade Center at $45.00 per day. Overall a good central location and a great value.

We stayed from Aug 4th – 11th with the terrific people at AQUA Waikiki Pearl. Just to name a few of our new friends – Ese, Rowena, Daisy, Rachel, Harry, Robbie, Charity, Dexter & Eric. Our stay started with a great friendly welcome. It is every apparent that the guests happiness is important to them so we have an excellent time while in Hawaii. It was a wonderful relief knowing that when we came back to our rooms at the end of the day (very tired) we would be greeted with smiles and “How was your day? May we do anything for you?” all before we get to our freshly cleaned rooms.I will personally miss seeing and visiting about the many fun things to do in Hawaii.Thank You so much for doing a Great Job of making our happiness so important !God Bless all of you.
user_name:
Larry A
Albert Lea, Minnesota, United States

review_body: The staff is wonderful. The rooms are clean and very nice. The room had a coffee maker and fridge. We did not receive our wake up call so make other arraignments if you need to get up at a certain time. I still gave it five stars everything else was just perfect for us. We will be staying with them again.

My friend and I recently stayed here for a 4 day getaway trip. Other then the hiccup of us trying to check in early because our flight landed at 8.00am.The location is perfect and close to everything (2 young females) would want. The staff were super friendly and I would highly recommend this place (other then the pool situation).The junior suite we booked was very comfortable and also very spacious, clean and tidy.I had previously seen a lot of posts regarding noise level. We stayed on Level 4 which is quite close to the ground floor, other then a few slamming doors from the neighbours, we hardly heard anything at all. When booking the next trip with friends, I will be staying here.

I would certainly say this is a good hotel in a great location. Staff was very friendly, especially Eric and Esu? I'm not a 100% on his name, but big Hawaian guy. He was very welcoming. Overall, 5 stars for location. The hotel is basic, but the room was clean and spacious. My only complaint was the elevators which took forever. Other than that, it would be 5 stars. Again, nothing fancy, but you don't come to Hawaii to be in your room. I would stay here again and again just for the location and the friendly staff.

We recently stayed here for a girls trip for 8 days. There was 6 of us and everyone loved it. The staff are all so very helpful and friendly. Nothing is ever a problem and they are always willing to help. We booked all our tours with the help of their concierge - he was great and understood exactly what we wanted and made it happen. Our unit was clean and accommodated all 6 of us easily. The beds were comfortable. We also liked that Aqua Waikiki Pearl was so central. It is in walking distance to the markets, the beach as well as many restaurants. There is a sports bar downstairs, perfect place to stop by after a long day at the beach. The bar staff were always happy and friendly and made you feel welcome. I have already recommended Aqua Waikiki Pearl to friends. I will definitely be back :)

This hotel has everything you need and the location is amazing. What impressed me the most, however, was the friendly and helpful staff. They always greeted you with a smile and were quick to make sure your every need was met. They truly treated us like Ohana :)

We had booked the standard room in advance but we did not like it on reaching the hotel. So we asked in the reception to change our rooms to junior suite. They were booked but somehow they managed to get the perfect room for us. It was on a higher floor and we could see the blue sea (a little bit though) from the balcony. It's only 10 minutes walk to the Waikiki beach and many other shops and malls nearby. The bus stop for all trolleys is just round the corner. Hotel gives complementary towels for beach. We had great fun on the trip. The room service was also very good. No hassles at all !!

If you're over-nighting and are just looking for a place for a quite night's sleep, this is NOT the place for you.....There is no sound proofing in this hotel ANYWHERE... Not in the walls, not in the ceilings, not in the floors and certainly not in the windows. All night long you're subjected to the sounds of trucks backing up, motorcycles drag racing down Kuhio and teenagers smashing bottles.Don't get me wrong, the hotel is nice enough for the money. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Friendly staff, a small sundries shop, even a small massage place. It's just LOUD.If you're the family of five with the screaming baby that was on my flight and in my hotel.... this is probably perfect for you as you're probably not getting any sleep anyways :-(

We just needed a room for an overnight stay in Honolulu before our next flight to Kauai. For $80 including all taxes this hotel was fantastic! The hotel was centrally located, right next to the International market and one block from the Waikiki beach. The room was clean enough and the bed comfortable. We were on the 5th floor and did not notice any street noise. The hotel staff was extremely friendly. Our flight was not until the evening and they checked our luggage free of charge. They were also very helpful assisting us with our online checking for Hawaiian Airlines and printing off our boarding passes. I would recommend for sure!

We stayed at the Pearl for 8 days and we loved it!!! We have a 4 yr old child and there was NO noise problems at all even late at night.. Great location handy to all amenities and public transport and only few blocks from the beach..its clean and housekeeping was excellent our room was always clean even if we left the room late in the afternoon..Staff were friendly and helpful and knowledgeable!!! will definitely stay here again and would recommend it highly to anybody!!! Mahalo and Aloha!!!

I was leery getting a $65/night room in Waikiki but this was perfect. We had a 5 min walk to the beach, easy access to food and shopping. We took the city bus and there is a bus stop really close to the hotel. All staff was friendly!

This was our first trip ever to Hawaii and thanks to the Aqua Waikiki Pearl staff it was a memorable one! I can't emphasize enough how friendly and helpful the staff was! The offered suggestions for restaurants, shopping sites and tours. The hotel itself is cute, clean and cozy. We were on the 10th floor and the room was very clean and spacious. Coffee was complimentary every morning in our room (which was stocked with a coffee maker, microwave and mini fridge). My daughter and I were completely relaxed and felt safe in the area...everything you need is steps away, and the beach is two blocks down! The nightlife is busy around the hotel but it isn't crazy enough to keep you awake. I will definitely return to Hawaii and MOST certain we will stay @ the Pearl. Great experience! I totally recommend to family and friends!

I've been staying at this property, and having others take my recommendation to stay there, for 16 years. That's at least three different owners and half a dozen friends and colleagues -- all of whom loved it. It is still the first hotel we contact when planning a trip. As a flight attendant, I stay in lots of hotels and I often travel for pleasure to Waikiki at the last minute. (It's my husband's favorite place on earth.) The staff at the Pearl has always been accommodating. The addition of an ice machine and vending area is a real improvement. The rooms have a microwave and small frig (great for bringing back the leftovers from the oversized portions common in Waikiki restaurants). Coffee packets are complementary (many hotels in Waikiki charge you for them) and were refreshed generously for us every day. There is someone at the front desk 24/7. Our check in and check out were very fast and the cab they called for our trip back to the airport was there in two minutes. Free newspapers and entertainment guides are available in the lobby every day. One improvement is that this pet-friendly hotel is apparently policing pet owners a bit more stringently. We saw NO pet souvenirs anywhere around the hotel, as we often notice with consternation at other pet-friendly hotels. Internet was fast and free and we had no problems accessing it in our room and even on our balcony. Pillows and linens were crisp and lovely and room was very clean. With a family of three, I appreciate the bigger bathroom. Location is key in Waikiki. At the Pearl you will find a Starbucks so close that it might as well be in the lobby. (Bring a loaded Starbucks card and it's way fast.) A mini-mart is right across the street, well-stocked with beer, wine, liquor and all kinds of sundries, and at reasonable prices. It's literally a few steps across one street and you are at the International Marketplace and then across one more street and you are on the beachfront and in the middle of all that Waikiki offers in the way of restaurants and shopping and hotels. I read that one person found the hotel noisy. I do not find the Pearl any noisier than any other hotel I've stayed at in Waikiki, and less noisy than most. We've probably stayed in half a dozen over the years when the Pearl was full or when my husband was attending a conference hosted at a particular hotel. They were all more expensive than the Pearl, and many not as nice as the Pearl -- noise aside. People who have never been to Waikiki before are often shocked that it IS an urban environment, with all the activity that this entails. If you want absolute peace and quiet, go to the North Shore or Maui or ask for a room facing the canal. Waikiki is more like the Vegas strip or Times Square -- it's full of action and that's what my husband loves about it. While it's unfair to include them in a review of the hotel, I have to mention that the very casual taco place just on the corner (near the Subway sandwich place) made my son a fabulous quesadilla, cheap and fast, and the St. Germain bakery made wonderful spinach quiche along with sweets for breakfast, at a very reasonable price. Some other places we love to eat include Ruffage (the best tuna sandwiches in the world), Cheeseburgers in Paradise (although we prefer the location on Beach Walk, as it is a little less rowdy), California Pizza Kitchen, the Oceanarium at the Pacific Beach Hotel (pricey but worth it, especially with a group when you are VERY hungry) and, of course, our favorite, Duke's Canoe Club.

My family stayed here one night before we had to catch a flight back home very early in the morning. I have NEVER experienced such a loud night in my life. The hotel sits on top of a bar/nightclub so the music was blasting until at least 2am. We could also hear extremely loud music coming from other nightclubs in the area along with lots of street traffic, people talking, motorcycles revving, etc, etc. Granted, we were there on a Friday night but this is Waikiki so I'm assuming it is pretty noisy and busy with crowds every night in the summer. The room itself was basic and bland. We could not wait to leave!

This is our 2nd holiday to Hawaii and the second time staying here for our family holiday. Stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment, everything was great. Have told many ppl about the hotel. Will be back again.

Though I was happy with the room size, my charger literally exploded within a few minutes of plugging it in. The location was close to the beach, but very noisy at night due to the bar at street level and thin windows. The management did send me a new charger, so I was relieved they made it right. Still would not stay here again.

for the price this hotel was more than satisfactory. The staff were brilliant, from the front desk, to the cleaners. We were made very welcome. Rooms were clean and tidy and we found the beds comfy. Being in the 'noisier' part of town, there was a bit of noise on the Saturday night (which we expected) but this in no way caused us dissatisfaction. We were on level 2 (at our request) so I imagine if you were on a higher level you may not even hear the noise. We travelled with our 1 yo and found the junior suite to be a great size and again, the staff were very friendly and helpful as we were travelling with a child. The location was a short stroll through the international market to the beach and there was a supermarket (Food Pantry) one block up which is always convenient when travelling with a little one

We only stayed for two days and the location was great. I had read the reviews of all the hotels in Wakiki seeming to be more run down inside so I wasnt too surprised that this one was not so new looking.The room was clean, the bed was fine. But the noise was bad. We had suggested to be on a higher floor via our internet reservation but they only had the 3rd floor. I thought that would be fine, but it was still too close to the on going motor of the big air conditioning unit. Also we could hear laughter and voices throughout the night.

My family and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the AWP. We stayed here last July and were excited to be coming back again. The AWP did not disappoint! We stayed on the 6th floor and had no issues with noise. The room was cleaned daily and again, my family of four was very comfortable with the size of the room. Beaches are within walking distance, Starbucks on the corner, many restaurants close by and the International Marketplace just across the street. Free wi-fi in rooms is great upgrade from last year. We did have a car and on two nights came back and the lot was full but we just crossed the street and parked at their sister hotel. Not super convenient, but not that big of a deal either. The shining star (stars, really) are its employees. The front desk staff is amazing. Charity, Eric, Harry, Dexter and the rest of the staff treat you like Ohana. Dexter even recognized my family from our visit last year! Always an Aloha or a wave/smile when you enter the lobby. I hope to return to Oahu again next year and have no doubt that my family will stay at the AWP. Mahalo Aqua Waikiki Pearl staff for another wonderful stay. A hui hou kakou.

Went on a girl trip to Hawaii for some R&R and stayed here for 6 nights. If you just need a clean room to sleep and shower, then this is an excellent choice for lodging. It’s in a great location – few blocks from Waikiki Beach with plenty of shops and restaurants around. If you have a car, it’s also a little easier to find street parking. And they have FREE wi-fi!To top it off, the whole staff is wonderful! Everyone here was really friendly and helpful. Walking through the lobby was like seeing friends. Jamar and Robbie at the front definitely made our stay at the hotel pleasant. Jamar was amazing and suggested several beaches, hikes, and restaurants for us to check out. All his suggestions did not disappoint. Will definitely stay here again!

The room we got was not shown on the website. It was a corner room with no balcony, pay per view, phone book, extra pillow, blanket, dry cleaner bag, pen, paper, table or desk to write or eat on. We ended up using the ironing board for our table. Before we got to use the bathroom there was hair on the bathroom floor and hair even stuck to the base board. The sink kept plugging up and the only window you could open was in the bathroom. The parking was so limited, you should count on having to use the public parking car lift that takes time to drop off and pick up. It's about a block away, so you're having to carry your things with you. The only good things were the friendly staff and convenient location to shops and dinning. We asked for an upgrade the next morning to a room with a balcony. It was not expensive for the one bdrm suite that had a full kitchen, but the room had a very bad odor. We sprayed perfume all over, and it didn't help much.

The hotel was perfect for what we need. The rooms were clean and tidy and big, so big tha the TV was a little bit to far from the bed. The staff was great and very friendly. They had fresh water with watermelon in it and coffee all day at the reception. The location was perfect, near Waikiki beach and al the nice shops arround. Something no so good was the parking lot, allways full and a little expensive. We parked on a parking lot just a few meters away and it was cheaper. Another thing not no so good was that at night the street gets a little bit noisy.Although this 2 things we had an excellent time, and we defenitelly would stay at the hotel again,

I stayed for 7 days there (for joining 2 day tour of other islands and visiting friend). Its location is very good. Easy access to the Waikiki beach and many restaurants nearby. They also provide microwave (besides fridge) in room. Most of all is their reasonable price in Waikiki. But they seem not taking care of customer's security. One night the electric power in my room suddenly shut down and it was all dark in room. I have to use my iPhone having light to find the room phone for calling the front desk. They did come in a few minutes and tell me that the main switch of my room electric power (which is outside my room and easily reached by anyone) is trun off by someone. They said it always happens. Another issue that I joined a day tour for Hawaii Big Island and have to depart at 5am early morning for the airport. When I go out of my room, I find a man sleeping outside my door (near corridor). Such things really scare a single woman (me) traveling alone! One more weird thing: when I come back from the day tour that night, a fake Visa credit card (have name but no signature) is inserted in my key slot and they didn't clean up my room that day! For security reason, I won't stay there again.

What wonderful staff that work here!! Looking for a nice, clean, comfortable place to stay off the main drag but very close to all the necessities of Waikiki. We just needed a place to stay for several days, but didn't request an ocean view so got a lovely view of the parking lot behind the building.....oh well. Our other needs were more than met. We needed help making after hours arrangements for a trip to the Arizona Memorial and the desk staff (6/3/2013 night Charla??) called and made necessary arrangements so that we were able to get this done the next day. Several additional requests for extra room supplies were met with cheerful, friendly, and rapid customer service...thank you all for your hard work! It is very good to see folks that truly enjoy their work environment and put customer satisfaction #1.............

Only stayed one night prior to flight to Brisbane but impressed with room size incorporating twin queen size beds but still leaving plenty of room to walk around in. The cleanliness and lack of noise surrounding our room was great and we had a good nights sleep before our flight.The locality was excellent just a 5 minute walk from The International markets but down a side street towards the beach. The staff were very helpful and eager to please. I would not hesitate to stay here again in the future.Very well priced.

My friends and I were in town for a wedding and we decided to book several rooms at this hotel. It is in a great location - on the quiet side of the International Market Place, and near several tasty restaurants. Each morning, staff cleaned our rooms and gave us a new towels. The hotel offers free wi-fi and the staff is amazingly friendly and helpful! There's a computer in the lobby so that you can check into your flight online beforehand. I've stayed in several different hotels in Waikiki, and this one was great and reasonably priced! The room was spacious, although there was a limited amount of furniture. This didn't bother us since it allowed us to walk around the hotel room without bumping into each other constantly. There's a safe that you can use in the closets as well. I would definitely stay at this hotel again when I return.

Fairly handy to the beach, easy access to shops and food.Had to ask for bed linen change and tea/coffee top-up, otherwise clean. Staff were very obliging and friendly.Hotel faced a one-way access street between main roads and was noisy all hours of day and night. Good sized balcony,but no sea view

My family and I recently had a 14 night stay at the Aqua Pearl and must say it was a very pleasant experience. It was our first time visiting the island and our stay is wanting us to return in the future. The hotel is a family friendly hotel and is clean and comfortable. We stayed on the 6th floor and found it was good for the noise factor, the higher the better. Of course you will get garbage truck noise , cant avoid that. You pay for what you get. It is not a five star hotel, so don't stay here if your looking for glitz and glamour. A huge positive is that the Aqua Pearl is very central to every day needs, Food Pantry in next block, Star Bucks on the corner for wonderful coffee, International markets across the road, beach just a short walk. The staff are of the upmost friendly people I have ever met ( Charity, Rachel, Eric , Harry just to name a few) they are all very inviting people. All in all, our stay with our 3 children was excellent and will stay here again. Well worth it. A+++++++++++

I stayed at a different Aqua hotel last year and I chose Aqua Pearl this year based on the location and good reviews from Trip Advisor. I have to admit, most reviews are correct. The hotel is really well-located. It's closed to the bus and trolley stops. A grocery store and a popular Japanese udon are just a block away. It's a long walk to the beach anyway. Staffs at Aqua Pearls are much friendlier than those at the other Aqua hotel I stayed last year. I booked the junior suite, so the room was quite large. Beds were clean and comfortable. Bathroom was clean too. After 10pm, the hotel entrance is closed and guests have to use to scan the room access card to enter the hotel. I think it's a plus. I like free Wi-Fi access in the room and the free Apple computer at the lobby for everyone to use. The only cons I found are the hotel is quite noisy in early morning due to the garbage pickup trucks even though my room was on 8th floor. There are limit parking space and they charge $23/day and they don't have a pool. I myself prefer the beach than the pool. Overall, my family really enjoyed our time at Aqua Pearl. If you're looking for a luxury hotel, then Aqua Pearl is not for you. If you're looking for clean hotel, comfortable bed in a central location, then you should try Aqua Pearl out. I definitely return to Aqua Pearl for my next trip to Oahu.

We stayed one night in this hotel because we were going on a cruise the next day. For the money, this is a very great hotel. I booked this hotel on the Aqua Waikiki Pearl website and got a 20% discount. Rooms our very clean and it is in a perfect location. I had no complaints. I did not hear any club noise from outside the room. Elevators worked fine. I rate this hotel 4.5 and if I come back to Hawaii I would really consider staying here again.

This is the place you want to stay if you are going to Hawaii on a budget.The room are clean and a bit small but you don't need much sinces you will spend your time outside. The staff are really nice and helpful, don't hesitate to ask them anything.The hotel is very well located. This is a grocery store in walking distance.The only thing I badly missed was a pool.This is not a luxury hotel but I didn't pay for one either.

Our family of six stayed in a three bedroom apartment, and was very clean and comfortable. The apartment looked like it had been recently renovated, with main bathroom and ensuite to the main. Air conditioning was vey good also, with split systems in two bedroms and lounge/kitchen. Value was fantastic, and a great location, only metres from the international market and a five minute to the beach.

First, like the other reviewers have said, request a higher floor. The first night we were on the 5th floor and I actually cried at about 3am as I was so tired and there was just loads of noise echoing up between all the buildings. We had also booked a king but ended up with 2 doubles (how's that for our romantic get away?). We were moved farther up for the remainder of the week and had the daily garbage truck noise, but otherwise not bad.It's very basic and housekeeping leaves a bit to be desired (vacuum anyone?). There is no view to speak of - just buildings and parking lots. If you have difficulty with stairs, there seems to be ongoing drama with at least one of the elevators and there were long waits.That said, the bed was clean and the location made for easy walking to the beach, markets and shopping. The day staff were very helpful in recommending and arranging attractions and shuttles for us. Also note that you need your key to enter the lobby at night.If you're looking for romance, pay more elsewhere - it'll be worth it.

My wife and son who flew in from Los Angeles stayed here for 3 days in February 2013, a stay that was cut short due to a blizzard in Boston. The hotel is located in downtown Honolulu about a 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach. Parking was sparse, only about 20 spaces but we managed to get a spot each evening. Yea the area is lively and a bit loud but it is downtown Honolulu and there is a bar that is adjacent to the hotel. We stayed on the 6th floor. Rooms were clean but not big. The television was rather small. There was an IHOP about 12 minutes away for breakfast. Each room has a large window probably 6x9 feet. As we were walking to our room around midnight on the first night after a 12 hour flight, we walked by a room that had the drapes open wide. There was a young couple having sex on he bed. Oh well, kids on vacation which was not really the fault of the hotel. What happened next was a little troubling. On the second day after returning from breakfast, we discovered that our son's laptop was missing from the room. We immediately notified the front desk and we later filed a report with the Honolulu police. The staff was helpful in the matter but denied that it would have been any them who took the laptop. Did we accidently leave the door ajar? Did someone from the hotel take it? Was it taken by a professional thief? We probably will never know what happened. Our son is presently working with the hotel's insurance company on the matter. In all fairness to the hotel, other than the 2 incidents just described, we were happy with the hotel and its accomadations. Dexter was great in helping us with a cancellation of the first night due to the blizzard and as stated, the staff was courteous and helpful with our son concerning his laptop.

I was a bit skeptical at first but it actually turned out to be better than I expected! I'm very pleased.Pros:1) VERY friendly, funny, and awesome front desk staff-helped out a lot with excursions/attractions, transportation, night life, places to eat, etc etc.(names I remember are charity, jamal, and eric but there were many more!) *thumbs up*2) The watermelon water was SOOO refreshing.3) Location is awesome. Just down the street from Murakame Udon (winning!)4) Just a few minute walk from the beach, farmers market, arcade, ABC store shopping area and good eats.5) Free WiFi6) a lot cleaner than expected7) Elevator did not take long at all! I read some reviews about only having one working elevator and it worried me at first when I found out I was on the 7th floor, but they got it fixed and now it works great! So no problems with the elevator.8) Microwave, coffee maker, and fridge was really useful. (plus the free coffee and tea was nice)9) Bathroom was clean and towels were changed daily.Cons:1) The hotel room doors shut really loud (I woke up from it a few times from my neighbor shutting there door)2) A bit loud in the morning from the streets and the garbage man but it wasn't a big deal at all.3) Air condition was good but a bit loud.4) I noticed the maintenance staff forgot to change my sheets 1/7 days I was there.Other than that, I would defiantely recommend it to my friends and family and would visit again. It exceeded my expectations by far! especially for the price.

We were looking for a place in Waikiki for our 2 night stay, and this fit perfectly. The staff was all very friendly and helpful. The rooms were simple and maybe a little dated, but very clean and had everything we needed. We were an easy walk to everything in Waikiki, and yet we found the hotel very quite and safe at night. It may not of had a pool, but being so near the beach, why would we need it. And the price couldn't be beat.

My daughter and I recently spent 5 days at the Aqua Pearl. We upgraded our room to a junior suite and it was definitely worth the extra $15 per day. The first room was clean and pleasant, but did not have a balcony or a view. And it did have quite a noisy air conditioner.The staff at the front desk were always friendly and cheerful. The cleaning staff were exceptional.If you are looking for a clean, safe hotel at a reasonable price and an excellent location, this one is perfect.

We stayed for 6 nights and loved this hotel. The whole staff was great. They all were friendly and helpful. The location was great. Only a couple blocks from the beach and very easy to get there. The hotel was clean and all our needs were seen to. We would definitely stay again. The only negative comment is that the concierge that helped us with our arrangements seemed clueless as to what he was doing and was not up on local information. The regular concierge we didn't use but he didn't seem very friendly. Never said hello when you walk by, never smiled. That was the only downfall but you can go to one of their sister properties if need be. We can't wait to go again. This was my fourth visit but my familys first. They all loved it and would stay there again. Wanted to give a thumbs up to Eric and Rachel who were the best. We dealt with them the most when there but all employees were great.

Considering the good location, this hotel is value for money. It is one block from Waikiki Beach, less than 50 metres from the International Market Place, Starbucks is on the corner and restaurants and shops are close by.We received an upgrade before arrival to a Junior Suite which was quite a big room with a balcony (facing other apartment blocks and a laneway) on the 8th floor. The room was rather dated and basic. There was a king and queen bed, one bedside table, desk and one chair (for 2 guests?) though there were 2 chairs and a table on the balcony, a TV, microwave, mini fridge and coffee maker. The lighting was quite poor and dim, room being lit only by lamps. The air conditioner was quiet and worked well over the 3 nights we spent here. The bathroom was in need of maintenance... fixtures loose or missing and the shower head rather rusty with restricted water flow. We liked the comfortable bed providing a good night's sleep, the free wi-fi and being on the 8th floor it was quiet. We never had to wait very long for the lifts to the ground floor and the water dispenser with watermelon in it in the lobby was refreshing. The front desk staff polite and service was acceptable, nothing especially praiseworthy like other reviewers have noted.We didn't like the lack of cleanliness and lack of servicing of the room. This is what let the hotel down for us. On first arrival in the early evening, our room was ready and appeared clean as you would expect, but closer inspection revealed a different story. The carpeting was stained and the bathroom tiled floor was tacky/sticky with residue from not being properly cleaned and rinsed. It stayed this way for the duration of our stay. For the next 2 days, our room was never serviced/cleaned before 2pm and one day well after 3.30pm. This is unacceptable. After doing a morning hike to Diamond Head, we came back around lunchtime for a shower to an unserviced room and therefore had to re-use our wet, dirty towels. After going and coming a number of times from our room, we mentioned that our room hadn't been serviced and were told, "yes, the staff were in a meeting". Maybe they ran out of time because when the room was eventually serviced the only evidence was clean towels. Toiletries were not replenished, hair, dirt and a rubber band that had been on the floor since our arrival were still there. Everything in the room was as we had left it/moved it and the rubber bath mat, instead of being rolled back up and placed on the side of the bath like when we arrived, was still in the bottom of the bath indicating the bath had not been cleaned... that and the suds still on the tiled wall were a dead giveaway. Also as a previous reviewer noted, there was a bit of a problem with bugs in the room, especially the bathroom. When we were using the bathroom, we could also hear the neighbours in their bathroom through the vent in the common wall.Would we recommend or stay again in this hotel?... I don't think so. We will accept a dated and basic room, we will accept a little time delay, but we will never accept poor attention to detail and uncleanliness. This could've been a more pleasant stay had the hotel got their act together!

Our stay at Aqua Waikiki Pearl was wonderful. The location is perfect and the staff are very friendly and helpful. We stayed in the Junior Suite which was very spacious for Honolulu standards. The rates are very reasonable and the facilities at this hotel are very good. We have been to Honolulu 15 times and would not hesitate to stay here again. Only criticism was the carpets were a bit dirty but that is minor. Overall a great place in great location with very reasonable rates.

This was our first time to Hawaii after 30 years. We had the best time. We stayed at this hotel for 2 days before and 4 days after doing the Pride of America cruise (which was fantastic). We had a standard room for the first 2 days and it was spacious and clean. The staff were the best, very obliging and helpful. Our stay was great. For the last 4 days we had a bigger room with a balcony and this was even better. Both rooms had a microwave and a fridge and we ate in a couple of times as we were exhausted from having a good time. The location was perfect - close to buses, beach(very short walk),Denny's, International Marketplace and best of all close to Ross. Big thanks to Jay ("Harry" as my husband called him) as he helped make our stay even better
user_location: Dora Creek, New South Wales, Australia
user_name:
Janet_M_13450
Dora Creek, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Location across from the international market was handy. Staff were pleasant enough. Airconditioning works. Management needs to spend some serious money to bring this hotel up to par. Rented a Junior suite so we could enjoy a lanai. Carpets are grubby and in dire need of a steam clean. My feet were dirty 10 minutes after taking a shower. Grime around metal frame of sliding door. Magnetic seal on the fridge is weak causing the door to be ajar and ice to melt on more than one occassion. Couldn't enjoy lanai because of noisy road repairs during the day and the chap across the road using a circular saw in the evening. Noisy all the time it seems. Drunkards leaving the bar downstairs at 2am. Then come the garbage trucks. No pool. Why come all the way to Hawaii and stay in this dump? People who have given rave reviews must be hallucinating.

I have been on this hotel several times in the past, starting 20 years ago when it even had a different name. My previous stay to this trip was in 2009 for a couple times. I was able to get better rates when calling front desk or emailing them rather than booking online using all different websites. The room had microwaves and fridge which are a plus in case you are staying for several days. The location is very good, close to several shops, to the beach and to the main street - there is even a Starbucks a few meters away on the corner.The down side is the same as most hotels there, the parking... it costs 23.00 per day and they do not have space enough for all guests - do not even consider double parking since they will tow your car. Aditional parking is on another hotel accross the street.Internet is ok - not very fast but will do most what is needed in reasonable speed.I would definitively return on my next visit to Honolulu.

This small hotel is very comfortable. As previous reviews have stated, the air conditioner is a little loud, as are the sounds from other doors closing. The room was comfortable and well attended. The staff were superior in attentiveness. I was very impressed with the manner in which the front desk staff handled a sensitive matter (not the fault of the hotel's) from a very angry guest. They were patient, professional and attentive. I definitely recommend this hotel.

From the moment I walked in to this beautyFULL hotel... all of my senses were seduced. The watermelon water that's offered in the lobby is so REFRESHING after a day at the beach. ALL of the staff were very warm and inviting and due to complications I had to leave my luggage with them for a few days... EVERYTHING was well taken care of and one of the bellman even arranged a last minute shuttle for me to make it to the airport on time. I would HIGHLY recommend staying here if you are ever in the area... there are about 16 different locations though so be sure you know which AQUA you are staying at. Overall my experience was one of the BEST & being from Las Vegas I expect allot when it comes to service. THANK YOU to ALL the staff for ALL that you do on a daily basis!!! Keep up the good work... I will definitely return when I am visiting Hawaii in the future :)

Before my travels I read somewhat mixed reviews about this hotel, but was pleasantly surprised with how great of an experience I had. This hotel is in a terrific location, especially for the price. Only a couple minutes walk to the beach (we made this trek at least 20 times, as it was so close). Also right in the center of shopping, including the international market. The hotel had a nice amount of space (there was 6 of us in a 2 bedroom unit) and we never felt cramped or in each other's way. The unit has a small kitchen with a medium sized fridge and is stocked with dishes, pots, pans, toaster etc. for dining in. Most importantly this unit was clean! The decor is modern and consistent throughout the units (from what we could tell). No pool, which is a bit of a downfall, but like I said the beach is practically a hop, skip, and a jump away. Housekeeping came everyday with fresh towels and toiletries and to make beds and dispose of trash. Overall a wonderful experience, would definitely stay here again! Thank you Aqua Waikiki Pearl!

It may not be a 5 star hotel BUT the front desk AND security service during my stay was a 5 star. All hotel employees were friendly, professional, personable, experienced, knowledgeable about so many things like directions, places to and how to get there. At night I would chat with some of the night crew, we laughed, chatted and shared some of life's experiences with each other. I wouldn't stay at another hotel if I should go back and I hope I do someday. I can honesty say I miss the staff at Aqua Waikiki Pearl Hotel. Charity, Rachael, Ese and another daytime tall man were so awesome! I really do miss them. They all made my stay very pleasant.

We stayed here for two nights at the end of April. Spacious room (which lacked a chair - only had a couch). Included a 'kitchenette' that was not well supplied (no paper towels or dish towels, for example.) Great location (just a few minute walk to the beach and great restaurants.) Very friendly staff. Local grocery store delivered groceries before our arrival (great service!) Room was not clean (hair in tub drain, bugs on counter) and even had a gecco on the wall. We are not squeamish folks and understand the challenges of tropical weather. When we camp, we expect bugs. But not in a hotel.
user_name:
C J
Saukville, Wisconsin, United States

review_body: An excellent hotel with value for money. Having been to Honolulu many times this is a quiet achiever. If needing an in house restaurant is not on your agenda this is a goer. (There are dozens of eateries within meters anyhow!)Don't judge the outside of the building looking a bit average as the rooms are extremely spacious and well appointed.A bonus is the staff friendliness from Front office through Housekeeping.
user_name:
Bruce P
Clovelly, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We we're first time travelers to Hawaii and staying at this hotel defiantly made our experience all the more enjoyable. The staff are very friendly, helpful and would do anything to make sure you enjoy your experience and not just at the hotel. Rooms are very spacious, very clean and comfortable. Location is perfect, close to the beach, shops, transport and restaurants. We will defiantly be returning to the Aqua Waikiki Pearl and recommending this hotel to all our family and friends. We traveled as a couple but this defiantly would be perfect for families too.

I went to Hawaii for a cheerleading competition and stayed at the Awua Waikiki Pearl. The location is very convenient. We walked nearly everywhere and the buses and taxis always were there on time. A few of my friends and I made great friends with boys from the front desk. Harry, Eric, Jamar and Dexter. These four sicklads made the trip worthwhile. They put a smile on your face everytime you walked in or out of the door. Overall I enjoyed my stay and hope those four lads get promotions. They deserve it :)
