We switched hotels our first day in Honolulu and I found Aqua Waikiki Pearl last minute to have 2 rooms for us for 6-nights. It was the best decision we made. The staff was great, very friendly and the rooms were spacious. This hotel is truly under rated~! I will recommend to my friends and family. The price was reasonable, and the location was perfect. It was nice to enjoy a drink out in the lanai downtown Waikiki. Very positive experience, and again thank you to the wonderful staff!!! We will be back!

We were travelling as a group for a roller hockey tournament so my expectations were not high as it was a "budget" hotel. We arrived very early (too early to check in) but Harry gave us a parking permit and a great recommendation for breakfast. We returned to the hotel about 12:00pm to find our room ready with everything we needed to freshen up. The rest of the stay was great with all staff friendly and obliging. This hotel is only 5 minutes from the beach, has a convenience store across the road and is great value for money. For anyone with allergies (my youngest has a peanut allergy) we can strongly recommend Chillis (around the corner).

Brought back memories of 1970s beach holidays in Australia with my parents. Really to stay here is to take a step back in time, when hotels had bigger rooms, all outdoor corridors, no pools, simple lobbies, simple decor, a slightly shabby appearance - when the world was a simpler place.Let me say the hotel is none the worse for its plain presentation. Staff are very obliging, we were upgraded into a large two roomed apartment, albeit with a rather peculiar layout, perhaps courtesy of the fact that this hotel used to be an apartment block, before it was converted into a hotel about 10 years ago. The location is very convenient, the rooms were large, it was quiet and good value for money. It felt comfortable, like a favourite pair of slip-on shoes.

We came to the Waikiki Pearl to move from our original accommodation plan.Our over all experience was very positive with a few minor exceptions.The staff on the front desk,Harry on days and the night representatives were quick efficient and direct even when they were not able to do all we asked. They were always happy and pleasant.The cleaning were flexible and saw that our room was proper.Louellen and the staff treated us well.The location is in central Waikiki with a very active night life which added to the night time and morning noise.These issues are beyond the control of the management and staff.If you wish 24 hour silence another area of the city might be more appropriate. On the other hand if you want to be in a secure place in the close to everything that makes Waikiki a place to be, at a reasonable price, the Aqua Waikiki Pearl, is worth a serious look..

I was travelling alone and with a mobility scooter, and found this hotel perfect for me. It was easy to get to and from my room with the scooter and I found the staff very helpful. My room was large with a fridge and microwave which was great. It is in a great position, close to everything- International Marketplace, Starbucks, Dennys, Food Pantry (supermarket) as well as public transport and shops and beach. The airconditioner was noisy but I just turned it off because the weather wasn't too hot. There was a bit of noise from other guests running excitedly along the corridor but that was fine too! I found all the staff really helpful and enjoyed the breakfast and afternoon snacks(if i was there at those times) provided in the foyer. I really enjoyed my stay and thought it was great value for money - I would definitely stay there again.

Pros:Spacious room. Comfortable beds. Maid service was very good. Location - 1 block away from the Food Pantry and few other good restaurants. Just a 5 minute walk to waikiki beach. Major bus stop 1 min down the street on Kuhio. Friendly and helpful desk clerks. Internet (wi-fi) was O.K. and the speed was reasonable. Cons:The A/C was a bit louder then I would prefer. View from hotel room is either facing parking lot or the street with another hotel. You will probably end by closing curtains as you don't want to be watched. The main problem is noise. If you are sensitive to loud sounds at night, stay away from this hotel. Soundproofing is definitely required!Conclusion: We got very good price (100$/night) so I shouldn't be complaining too much. If you don't plan to stay a lot at hotel room than and You're not a light sleeper than it's a definite go. Otherwise try other option.

Very friendly staff, checked us in very early in the morning after a long flight from New Zealand. Good location near Waikiki beach, International market place and restaurants. The room was clean, no view and no pool. Coffee and muffins every morning. We found a special on the net, so it was reasonable for this location.

this hotel is in the best spot for trolleys, walking distance to the beach and the other way to the shops. staff is lovely, rooms very comfortable. Highly recommend. only one drawback for me was no pool, but no big deal.

I'd still classify this hotel as 3 stars, but one of the better ones I've stayed in. Primarily because we found the customer service exceptional. Front desk were very helpful and super friendly. We were upgraded to a bigger room with king, but we didn't have a private balcony. Who cares? We were in a very clean room that had been updated, with a comfy king bed and plenty of room for our portable crib for keiki. Continental breakfast was very basic, I'd opt for eating out, but again, overall I'm was really satisfied with the value. If you're looking for budget, look no further.

This is a good value hotel in a great central location. It is not on Waikiki beach and has no pool and is well priced accordingly.It is a short walk to the beach and to everything else.The staff were excellent and the rooms were clean and spaciousOn the down side, the room air conditioners need to be upgraded to newer more silent split systems. The current ones are noisy and in efficient.As with any good hotel, the staff make the difference and they were extremely helpful and Mac, the Concierge was great.MarkSydney Australia

When I saw the price for this hotel I was a little worried, but I needn't have been. For a rate that is a lot cheaper than its competitors, I found the hotel to be neat, clean and the service to be brilliant. The location is excellent, with all of Waikiki's attractions in easy walking distance. I also walked to Ala Moana shopping centre on a couple of occasions, however this might be difficult for a lot of people (but don't worry - the bus and trolley stops are just around the corner from the hotel).It's not really a place to go for your honeymoon, but I'd highly recommend this hotel for couples and single travelers who are after good value in a good location.

A great fair priced hotel large rooms very clean free wi fi great staff I have stayed here for 10 nights you even get a light breakfast served in lobby what more do you need it may not have a view but hey who has time to sit on a baloney when you are in Hawaii not me would I stay here again I sure would they also have a safe and microwave

Stayed here for 4 nights (10 March to 14 March 2013). This hotel makes no false claims. You have what you need at a price that is affordable compared to most Wiakiki hôtels. The service was EXCELLENT!!! ANything we needed or asked for was provided to us within 5 minutes. The staff are exceptionally friendly (especially Harry who is quite a hoot) and always willing to accommodte your needs as much as they can. This hotel was clean and comfortable and spacious. We had a 2 bedroom- kitchen suite (there were 4 of us) which was supplied with what we needed to feel right at home (pots, pan, dishes, microwave, stove top). It is a 5 minute walk to the beach and a 20-30 minute walk to the zoo and aquarium. I would stay here again!Dianne

Stayed here March 2013 for 6 nights. Positive things : Excellent staff ; clean rooms ; walking distance to the beach is probably 1 to 1 1/2 blocks ; rates are reasonable ; suite was very roomy, there were 6 of us and we never felt cramped ; can't say enough about the staff. Just looking at Aussieliv's review -- I think it's fair to say that it probably doesn't matter where you are at night there are going to be shady characters, we actually walked up to the beach at night because my daughter thought she left her camera there - and there are "characters" at the beach too - but during the day these "characters" are nowhere to be seen, more specifically if you want to spend $400-$500 / night then stay at a five star hotel - if you are interested in a clean room that has housekeeping done to it daily (fresh towels, beds made etc.) and close to the beach and still want to have some money in your pocket for other things - then this is a good place to be. We spent our entire day out and about and only came back at night to sleep, a plus was we asked for beach towels at the front desk each day - so it was nice not to have to pack beach towels ! I would suggest, if you are a light sleeper then you should ask if you can get a room on one of the higher floors.

Near international market and a block away from waikiki beachfront..Room is spacious, clean and with huge bathroom that is appropriately stocked. The bed is super comfortable. A safe is provided.Stayed on the 5th floor - so noise was not a problem.the lift is quite slow though.Parking is limited - they however have a back up parking which is a block away but too much hassle because the streets in these area are mostly ONE WAY. So, if parking is not available it is going back to busy streets. But this is anywhere in Waikiki i guess -- There is a Starbucks at the corner, a pizza place across and a cheap but delicious, gourmet Ramen place at Kuhio avenue ( Marukame Udon) that prepare their udon fresh.The street it's on (Nahua) is one way from Kuhio towards Ala Wai Blvd - so you are driving away from busy to less congested.

Very helpful guy at desk on checkin. Reasonable price and central to everything.s.ome other guests were a biT noisy but that wasn't the hotel's fault. Didn't need the air conditioner . Rooms big with plenty of amenities, safe,microwave etc.

This hotel feels like it is in the Ghetto area of Waikiki. Lots of shady people around the hotel and drugs deals going on at the corner. If you stay on the parking lot side you will have a room with a noisy air conditioner. If you stay on the street side prepare for no sleep. It sounded like people were fighting in our room it was that loud. It is also scary for kids when all they can hear is police sirens and people swearing and fighting as well as Harley's roaring up and down the street. Our room absolutely stank. Kids would not walk in the corridors as they were scared. Have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian village and and Wyndham Waikiki Beach Walk and both were excellent. This place is a dump. Don't be fooled by the reviews on Tripadvisor like I was- it is the pits and put a dampener on our holiday.

Booked this place because of the location and decent reviews, plus reasonable price (especially for Spring Break time); wasn't disappointed. A bit older, but well-maintained, very friendly and knowledgeable staff, awesome location, can walk to anything, big room with lots of space, fridge, micro, free local calls. Would definitely stay here again.

Took a spontaneous trip to Oahu with just the kids and just needed a fairly cheap place to stay in close proximity to the beach and shops so booked a room thru Trip Advisor using a promo code.Love that its located in central Waikiki, but if you're a light sleeper or have kids that are sensitive to loud sounds at night, stay away from this hotel. It gets super loud at night since there's many bars around and for some reason, Harley riders loved going down this street at night and gunning it for everybody to hear(and feel) them zoom by. Incredibly annoying. Just be prepared.My other big gripe is what most other people already brought up. The elevators. First off, there was only 1 working for nearly our entire stay and its SLOW and SMALL. It amused me they had a sign that said they are "modernizing" the elevators. WTF is modernizing? haha It certainly didn't include making them faster or more efficient. I noticed they fitted new buttons and decor but Id rather have faster elevators than fancy buttons. So one busy morning we waited about 10 min for the elevator to go down and twice when it got to our floor(4th) it was already full so we said the hell with it and I folded up my son's stroller and we walked it down the stairs. Needless to say, I was irritated already.The lobby has a nice modern(ized) feel but its a little deceiving since the rest of the hotel isn't as updated. Don't let the lobby fool you!The standard rooms were quite large but what I didn't get was why there was only 1 chair in the entire room at the desk. No bench, no sitting chair so you either sat on that one chair or on the bed. And this goes for the balcony too. Nice big table but only ONE chair? Who's bright idea was that? I understand the view isn't the best but couples will occasonally sit and have soem coffee or eat a malasada outside and if there's only 1 chair outside its useless.Last but not least has again to do with the noise. We weren't able to get a room that didn't face the street so the sliding door was shut at night. However, our room had a HUGE crack on one end of the window where the frame of the sliding door meets with the wall and not only warm air came thru but sound as well! I should've taken a picture of that it was so appalling. They can put granite counter tops in the bathroom, put in a flat screen tv, but you can't renovate the sliding doors? Not cool.The sole reason I'm not giving this place a 1 star rating is the value for the money and its centralized location. The complimentary taro and sweet rolls, and muffins, coffee, tea in the morning is nice as well. I'm usually not a harsh critic but had to expose this place for what it really is in hopes that mgmt will fix these glaring issues.

Came here earlier this year and had a wonderful stay. Great location, close to tourist spots such as Waikiki beach. Very friendly staff, beautiful rooms (especially loved the huge bathroom, was wonderful), and very clean. Would recomend this place to anyone.

The Aqua Pearl is a lower cost hotel with very roomy, comfortable rooms. We appreciated the microwave and mini fridge. The staff was exceptional. They went out of their way to make our stay everything we were looking for. They had muffins and fresh pineapple juice available every morning. The beach was a block away, easy walk. The international center was across the street and public transportation to anywhere on the island was around the corner. If you are looking for a comfortable, cost effective way to stay on Waikiki I would recommend this hotel every time.

My best friend and I stayed here for 6 nights. I had read about this place here on trip advisor...and all i had read was true! The first thing that jumped out at me was the friendliness of the staff. They were very welcoming and helpful. All the staff were friendly and helpful and answered all the questions we had but Eric, you totally saved us more then once, always had an answer and solution and always had a smile! Mahalo! The hotel is totally central to everything! Waikiki beach is between 5 to 10 minutes walk, depending on how fast you want to walk or how far up the beach you want to go. There are dining options all around, from Chili's to Denny's to hot dogs and noodles, there is somewhere to eat for everyone all just a few minutes walk. The pharmacy and food pantry are around the corner, and an ABC store just across the road. The bus stop is literally around the corner. We were a 5 minute walk to all the shops on the main strip at Waikiki, the location was just right. We stayed on the 5th floor facing the other hotel. We were a bit reluctant to open the curtains as all the other guest from the other hotel could see us but we were never in our room so it didn't really matter. Our room was clean and spacious, bed was comfortable and we were provided with all the beach towels we needed. We had free wifi in our room which was great.The A/C was a bit louder then I would prefer but I didn't lose sleep over it. There is no pool in the hotel but seriously, just walk 5 mins and jump in the ocean! You're in Hawaii! Check-In and Check-Out were easy and quick. I would recommend the Aqua Pearl to anyone looking for great value in Waikiki. Mahalo to all the staff!

Had a 3 night stopover at the Aqua Pearl. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is centrally located with a great noodle bar around the corner and also a Japanese Seafood buffet restaurant down the road, both worth a try. Many other dining establishments all around the place with markets and shops all within easy walking distance. The Pink Trolley (tram) that takes you to Ala Moana shopping centre and local buses stop just around the corner from the hotel. We had room (501) that faced the alleyway next to the hotel and therefore could not open the curtains as guests staying at the adjacent hotel across the alleywaycould look directly into the room (all 200 of them!) if we did so. Ask for a room facing the street or the back carpark to ensure a little more privacy. As we were out all day and most of the evening it was not such a big problem, more of an annoyance in the morning when we got up and wanted to check the weather. (Net curtains would have helped a little). No gym and as there is no pool at this hotel, beach towels were not supplied. Beach is an easy 5 minute walk away. The room was a good size, very clean and tidy and had a decent mini fridge, a safe and sufficient storage space. Bed and pillows were very comfortable.

My wife and I purchased a package deal with RCI, in connection with a time share condo we used to own, but no longer do; for a cruise and resort stay package. We chose the Hawaii package, since going to Hawaii had been high on our "bucket list" for some time. The cruise was a seven-day cruise on Norwegian Cruise Line of the other three islands; and that was a fantastic experience. However, the resort was a different experience. We were supposed to get a seven-day resort stay also, but there was only one resort that they had in their program; and that was on one of the other islands. After considerable negotiating with RCI, they gave us four days stay in the Wyndham Royal Gardens. It was nice, but not in a very convenient location; and they would not give us the two extra nights we needed prior to boarding the cruise ship. We were looking for an alternate place to stay for those two nights, and we asked one of our tour bus drivers for a recommendation. He said, "you mean an affordable place", and I said, "that is exactly what we want". He recommended the Waikiki Aqua Pearl, which was located about eight blocks from where we were staying, located in the middle of good restaurants, shopping; and less than two blocks from the Waikiki Beach. It is a basic small hotel, very clean, excellent service, courteous staff, and only $116 per night in Waikiki. They did not have a restaurant, but there is a good selection of restaurants within easy walking distance from the hotel. We stayed the two nights prior to starting the cruise, plus one night following the cruise to take advantage of a better price on our flight from Honolulu to Milwaukee. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone looking for basic clean good lodging. Even though we feel we were short-changed by RCI, we ended our Hawaiian vacation on a very high note with the cruise and the stay at Aqua Pearl.

Stayed 1 week in early March on the 9th floor in a 1 bedroom jr. suite. Wonderful balcony. Treats for breakfast between 7-9 a.m. and in late afternoon. Very spacious room. Comfortable beds. Maid service was very good. The Mitsubishi ACs with remote controls were quiet and efficient. Location 1 block away from the Food Pantry is super convenient. Also, quick photo processing for 17 cents per photo in the next door drug store. Just a 10 minute walk to the Royal Hawaiian Center. Major bus stop is 5 minutes down the street on Kuhio. Very pleasant desk clerks. Quick check-in and check-out. A WONDERFUL STAY.

We (7 of us) stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for 5 nights in November 2012. The hotel was clean, clean, clean, rooms were clean, but were sparse. We had stayed in a three bedroom suite (be prepared, both bathrooms are off of rooms - the third bedroom had no bathroom, so you had to go into someone else's room to use the bathroom/shower). The kitchen was sparse, only setting for 4 people. This was fine as we only used the kitchenette for breakfast and lunch. The dining table was for 4 people. The fridge was full size, the stove had two burners, microwave and small 2 cup coffee maker. The living room had a pull out couch, and a TV, nothing else, a big open space. This was great for the kids, but no coffee tables. The rooms were a good size and the AC worked really well. The beds were comfortable.Wifi only in the lobby.Across the street from the international market and a 10 minute walk from the beach. Starbucks was on the corner.Hotel was not expensive, but you get what you pay for.

I've stayed in several Aqua Resorts and always been pleased, especially with the staff and little extras. The Waikiki Pearl is one of their budget properties, so I wasn't expecting something grand like the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The Good: staff is friendly, accommodating and professional. I asked for an upgraded room and it was quickly cleaned and made available for me. I also liked the lobby snacks, free wi-fi and close parking.On the flip side, the hotel is old and small, with virtually no lobby and certainly no curb appeal. But then, you usually pay for that in the cost of your room, so I didn't expect it and didn't care. I'd rather have a frumpy lobby and a courteous and kind staff (which was the case), than a grand foyer with an aloof and uncaring reception (had that before, but NOT at an Aqua hotel). One of the two elevators was out of order, which made getting up to the 7th floor onerous. These things happen. Forced us to slow down and chat with the other tourists.The room we had was HUGE (a one bedroom suite). Balcony views are quite unexceptional as they look down on some ratty apartments, but it's still Hawaii and it's always fun to people watch in Waikiki (especially the residents!)I would say the hotel is conveniently located, but I cannot think of a hotel in Waikiki that is not so (except maybe the Hilton Hawaiian Village, which is a destination unto itself). Really, pretty much everything is within walking distance.Arg, they charge $23 per day to park. Going rate, I'm afraid. Not unique to this property.Overall, I got what I was expecting, which was a solid, basic hotel. The only reason I would not stay at this particular hotel again is because, by the time I paid for the upgrade, I could have chosen a slightly more upscale Aqua property and been a little happier. But I will return to Aqua Resorts again and again. They have properties to suit every budget, and I've never been dissatisfied with what I got for the money.

I would highly recommend staying at this hotel while in Waikiki. It was one of Aqua Resorts properties. We were able to get everything we requested: high floor, lanai, king bed, and junior suite with a safe, microwave, frig and coffemaker. The price was so reasonable for the area. The facility has no pool or spa but spending time on the beach was more important.The air conditioning was amazingly quiet for a hotel. The room size was very large. I would recommend requesting a high floor to get farther away from the street noise. The higher floor allowed us to have a partial view of the ocean when we leaned out from our lanai as well. The street noise is loud as the hotel is just off of Kuhio, a very busy street in Waikiki and the trash was picked up early every morning. It is a nonsmoking facility. There is a little bar adjacent to the hotel. We had fun playing darts and drinking $3 mai tais there. Here were the drawbacks from our stay: When we arrived our toilet seat was dirty, but the housekeepers cleaned it for us the next day. (We arrived at 2 a.m. so no housekeepers were there at that hour.) One day we didn't get fresh glasses or paper replensihments, but that was remedied quickly. One elevator was being refurbished, which left one elevator operating for the entire hotel and that made for a bit of a wait. They had snacks for the "winter season", but the rolls for breakfast were nasty. The afternoon snack was good. Good things: We received fresh towels everyday, even though we were willing to reuse them. There are fast food places close, so it is not necessary to spend high prices on food. A grocery store is just around the corner. It was easily accessible to catch the bus, trolleys or any tour buses. The staff was super friendly and helpful. I would stay here again and request all the same things. Wonderful stay!

Great clean room comfortable bed large balcony friendly staff a very reasonable price considering the drastically overpriced waikiki it was across from the international markets 1 block from the beach i would deffinently recommend thi for someone not looking to be ripped off

I stayed for 3 nights the last week of February, 2012. I was surprised at how close it is to Waikiki. Everything is within walking distance. As I was alone, this was very important to me. I was pleased with the pastries and juice in the morning. I also discovered how close it was to King's Square, which had a Farmer's Market later one day. There was also a grocery store closer to the hotel which was also convenient.Brenda
user_name:
Brenda M
Port au Port, Canada

review_body: Revisted the Aqua Pearl for a 3 day stopover enroute to San Francisco, This hotel just gets better each time we visit Waikiki. Apart from quality accommodation for the reasonable tariff,they have now added complimentary light refreshments daily-breakfast-mid mornings & afternoons. Coffee,juice & pastries in the main. Hotel does not have a restaurant onsite so this treat is welcomed before going out on daily sightseeing activity & a more substantial meal. Service standards can't be faulted from the time you check in to departure. Well located off Kuhio Street-short walk to all main tourist attractions in Waikiki-International Market,bus stops & a block from the beach.Highly recommended if you want to avoid expensive hotels also located in the immediate area.

Just got back last week from a 4 night stay! I was surprised by the prices of hotels in Waikiki in general when I was trying to book a hotel, but pleasantly surprised by the reasonable price here. Literally across the street from the International Market and not far from all the action...beach, shops, restaurants. Room was clean and I was even happier once I saw the maid mopping the bathroom floor (had to return to room unexpectedly). Staff helpful and friendly and there's even snacks in the afternoon :)

HI, this is my 2nd time staying at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl and i think my experience this time round was much more joyable. Dont get me wrong, the first time i went i had a great time, the room was fantastic and the staff were great, my review last time was a 4 out of 5. This time i would say that it surpasses that. If there were more stars to add i would have added a couple more.This time round - from the moment i stepped off my shuttle bus at the curb to have someone from the front desk waiting to take my suitcase from me was fantastic, especially for a hotel that is not a luxury rated. The gentlemen at the front desk was so friendly and helpful with everything i needed to accommodate me. Again like last time i was upgraded to a 2brm apartment. Love these people.. It was great. The bathroom is massive, the bedrooms are grand, and the living area and kitchen is very generous. I got a different styled 2brm apartment than i did last time, and the balcony was large.Everytime i would leave the hotel and walk past the front desk, i would stop and have a chat to the men if they were not serving anyone - always friendly.. one of the great things i love about staying at Aqua properties. And it is one of the main reasons i will keep coming back.Now what most people need to know is that the hotel is not on the beach, or the next street down, but is actually closer to the canal. However, if you have never been to Honolulu than here is a tip - Honolulu area of waikiki beach is not that big, this hotel is only about a 3-5min walk through the international market place alley to waikiki beach. Only 2 mins from the international marketplace itself. And if you are looking for a hotel with an apartment than you wont find these on the beach anyway. To end all i can say is thankyou to the team at the front desk for my upgrade from a standard room to a 2brm apartment, thankyou for your friendlyness that always made my day, and thankyou for always having a clean hotel with great service.THANKYOU.

I have booked the room only one month before the trip and prices for other decent Waikiki hotels were high... I have booked the 1 bdrm suite with kitchen & balcony and this was excellent choice. Staff is very friendly, location is perfect only two blocks from Waikiki beach... what means that is it not very crowded. Rooms clean, towels changed daily, wi-fi (free) worked well.... They offer a kind of free continental breakfast and afternoon snacks in (very small) lobby.... nice.... Sports bar (cheap!) in hotel, Starbucks & Food Pantry just few steps away.... perfect.... decent price for parking pass....And couple things to critisize: hotel & rooms a bit tired, carpets in the rooms could be changed, one elevator (of two) still not working (this must last for several months... I saw this remark in reviews from december or even before).... the onyl thing I really hate is blanket between two sheets.... brrrr :(.... My rate is 9/10!

Hotel is comfortable and is quite clean, although more amenities need to be provided such as a KETTLE! I realsed travelling through USA, lots of hotels don't provide kettles?? Our room wasn't being cleaned everyday as I expected, but when we requested clean towels etc, they were quite prompted bringing it up to our room. Staff especially front desk were extremely lovely, very helpful and very funny! My friends and I loved them. WIFI was a tad annoying, because you had to connect everytime you came back to the hotel, when us girls thought it'd be auto? The location of this hotel is within close proximity to everything, so that was a bonus. Would I come back here to this hotel again? Most probably!

This was my first time staying at this hotel property. It is a great location, just a walk off the street in Waikiki, from nearby shops and eateries. The staff was very friendly, and accommodating to all of my needs. The room amenities were a good value for the price paid, and came with air conditioning! (Some hotels on Neighbor Islands are non-air conditioned) I also received a free room upgrade to a Junior Suite, due to my later check-in time of 6:00pm -- who-eey -- a microwave, refrigerator and coffee pot in the room, with a continental breakfast in the lobby every morning from 7am to 9am! Mahalo nui loa, Miz Pam

We stayed for a week, and were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The welcome is warm and genuine, and it is very well placed 2 roads back from the beach, but in a busy area. The Hotel is a bit tired, but clean, and although only 1 lift was working while we were there, the second one is being upgraded and should be active mid march. We had to buy our own tea and milk after using the supplied couple, but cheap enough from the shop opposite which stays open until 11.00pm.Would stay again if the price was right!

Stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is older, but the location and the price can't be beat. The hotel is walking distance from the restaurants, beach, shopping, and is a quick cab ride from the airport. Also, the staff can't be beat. Allan was particularly helpful with watching our bags and restaurant recommendations after a very trying day. I would definitely stay here again.

I gave it 5 out of 5. Is it 5 star? No. But it is very affordable and for the price I don't think I could get cleaner, closer or better service. You are 5 minute walk from Waikiki Beach as well as hundreds of bars, resturaunts, shops, boutiques, shopping centers, bus stops, taxi stops, grocery stores and much more that the center of Waikiki has to offer. Room was clean. AC was cold. Shower was hot. Only reason I gave 4/5 for room was my room had a view of the balcony of the neighbor building. But I didn't expect ocean view at the reasonable rate that I got. So I wasn't disappointed. Front desk guys were awesome. Jamar got me set up as a walk in. Without reservation. I'm from Maui so I didn't know where to go. He gave me some great recommendations. As I was checking out I was concerned how to get to airport. Eric called and hooked me up with a shuttle. Only $11 or $12. Amazing. Harry has the sweetest hair/stache. Ill definitely be back. Aloha. Freddy V. aka Wolverine's Brother

We had fantastic service from the Aqua Waikiki Pearl Team, particularly Jamar on the front desk. This guy is professional with a great sense of humour and we'd stay at the Pearl just because of how welcome he made us feel when we stayed. The whole team were excellent and if you're after a central location, clean tidy accommodation and reasonable value for money then I'd recommend this hotel.

This hotel has the perfect location as everything is close by. Parking is a big issue but if you stop in and asked the hotel clerk they will tell you the closest place to park which is right down the road and only $18 a day if you do not move the car in and out all day. We had a two bedroom which is not a true two bedroom but a one bedroom with another bed sharing the living room divided by a curtain. I can tell you we stayed on the 5th floor and the first night I thought there was a fire in the building as it was so noisy we got no sleep. The sports bar downstairs can be heard up on the 5th floor as well. I did speak with someone who was on the 10th floor and they stated they could not hear the noise but I will also state that the other couple we were with had the actual bedroom and heard no noise during the night. My suggestion would be that the hotel invest a little money and put a wall up instead of using the curtain which would keep the noise out. This hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly and even with the noise issue I would still stay here again.

We stayed at the aqua pearl twice for a total of 6 nights in January. Our first impressions were great as Jamar at the front desk was welcoming and funny and helped us to get into our room quickly after a long flight.Their team kinow how to have fun with guests and be professional at the same time. EG: when i call front desk im addressed as MR xx and when im at the desk they are smiling and asking how my day was and having a joke etc.Clean rooms, good value for its price and great service. Id stay there again.

The hotel is clean and the staff friendly. We enjoyed our stay and would head back if we were in the area. We were really impressed with the front desk staff who helped us out when we turned up early!

Wasn't planning on staying at a 3star hotel, was hoping to book somewhere a bit nicer but we left it too late and everything else in waikiki sold out. But our stay here was very pleasant and everything we could expect from the property. Would have been better if it had a pool, but the beach isn't far. Plenty of places to eat nearby. The free breakfast and afternoon tea snacks were a nice touch. The concierge was very helpful with assisting us in booking a helicopter flight and giving us directions etc. king rooms were large with fridge and microwave. Pub next door has cheap drink specials. Cafe next door does good vegetarian food. Lift is slow, just take the stairs! Parking costs $23 per day only about 25 car spaces available.

2 bedroom suite separated by curtain only, 2nd 2 bedroon suite bathroom in main bedroom only, had to up grade to 3 bedroom at least 2 bathrooms but only in each bedroom there was no bathroom for 3 bedroom, setting only for 4, only had 1 chesterfield in room, 2 burner stove no oven, 4 cup coffee maker, no lights or ceiling fans in any of the rooms, had to pay for parking & had to be back by 2:00 pm to be sure to get parking only had 20 stalls, only 1 elevator working, no pool, facing very busy street, only good thing was that the staff were very nice, sports bar on one corner under the hotel, Would not go there again or recommend it to anyone
user_name:
Judy B
Lac La Hache, Canada

review_body: We loved our stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. It is hard coming from the other side of the world to choose acceptable accommodation but we choose well here. The apartments were extremely spacious, well furnished and very clean. We were close to all the shopping precincts and about 7 minutes walk from the beach. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We have no hesitate in recommending the Aqua Pearl to familes wanting clean, spacious and affordable accommodation.

We stayed for six nights in February. The room was clean other than the door frame to the balcony which was sticky. The pigeons roost on the balcony ledges, chairs and tables and we had to wipe up the messes before sitting down. It's an ongoing problem in Honolulu. Our room faced the street which had lots of traffic starting at 5:30 a.m. so if you want peace and quiet you might want a location further from that area. The staff was excellent, however. All were friendly and courteous. There is a laundromat on the third floor that was handy. A starter breakfast and snacks were served daily and I really enjoyed the watermelon water. Be aware parking is an extra $23 per day.

Stayed here one night in February not knowing what to expect - turned out to be a great choice. Harry, Dexter, and Eric at the front desk were very welcoming and accommodating. Thank you, guys! Look forward to the next visit.

Stayed here for cousin's wedding. The place is rather old, but relatively clean and the price was affordable. They have 2-bedroom suite upstairs complete with full-size refrigerator and kitchen, which is nice for cooking. The rooms were bit scruffy and had a faint smell of mold, but generally clean enough. It was at a great location near shopping center and the Waikiki beach and staffs were friendly.

The Staff at the front desk Rachael, Charity, Eric, Jamar, Dester and the rest of the team were courteous, friendly and very welcoming. I highly recommend this hotel to whomever chooses to visit Hawaii who is looking for affordable yet pleasant accommodation. The location of the hotel is centered in the heart of Waikiki therefore, everything that you require is within short walking distance. The view is also spectacular at night =] I will definitely be staying there on my next visit, until then thank you Aqua Waikiki Pearl for the great service Looking forward to seeing you's again real soon! Mahalo xx

This was our first trip to Waikiki. Found the rates (reasonable) on Hotels.com. The staff is extremely courteous. Our room was cleaned daily..Lewlyn did a Fabulous job! There are 2 elevators, only one was operating, so there were long waits for the elevator, especially early in the day when the cleaning staff was working. No amenities at this place (restaurant, pool, market, bar).

I understand this is a budget hotel, but I was pleasantly surprised. I had been staying at another hotel where there was a power outage. Knowing it was ProBowl weekend, I didn't expect much. So I walked over to the Pearl.The staff quickly found a comfortable room, offered me a cup of coffee and I was on my way. Although there was only one lift working, I quickly found the stairs. Later in the evening as I was passing the front desk the staff asked if I needed anything. I didn't. There were enough towels, not real fluffy, but neatly folded with shampoo and conditioner....etc.

We were extremely pleased with our room for 6, especially for the price! Would love to stay at place right on the water, but that's out of our price range. When I called to directly reserve the room, the guy was amazing! He told me not to prepurchase transportation from the airport - saved me a lot of money. I got a taxi for the 6 of us for $35. He also gave me lots of pointers. The location was perfect - just a short walk to the beach and we often cut through the International Place and did shopping too. Loved the Starbucks next door, the noodle restaurant, and DaBig Kahuna Pork sandwiches and even walks along the canal. We had two bedrooms, pull out sofa, and full kitchen (except oven - only stovetop). Thought we were going to not like having extra large closet in one bedroom, while bathroom was in the other bedroom. It actually worked out fine and we loved having spacious rooms. I stayed at another boutique hotel and the room was cramped. Not this one. Bed very comfortable! Our lanai overlooked a city scape, but could see the pretty pool lights across the street at night and lucked out having a palm tree just outside. Really enjoyed family time chatting on the lanai in the mornings and evenings. Easy to get around from this location. The best part was the friendly staff. They were soooo helpful! We honestly felt the aloha spirit from every staff person - it was almost like we were family. I asked a lot of questions about the college system and living there - they were so sweet and kind. Two different staff members even printed information for me. I bought a picture CD from Island Divers and I am having a hard time getting it - they were supposed to drop it off before we left. I have called, no response. So I called the hotel to see if maybe they had it. No, but they are going to have the conceirge work on getting it for me. That's service!!! I will definitely stay here in the future!!!!

Nice location ...short walk to the beach via International Marketplace. We took advantage of close proximity to luxury hotels. Recommend the history tour at the Moana and dinner in the Mai Tai bar at the Royal Hawaiian on Mondays with perfect view of luau festivities (might be the most expensive burger on the island, but probably the cheapest way to get a luau experience!) Look for sea turtles while swimming at Waikiki beach. We saw them every day ... couldn't believe they were so at home with all the human activity. Hotel is close to bus stop, easy way to get to Bishop Museum and other points of interest, with lots of local color along the way. You can rent a car for the day right there in Waikiki if you want to explore the rest of the island, and don't miss the Wai'oli Tea Room in Manoa area.

Good location for price beds were nice sized. Had good service room a little small, but we were only there to sleep and change clothes. Good for a short stay. Traveled with my cousin and his wife. Had a microwave and fridge which we didn;t use.

I stayed on level 10 from Jan 7th till the 22nd Jan. What more can you ask for when your staying at a affortable place that is centralized to everything in Waikiki? Perfect location & excellent service by all staff. I would like to thank Tasi & her team(the front desk crew) Dextor, Eric, Rachel, Charity, Jamar & 3 others..also the concierge desk staff & the security guys. You guys are all amazing & thank you so much for taking care of us during our stay. So blessed to have met all you lovely people. I will definitely be recommending your hotel to all our family & friends that travels to Hawaii. I hope to see you all soon ;)Much aloha to the Aqua Waikiki Pearl Ohana.RegardsMere Semu from room 1013 ;)

My family and i were staying in one of the rooms in Aqua pearl waikiki hotel last Jan. 19. The room is nice but a lot of people are loitering during that time. I found out that one room was occupied by one of the group with 20 or more people in the room. They are having sex, moan a lot and drink a lot. I tried to ask one couples who are about to go to the room and told me that its a Swinger's Party in the hotel and it has been doing it for almost 4 years now and occupied that hotel just for them. The group name is volcano group or rainbow group. My comment is why this hotel allowed group like that to have parties and pay guests paid this man to have group sex in the hotel. Are the aqua resorts group knew about this? They must not allowed something like that. We never had a relaxing night during that time. Women' moans a lot. Very noisy.

We stayed at Aqua Waikiki Pearl in a Renovated Junior Suite with balcony. According to the front desk, there were no rooms available other than the one we had on the 2nd floor facing the street. The room was very large, but no other furniture except a desk and desk chair. There was a table and 2 chairs on the balcony where you could sit if you wanted to hear the traffic noise even better. The room smelled funny. PROS: The air conditioner was newer so was very quiet. We did get a very good rate--$321 for 3 nights using the AARP discount and the hotel was located in a very convenient area--across the street from the International Marketplace and various restaurants. CONS: The room smelled like a wet dog (maybe previous tennant?); no other furniture to sit on; coffee pot didn't work and the warming plate was all rusted; I did talk to the front desk about this but nothing was done. There are two elevators--only one worked the entire three days we were there so I guess it was a good thing we were on the second floor. Bottom line--would I stay here again? NO. I would pay extra to stay elsewhere.

We have just spent two weeks from 2nd to the 15th January 2013 at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl in a three bedroom apartment on the 10th floor. It was great. We travelled with my parents and two teenage sons (there were 6 of us in total). The kitchen was adequate with a large fridge, two hot plates and a microwave oven. There was only enough plates and cutlery for four so we mentioned this when we were heading out on the first morning. When we returned the additional cutlery and plates were stacked neatly on the kitchen bench. Our room was serviced everyday with fresh towels, bins emptied and our beds remade. The cleaning ladies were always friendly and when we were leaving on the last day at 6am in the morning they were just arriving for work and came across to say goodbye to us. The front desk staff in particular Harry and Jamar who gave us the best breakfast cereal tips were always friendly and helpful. The Aqua Pearl is located right in the heart of things just across from the International Markets a quick short cut through to the main shopping strip. Starbucks is located right next door and good for the morning pick me up with the Food Pantry just on the next block for all your food supplies. The trolley and bus stops are also just around the corner. We stayed in Waikiki two years ago at the Ohana Waikiki West and if we had to chose again we would definitely pick the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for value for money and the spaciousness of the rooms, it was also really quiet compared to the Ohana West which is just around the corner on Kuhio Street. We will certainly stay at the Aqua Pearl again when we return.

We stayed at the Pearl from Dec 27-Jan 3rd after not being able to book a room at the better rated Aqua Bamboo. We settled on the Pearl based on need for a kitchen and a separate bedroom - and the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. All the other reviews are totally accurate. It is well located, but in a busy area that can be noisy at night - there's a sports bar right next to the hotel lobby. We saw lots of folks walking down Nahua Street at night and it seemed to be a very safe area. As mentioned, we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen and it was a VERY large room. The living room was remarkably under furnished - I suppose to have enough space to pull out the sofa bed (?), but the atmosphere certainly would've been improved by even a coffee or side table to place a beverage on. The kitchen was fairly well equipped (we did buy a non-stick frying pan of our own as the room's wasn't the greatest) and we ate breakfast on the balcony almost every morning. The balcony was nothing to scream about - pretty basic, table and a few chairs. A small love seat would've been very welcome! The bathroom was fine (although the soap dish in the shower appeared to have been fastened with caulk, which was coming loose), the beds/pillows were quite comfy and the air conditioning was not excessively loud and kept the rooms quite cold (there were two units - 1 in the bedroom and another in the living room area). A number of reviewers have commented that the room was clean; which I would agree with...to a point. At the beginning of our stay, the room was spotless, but became less so over the 7 days we stayed. By day 5 I really wished there was a mop so I could give the tile kitchen floor a good going over. I am unsure as to whether the room was vacuumed every day and the balcony certainly was NOT swept for sand. That being said, it wasn't bad enough for us to complain about. As mentioned several times, one elevator was out of service and nobody seemed to be getting around to it, but we made the most of it and used the stairs most of the time we were there. The front desk staff was helpful with directions and beach towels; but with such a basic hotel (pretty much no special amenities; not even a pool) I wouldn't say the front desk service went above and beyond. They were simply nice people. We travelled with a nine year old child and he thought the Pearl was the greatest hotel he'd ever been to...even with no swimming pool! I think it's because the staff were kind to him and he enjoyed going to the lobby in the mornings to get some fruit to bring up to the room. Some notes on food: The continental breakfast offered by the hotel was pretty weak - grapes, what looked like really sugary mini-muffins and coffee pretty much every day. Having a kitchen, we made our own breakfasts, thankfully! Starbucks was on the corner and Food Pantry grocery was just a block over. We had a Hula Dog for lunch one day (just at the corner of Nahua and Kuhio in the International Market) - they were interesting for a change, but not something I'd eat every day (vegetarians note: you can get a veggie dog option there and they are cooked separately from the meat dogs - yay!). We really enjoyed the Veggie Star restaurant, which is right next door to the hotel, as well as it's sister restaurant Ruffage, which is closer to the Aqua Bamboo. They served great smoothies, a delicious vegan burger with avocado, and really tasty rice bowls (I had a yummy vegetarian one, my husband had a curried chicken and they were great!). We took a long walk to Bogart's Cafe (near the zoo) which is a very popular place (cash only!), very hard to find a table, but once we did we enjoyed yummy breakfasts and I experienced my first Acai bowl. They also had lots of options for vegetarians.

A wonderful gem in the heart of Waikiki. All the staff go above and beyond and are very friendly and accommodating. We had a basic hotel room which was very spacious, comfortable and clean and included a small fridge and microwave. Besides the great staff, the location is within walking distance to all the restaurants, shopping, beach and even the Aquarium. We stayed here for a week over New Year's and were very happy with our choice. I would not hesitate to recommend the Pearl to anyone looking for a hotel in central Waikiki. Check out the restaurant Bene Pesce across the street for a great dinner and Keoni's for breakfast is a nice restaurant with a friendly, comfortable feel to it.

The attitude of the staff in this hotel were first class, really genuine and friendly, always greeting people and offering advice or help. The rooms on the other hand are very basic so if you don't expect too much you will be ok, we had an outward facing room, if you end up with an inward facing room you will be disappointed as they look very dark.A huge negative was the 1 functioning elevator, waits can be up to 10 minutes during peak times.Overall though this is an acceptable hotel with exceptional staff.

Very friendly and helpful staff. A plus is also the spacious room equipped with microwave. Almost all places of interest in Waikiki and beach within 5 to 10 min walking distance. Good price for the location and the quality of the hotel and hotel room. If we visit Hawaii again, we try to stay here again.

If you are looking for designed rooms and architecture, this not the place.If you are looking for a friendly, fully equipped place to come back to after a beautiful day at the beach or a shopping spree in honolulu, this is it!all the + here:- spacious room with microwave, fridge, hair dryer, tv, bath tub.- location: close to waikiki beach AND close to shopping area AND close to restaurants, but still pretty quiet. - laundry room available- free coffee, muffins, fruits in the morning- extremely helpful and friendly staff AND cleaning personell- good wifi connection- reasonable pricesthe down sides -:- they only had 1 elevator working for guests AND cleaning personell!! the other one was being renewd, which caused a long waiting time going up or down. - the parking lot was full twice (over new years) so we had to park the car outside. we stayed afterwards at the aqua lotus and were very disappointed. aqua waikiki was friendlier, better equipped and quieter at nights!

So this isn't a five-star beach front resort, but it's really great for hotel the price. The hotel is centrally located, right by the international market and a short walk from Waikiki Beach. The rooms are clean, spacious, and much better than the unimpressive exterior would suggest. The staff was warm and gracious too. I ended up having to leave Honolulu early and the hotel was extremely helpful without sorting everything out. All in all, i really enjoyed staying here.

My wife and I stayed one week. The staff were excellent, very helpful, and consistently exuded the "aloha mood"! Everything we wanted in Waikiki was within walking distance, including a grocery store a block away (hidden) which appeared to be priced for local consumers, as opposed to the many stores marketing to tourists. It is a quiet location, half a block off the one of the busiest streets. We used the convenient bus stop half a block away when we wanted to get to the volcano, outlying "snorkeling" beaches, Pearl Harbour Monument, and other Honolulu attractions. The guide person in the lobby was very helpful. The room was basic, large, clean, with fridge and microwave.

Stayed here 1 night this weekend to celebrate my wife's birthday in town. This hotel is a great value for the money. We were able to book 1 night in a junior suite for about $150. Make no bones about it-this is a "budget hotel". You don't get many frills. Our "junior suite" was basically just a big standard room. There was still just a bed and desk/tv but with a lot of open space. Still, for the price, totally worth it. It is in a great location. You won't get any views of the ocean but you are only about a 5 minute walk from Duke's and the Waikiki beaches. As long as you are not expecting a posh resort, I think you will be satisfied with Pearl. I would equate the hotel accommodations to a Days Inn style hotel in the mainland. It's Hawaii so you are paying for location. This is in a great location. It was a bit noisy at night but again, we picked this hotel to have a nice bed to sleep off a night of partying in the city. For that, it performed above our expectations. If you're on a budget, I definitely think you should consider the Aqua Waikiki Pearl.

We weren't expecting much for the price we paid. We only needed a place to do some basic cooking and to sleep. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite on the 7th floor, with kitchen and balcony. The rooms were very clean. There was lots of room (we travelled with 2 kids and 4 adults). The kitchen was enough to cook basic meals. There was a sink, 3 pots, chopping board, microwave, 2 burner electric stove, basic kitchen utensils (spatula, egg flipper, knife). We requested a larger pot for cooking rice and the staff came up with an electric rice cooker! Too easy! Location was great, central and everything was within walking distance; restaurants, supermarket, international marketplace, Macy's, Waikiki beach. There is a convenient Health food shop next door which caters for people with food allergies. They can even pack your meal for the aeroplane!The staff were very helpful and friendly. The only inconvenience was the parking. Due to the limited number of spaces, it's first in best dressed, so if the park is full, you have to park nearby at the Waikiki trade centre. The beds were comfy and pillows were great. I would definitely stay here again.

Let's talk about what we did like about this hotel, it's clean, the room is very large, the staff is nice and the price are really reasonable, for Waikiki. The structure is old, and in the morning we have been woke up by the sound of birds out of our window. If you're planning to stay for a couple of night this is your place but if you're planning for more nights I'll go other place.

I stayed at the Aqua Pearl for 10 nights a year ago, and this hotel was the first place I considered for this years holiday where I stayed there for 14 nights. I booked online and later rang Tracey to confirm and pay the deposit, she is very polite and friendly (in fact all the staff are!). I received an email confirmation.I arrived late in the evening and that wasn't a problem, they even upgraded my room for me which was bigger and included a balcony/lanai that had great views of the cenryity. Thank you! The room had loads of space, was nice and clean, and the bathroom with bath/shower was a good size too, and it was all cleaned daily by the maid. I was on the 9th floor (of 10) and away from the lifts and the only noise we had was from the garbage trucks in the morning, but it must have been about 8-9am so wasn't an issue.As I said the staff were all polite and good to talk to, in particular Tracey (manager), Rachel, Charity, and Henry at Reception,.. and Alan and the other guy who I forgot his name who helps with bags etc.The guy on the activities desk provided us with info and was helpful too.The hotel room had a microwave, sink and fridge in the kitchen which was all what we needed. The beds were comfortable. If you want a good room for the night for a fantastic price then definitely check out the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. It's a few blocks from the beach, so about a 5-minute walk, it's in a nice safe area and everything is nearby. A convenience shop is opposite, starbucks just a few buildings away, and loads of other things just around the corner.If 5-star accommodation, on-site restaurant, swimming pool, resort-type holiday is your thing then this hotel won't be for you, but if you want a nice clean room for a great price, excellent value for money, then this is for you and I highly recommend. The next time I come to Oahu which I hope is in 2 years time, then I hope to stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl again!

The friendly reception staff at this hotel really make this a great place to stay. They were extremely helpful and friendly. The room was very clean with new carpet. The location is so central to Waikiki.

We were upgraded to a two bedrooms unit. The rooms, lounge, kitchen and bathroom are large and clean. Staff are friendly and very helpful. The location is the best. Food Barn (supermarket) is one block away. Restaurants are all within walking distance. International Markets across from the hotel. Beaches are within walking distance. We will definitely stay here again.

I have stayed in many 5 star hotels world wide and this hotel provides more than its allocated stars. Not only the rooms are very clean but the building itself is a pleasure to the eye.Now for the Staff !!!! I would strongly advised that ALL visitors to this hotel take the time to get to know each and every one of them as they all have wonderful personalities and show an excellent standard of professionalism. My Christmas wishes go to Allan, Jarom, Erik,Charity,Mac and all the other staff involved in the running of the hotel and be assured my recommendations will be posted on the ambulance and NHS intranets. And "I will be back" Aloha my friendsBez United Kingdom

I love this hotel I'm staying in....It's very clean and very serious about the non smoking. It does not smell anything like smoke. The downside is I stayed with 2 littles on ages 1 & 2, the lanais (balcony) are not safe at all. The parking is free if using TLA or it's $20 per day, crib is also $20 or free on TLA. Not much difference between a normal room than a suite. If you don't have kids a normal room will be more than enough room. The staff id outstanding, I dealt with Charity, she was great. Service makes all the difference in the world.

Stayed here the begining of Dec 2012, the hotel has huge rooms compared to some of the other hotels, we were in a 1 bedroom room. It was close to The Pantry (small grocery store), close to The Int'l Market and about 7 mins walk to the beach. Hotel staff were very friendly, always in a very cheerfull mood, and helpfull. Felt good to stay in a hotel that has been recently renovated as well, felt fully rested after a good night's sleep on the comfortable beds. p.s. one small inconvenience was that one of the elevators was out service, nothing that effected my stay at the hotel

This is a great hotel for your money and the service was excellent! The staff was very helpful in finding us what we needed to make our stay more pleasureable. Always were greeted with an "Aloha" no matter the time of day or night! Our room was always clean and fresh towels were brought daily. The air conditioner was a little bit louder than I liked but we just turned it off at night. Nice and close to the International Market and a short jaunt to the beach. If you are looking for great value, this place is for you. Thank you so much! Aloha!!!!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Aqua Waikiki Pearl Hotel. It's in a very good location from about three or four blocks to Waikiki Beach. It's close to the International Market and there are several restaurants close by. The hotel is lovely and clean, and the staff are all very friendly.

I booked this hotel with only a few days before leaving blistering cold Yellowknife for balmy Hawaii. The marathon was going on and affected room rates greatly. I usually benefit from last minute, not this time. That being said, king room suite was 179 avg per night for 5 nights. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom ( just the 2 of us). Rooms were huge, but oddly laid out. Master had ensure which was the only washroom. Kitchen was adequate with big fridge and apt sized fridge. Flat screen tv in living room, wifi and great ac. Hotel appears to have just been bought by Aqua which has a few properties in Honolulu. Elevators were being modernized while we were there, lots of new paint and carpet. Front desk staff was excellent! Maid service was so-so. Beds always med brilliantly, but coffee was not replenished every day and we hung towels up and they were taken every day and once jot replenished.We booked another week next door at the Ohana West, mainly because of price, but also due to maid service. No pool but the beach is only a few blocks awayI'd stay here again if the price was right

It's the staff that makes this place awesome!Great location and close to most amenities : Bus stops, Food Pantry, International Marketplace, pharmacy, ABC stores, Denny's etc.Our first night we had a Junior Suite on the same floor as the laundry which was convenient for us. Rooms were exactly like the pictures on the website. A/C worked a treat for us that were still adjusting to the climate. Bathroom was spotless. There was nothing bad about the room.We returned after our cruise to stay an extra 6 nights, being way too early for check in the staff held our luggage while we explored Waikiki.We got the same floor as last time but a different room which wasn't exactly up to par as our first night. It did look like the previous guests had a great night though, with wet patches and stains on the floor. But we weren't too fussy so it didn't bother us much.The only problem we had was the noise from the street but that can't be helped unless you get a room on a higher floor.So overall we would recommend this hotel to friends and family and we would definitely stay again the next time we do come to Hawaii.

I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel, from the beautiful staff who offer excellent service from the heart, to the central location, to the immaculate condition, well-maintained, and tastefully decorated rooms. They provide free wifi throughout the property and free daily newspapers, including Sunday. There is a large water urn in the lobby with large pieces of watermelon to slightly flavor the cold water, a very refreshing touch. The rooms have 2 double beds, microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker with coffee provided, flat screen tv, and room safe. The a/c units are updated. They are efficient in keeping the room at your desired temperature without the noise. Bathroom de-humidifier, also quiet, does a superb job in keeping away mold and mildew. This was my second stay, having visited a year previous at the same time, Nov. Id' like to recognize the quick, positive responses I received by email from the manager, Tasi; the front desk persons, Harry and Charity, who are so gracious, Emmie, the dearest and efficient housekeeping supervisor; and Elisa, who kept our accommodations spotless. As a caveat, if one desired to be right on the beach or have a pool on site, this would not be for you; but being so close to bus and shuttle lines and across the street from the Intl Marketplace, Denny's, etc., it cannot be beat. The jr suite with lanai is only slightly more expensive than the standard room, well worth the cost. For the low rates they charge, you get a terrific value. I will always return to the Pearl. They exemplify the Aloha spirit. It is my home in Wakiki, and indeed a Pearl of a hotel!

The hotel was fine - room was good (we upgraded to the east side rooms) - bed comfortable and good shower. The staff (especially Harry) were extremely freindly, helpful and nice - they went out of their way to help.

I had a very comfortable stay, i had a personal issue i was going threw during my stay, but come check in and check out, dawn had my back checking in, and jamar made me smile checking out.. Just what anyone should need excspecially in hawaii...

Great location with in 10 mins walk to beach and across the road to the markets. As we ate out a lot and went sightseeing the hotel was perfect, great size (2 bedroom apartment) comfortable beds, kitchen facilities good ( no wine glasses but can buy at supermarket) great internet service in room. Bus stop about 2 mins walk for the local shuttle buses.All the staff extremely helpful and accommodating would highly recommend this hotel to all families wishing to stay in a affordable and comfortable hotel. Great coffee shop " Hawaiian Gold "( not a chain coffee shop) up the road heading to the Zoo around 5 mins walk . TIPS Keep away from the ATM located around the island stick with the ATM at the major banks. Had my credit card scanned, and subsequently stopped as a result. Plus they dispense more cash depending which bank you chose up to $400.00. Best shopping for Surf clothes is up on the North Shore cheaper by up to 10-15%( compared to Ala Moana or the shops in Waikiki) on most items plenty of choice take your time to walk around and have a look. Best shopping in general according to my wife,kids (and Credit Card ) is Ala Moana. Try Matsomoto's on the North Shore for shaved ice, Giovanni's shrimp truck for a great meal, PF Changs and also Tanaka on Tokyo ( easier if you book a table) in Waikiki. If from Australia don't rely on getting cash out at shops as we do here.Could not find one that gave cash out with purchases next time i go will look at getting all my cash in American dollars before leaving.We used Virgin from Perth and Jetstar from Sydney had no issues at all with these airlines and will use again recommend getting extra luggage for 1 person and also pre pay for IPads on Jetstar flight.Weather was great as not too hot was coming into there winter season just perfect lived in shorts and t shirt whole trip.

The actual hotel is old but it is clean, tidy and cheap. It was the staff that made my stay special. They went out of their way to be helpful. The Staff were so friendly and had good suggestions for dining, activities and shopping. They put the AAaaaaa is Aloha.

Nothing was exceptional about this hotel, but everything was pretty good. Staff had the Aloha spirit, location within Waikiki was great for both shopping and beaches and the room was clean and generously sized for a studio apartment. Recommended for an affordable visit to Waikiki.

Well, the title says it all. This is by no means a luxury stay but good enough to get a good night's sleep to recharge and go out. My parents and my sister decided to do the 2 bedroom suite with the kitchen. Only one bathroom situated ensuite one of the bedrooms which makes it highly inconvenient for everyone. I wonder why they didn't design the one bathroom to be located in the common area of the suite. It would be much more practical for everyone. The living room area was huge with couchd and tv. Kitchen was functioning with fridge and stove but looked a bit tired. What I did like about this place was location. Around the corner was a noodle shop lined out the door where I can get authentic Japanese hot meal for under $5 and is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. 2 blocks or so to Waikiki Beach. Very close to bus stops to Hanauma and Ala Moana. Also, front desk is extremely helpful and friendly and so was the concierge who helped us book tours.There is a computer station located in the front lobby for general use and Wi-Fi is in main lobby only.

We were there during 10 days from 2012 Sept end to Oct, and it was a very nice experience. Very friendly staff, good room and overall service, free wi-fi at reception area, and most important very good location. Just couple blocks from the Waikiki beach, and very well located to the main restaurants area. There is a Starbucks coffee shop at the corner, a Food Pantry market one block away (to the left after the Starbucks) where we used to buy water bottles, juices and some snacks to bring with us during the day trips and to keep us up during the day actvities, if you have the opportunity try the brownie bittes, really delicious! If you like, inside the market there is a little japanese food shop, where we had some awsome oniguiris (or musubis), like the grilled salmon, that you can also take out as a snack. The "the bus" stop to Alamoana / Downtown area is very near as well and it is almost in front of the famous Udon japanese restaurant, always crowded due to its very good food and cheap prices. We recomend to use "the bus" to go wherever you wanna go, just do a little plan using the web site or google maps before going out, and always remember to get you "transfer ticket" that allows you to use "the bus" again for free during couple hours (or some hours more) at the same day.We recomend Aqua Waikiki to everyone!

This hotel is actually ok. It's kinda clean, minus all the hair from housekeeping. Sheets are pretty worn out. Alot of wasted space. Only beds and one chair to sit on. Microwave and mini fridge very convenient. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Parking is HORRIBLE. We decided to go cheap and park at the end of the road. It was very frustrating trying to find parking every night. But we did save 20$ each time. That's right. 20$ for parking!!! And it's like that everywhere in Waikiki. We were on a high floor and it was still noisy at night. The 3:00 am drunks walking down the street and screaming women, garbage truck dropping by at 6 am, and just general traffic. The noise and the price of parking is not the Hotel's fault, it's like that in all of Waikiki. And that's why I recommend not staying in Waikiki at all!! Stay somewhere else. Waikiki beach was our least favorite beach in all of Oahu anyway... Anyways, the hotel? Yeah it's alright.

aloha, I'm italian and I want to thank all the staff : jamar, allen, tasi, eric, rachel, charity, dawn (the housekeeping staff; I'm sorry if I forgot someone!!!). I guess that this staff makes the difference, so this hotel, in my opinion, is just like home and comparable to a 5-star hotel...thank you all guys...mahalo a nui loa. maria candida

Rooms & appliances are old but service is good. Car park cost you $20 per night. Don't expect much but then again you are not paying a lot either for a room in Waikiki area. In a nutshell, "stayable".

This past September, our family and "Louie" stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl, for the second time. We reserved the 2 room suite. The suite was spacious, complimentary internet and the central air-conditioning made our stay comfortable. Tracey H. Kuamoo and her staff made our stay, "just like at home". The Internationa Market Place was a block away, Waikiki Beach and other restaurants within close walking distance. We hope to visit the Aqua Waikiki Pearl soon.

My Firend John and I spent 5 nights in the Aqua Pearl Hotel, the rooms are very Clean and spacious plus we also had a balcony. We had all the amenties that we required,The Hotel is situated about 2 blocks from the The Waikiki Beach which was a quick trip to the Beach.A wonderful Young Man named Eric Peterson who is part of the Aqua Pearl Staff Management looked after us very well, giving us suggestions on where to Visit ( Pearl Harbour :) Alamona , and and Restaurants etc.Eric booked Tours and anything else that we needed he was very Friendly and we had lots of laughs with him and other staff members which made our trip very enjoyable.

My travel agent booked this hotel in light of my specific request for having a kitchen. I was pleasantly surprised to have been given a very spaceous living room/kitchen area with a balcony, and a separate, equally spaceous bedroom. The hotel location is close to everything in Waikiki--the Pantry for groceries, the International Market, restaurants and shops, and of course, the beach. The staff were friendly, special thanks to Remy for looking after my room. The drawback are that because of the location, the nice view is limited to the mountains from out the balcony, and there is no complimentary wi-fi on each room.

This the perfect place for those that just need a place to sleep, shower and dump cases. The hotel is handy to all the action in Waikiki, public transport and there are plenty of eateries nearby.The rooms have all you really need and EVERYTHING worked! The beds were very comfortable.The staff were all very friendly and obliging.The only down side to this place was the noisy air-conditioner and slamming doors. The AC didn't bother me but may annoy others. I was unfortunate enough to have some inconsiderate neighbours that slammed their door frequently until @ 3am. The doors are heavy and there is nothing to cushion the noise. However overall my stay was very pleasant and would stay there agaqin.

This was our 3rd stay since the remodelling 5 or so years ago. So so so much praise for all the staff. Booked a queen/double room with a lanai and got upgraded on our check in to a one bedroom apartment. Very spacious with a big lounge, kitchen and bedroom with 2 double beds. Managed to secure a car park every night on our 5 night stay. Their watermelon infused chilled water at reception was divine! Staff were always helpful and checking that all was ok with our stay. Our last night was the "tsunami" night and the staff handled the whole issue very efficiently and with concern making sure all were ok. My only suggestion would be to have wi-fi available in all guest rooms. They have free internet but by cable only. As we only had our ipad I had to go to the lobby to use the wi-fi. Would definitely stay again and highly recommend.

I've been staying here the last 3yrs. Aqua PEARL has a budget friendly cost, location is perfect, & the people have true aloha spirit. It's close to the beach, shopping areas, & night life. Never a full moment on kuhio street.

The hotel was centrally located, easy to get to all the sights. It was a clean comfortable place without many extras (no pool, exercise room...). Since we didn't spend much time in our room it didn't matter any way. The staff is what makes this place great. They were extraordinarily helpful and worked hard to make our stay a very pleasant one. Saving on the room left us more money to play in Waikiki. I'd definitely stay here again.

The Motel was what you would call middle of the road price wise. This suited us. But the pluses were A Grade: General Store over the road, A bar attached to the Motel, The International Markets at the end of the street, downtown shops and restaurants within minutes, Waikiki Beach five minutes walk. Central to everything. Front desk always helpful. Tours and shuttles picked up at the door. ATM machine. Tours desk in foyer.Much more user friendly that the massive big high rise motels.

The Pearl is a good value due to its location - close to dining, shopping and most importantly the beach (although it is a good 10 minute walk). The staff is friendly and accommodating. Booked a queen/double room for a week and was given a two twin bed room. Staff was happy to change to the queen/double. Apparently all rooms are not created equal as we had a small room and many others have reported how large their rooms were. We caught glimpses into other rooms confirming ours was much smaller. Our room was on the third floor on the parking lot side vs the street side and it did seem a bit quieter. A/C is a wall-mounted unit and does run loud. Didn't bother our sleep though. There were regular outside sounds from being in a big city but almost no noise from other rooms which was nice. There was a closet but no true dresser (desk drawers could serve as a dresser...) for unpacking clothes. Tough to live out of a suitcase when visiting for a week or more.Again, the staff was very pleasant and accommodating. We didn't get to know them by first names as others have posted but received Aloha each time we passed the desk (unless someone was on the phone).If you are on a budget and not planning to spend a lot of time in your room - which you shouldn't, you're in Hawaii! - the Pearl is a good option. Looking for a resort experience or view - look elsewhere.

Our 10 night stay at the Waikiki Pearl was a pleasure. The room was clean, comfortable and affordable. Great location, a short walk to the beach, shopping, groceries, Starbucks and restaurants. Hotel provides large clean beach towels. A one minute walk to bus route (Yes you can easily get to Shopping center and Pearl Harbor by Bus.) Good WIFI internet in the lobby or at Starbucks. Friendly helpful staff both at the front desk and housekeeping. Excellent value - Highly recommended.
