My wife and I stayed here for 10 days for a little vacation before the snow flies here back home. I was a little sketchy because it was going to be my first time booking online. i must say that i was pleasantly surprised with the staff at the Pearl! Mac the concierge was great! he advised us to go to the Germaines Luau. it was a great experience for someone who has never been to anything like it! he was always there to help us with whatever we needed, including looking into the exhibition baseball game at the U of H! he made a great reservation at the top of Waikiki which definitely did not disappoint! Next there is Eric, he is a bellman/ front desk person. he was absolutely great! always helpful. he made us feel like we were back home! did not see Jamar till the last day and like previous posts he is a great rep for the hotel! there was also another gentleman ( sorry i cant remember his name) but he is definitely a character! he could put a smile on anyone's face with his quick wit and personality. you definitely couldn't help but smile. everyone at the hotel was truly helpful and made our experience one that we will never forget!

This Hotel is very well located, close to the canal, and 4-5 fully entertaining blocks from the beach.Everything is near... to take a good dinner, cheers in local pubs or to visit local market.The service is really good, specially since your arrive; very nice people always willing to help you.For the price...taking into account the zone, is a really smart option when you arent looking for luxury rooms (but very decent anyway!).

Having surfed the net to find somewhere clean, friendly & safe to stay on my solo travel, I opted for the Pearl. I wasn't disappointed. My two night stay in Waikiki was a wonderful experience & the staff were so friendly & helpful. After my long flights from Glasgow via London & LA to Hawaii, I just wanted to relax & sleep without the formalities of specific dining times & sample the local food at my leisure. I was sorry to leave despite embarking on a 17 day cruise to Australia. Would love to renew the experience in future. I would definitely recommend the Pearl to those who desire comfort, friendliness & safety in a clean environment at a reasonable cost. Thank you for the pleasant memories.

Awesome and friendly front desk guest service team esp Jamar :) this place was so awesome ... How awesome? Sooooo awesome! Always smiling and made our day! Will miss this place and will def come back foresure. Loved it here Mahalo aqua pearl ! - ballerina (Angelica), Dora (telisa), cleopatra (Katrina) aka Toronto Girls :)

Aqua Pearl was one of the best decisions made ever! The staff was sooo friendly, funny and soo helpful! Everything we needed they we were there to help us out, and so happy about it. Jamar was amazing, he became apart of our family :) that's what makes an experience wonderful! So if you want great hospitality, location and whatever else in between, you should definitely, stay at Aqua Waikiki Pearl!!! With love, from Toronto Dora(Telisa) Cleopatra (Katrina) Ballerina (Angel)

Good place to stay. Rooms are very clean. Staff is very nice and willing to answer all your questions. Hotel is in the middle of Waikiki so it's very busy area. Not as close to the beach as I thought but within walking distance. The only issue is parking, not enough parking for hotel guest so had to park offsite. Also you pay for parking everywhere in Waikiki so be prepared to pay to park. I would stay here again. Very pleased. Thank you for a great stay.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The staff were super friendly and welcoming! Thanks! The tour desk was great and efficient! There was a bit of street noise but it didn't stop any of us sleeping. The rooms were large and maybe just a tad tired but I think reflected sufficiently in the cost which was very affordable and they were clean. The hotel is very well situated in Waikiki with very little walking distance to the shopping strip, restaurants and beach. If you love Mai Tai's you must go to the Royal Hawaiin for a Royal Mai Tai at sunset - warning - only have one!

This is an old review, so perhaps the Pearl has changed her ways since we stayed there. This place stands out in my memory as one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. First of all, when I made the booking I asked if the hotel had parking because I knew my family members wanted to rent a car. They told me that parking was available. When we arrived, we were told that the parking was unavailable and were directed to park at a neighboring hotel. (A very shady place, where the parking attendants happened to be running a scam.)The hotel room was huge but there was only a small couch to sit on. It was kind of like hanging out in an unfurnished apartment. There was no maid service during our stay at all. On the second day, we came back to hotel to find ourselves locked out of the room by the hotel staff. It was an hour long run around until we finally found out that they had booked somebody else into the room at a higher price and wanted to "down grade" us to another room in the hotel. They would not let us enter our room until we agreed to clear out our stuff so their other guests could move in. When we saw the room they wanted to put us in, which smelled weird, didn't have a balcony or enough beds to sleep everyone in our party, we decided to check out of the hotel instead. We were much happier staying at the Marriott Courtyard down the street.

We thought this place was exactly like a motel and we were not fans. The staff are fabulous and very welcoming but the room although clean and a good size with a king size bed was on the walkway with large floor level windows and we didn't feel that safe. It was quite noisy with traffic noise (we were on 7th floor) and other guests coming and going. We had to switch our air con unit off as it was old and too noisy. We were only there for one night before our flight home and it was cheap enough but not sure I would stay there again.

hospitable, clean, cost effective, convenient to restaurants and beach. Jamar is the da man!! This business trip alots 24 layover in Honolulu and Waikiki allowed tremendous restaurant and leg stretching opportunities. The front desk was easy to work with on taxi accomodations and room changes! Very reasonable price for the area!!

We were there for 4 nights. The room was large and very clean. The lobby is smaller than a lot of hotels but that is good. The staff can see who is coming and going. This made us feel secure. All of the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. They make great recommendations for places to eat and places to go. They arranged for our shuttle ride back to the airport. They show a lot of aloha.

We stayed in Waikiki for a few days before heading home, and everyone at the Waikiki Pearl was very friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean and updated. We go some recommendations from Jamar on local restaurants, and we had a great meal thanks to him! The location is great, it is in walking distance to great shopping and the beach! And you can catch the trolley right down the street. The only tricky part is if you have a rental car, as parking is minimal. Overall it was a great experience.

Nice size rooms, easy walk to the beach at Wakiki, friendly staff. No frills, but very reasonable price. We paid $130/night for an upper floor room with a partial ocean view. $20/night extra if you have a car. Great deal for Wakiki.

It's been said but I will say it again, Jamar and staff are truly what makes this place such a great value. Parking can be an issue, but location is great, so once we secured a spot we left our rental there for the duration of our stay.

The hotel is in a great location. 5mins to the markets, 10mins to the beach.....perfect!!!The rooms are a little run down but as a solo traveler they suited my needs, who stays in their room when you are in Hawaii anyway!The best thing about this hotel is the staff. They make you feel very welcome, have tons of suggestions about things to do and are always very friendly, they really make this place feel comfortable.I would recommend this hotel to people looking for somewhere close to everything but far enough away to get a good nights sleep.

Great location, great and very helpful staff, that made our short stay within Hawaii a pleasant stay. Its location is in the heart of all that is happening within Waikiki. We booked into a one room suit too which they upgraded us to a room with Balcony with a combined size that was larger than most one bedroom flats in the heart of Brisbane. Staff bent over backwards to make stay enjoyable. Only complaint would be the Legends Bar which is co-located at bottom floor, stayed open till all hours of morning and was always a very loud closing.

we stayed in room 1008, was a nice large room, clean with a view down to the front entrance. However it was very noisy from late night revelers, the nearby ladies of the night and the garbage men at 5 in the morning. I did see the receptionist give out earplugs to some of the guests. The location was great, a 10 minute walk to the beach and close to the main street, shops and restaurants. The computer at the reception area has internet however this very rarely works but there is free wi-fi in the reception area if you have your tablet,laptop, but it wont work in the room. There is parking for guests at $20 a night and if no spaces available there is a car park close by that you are allowed to park in, just ask reception. Beach towels are available at reception so don't bring the towels in your hotel room.I did notice that the towels in our room were not the cleanest so I did change them.The hotel was clean and the fantastic staff really made it an enjoyable stay. We were happy that we had our room until 6 pm on the day of check out as we had a late flight that night but they will keep your cases for you if you have to check out by 12 pm.I would stay again but remember my ear plugs

We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights in one of their spacious 3-bedroom suites on the top floor. It was like home away from home. It was very quiet on the upper floor. Our family stay included my 80-year old parents and my 13-year old twin daughters. So we enjoyed the apartment like residence having 2 bathrooms and a kitchen. The beds are on the firm side which is the way I like it. The hotel was clean and although older, seemed safe. I'm guessing the hotel was remodelled within the last 3-4 years. The staff was extra helpful and friendly. Whenever we called for service, someone was there to help within minutes. The only complaint I have is the limited parking, but there is an overflow lot about 1 block away. We loved being able to walk through the international marketplace on our way to the beach (about 2 blocks away). The hotel is walking distance to everything in Waikiki. The hotel is already a good value and they gave us a 10% AAA discount. Note that there is no swimming pool at this hotel, but the beach is only a couple of blocks away.

We stayed here for 3 nights and accepted an upgrade to a junior suite. Perfect spot to sleep off jet lag after almost 24 hours of travelling.Happy with space of the suite, especially after long haul flight and knowing that most of remainder of holiday we would stay in hostels. Close to restaurants, beach etc. I felt trapped in Waikiki but through no fault of the hotel- I'm not a resort person and would rather have stayed down town.All staff that we encountered were very nice, friendly and helpful (maintenance staff through to desk staff, manager etc).I would consider staying here in the future.

We were surprised at how safe and clean the place was! Our suite was nothing like the pictures, but it was a great value. The staff was very friendly and that's probably one of the reasons why we would return to this hotel. There was a couple of minor problems with our hotel reservation online and on the phone prior to our arrival, which made us second-guess staying here. However, the fact that the hotel staff remembered our names and always greeted us made a difference on how we felt about the place. If you are looking for a budget friendly, staff friendly hotel in Waikiki, this is the place!

The neighborhood is a busy one. If you're a light sleeper, be sure you rent the room with the separate bedroom (it insulates you from the street noise at night). The staff are very helpful and can reliably guide you to attractions and stores for your needs.

This hotel is actually in a great spot. It's in Waikiki but on the fringes of the nightlife, which makes for a real quiet stay. The room was comfortable, clean and updated. There is WIFI down in the lobby, and the rooms have Ethernet connections, which worked perfectly for our needs. All the rooms also have a safe so you don't have to worry about where to leave your valuables either. All the rooms have recently updated AC units, so you can control your own room temperature.The Staff was awesome! Every time we had a question, it was answered promptly and in a friendly manner. Jamal was an absolute sweetie and took very good care of my hubby and I.The parking is limited at the hotel and it is $20/day. There is a parking lift right around the corner for overflow if the hotel lot is full (you leave the keys to your car, they put it on a lift and drop it in a spot for you, giving you a claim slip) You do have in and out privileges for both locations at $20/day.The only complaint we have is that the bed was a little too firm, however, we're used to a waterbed...YMMV

We stayed here for a couple of days and enjoyed this hotel. What made it great were the staff all we're very helpful especially Dexter. He recommended some great restaurants. The rooms are clean and huge, some of the largest I've stayed in.

The location is 2 blocks from the beach, the great part is the international market place is litterally 100 yards from the hotel so you can cut through and be at the beach in less than 5 minutes. The staff here is excellent. Rachel is a standout, although the entire front desk staff was great. The bell staff were great, friendly, helpful and always smiling. They kept calling my mom, mom!!! The watermelon water at the front desk was a very pleasant surprise. The only con about this hotel is the beds were a little firm for my taste, but thats just my sleeping preference. I cannot wait to get back to the Aqua Pearl

We stayed for four nights at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl 15-18 September 2012. Very handy to the beach - you can walk down the pathway beside the International markets. Plenty of restaurants nearby, and close to the good hotels on the beach with restaurants, terraces etc. Is what we would call the fringe of the good Waikiki, and no problem with the location for safety etc. We were put in a noisy room above the bar but staff promptly shifted us to a superior apartment on the top floor at no extra cost. The apartment was very spacious and ideal for two couples. Good balcony. Full kitchen and rooms/beds etc perfectly adequate.Is 3 star but of a good standard and we thought very good value for money. Staff were the highlight,very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. There is an ABC and a mini supermarket very close by.Bar underneath can be good fun to - is a sports bar, but don't book the room above it.AndyAuckland

It's been my 2nd time staying to Aqua Waikiki Pearl from Honolulu, Hawaii and the experience has been amazing! The location is great and the staff is so cool, polite and helpful! My great memory was to be served by Dexter, very professional and friendly. I will surely come back to Aqua Waikiki Pearl anytime! :)

We had a marvelous stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. All staff at the front desk, (especially Harry),the chambermaids, and the hotel maintenance people were exceptional. A special shout out to Sara Beth, the concierge who went over and above on every request. The room was immaculately clean, and though the rooms in the back are smaller without a balcony, they are much quieter. The wifi in the hotel is only in the public area (lobby) which is very pleasant and continually stocked with cold watermelon water. There is Internet through Ethernet connection in the rooms if you are travelling with a laptop, but this won't help with a tablet. The rooms are equipped with a fridge, coffee maker and microwave. All in all, the aqua Pearl was very well worth the money and I can recommend it to those who like a nice hotel, with up to date amenities in the middle of the action.
user_name:
redcat777
New York City, New York

review_body: Clean, basic accommodation which is very well located for transport, food and entertainment. The rooms are spacious and the little verandah is handy. No view, but a leisurely 5 minute stroll to Waikiki beach. The staff are just lovely. There is a most excellent concerge service located in foyer. Tariffs very reasonable.

Very nice hotel that was close to everything we needed. Did not have to rent a car but still had a great time, lots to do within walking distance or short bus ride.Rooms were clean and well taken care of during our visit.

One night stay here before embarking on a 7 day Hawaiian Cruise. Excellent value/bargain hotel. Clean spacious rooms with friendly, helpful staff. Easy walk to Waikiki Beach. Many restaurants and shopping opportunities very close by. Computer available in lobby for quick internet searches. Our room had a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. Street a little noisy at night. I would reommend to budget travelers looking for a clean room to rejuvenate & sleep. Not a luxuary room to spend a lot of time in. No pool.

avg room at a decent fee whatever conveniences were overshadowed by the less than accommodating room featuresa/c mount unit had no directions stating one had to remove from wall and point at wall unit in order to operatethe pillows were musky and wreaked of sweatcigarette smoke finds its way in regardless of all doors shut speaking of, the entry door slams shut incl your neighboring rooms which sends a jolt at all hours of the wee morning
user_name:
KnightMoves808-702
Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

review_body: is a older looking hotel but was refurbished rooms they where nice, staff was the best and i have stayed at a lot of hotels. the only down fall i had was there was no WI-FI for guest rooms (except in lobby).they have Ethernet cables in rooms. but did not help me or a lot of other guest that carry ipads. i would stay there again great location if they get wi-fi in rooms.no pool or fitness room

Great value! A short walk to Waikiki Beach and lots of shopping. The room was basic, but clean. The bed was comfortable. The service was great as well. I would highly recommend this hotel for someone traveling on a budget who wants to be in the middle of everything.

This was a first time for my sister in law & aunt. We had a wonderful time and the hotel/room was excellent and a very nice size standard room (1 queen & 1 double). It accomandated all our needs and we were close to everything. The beach, restaurant and the marketplace. For the price we paid we have no complaints. The staff was excellent, a shout out to Jerome & Eric (front desk clerks) they were very kind & helpful to us. Please read the letter in the room regarding automated incoming calls and you will know what to do regarding the hoax caller. I too received one of those calls, but it was resolved immediately. Beautiful trip & hotel stay.
user_name:
Olita W
Portland, Oregon, United States

review_body: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with a kitchenette/living room space. It was fairly large but there was a lot of wasted space. The furniture sets were incomplete: In the master suite there is no closet, but there is a dresser. In the second bedroom there is a closet but no dresser. In the living room there is a couch that seats 3 and a small round dining table which can seat 4. No love seats or lounge chairs.A lot of the outlets in the suite didn't work correctly. One side would work and the other wouldn't. In the second bedroom *all* the outlets were faulty. The safe was useless. It only worked when it wanted to and would beep and glitch out when you tried to use it.The remote in the master suite wouldn't work and they initially gave us batteries but it still didn't work. After that they made no more attempts to resolve the situation despite our inquiring about it. A small thing, yes, but after the other stuff it was just one more thing to add to the list.EVERY DAY the housekeeper came by, she would take all the towels regardless of whether they were on the floor or hanging up. We had four people staying in the suite and she would still only leave 2 sets of wash cloths and body/hand towels. After calling down for more towels the first two days she serviced the room we just started putting the Do Not Disturb sign up to keep her out (and keep our towels!).The highlight was the super awesome AC units in each room (except for once when a roach fell out of one while it was off). So easy to control with the remotes!

Distant beach views and massive roomBe warey of hoax callers saying they are from reception many guests were had been frauded when we were there by a caller Staff very friendlyClose to Ross dress for less, macys and bus and trolley stops Good location for the price

Hotel is clean and comfortable - not a resort type, but centrally located to everything in Waikiki. We have stayed four times during the past three years and will return again. The staff is great - always friendly and helpful.

Enjoyed my stay very much. Hotel staff very friendly and helped me out with a very early check in after a long flight from Australia. The hotel was convienient to the town centre and not to far from the beach. Unfortunately it appears none of the rooms have a view, but I did not find this a problem as I was out and about most of the day. Room was very clean and had a nice bed. Spacious bathroom and having a microwave and a decent size fridge in my room was an added bonus. Can't wait to return and this time I hope to have my family with me. Barbara.

This property was perfectly suited for us!! The rooms are very spacious, including a full size refrigerator, sink and stove, fully equipped with cooking neccessities! This was a huge bonus having groceries there on hand and not having to eat out for every meal. The staff was always very friendly and always smiling. Tracy was outstanding in helping to accomodate us with any and all of our needs! Compared to property options around, the value that you get for the price is exceptional here! We would highly recommend everyone to the Aqua Pearl during their stay in Waikiki!!
user_name:
Jaime B
Happy Valley, Oregon, United States

review_body: The staff at the Waikiki Pearl were all fantastic. Everyone bent over backwards to make us feel comfortable and to help us in any way. It is a nice, clean hotel. The hotel was a short scenic walk to the beach through the International Marketplace, short walk from great food, and close to night clubs. My wife and I will stay there on our next visit to Hawai'i

Long story short. Booked the room for a night on priceline for a night. Priceline messed it up. The girl working at the service desk Rachel. She went above an beyond to help. She gave us a better deal, better room. It was a fast process & painless process Once we realized we didn't have to go through priceline anymore. Thank you Rachel!

Great value. The location is close to shopping, great food and just a short walk to the beach. Our room was spacious and clean. The hotel personnel was outstanding! Very friendly, welcoming, helpful and full of smiles. It was nice to be greeted by the front desk each and every time we came through the lobby. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family and would stay again in the future.

Staff were terrific especially Dexter, great location although night street traffic was an issue in the early hours. Smooth arrival and departure and would happily return. Excursions were organized, transport booked and all done with a "no problem" attitude. Maholo

A friend of mine had originally booked another hotel a bit further from Waikiki Beach, but after some googeling and reading a few reviews on Tripadvisor, I convinced him to change our booking the Pearl. It turned out to be cheaper than our original hotel, and much closer to the beach. When you add in that the rooms were great (both spacious and in very good condition) and the service was excellent, with helpful and courteous staff, the Pearl turned out to be an excellent choice. My only real complaint is that that aircon was fairly noisy, but in the hotel's defense I did not bother to ask if they could fix it (or if it was supposed to be that noisy). I should also add that parking outside the hotel is very limited, but they to inform you about that on their webpage. Additional parking is available not far away.Finally I would just like to mention that there is a nice little Italian restaurant across the street which I can also recommend.

I stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl with my partner for 11 nights. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is close enough to walk to many restaurants and also grocery stores. The shuttle to the Ala Moana shopping centre and more is just around the corner of the hotel which made it easy for transport if you don't hire a car. The beach is in easy walking distance and the international marketplace is nearby for all of those souvenir's to bring home. The staff at the hotel are all extremely friendly and are there all the time to answer any questions or direct you to the best spots in town. Our hotel room was always well looked after and kept clean for the entire duration of our trip. We stayed on the 6th floor in room 615 and throughout our time there we had no issues with loud noises at night or during the day. My partner and I had an amazing time and will be recommending the Waikiki Pearl for anyone to stay at as they made us feel at home. I will never forget my time spent here as my partner proposed to me in our hotel room. <3 Thank you so much to all the staff for an amazing time and an excellent job. We hope to be back again in the future..Christina and John.

I spent a week at this establishment and was impressed! The staff made me feel at home. If you come across Tracey or Dexter, you will be in great hands. Both helped with recreational recommendations and even mapped it out for me. The legendary Waikiki Beach is about a 5 min stroll away. There is also a sports bar (live football games YES!) and a nice little organic/veggie lunch shop located in the structure. Food pantry with fresh fruit and everything else around the corner. Great experience at an awesome price!!

I stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for four nights. The experience at the pearl was amazing. The room was comfortable and relaxing. The staff made me feel at home, Tasi the Hotel manager at the pearl always handled and answered all my questions and concerns. She made sure that my stay was a awesome and confortable stay. She also took the time to make sure that as a tourist I was enjoying my stay and also advised me of all the wonderful things I was able to do in Waikiki. I took her advice and I had a wonderful experience. I also got to get to know some of the staff as I stood at the pearl, Rachel was one of them and she was awesome, always asking how my stay is going and also took the time to remind me there were offers and great ways to explore Waikiki Hawaii. She also always made sure that my room was up to standard and if I had any questions for anything or needed any help for anything all I had to do was make a call. Along with getting to know Rachel and Tasi I also got to know Harry and Dexter they were also very nice and helpful knew how to handle everyone approaching the desk with many different questions and concerns. The Aqua Waikiki Pearl is at a very convenient and wonderful location, a 5-10 min walk from Waikiki beach and in the center of the downtown area. The hotel has the accomidations of tours to take to explore hawaii and shuttles to get you to the airport along with many other exciting activities to chose from to enjoy your ultimate hawaiian get away! This was my first time staying at the Aqua Waikiki pearl and I am looking forward to my next stay there, it will for sure not be my last time staying there the experience and the staff including the Manager Tasi were wonderful and I am deffinately going back to the Aqua waikiki Pearl!!! :) ~Cristal Marin~ ;)

We stayed at the Pearl for 6 days, this is my second stay at this hotel. The rooms are large, and great to have a microwave and fridge in the room. The staff is super friendly and very helpful. The location is awesome, super close to walk to the beach, for food and even a grocery store. Shuttles to the outlet mall are just around the corner, and it is across the street from the International Market. The beds are very comfortable adn the rooms are clean. We had a large balcony that had a table and chairs to enjoy morning coffee as well, however it is just a little bit noisy in the evening as there is a club very close by. Checking in and out was quick and easy, and they will hold your bags when you check out (we had a night flight). Will stay here again for sure! THanks for a great stay!!
user_name:
Alison B
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: I stayed one night at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl before our cruise. The immediate area around the hotel is looking rather dated however the hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the amazing Waikiki beach area. Just walk through the Market Place until you come out the other side and you won't believe what you see. The hotel is fine. It was clean although the area around the hotel did not seem like the safest at night, although it may just be a bit seedy as opposed to dangerous.My review is really about the service at the hotel, which more than made up for the hotel itself. In particular, Dexter was so helpful and accommodating to our large group of close to 30 people, and did whatever he could to get us all settled in. He also helped with restaurants, transportation to Pearl Harbor, and transportation to the cruise ship. If you're looking for luxury this isn't the place, but if you are looking for a decent sized clean room, good service, friendly staff, and a good price you should stay here without hesitation.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in August. I wish I knew that this was a "motel-style" hotel - the hallways are outdoor and open to other buildings/hotels. I didn't feel very safe at night. Our room was medium size, generally clean bathroom, but I have definitely stayed in nicer hotels. Staff are generally friendly. Location is good, close to shops and dining, and short walk to the beach. Other downside: hotel offers beach towels but they run out mid-day if you don't grab one in the morning. I would recommend this hotel more if you are travelling with a group of friends, rather than as a couple. Waikiki in general is very busy and very touristy, so if you are looking for a quiet beach vacation, skip it altogether.

We have just recently returned from 2 weeks in Hawaii and stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for our first few days in a 3 bedroom suite. Excellent way to stay when traveling with friends (6) as it gives you a lot more room than hotel rooms and you have the use of the kitchenette if you don't want to eat out etc. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location was great and only a couple of blocks from the beach." Just a note for travellers moving through Honolulu Domestic Airport you need to allow 2 hours plus minimum to get through check-in and airport security!! " They cannot cope with the huge number of travellers using their airport!Kiwi Travellers

I recently returned from a 2 week stay at the Pearl. I travelled with a few friends and we had a 2brm apartment on the 5th floor at the same end as reception. The only possible downfall that we experienced was that the glass doors to the balcony & the windows are not double glazed (sound proof) so the noise of people yelling and garbage trucks coming past every morning at 6am was not the best wakeup call! With that being the only thing that I could say was a downfall, the positives definitely out-weighed the negatives. I would like to commend every person that you have working in the hotel from Jamar on reception to the cleaners, everyone was so friendly & helpful! We booked some tours with Michael on the tour desk & he also was great & knowledgable! A huge bonus for us was when we arrived at 8am at the hotel after a 9.5hr flight and expected to be told to come back at 3pm for check-in to our joy our room was ready....Great way to start our stay! I would definitely recommend the Pearl to anyone just as for a room away from the main road & you will have a great time. Rooms are clean & tidy and we defiantly didn't have any stains on our carpets and our kitchen was extremely clean & tidy! Thanks again Aqua Waikiki Pearl, I will definatley be recommending your property to anyone that goes to Hawaii. Keep up the good work & keep the staff you currently have because they are who make your hotel stand out from others.

When my friend and I found out that our favorite hotel in Waikiki was booked for our entire stay, we had to look around. Being one of the last reasonable and affordable places left that weekend, I booked it on a whim. When we got there, Harry and Jamar at the front desk were more than helpful when it came to getting us checked in smoothly and showing us where we were on the map. We decided to upgrade, and it was definitely worth it.We ended up on the top floor (10th) with a gorgeous suite. The view wasn't so great, but you know you're in for a good time when you can see Zanzibar nightclub from one side (and the Ala Wai Canal on the other). From the outside, you may not expect it to be the nicest hotel, but they sure have renovated the inside (and in my opinion, being hidden makes it that much better). It's right off Kuhio Ave. and is in walking distance to the International Marketplace, a grocery store, Starbucks, nightclubs, the beach, everything you'd want from Waikiki. Checking out was equally easy and they held our bags and let us relax in their lobby while waiting for our ride to the airport.

When we arrived, we were greeted by Tasi and Eric at the front desk with a big smile. Since we arrive an hour early they offered to hold onto our luggage and even asked if we wanted towels so we could check out the beach until the room was ready. After checking into our 2br suite, it was clean and very spacious. We also took advantage of the full kitchen and enjoyed having breakfast on the patio. Our kids told us that we need to come back to Hawaii next summer and to ask for the same suite if possible. Thank you to the all the front desk staffing and see you next summer!
user_name:
Steve Y
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: Aqua WAIKIKI Pearl hotel is really awesome. I chose it for its special price, while I find the facilities there are really nice. what is more important that staffs there are quite nice, kind and helpful. it is close to strip and there is also a store helping me send my postcard...
user_name:
Yuhang_He
New York City, New York

review_body: I'm so glad we chose to stay at Aqua Waikiki Pearl recently. The room (808) was a lot bigger than we expected, which was definately a good thing! One person who helped make our trip even better was Jamar. He was so friendly, every time we saw him he never failed to give us an energetic greeting and would ask how our day was or ask what our plans were etc. Jamar was genuinely interested in giving us advice on the best places to go, he couldn't have been more helpful to us if he tried. I can easily say this was the best trip of my life and I know the rest of my family agree! Hawaii is so beautiful and I will be going back as soon as I can and I know where I'd stay, Aqua Waikiki Pearl!

We stayed there for a month, we could of move to another hotel or resort but the location and the staff was just perfect for my family, we stayed at the two bd with kitchen and we felt pretty good very spacious room... The staff was awesome always helpfull and friendly.... Dexter (diego),Rachel, Keisha, Jammar and Eric they would always help... this people were awesome to us and the kids... The Garcia family!Mahalo for everything!

Aqua Waikiki Pearl isn't the fanciest hotel in Waikiki, but it was fine for my recent stay. This hotel is off the main street in Waikiki and still convenient to the beach and the shops. All of the employees were friendly and ready to help. My room was on the top floor - spacious and comfortable with a sunny balcony. Ice & vending were only on another floor, but there was a refrigerator and microwave in the room so it didn't matter to me. No pool, but you're in Hawaii so going to the beach is a better option! No on site restaurant, but there are plenty of options within easy walking distance. Only thing I missed was wifi in the room, it was only available in the lobby. Internet in the room required their ethernet cable. I would stay here again. Mahalo!

We stayed here for 2 nights and thought it was great. This is not a 5 Star Resort-like hotel, so if that's what you are looking for, this is not the place for you (and you won't find such perfection and ammenities for the rates charged at the Pearl). When we booked this hotel, I set reasonable expectations. This is not the hotel for you if you want a place where you can hang out all day/night . But if you are looking for a clean, affordable, comfortable place to sleep and shower and want to be in a good location in an expensive city (5 min walk to Waikiki Beach), then this is the right place. The rooms are all very spacious and we were upgraded to a larger room at check in (without even asking). The staff is very helpful and friendly. This place is ideal for shorter-stays where you don't need hotel ammenities to supplement your activities.

We stayed 3 nights and we had no major complaints besides the noise from other guest slamming their doors and no pool. this is a motel style hotel... the kind where you walk down a outdoor hallway to get to your room. The hotel is located about 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach (10 min walk at the most) with no pool at the hotel the walk gets long after a few days. There are several dining options nearby and a grocery store (Food Pantry) 1 block away. The staff is very friendly except Kisha, but I learned she was let go a few days before our departure. The rooms are spacious and clean, I requested a 2 queen bed room, but they had reserved me a king room by the time I arrived. They changed it to a queen and a double so it worked out to say the least. I reccommend that you call in advance to reconfirm your room choice with the hotel so you aren't dissatisfied. I was in room 311 there were no strange smells, the carpet wasn't stained either.

This was our first (and last) time staying at an Aqua property. Pros: Good location, Very large room, people at front desk are very nice/welcoming, small flat screen television in living area. Cons: Hallways leading to room are nasty (stained carpets). Once in room ---- Carpets are soiled (didn't want to take my shoes off), Not a pleasant view (kept our curtains closed), outdated box television in bedroom, kitchen with foil on stove burners, because of soiled carpet I didn't trust kitchen was clean --- we wound up going out to eat, ........ Just not a very nice place to stay while I'm relaxing on vacation. They had made attempts to update the room we stayed in however, it still needed a lot of work.This would be a great property for someone who is travelling with a sports team (we noticed a water polo team staying), a very large family. We booked our stay for 5 nights and only stayed 1.

Waikiki has so many hotels all you can really do is take a chance. Here is where we landed: Aqua Waikiki Pearl a block from the canal and off Kuhio St. A very entertaining area of Waikiki with lots of bars and restaurants nearby on Kuhio St. The hotel is near the bus line and a few blocks from Waikiki Beach (not a bad walk even at night). We caught the local bus to go to Ala Moana Mall, Iolani Palace and Hanauma Bay to snorkel. The hotel looked clean and decent (no bugs). The room was a good size with 2 HARD double beds. The nice size bathroom with good hot water pressure in the shower helped to ease our sore muscles in the morning. For free internet we used the ethernet cable supplied in the room for the laptop (no biggie). We used our room mostly for sleep, storage, and laundry ($2 a load). Will not be staying here again unless beds get updated. Very poor sleep quality. Will try our luck elsewhere.

Not the best place to stay. Rooms and building were old and poorly kept. Stains on carpet, walls and run down basic furnishings. Wifi access was only avaliable in tiny hotel lobby. We stayed here just for one night. The Pearl provided a place to sleep but that was it. I would not stay here again for the price. Staff was friendly but that was the only thing I can say was good.

We stayed August 5-10th of 2012 and the accommodations were set up through a travel agent so we were not sure what to expect. The value for what we received was decent. We wish it had some more amenities, pool, spa, exercise room or restaurant. Too much noise from the street where our room was located especially with family.I would have to say the desk clerks were fun and knowledgeable. Jamar, Dexter, Eric, Harry and Kisha were terrific. They had fun with us everyday and spoke to us no matter when we were around. They deserve a raise or an employee merit. Tell Jamama Tiny says Aloha and hope to come again soon. Have a nice day as we did always. Aloha Mo, George and Dawson.

Staying at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl has been a wonderful experience. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki. Restaurants, stores, and all kinds of entertainment, including Waikiki Beach, are within walking distance. The hotel is also very clean. It has a laundry for the guest’s convenience. The staff members are extremely friendly, especially Lucena. She is very kind and professional.

My friend and I stayed at the Aqua Pearl in July 2012. It is a good place to stay if you are looking for someone to sleep in between busy days seeing the area! But it is not a resort style hotel and would not be good if you are looking to relax by the pool (it doesn't have one!).Good:* Good location in central Waikiki and right near the bus route* Friendly and helpful staff* Free wifi in the foyer* Junior Suite room was enormous and balcony was greatNot so good:* Noisy area - but I think most of Waikiki probably falls into this category!* Rooms are quite dated, older style carpets and furniture

I just want to commend the staff members Kisha and Dawn for the help and professionalism that I received from them and for making my stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl enjoyable and stressfree. It had been a long time since I had experienced customer service and professionalism like that in a long time. Thank you Thank you. It was nothing but the best.

Very friendly staff and helpful any information you need just ask and you'll have a numerous of options to choose from. The Rodriguez, Lemus, and De Garcia Family from California and Vancuver BC, Canada.......

I would love to come back as long as Jamar and Eric is still working there!! Made our stay at the hotel that much more enjoyable! Thank you! Nice rooms, friendly faces and in a perfect location to explore Hawaii!

The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the beach. Our room was looking to the main street and early in the morning it was very loud. The wi-fi is only reachable in the lobby, in the rooms is internet cable connection. The rooms are clean, enough fresh towels, there is a small fridge and a microwave.

We spent 4 nights here in room 704 which is a huge room with 2 double beds, fridge, and microwave. If they rearranged the furniture, they could fit a little living area in the room. Friends of ours were staying in 709 which is a much smaller room. The location is fine and the staff is super nice and friendly. The lobby is small but clean and comfortable. Rooms are also clean and comfortable. At night we prefer to sleep without airconditioning but the air conditioner was tricky to turn off. The parking lot is super small, but we were able to park on the Ala Wai. The building could use a little love. All in all an enjoyable stay

This hotel was all we needed. Very friendly staff and a large hotel room (Junior Suite) due to an upgrade. Help was always on hand at the front desk if we needed it. The rooms were kept very clean and the hotel felt very secure. Definetly recommend this hotel to others.

We had a great week here. Basic clean accommodations with very friendly staff. Located across the street (mountain side) from International Marketplace and the Moana Surfrider, you are basically in the center of Waikiki and it's not far to walk to anywhere you may want to be. Laundry is located on the 3rd floor and ice and vending machines are on the 7th. We stayed in Room 505 which is centrally located. It had a king size bed with ample room to layout all our luggage and shopping. There is an easy to use in-room safe which we found very useful.The rooms are hardwired for Internet and a cable is provided, but if you want WiFi you have to go to the lobby and ask for a login code. Each device needs a separate code and WiFi is only available in the lobby. Luckily there's plenty of seating in the lobby as well as a computer for you to use. If you have a rental car and need parking, you'll probably need to park off-site because the rear lot is very small and almost always full.There isn't a pool or other amenities in the hotel but being in Waikiki, the beach is not far if you want to swim and there are plenty of hotel bars and lounges and restaurants nearby if you want refreshments. For those looking for coffee, Starbucks is one door down on the corner.

Spent a week at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl and loved my stay there. The staff is amazing (especially Jamma) and really makes you feel like part of their family. Every time we walked through the lobby we were asked how our day was and received a greeting. The staff was very helpful in providing tips regarding what sites to see. Our room was spacious and clean, there was three of us staying in the room and space was not an issue. The location of the hotel is in the heart of downtown Waikiki and couldn't have been more optimal. We were minutes (walking distance) from the beach and places to eat. We were surrounded by ABC stores and the International Market Place. Parking is minimal for the hotel, and the one night we did have a car we found it hard to find parking (the parking spaces fill up by 5:30pm) but we learned that is just how it is in Waikiki. I would definitely stay in this hotel if I return to Oahu.

Although this hotel was off the beach it was close to all the main attractions in Waikiki. The staff were excellent, the room was large,clean and well fitted with everything you expect today. Great place would stay there again.

Spent one week at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl and the family has decided this will be our go-to hotel when we return to Oahu. The staff is amazing and treats you like one of the family. Everytime we walked through the lobby we received a greeting or comment about how our day was, etc... Our room was clean and spacious. We are a family of four and we have stayed in many hotels where we are stepping all over each other because the rooms are tiny. That was not the case at the AWP, we were super comfortable in our room. The fridge, micro and coffe maker were very convenient and helped save money. The hotel's location could not have been more optimal. We were steps away from the International Market Place, minutes away from the beach and surrounded by ABC stores and places to eat. The parking spaces are minimal but for the two days we did have a car we had no trouble finding a spot in the parking lot. I can't say enough good things about our stay at the AWP. We are planning a return visit to Oahu next summer and will definitely be staying here again.

The people working at the front desk (especially Eric and Harry) were terrific! They were extremely friendly and helpful. They greeted us each time that we entered and left the hotel lobby, and they provided prompt, friendly service each time that we asked them for help. They even provided tips regarding what to see and do in the area. Also, the location is good – a safe area, a short walk to the beach. I would highly recommend this hotel – it provides excellent value for your money!

The Hotel is well situated for shopping and just a short walk to the beach. The staff are the most friendly, helpful and courteous people that I have ever met while on holidays. A big thankyou for making our stay so warm and enjoyable. So lovely to walk into the foyer after hours of shopping and sore feet to be greeted with Aloha! how are you! Only thing I missed was a swimming pool.Trish- Melbourne

EXCELLENT SERVICE is their motto and they treat their guest fantastic like a 5 STAR hotel.The location is great and the staff makes you feel like you are at a "5" STAR hotel and the cost is reasonable. Everyone greets you with a smile and always willing to help you out. My family and I want to give a special Thank you to Kisha, Rachel, Jamar, Eric Peterson,Carmen and Harry (front desk ) they are AWESOME and ALWAYS made us glad we stayed at this hotel. They would laugh and really talk with you which made this visit wonderful. The room was always clean, thanks to Lucena (housekeeping). This was the BEST hotel we have ever stayed in during a vacation and we would definitely recommend this hotel for any family vacation. It is safe and your family will be treated like family with this EXCELLENT staff. Plus it is close to restaurants and the shopping area.A "5" STAR HOTEL is how you feel when you stay here.

Hotel is great... Excellent location, good rooms and the BEST staff (which really make the hotel what it is!!!!) A special thanks to Rachel-Rachel, Dexter, Jafar (haha) and Eric (which is an excellent massage therapist)... you are the best!!!! always just a call, smile and joke away even at 2 or 3 in the morning!!! I can only recommend this hotel and if you do decide to go there just hang at the front desk for a while... that is where the party is!!!! Hope to see you guys sometime soon in Hawaii, Australia or Switzerland.... Biiig Huuuug

Arrived without doing our homework... staff fixed everything and were awesome the whole time..this is a nice cheap clean hotel, a block from the beach, all the shopping you can do and great restaurants.. if anyone says its too noisy or didnt find it nice... has a real problem.. this place is great.staff always had a smile and welcomed you and were only to willing to help you every day.. A definite will stop again !!!!! thanks again!!!

I. booked this hotel online simply because of the positive reviews that I read. This was my famlies first visit to hawaii and the good people at this hotel made it a very pleasant experience from the start. The staff was always smiling and never let us come or go without a good morning or nice greeting. We were made to feel right at home. The location is perfect for the money, only 5 min. Walk to beach, and so clean. We would stay here a again in a heartbeat.

From the minute we walked into the Aqua Waikiki Pearl, we felt as if we were at home! The staff were so friendly and made our stay a memorable one! I would like to make a special mention to Rachel, Dexter, Jamar and Eric who would greet us every morning/afternoon and have lovely chats! They went above and beyond to help us everyday, whether it was booking us a massage or a bus to transport us! Mahalo and hope to see you in Hawaii or Australia soon!

I was very please with this hotel and it's location. Very handy for the bus, restaurants walking distiance for a lot of the shows I always go see while in Honolulu. Also all of the staff especially at the front desk were very friendly calling me by my first name whenever I was going in and out or even using my local nick name of "Auntie Clic Clic" . Room was always clean and plenty of room for things to have on hand. The only thing was that the toilet(ha) was a little low as I have been having trouble with my one hip but I made out OK.

My husband and I stayed for two nights. We were very comfortable with the hotel. First of all the hotel location is fantastic! Wonderful people who work there made our stay very special! Our favorite staff was Dexter! He was just nice. Also a concierge was so good! She was very nice to us. We requested for free upgrade room over the Email, and it really happened!! We had a great time in Hawaii. Thank you very much for your wonderful hospitality. Mahalo!

As a large family making a military move to Hawaii, the staff and facilities at the hotel were outstanding. Eric, Dexter and Jamar were the most friendly and helpful in making our transition to the island as smooth as possible. They were never to busy to recommend a place to eat or give us advice on other activities. This was by far the best stay at a hotel during our move. The entire staff at Aqua Pearl was outstanding. Thank you for making us feel at home!

We loved the Aqua Waikiki Pearl staff. They are so helpful. One person really stood out. Eric Peterson. He was professional and personal. So kind to our whole family. We now friends with him and found out that his Uncle lives by us on the mainland so he asked us to look him up. Eric is a genuine asset to your hotel. I've observed him and Eric is thoughtful to everyone! What a natural public relations person. Thank you for the wonderful experience we had in Hawaii! Mahalo!

Felt so welcome by thier friendly staff, Dexter n Tracey, also made us feel welcome, I loved how spacious, clean, friendly, n the view alone is beautiful. Thanks Aqua pearl staff for making a joyful nite for us. Can't wait to come bak and celebrate n stay thier again.

Dexter is a great asset to your company. He means well and mends well with his customers. He knows exactly what to say while being asked questions. I appreciate people that represent and stand prominently to promote great, efficient and outstanding customer service! My stay at the Aqua Pearl was my first and it will not be my last; great rooms, great location and great service!

First, let me say that the employees were really great and welcoming. We had no issues with our reservation or getting into our room. Great location. You are right across the street from the International Marketplace, which made us feel like we were in the heart of Waikiki. A couple of blocks from the beach. Starbucks (not that good) within steps and ABC stores, for incidentals, every half block. Room was fairly clean and was good sized, with outside entrance. Microwave, refrigerator and safe were nice extras. The main complaint was noise, or to be more specific, closing of doors. When the neighbors closed their doors, it seemed to be inches from you and shake the entire room. We were awakened several times during our stay with the sound of shutting doors. We didn't really hear people in their rooms and didn't hear a ton of external noises (except for the doors) until 5:30 or 6:00am. For those who value watching TV on vacation (just saying), this is not the place. Elevators were slow. We were on the 3rd floor so just took the steps most of the time. The Pearl is fine for what it is. It is a budget hotel in a great location. We chose to spend our money on skydiving rather than on a nicer hotel and the Pearl certainly served that purpose. Some people aren't familiar with it so if you are in a Taxi or Shuttle, just tell them to go to Ohana West.
Thank you Tracey K and Dexter for your excellent service we received at your hotel. We really enjoyed ourselves, and loved our room hehe. We cant wait to visit again;) Thank you again

I initially booked the room for 2 nights but had to check out earlier. But the one night left a great impression. I had a busy day and was dead tired by check in time. Thankfully the front desk staff Kisha and Tracy were very helpful and expedited my check in process. They also helped out with the parking situation that was a plus plus.There was a minor "bug" problem in my room. I reported it to front desk, and Tracy was kind enough to upgrade us to a suite. Which was a very nice touch.Tracy checked up on us to see if everything was ok with our room. The location is great for night life. It's close to a lot of night clubs and bars if that is your thing. The international market is close by if you wanna walk around. We were in waikiki to celebrate my birthday and the pearl is the perfect location. That was my first stay there and I will definitely be back. Thank you Tracy and your staff for making this a memorable stay and for showing lots of aloha to this gal :)

We ended up staying week at the hotel when the house we were moving into was not ready. It was a very stressful time with all our belongings packed in a moving truck & not knowing when we would be able to move into our house. We let the staff know our situation & that we had no idea how long we would be there. They were incredible, working with us to make sure we were taken care of & all our needs were met. I would like to thank Jamar Bautista for taking care of us. He was incredible! All the staff we dealt with at the Pearl were great! This is now the hotel we recommend to all our guests coming in from the mainland.C. Lacy

We reserved two rooms for a party of 5 well ahead of time and got a good deal, about $80 for each basic room per night. When we arrived, we were upgraded to 2 suites! What a surprise! The rooms were spacious, well furnished, clean and were high enough to be away from the street noise below.Pros: Clean, quiet, spacious, affordable, Close to many restaurants, shops, Int'l Market Place, and Waikiki beach. Parking available for $20 per night. Free wi-fi in the lobby.Cons: One room had a slight, funky smell to it, but was fine after we aired it out for a couple minutes. No wi-fi in rooms. Prostitutes strutting their stuff on the streets below at 4AM

We only stayed one night on our way to Samoa but could not have been better. The front desk staff was very friendly and efficient. Room was bigger than expected with microwave and fridge. Internet access a plus at no extra charge! Big bathroom and room was very clean. No complaints whatsoever and very good deal on room. Hope to stay there again as we visit Hawaii every year.
Made my stay very comfortable , wonderful front desk attendants. Perfect location only 2 blocks from the beach and amazing spot for the night life . Will most definatly be back to stay here again!

The service was far beyond what I have ever experienced in a hotel in Waikiki. Dexter and Jamar that my stay was the best! Kisha was very helpful in many ways. I would like to thank Tracy who is one of the manager's in making sure that my stay was taken care of. Parking was a problem but thanks to Dexter and Jamar who directed me to the best spot to park my wife's new Armada 2012 Platnium. There was no scratch was so ever and it was brand new. I am so greatful and thankful that there a people who not only cares about your stay but also cares about your personal things. 5 Star and you can bank this home because it has been the best deal I had ever made. Aqua Waikiki Pearl is the true Pearl in Waikiki.

Friendliest hotel staff ever!! Dexter and Jamar were the highlight, always ready with big smiles, funny jokes, and a helping hand. Every other staff member was great too. They actually get to know you and help to personalize your stay. The lobby is cute and modern and the location right off of Kuhio is fantastic. My brother booked this place for my best friend and I knowing it is close to some of our favorite places in Waikiki. Our room was gigantic and it was very nice having a mini-fridge. Happy to report that the Aqua Waikiki Pearl contributed to a personal first - staying in Wakiki for a week without seeing a single cockroach! =-) (I have stayed at some not-so-fab places in the past and was pleasantly surprised.)If you are looking for a very quiet stay, this might not be the place for you - it IS in the heart of Waikiki so you are surrounded by the sounds that a city (and its many visitors) makes. If you are looking to stay in a clean, convenient place where the staff actually adds to your enjoyment, and you don't have an unlimited budget - then the Aqua Waikiki Pearl can't be beat.Book the Pearl and say Aloha and Mahalo to Jamar and Dexter!

I would like to say Thank you to Tasi and her staff who made our stay very welcoming and enjoyable! Everyone was always so helpful and friendly. They were always there when we had a question or 2 to ask.Thank you Tasi and staff for Great Customer Service! I would definitely invite all my friends and family to your hotel! Mauruuru from Tahiti!

The location of this budget hotel is great, close to all the action of Waikiki. The rooms are nothing fancy at all, but most have a great city view. There is no pool here, but the beach is about a 10 minute walk. The best thing was the friendly and helpful desk and bell staff. All were quick to help or make suggestions on places to go and how to get there. Good budget hotel for the money.

They were very friendly to us completlly give the meaning to Aloha! Tracy the manager was a sweet heart to us after we were disappointed by the Aqua Bamboo hotel! They were extremely nice and kind! Thanks to you all! Had a wonderful stay!

We had a room on the 8th floor. At first, we noticed some little bugs in it. Then we noticed some bigger bugs in it. It's Hawaii - probably typical and the door was "breezy", but I don't like bugs. We went down to the desk and asked to change rooms. Eric was great. He changed us and upgraded us to a two bedroom suite for our troubles. That room was excellent and had no bugs. The location for this hotel is great because it is 2 blocks from the beach and right by the International Marketplace which I loved to walk around at night. Would stay here again. Staff did everything they could to make our stay great.
Jamar, the bell man had the best personality. Every morning he greeted my family and was exstreamly helpful!!! Will definitely come back!

We stayed in a two bedroom suite--it's really one bedroom and another living room separated into two rooms by a curtain. Regardless, the room was incredibly comfortable and the balcony was useful for drying swimsuits and towels after a day at the beach. In the lobby you are always greeted with a warm welcome from familiar faces. Jamar was very entertaining and helpful every time we needed something from the lobby area. We would visit this hotel again solely for Jamar's company! Awesome hotel and most affordable!!

We spent 4 nights here, and had an excellent experience. Rooms were clean and well kept, the location is great, but best of all is the staff. They were incredible! Jamar and Dexter at the front desk provided especially outstanding service. Thanks for a great stay!
user_name:
Sarah C
Beaverton, Oregon, United States

review_body: Staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were nicely cleaned I stayed June 13-June 24 and I enjoyed the hotel very much. Great location, near everything I would recommend it to anyone.

My sister and I recently stayed at this hotel and felt so welcome. The hotel itself is what you would expect for the price and the location is great, however the front desk staff make it truely extraordinary. I have never experienced staff who enjoy their jobs as much and are so genuinely friendly and interested in the guests. When my husband and I return we will stay at this hotel just because of Eric, Harry and Rachel...... good job!

I was in Honolulu for 3 days and nights for business....so even though I wasn't paying out of pocket myself I still booked here. If I were to return to Waikiki and pay for it, I would most likely stay at the Pearl. It is about 1/3 the price of the hotels right on the beach....and it is less than a 10 minute walk from room to beach. The room is big, clean and has everything you need for basics. It does seem a bit bare....but it had an ironing board and a safe, so I was happy. The people at the front desk like Dexter and Jamal could not have been nicer or more willing to help out. You can book tours there as well. The hotel does feel a bit like a hotel since the doors open to the outside,,,,but you still have to pass through the lobby to get to them...so you feel safe. There is street nose, from sirens, motorcycles, people and music at some nearby club until 4am...and I was on the 10th floor and could still hear it. But it is not over powering. Funny I did think I smelled faint wet dog on a towel, I dropped it and used another....then I read it is pet friendly....guess someone used that towel for the dog and it didn't wash out. All and all this is a great spot on Waikiki for much less than beach front price. To me these things were worth the trade off.

My wife and I celebrated our 32nd Anniversary with a 14 day stay in Waikiki at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. The room was spacious and clean. The front desk staff were caring, helpful and gave us A-1+++++ customer service. This was our 4th trip to Waikiki and we have stayed at this and other Aqua Waikiki hotels, but this was the best one! Front desk staff members Dexter and Jamar are really great people and made us feel very welcome. When a staffer can remember your name and ask how your day went.......that makes you feel like a VIP guest. I can't say enough about this great hotel which is walking distance to the beach, the International Market (which has some great eating places) and nearby eateries. Our next stay will definitely be at this Aqua hotel. Lynette Eastman is the Area General Manager and she was very accommodating and made our stay extra special. Thanks to all there that made this a wonderful stay.

This was my first trip to Hawaii and the staff were very friendly and helpful. They have a great location that allows you to get to most tourist places within walking distance. The room I was given was huge and could have fit two air mattress if necessary for extra guest.

the rooms where great, loved the bathroom! location is good, just 2 blocks from the beach! the service is amazing. everyone is very helpfull and always smiling:) loved Jamal, always made us laugh:))) i would definitely come back her. you get more than you pay for!
The Staff were very friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel is perfect.
user_name:
Emmanuel V
Anchorage, Alaska, United States

review_body: clean rooms, thin walls- heavy doors- Friday night the people who stayed next door kept slamming their doors in the middle of the night- very annoying-- The staff were great. Be aware of very difficult parking and the hotel charges $20 a night to park there. for a " staycation" this place will do- we would stay here again. Pet friendly :-)

Just wanted to say "Mahalo" to Tracey and her staff at Aqua Waikiki Pearl. It was our first stay at the hotel and guarantee it won't be our last. From the day we checked in until the day we checked out, Tracey's warm smile and easy going personality made us enjoy our stay in Waikiki. Tracey answered all our questions and was visible throughout the property which made us feel safe. We're from Hawai'i Island and will definitely make Aqua Waikiki Pearl and Tracey our home away from home....aloha and mahalo...

Aqua Waikiki Pearl is awsome, my parents stay there for 2 weeks, we booked the standard room and the room was spacious and clean !!!! it is just great. (my parents, my sister and my cousin; 4 people in hotel and we didn't feel crouded at all + My husband and I hang out with them, so a total of 6 people !!! 5 adults and a child and we were not walking on each other)Located in the middle of Waikiki, it makes the hawaiian vacation complete with night walks on Kalakaua Avenue.I highly recomend the Aqua Pearl Waikiki
user_name:
Heiani B
Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: My friends and I spent a week at the Aqua Wikiki Pearl during Memorial Day weekend, from the moment we got to the hotel the staff was absolutley amazing. our flight was slightly early and the transporttion provider we used was reccommended by the hotel. They were there waiting for us and it went without a hitch. The hotel is in such a great location! just a short walk to the beach and the international market place is literally across the street. starbucks is on the corner and legonds is a bar attatched.. have a mai tai!Our room wasn't ready as we were quite early but they checked our bags and we went to get some lunch. worked out just fine for us.. since we were pretty hungry.on our return to the hotel they apologized that the room was stilll being cleaned, and it would be about 15 min. so that not being a problem we found the perfect opportunity to speak with the consierge Sarah Beth. WHO IS AWESOME!! she was able to book us everything we wanted to do and we didnt have to omit ANYTHING!! She combined a few things and made it as simple and easy breazy as possible. she also gave us information about the japanese lantern lighting ceremony that they do annualy which was an amazing thing to experience on memorial day. after we finnished up our tours ( which I totally recommend you do the day you get there so you can fit in everything you want to do) we were handed our keys and off to the room we went we had the Jr suite which was a great size room for 3 ladies it had a balcony and fridge counter top and microwave. Very clean rooms and beds. only a few stains on the carpets, but those were minor. the next morning we were greeted by a smilig staff and an aloha.. every time you come and go they say hello and tell you to enjoy your day or evening. Jamar was a delight. he took care of us anytime we needed somethig, recommendations on dining, or needing a cab. always a delight, he even broght us some Leonards doughnuts a local yummy treat.. We brought him and Sara Beth a doughnut the day before from another bakery we found , just for being so nice.. and we get a box of doughnuts filled with guava and coconut and chocolate.. i forget the name of the doughnut but they were delightful. I have stayed at many hotels across the world and the Staff at this hotel by far is the most amazing staff I have ever come across, I cant remember everyones names but seriously EVERYONE we came into contact with at this hotel was just the most polite and professional people they all deserve something extra.. I would stay here again and again ... people complained they dont have a pool... um you are in HAWAII you have an entire ocean so go with an amazing staff who truly treats you like OHANA (family) Mahalo my friends and Aloha!

I really appreciate the staff making me feel good. I stayed for my birthday at the pearl and it was wonderful i really liked the way the staff greeted me everytime i walked in and out the property and i walked in and out alot hahaha

I had to coordinate memorial arrangements in Hawaii in the first week of May. The entire staff proved how they have been superbly managed by Karishma Chowfin. The level of consideration and eagerness the entire staff gave to me, for any matter, are beyond reproach. They will do their best for you. You can be certain of that.

I just stayed here for one night before I headed out to Kauai. The hotel is relatively cheap, in comparison with the other hotels in Waikiki, may be due to the fact that it is not on the beach, but across the street from the beach. Honestly, it made no difference to me, because this hotel is in the center of the Waikiki area and therefore, I could walk to almost any place I wanted to. I had asked for a one room with two beds, and they gave me a free upgrade to a suite-like room. I really enjoyed staying here, and will definitely come back.

Did my homework before booking at this Hotel. Most of the hotels in the neighborhood were significantly more expensive like $60-$380 more per night on the weekend! wow! We were here to celebrate my birthday with family and friends. We didn't want to stay at some high end hotel nor some grungy place we never heard of. First of all the hotel is a little hard to find, but that was okay, we figured it out in less than "two shakes". Parking is right there on the property and I liked the fact that I could see my car and not have to walk over a mile like some hotels just to get to it. Parking is first come first to park, so we just left our car there the whole time because we could walk or take a cab to everywhere in Waikiki. I heard that they have other places to park also at their sister properties. Check in was super fast, got some coupons and a free newspaper, that was cool. The girl checking me in ( I think her name was Tracy) saw that today was my birthday and upgraded me to a one bedroom suite, that was the the best thing I could have asked for! Sweetness!! When we got upstairs and I thought holy smokes this room is just way too big for us! I mean the room was so big that if you stood in the middle of the hallway and talked, your voice actually echoed, this room was so big that you could probably fit 40 people in there for a party and they could all sleep over. There was a full kitchen and even ice in the freezer. About 1/2 hour after we got in to the room Tracy called to see if we liked the room and if there was anything else that we needed, I thought that that was a nice touch. The room was clean and the pool and Jacuzzi was right across the street. The free stuff included cable, 2 flat screen tvs with remote, coffee, internet ( most places nowadays that's not included) it was pretty fast we watched some streaming movies. The locations is right in the middle of Waikiki so everything is about 5 minutes away or less ( if you are a fast walker like me) ; convenience store, restaurants, night clubs, shops, theater and the beach. The next day I saw that some of the other people staying here had dogs, hmm, if I had known this was a pet friendly hotel I would have brought mine, come to think of it my room didn't smell of pets. I guess that house keeping does a pretty good job if that's the case. I called them for more pillows, I like me a lot of pillows. We caught a cab to go to dinner, I was worried that we would have to wait a while, but the cab was waiting for us when we got down stairs, super convenient. We hit the late night, night life and man let me tell you, I loved the idea of having to walk just 5 minutes to my room. Ya, I liked the balcony too, got a small tan and the view was really nice. The next day, I asked for a late check out and they said it was no problem, that won me over, I am definitely recommending this place and we would absolutely stay here again.
user_name:
Daniel P
Waipahu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: BAD THINGS:- The bathroom was really dirty when I arrived there, mainly the toilet. I asked them 3 times to clean everything but they didn't do it and moreover they said that they usually don't clean outside of the toilet, only inside of it. OMG! How come the guy from the desk told us this? - If you wanna use the internet in the room, you have to use cable. Don't take tablets or ipad if you don't wanna stay in the public hall. So there is no wi-fi in the rooms, only in the entrance of the hotel.- The hotel is old.- The house keeper used to leave garbage of the rooms during the day in the corridors.- Parking fee is $20 per night.GOOD THINGS- By the price, the amenities were ok. - The location was really convenient.- The staff are really cordial.

I stayed at the Aqua Island Colony in October, however they did not have availability so I chose a different Aqua property. My room appeared newly renovated and was spacious and comfortable. I did not have a lanai or view, but that was fine since I was in town on business. I had a couple of issues upon check in(missing remote, internet), but they were resolved immediately. Front desk and bellman were always friendly and helpful. I felt this was a good value for my business trip. The only negative was the limited parking. I'm not sure I would recommend for someone who will have a car the for the whole trip. To be fair, I was always able to park on site, but there was always some stress when returning with hoping that I would'nt have to park off site. Since I was there on business, I would leave and return a few times throughout the day. In comparison to the Island Colony, I would say the Island Colony is better for longers stays and families due to the larger amount of ammenties that it has. Island Colony also has great views due to it's size. I would stay here again and would also consider other properties in the Aqua family.

This was my very first time staying at this hotel and I thought the location of the property was so convinient! It is walking distance for an array of people who have various interests. If you're a coffee lover, Starbucks coffee is located right next door. It was pleasant going downstairs in the morning and being greeted by smiling faces and happy guests who had gotten their morning coffee as well as the welcoming staff members. If you love to shop & eat, there are many shops and food places (even Hawaii's famous "Puka Dogs") right across the street. Also, for those who like to relax and let loose while their on vacation, there's a mellow pub connecting to the hotel and also bars across the street. The friendly staff members made you feel that sense of "Aloha." Overall, I enjoyed my stay very much and look forward to going back :)

I had amazing time at Aqua Waiki Pearl. The hotel room was really big and nice; there was a balcony too. Everything was super clean and I didn't expect it to be that nice. There was couple of Hawaiian people at the reception: Dexter and Christina - amazing people they make you feel like going to a kingdom or something; amazing staff!!!!!!!!

We spent 6 nights at the Waikiki Pearl. The location worked out well, an easy walk the beach, restaurants zoo, etc. Parking is restricted and limited, but you are probably better only hiring from one of the local places when you really need one. The buses are a good option.The staff are very good.

My girlfriend and I spent a week at the Pearl. We had a stressful first day of travel and were glad to finally be at our hotel. We were greeted by a Wonderful Greeter/bell hop named Jamar. He immediately made us feel welcome. He was there everyday other than one of our trip- the one day he was not working we felt the bell hop was extremely unhelpful. When Jamar was there we were always greeted with a smile, advice on local food, and helped us plan out our day with his suggestions. We felt he went above and beyond and he would be one of the few reasons we would return to this location.
Rooms are clean and big enough for singles. Hotel workers are friendly and helpful. İt is ideal for cheap and short business trips.

My wife and I spent 10 days at the Aqua Waikik Pearl this May. The room was spacious, spotless and comfortable. The room had 2 very comfy queen size beds, a fridge, coffee maker, and a decent LCD Tv. However it was the staff that made the biggest difference in our stay. Dawn, Harry, Jamar and Clif were all very pleasant and helpful.
