The hotel is also centrally located in Waikiki and handy to bus routes to all major attractions. There is wired internet in the rooms and free wifi in the lobby but it woud have been great if the wifi was in room as well a small complaint.

For my 40th Birthday, I wanted to have a relaxing weekend in waikiki with my teenage children. I chose the Aqua Waikiki Pearl hotel because it was recommended to me by a friend who stayed there && said that they had so much aloha && would make my birthday weekend great. As soon as we arrived the bell man Jamar greeted us with a friendly aloha and a huge smile. As we were checking in we met the manager Tracey, who greeted us with a big smile and a warm aloha. She saw that I had teenagers, so she upgraded us to a two bedroom room!! Loved it!! When we got to our room, we were really surprised on how spacious the room was. The manager Tracey called our room to see if everything was to our liking and said if we needed anything to just let her or her staff know. I truly felt like "wow, this is the first time in a hotel and the manager calls to check if we are ok" This really is an ALOHA HOTEL!! We had so much fun and it really was a relaxing weekend. My daughter just loved talking to Jamar, because he was so funny and made her laugh all the time. Whenever we need more blankets they were willing to come up and bring it to our room. I have nothing but GREAT things to say about the staff and management of the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. I will definitely come back to stay here again and recommend this hotel to all of my family and friends that want to stay in waikiki. I really got what i wanted for my 40th birthday thanks to the Aqua Waikiki Pearl Hotel. Peace and Relaxation!!! :)

My husband and I stayed in April so I'm a little late in reviewing. We'd booked the cheapo studio room and got upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. Bedroom was dark and quiet (tiny high window with no view) and we were pleased with comfy beds and in-room small tv. Kitchenette was great; full fridge, hotplate type stovetop, microwave. Minimal cooking equiptment and we would've liked at least a wine bottle opener. Very large main living area seemed strangely empty of furniture and bare of decor but had a small tv and decent couch. Would've been nice to have at least a coffee table or something to put drinks. Very clean rooms. Excellent helpful service by all staff we encountered. Nice balcony with a little table and chairs with view of city. A/C worked great. Close to grocery store and restaurants; great location in Waikiki. Free wifi and internet in the lobby. Overall offers very good value in a convenient location close to the action in Waikiki and you'll be very happy here as long as you are not expecting any frills.

Aloha travelers,We selected this hotel based in location and price. Both very good !We booked directly with hotel, no fees, (kamaaina rate $98 total, (Hawaii residents)Don't expect much, it's simple, clean, friendly.Because we're cool and fun people (yes! we are) we got upgraded to a Junior suite :-)(not much of a suite, but it felt good the upgrade...)Don't get discourage by the dirty spots on the hallways, that was the only down point.Hotel located on the little side street, so is more quiet than hotels on Ala Moana Blvd.Small fridge and microwave could save you some $$ .Here are some photos of room 415.Enjoy beautiful Oahu IslandAloha

During my week stay at the aqua Waikiki pearl, I've had the most Relaxing and unforgettable experienced there. As soon as I arrived, I was welcomed by the front desk staff and their manager Tracy, who was very friendly. Tracy helped check us in and gave us an upgrade! (awesome) The location of aqua waikiki pearl is great and convenient with many shops and restaurants near by, my room was very spacious and comfortable. The employees from front desk all the way to housekeeping made me feel right at home by always greeting me with a smile and having that aloha spirit. I also wanted to share that their prices are very affordable and that's always a plus! Last thing I would like to say is a big MAHALO to The Aqua Waikiki Pearl Staff and Management for making my vacation stay there a very memorable one. I enjoyed every second there and will always recommend this hotel to family and friends!

This hotel as great customer service! The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The manager was very helpful and accommodating, upgrading my party from two separate rooms to a three bedroom suit. And when she over booked and needed us to move she made the move as pleasant as possible by upgrading us once again to two, two bed room suits which actually was perfect for my very lager group. The bell man Jamar was very helpful during our stay; he happily helped move our things from room to room. All the while putting up with my friends openly hitting on him.... he kept it very professional. The manager Tracy was every nice and welcoming as was all the front desk employees were every helpful and nice. I would differently come back to this hotel to be able to enjoy this wonderful service again!
user_name:
Kalani H
Wailuku, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Everything here was just superb. We first got upgraded before we made it down to the hotel, which was exciting and then we were greeted so kindly and friendly we just didn't want to leave. The hotel employees were so friendly and accommodating i knew that I'd want to come back on my next trip. The rooms were so big and comforting, offering such big rooms for myself and the company I was with. We had a great time, before, after and while we were leaving the hotel. If there was a need, the hotel employees and management got right on it. Their customer service skills were so on key that we felt like royalty whenever we strolled in through the lobby. We just all loved our stay and are planning another. Hopefull soon!!!

We stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for 2 nights & had a wonderful stay. The staff was extremely friendly & even gave us great restaurant suggestions. We paid an extra $20 for parking behind the hotel. There aren't many parking spots but we managed to get the last one both days! They also have validated parking at a lot a few blocks away. The hotel is in a great location very close to Waikiki Beach & shopping. We walked a very quick 5 minutes to the International Marketplace for shopping & right to the beach. There's a Starbucks on the corner for easy breakfast. The room was spacious & well kept. We were only in the hotel at night...why stay inside when you're in paradise!!! My only minor complaint is that we could hear street noise at night, but this was expected being in the city. This hotel was a great start to our trip to Hawaii. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for great value & great location.

I and my family recently stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for a family gathering and found the service at the hotel and it's staff outstanding. We were there primarily for a baby's one year old party local style and had bought all the fixings for a luau from the big island. I want to extend a big MAHALO! to the Bellman Clif Gunderson, who went above and beyond in assisting us withthe many pieces of luggage and large coolers we had bought along with the goodies for the party.His service to us was invaluable and greatly appreciated. The rooms were always neat and cleanand the location to everything was totally convienent, not to mention the price which was very very affordable, the feel and atmosphere was totally "Local Style". I want to thank Traci Kuresaand her staff for a wonderful experience and plan on being repeat customers in the future.

Just back from staying eight nights at Aqua Pearl, hotel is great value and location is central to everything although may be a bit noisy for some, staff are excellent, friendly, knowledgeable willing to help with all requests,security was good, room was cleaned daily with extra towels housemaid always friendly and would ask if we needed anything. Suites have balcony our view not great but was nice to have to sit outside.Gale (Australia)

When i stayed here, there was not many guests booked in, and i was fortunate enough to get upgraded from a Standard room to a 2 brm apartment. I was staying on my own, so i had the run of the place.The room was huge, and not at all what i expected from such a cheap hotel. It was exceptionally clean and the staff were extra friendly.Having a full kitchen was fantastic, as i ended up stocking the fridge with things for breakfast and drinks for late at night. As i travel on my own, i tend not to stay out til the wee hours of the morning clubbing like a lot of people my age, but i like to have the occasional drink so i would stock the fridge with alcoholic cocktails (from the ABC stores) and sit back and watch tv or sit on the balcony and chill.The hotel is in a great location - it is not on the main streets, or across the road from the beach.. but Honolulu is only quite small and even as the hotel was a couple of blocks from the beach, it is only no more than a 5 minute walk. It is about a 2 minute walk to the International Marketplace and it also has a Starbucks on the corner (important if you are like me).

I would like to thank the excellent service that we received from Jameer and Dexter., they are the best front desk people I ever met. The hospitallity that they gave us is very much appreciated. I would like to thank also Nicole the concierge of the hotel, she help us very well on our activities. And as far as the hotel quality, very much recommeded with the reasonable price and the location that my kids enjoyed because it's close to where they wanted to go. LOVE IT, LOVE IT, LOVE IT. Jocelyn Rm 814
user_name:
Joycelyn B
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: We were making somewhat last minute reservations for an event in Honolulu the weekend of May 5 & discovered practically the whole town was booked unless you wanted to pay $500 a night for a room. The Aqua Pearl was available at a very nice rate-- which I will admit almost scared us a little. But we HAD to have rooms, so we decided to roll the dice. Hey, we bingoed! The hotel isn't a 5 star resort-- it's a basic hotel. But, we had LARGE clean rooms, comfortable beds with nice linens, and spacious clean bathrooms. A bonus was the refrigerator & microwave. Parking is the pits (as it is almost everywhere in Honolulu) but we lucked out 2 of the 3 nights & got a space at the hotel. The other night we had to park & walk a couple of blocks. Yes, it can be noisy at night because all the tourists on the main drag act like idiots, but that's not the hotel's fault. The bar on the street level that someone referred to was never a problem-- I thought it was pretty quiet. People on the street you can't control, so yes, there was noise there. But the beds were comfortable enough that I slept like a rock once I nodded off. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Aqua Pearl again. Like I said, if you want "fancy", this isn't it.... if you want a nice clean room at a decent price with nice staff & in a convenient location, this is a great choice. Mahalo Aqua Pearl.

The front desk personnel manned by Dexter and Jameer made the stay and experience a very good one. They helped and managed to turn a potentially bad situation into a positive experience. We will definitely be back and highly recommend this place.
user_name:
JoL978
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a great hotel for value, wonderful service (the Front Desk person, Dexter was superb!),cleanliness and location to restaurants, the beach and bus stops to make the stay very convenient and pleasant.My only wish is they had at least a small pool (or access to a pool close by) and the street noise was not as bad, but then again, the hotel is in the middle of Waikiki which is a huge plus!They don't need a restaurant because great restaurants are near by.

I had a great first experience staying in waikiki. The rooms were clean and the service was superb. The guest service manager Tracy check me and my family in and she was very polite and proffessional. The bell man took our luggage to the room quickly and with a smile. The rooms and the balcony was large. Our room had a kitchen that subsided the cost of eating out. The hotel was close to many stores and eateries. Upon entering and exiting the hotel, me and my family were always welcomed with a smile from the staff. Overall my family and I had a great experience.

We had a wonderful time at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. It was our first time staying at this hotel so we weren't sure on what to except. I am happy we had a amazing time. We were greeted by a friendly, warm, welcoming front desk staff. Clif, the bellman, was exceptionally helpful and patient with us. We were a large group with a lot of luggage and Clif handled the load with such professional ease. He was always there when we needed something, from bringing extra towels to extra kitchen utensils, he was always quick and efficient. The front desk staff was always courteous and so very helpful. As for our unit, we stayed in the 3 bedroom suite. This unit was large and spacious, very clean and welcoming. We had more than enough space for everyone to sleep comfortably. The housekeeping staff was always there to tidy up the room and refresh the linens daily. That was SOO greatly appreciated. The unit had a good kitchen unit, along with necessary utensils for preparing a meal. This amenity was a major help in keeping us on budget. We used the laundry room on our last day. Your washers and dryers are awesome! For a hotel the washers are good and clean the clothes good. Your dryers are so hot and actually had more than enough time to dry a large load, actually had time to spare. The price to do laundry was actually less than what we pay at a laundromat back on the big island.All in all, our stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl was amazing and we will definitely be returning for another stay. MAHALO NUI LOA to Tracey and her amazing staff.

I got stuck in Oahu flying standby and needed a place to stay for 1 night. I booked a room at Aqua Waikiki Pearl on Hotels.com. I took a shuttle to the hotel and arrived around 10:30 PM. When I got to the hotel they advised me that hotels.com had made the reservation for the next day and there was nothing they could do about it. I asked them if there was a rate difference they advised me there was not but that they had a strict 72 hour cancellation policy. ( I only needed a place to sleep for 7 hours until I could get onto the next flight. They told they only thing they could do for me is book another night at the same rate. I proceeded to call Hotel.com (which by the way was 100% nicer than the front desk girl at this hotel.) Hotel.com called the hotel and spoke with Chris at the front desk who was nice on the phone to hotels.com but told them they would need to call back and they she needed to talk to her manager. When Chris would call the manager she would say things like I don't think we should waive any cancellation fee etc and was really rude about the whole situation. Being 5 months pregnant I waited and waited to find out the outcome. I just wanted to sleep at this point (almost midnight). The hotel wouldn't budge and so we booked another night. Hotels.com called and offered to cancel the room for the next night at no extra charge and would take on the cancellation fee. I was very impressed. I will use hotels.com again but there is no way I would ever book with this hotel again. As for the room- Both my husband and I got bit by something in the bed I had red marks all over my body the next day. This place is really a motel not a hotel. I barely slept they put us on the second floor and there is club right underneath the room, music was blaring all & rattle the room until 4 am. I could hear people partying and screaming in the streets all night. The beds were extremely hard and room was really dirty. My worst hotel experience by far.

We had such a wonderful stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. The room was very comfortable and clean. We loved that we had a kitchen and a nice home away from home. The location is perfect and within walking distance to everything! The beach, shops, night-life and much more practically at our doorstep. Most importantly, the service was more than exceptional! We had a last minute trip and they were able to accomodate us on such short notice. We cannot be more grateful for the warmth and "Aloha" from the management and staff!

To the hotel manager and her staff very awesome job making us feel at home and to cliff bellman big upps to you to the whole aqua pearl staff I rate you 10 and above I will recommend to everybody to stay at the aqua pearl number 1 in my book.

Friendly helpful staff! Our first room was amazing with a lot of space! Laundry facility onsite!! Close to everything - shops and most importantly - short walk to beach! For the price this is a hidden gem! I would highly recommend the pearl!!! ;o D

Clean room and bathroom, comfy bed. The 8th floor overlooking the small parking lot was quiet. Their other parking options 1-2 blocks away were fine. It's a waste of time to look for free parking in Waikiki - there isn't any. I had a problem during my stay and Tracey the manager cheerfully made everything right. I'll only stay at the Pearl in Waikiki.

First off very pleasant customer service...we were very pleased with the upgrade...talk about accomdating to my wedding needs...lovely and convenient area...thanks to tracy and the rest of the staff for making my wedding day extra special....Mrs.Fosi

The hotel staff was incredibly friendly, the rooms were clean and fairly spacious. The location is a decent walk to the beach, but just go straight through the international market and you are there! Would stay here again...

Excellent staff. They went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and comfortable. Staff treated us with lots of Aloha spirit. Verry nice people at this hotel. Facilities are nice, modern and well maintained.

We stayed here as the first stop on our honeymoon. Being in Honolulu and eager to spend a good deal of our time out and about, we were not fussed about staying in a fancy hotel. However, this place really did exceed our expectations. On arrival we were lucky enough to get upgraded to a very comfortable and clean spacious room and we felt right at home immediately.The staff were some of the most friendly and helpful that we encountered throughout our whole trip to Hawaii. They never failed to greet us on the way in and out of the hotel, and were very helpful with all requests. They were also happy to make a tour booking for us on another island which really helped us out.It is in a great location - minutes from the beach or a quick stroll through the International Marketplace to find yourself on the main strip of Waikiki. While not the fanciest hotel in Honololu, it provides everything you could need and I would stay again.

My friend and i just returned from a 9 day stay at Aqua Pearl and we can honestly say it was fantastic. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. They assisted us with all our needs. The hotel has 24 hour security and reception. The housekeeping was great, the hotel was always clean. We were on the 7th floor in a Jr Suite with a Balcony, room was large with 2 double beds and had a good sized balcony. 5 mins walk to the beach, literally one block away.The hotel is central to many restaurants, shops and clubs. It was perfect for us!

Just off Kuhio Ave at 415 Nahua, the modest entrance to the Aqua Waikiki Pearl may raise doubts about the wisdom of one's choice, especially if your primary reason for choosing was price.However, the very friendly staff welcomes you and we had no difficulty checking in. Our room on the 8th floor was clean, cool, comfortable, well lit. Had a minifridge, microwave and coffee maker. We did not have a lanai, but did not feel the lack of it.All staff was friendly and accomodative. Every question we had was answered and we felt like we were viewed as welcome guests. We had already arranged all our tours, etc., but the concierge was very friendly and we saw her helping another couple who seemed to appreciate her service.Very convenient location, across from the International Marketplace and practically next door to an organic vegetable store. We had booked another room for our daughter & son-in-law. Theirs was upgraded to one with a lanai.Check out was a snap. Computer in lobby for those who don't carry their own.Wireless in lobby only, but if you carry a wire you can use it in your room and the wired internet access was great.No complaints about the Pearl. A modest hotel that gave good value and proved to be a pleasant experience.

Ok so im in Waikiki on business so wasnt too worried about where I stayed so long as it had internet access and was clean and in Waikiki. The staff here are lovely as with all the Aqua hotels I couldnt fault their politeness and helpfulness. My room was very spacious if not a little over the top for the amount of furniture there was. Having said that it met my needs. For a budget hotel it was ok. After all what do you do in your hotel room............. sleep and wash! I'd stay here again although it can be a little noisy due to the fact its so close to a main road. My only complaint would be the cleaner could do with dusting and hoovering a little more often.

We've stayed here three times in the last 5 months and have thoroughly enjoyed the front office/front desk staff. Tracey, Gabe, Harry, Dexter and Clif have bent over backwards to make sure our every request was met--and with a smile. You definitely get that "at home" feeling. I highly recommend this hotel--especially if you're on a budget like us!
user_name:
Marisa K
Newbury Park, California, United States

review_body: My partner & I stayed at this hotel for 13 days in March. It's located in the centre of Waikiki, with plenty of restaurants & shopping nearby. The beach is 5 - 10 mins walk away. The hotel & rooms were very clean and well-serviced - the only thing we saw which could be improved was some dust & fluff on the air-conditioning unit, but this was a very minor detail. Check-in and Check-out were quick, friendly, and very efficient. While there is no pool or restaurant in the hotel, the beach is only 5 - 10 mins walk and there are loads of restaurants nearby - Denny's does great breakfasts on a budget. We were asking in reception where we could buy a sun umbrella for our friends' toddler. No need they said, and gave us one free for the week. It's also located beside a stop on the main bus route, so getting around is simple and relatively inexpensive. Very happy with our stay. Hope to return sometime in the future.

we originally booked a room with standard double, but we stayed Suite w/Kitchen and two queen beds!! the receptionist gave us FREE-UPGRADE!! thanks to this, we perfectly enjoyed our stay in waikiki!! also the location is really convenient for everywhere like waikiki beach, to get meals, and to take the bus/trolley.
user_name:
Kotaro H
Auburn, Washington, United States

review_body: Just there overnight on business, the hotel was clean....nothing special its your average no frills reasonably priced hotel, the staff was very helpful and courteous, witch made up for anything the hotel was lacking.

THe people at the Aqua Wakki Pearl were excellent. Dexter at the front desk was very warm and friendly. He was exceptionally knowledgeable about place and things to do on the island.The rooms were nice size and the bathroom was very large for Wakkiki standards. The beds were very comfortable and the location was great!! ( Starbucks just one door down). I really got a lot for what I paid. I will certainly stay there again. I must also mention Harry who was very nice and helpful
Not the most luxurious hotel, a little noisy, but nice staff, especially Tyler. Very convenient. Check out the excellent cheap noodle place next door, Marukame.
user_name:
Steve H
Hilo, Hawaii, United States

review_body: BEST HOTEL EVERRRR!!!! I stayed here 3 separate times on my trip and each time I got a free upgrade!!!! The staff r so awesome n friendly!!! especially Gabe n Dexter!! hehe its the best location and cant wait to go back here again!!!!!! YAY!

This was the second time we stayed at the Pearl. We stayed for two weeks in February 2011 and returned for 4 weeks in February 2012 and would love to do it again...perhaps even longer? On both visits we found the front desk staff and housekeeping staff to be excellent....our only suggestion would be to have another chair in our room as we are older and probably spend more time than most in our room. Agree with other comments that it is not of five star quality but for a budget friendly hotel is very clean and comfortable - and a good size as well. We have and will recommend it as a very good place to stay. There's not much you can do about the noise factor - it's centrally located and easy to get to so many restaurants, beach, bus, etc. so guess that only goes with it. Didn't notice noise or barking from other rooms - didn't even see any dogs when we were there - think it's just great that people CAN bring their pets with them. Thanks for making our holiday a great one!
The desk staff of this hotel were courteous, and went out of their way to provide succinct directions to the various natural wonders of O'ahu we saw during our stay.

Althoughnthe room was decent, it lacked storage and seating. The only storage for clothing is in the 4 small drawers attached to the desk. There was only one chair for a room that could potentially accomodate 4 people. It lacks adequate seating accommodations since the only place to sit is on the bed. The room is large enough to place a small table with 2 additional chairs. The room also lacked adequate lighting, especially over the kitchenette area. Although the hotel is within walking distance from the beach the noise from the multiple bars at street level created excessive noise that it was difficult to sleep. The parking was $20/day and parking at the hotel is available only if you are there before 6:00 pm. One positive thing about this hotel is the friendly staff at the front desk. If they were not there my ratings would be much different.

Hotel was in a great location - within the two blocks of the hotel there was a great bus service (didn't have to wait more than 5 mins), pharmacy, medical centre, food (short walk to McDonalds), ABC stores, grocery store and the international market place - a quick walk through here will get you to the fancy shops, Dukes, Waikiki Beach. Rooms were clean. Microwave, small fridge, TV and internet provided in rooms. All in all a great stay. Special mention to Harry - he was great in recommending places to eat and bus transfers to get about town - he deserves a pay rise! ;)

My family and I stayed at this hotel for about 3 weeks and enjoyed our time! Lucena, our room service attendant/ maid was fantastic! she did an awesome job cleaning our room everyday and making us feel as comfy as possible! The hotel and staff in general was very nice, but Lucena really went above and beyond, making our room/ bathroom very tidy and clean on a daily basis! I would definately recommend this hotel and if you you do choose to stay here ask if Lucena can be your maid!!!!
user_name:
Joshua A
Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Booked this hotel because the rates were reasonable for a two bedroom w/kitchen in Waikiki. Upon checking in the staff is pleasant, all rooms clean and spacious. Only downer was the daily room service. For a two bedroom they only had towels for two people. I would assume when they (or if the information) was known that four people were staying, they should have had the proper number of towel sets. That remedied the second day. Third day no service at all. Not even to make the beds. The fourth day they only made the bed, did not change the sheets. SO I had to request the changing of sheets the next day, and in addition, more hand soap. (The soap was given to us on the the 7th day.) Then the sheets were the same for the rest of our stay... Not so horrible, BUT when sand is found in the sheets, its a bit annoying to fix it ourselves. We had 9 days in 808, had a good time, Just could have been a bit better with consistant room service. Hopefully this is not the norm. I think we would stay here again, The value, polite front desk staff and location is great.

This was the best staffed hotel that we have ever stayed at. The staff were all very helpful and polite, and always had a smile as well as a greeting by name whenever we passed through the lobby. The room was huge ( 2 bedroom suite) and the location was great. There is a starbucks right beside the hotel, as well as a grocery store about 1 block away. The market Place is directly out of your hotel and loads of restaurants all over. The beach is only a 5 minute walk as well. The hotel has beach towels, chairs and beach mats for you to use at no cost, you just need to sign it out. We were very impressed with this hotel and will for sure be back. Thanks so much for the wonderful time Gabriel, Dexter, and Sara- Beth!! You all made our holiday even better by being so fantastic! My 8 year old said before the cab pulled away to take us back to the airport thst he already missed Dexter. Great place to stay, clean rooms (thanks Elisa!) and great management at this hotel will make you happy that you stayed here. Thanks again Pearl!! See you next year. Sheri Hanna
I love the customer service and the rooms where clean. The only flaw about it is the parking but that's waikiki for you.
Great budget hotel. Staff was really friendly and helpful. Property and rooms were clean. Good location.

My only reason for traveling to Waikiki is to visit my daughter, and so finding a clean hotel at a reasonable price is a top priority. My mom and I booked a Jr. Suite at the Pearl on a recent trip out to visit my daughter who attends university in Honolulu, and we were really pleased with the cleanliness and spaciousness of the room, the friendliness of the staff, and the close proximity to all that Waikiki offers.

We made a call to confirm our junior suite 1 week before we arrive and talked with Harry. I told him it was our 20th. wedding anniv. and we were lite sleepers & if it was possible to have a room as close to the top floor. On arrival in the evening Dexter was very cheerful and said he will check what Harry has entered & we were on the 9th. fl. with a balcony. This made our trip memorable. The room was large with a queen & double bed, micro-wave, fridge, ironing board, safe, coffee-maker a clean room. The internet in the room is by cable, you will need a laptop or if you have a Mac you need a device to accept the cable connector. Saturday nite was noisy and when I opened the patio door 2 am the sound was coming from the area of the Aqua Waikiki Wave and another bar across from it.All the staff, Harry, Robin, Clif (day shift) & Dexter on nites were excellent. The Elite Concierge Sara Beth was very helpful in giving us a driving map for the things to see on the North Shore circle route and the reservation for the car.The Waikiki Beach is aprox. 5 min.-10 min. with many places to eat nearby. The bus stop is just around the corner and the wait time is short. We enjoyed our stay with the friendly staff at the front desk.

Great location! Close to everything! The rooms were very clean and the staff are very helpful and pleasant, particularly Harry. My room was on the second floor, & had no arm chair to sit on. You had to sit at the desk or on the bed which was a bit annoying. My only negative comment was the noise at night.I heard every sound from the parking lot all night long, and the bar patrons outside smoking and goofing off.

Just stayed at the aqua pearl for 4 weeks on the 5th floor with a balcony. room was large and clean with a queen and dble bed microwave coffee maker in the room also ironing board hairdryer. The staff were all friendly Dexter in reception always asked how our day was our housemaid Daisy was excellent . Hotel was nice and central bus stop 2mins away 5mins to beach and Kalakua Ave. Would recommend this hotel if you want a holiday on a budget and we go to Hawaii every 2years and will be back here again.

Always courteous staff, the Aqua Pearl has been my chosen accommodation on the last few business trips to Honolulu. The rooms are spacious, and clean. The property is located in the heart of Waikiki with many convenience stores and restaurants nearby. I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone wishing to visit O'ahu on a budget.

I stayed at this hotel on December 29, 2011 prior to embarking on Norwegian Cruise Line Pride of America on December 31, 2011. The hotel was a gift from my nieces and nephew. It was a decent hotel, however, not like the Hiltons. The location of the hotel suits me perfectly. It is right across the market which allowed me to take a long walk and shop and eat .You can take a free trolley bus across Dennys Restaurant to Ala moana mall. The staff is very helpful and friendly . A particular staff walked me and my belongings to another hotel where I stayed with my nieces, nephew, brother in law and grand nephew. I was very pleased! Did I mentioned that you can also walk to Waikiki Beach? Yes you can! I will definitely stay here again.

My family and I stayed here for 5 nights in February. When we arrived, there was a HUGE line at the check-in counter. I waited about 15 minutes until I could check in. This was not the fault of the staff--it was just really busy at that particular moment. The lobby is small, but renovated with a contemporary look. There is free wi-fi in the lobby, and a computer is available if you need to use it.I stayed on the second floor, with a view of the TINY parking lot. The room was CLEAN, however, it smelled like mildew, and the bathroom smelled worse. I am guessing there is very poor air ventilation/circulation in the room. Once we had the air conditioner running for a few hours, the smell in the room was hardly noticeable, but the bathroom remained stinky. The staff was very friendly. But one thing that completely BAFFLED me was the housekeeping. Everynight--and I mean EVERYNIGHT--when we returned from the beach there were not enough bath towels in the bathroom. So I would have to call housekeeping to bring up more. There were only 3 of us in the room, so shouldn't we get 3 towels everyday? If you take away 3 dirty towels, shouldn't you replace them with 3 clean towels? One time, many occasions there were only 2 towels. On 2 occasions there were 2 towels, and a hand-towel disguised as a bath towel. On 3 occasions there wasn't a bathmat to step out on to. Now onto the parking. It really sucks. If you get back to the hotel before 4pm, you're probably ok. However, if you get there and there is no parking, you have to go to another parking garage about a block away. I thought this was ok, except when I had to do this on a Friday night with my child. The parking garage is located in the same building as two popular night clubs. When we arrived in the garage there were SO MANY rowdy people I was nervous to leave my car. People were drinking by there cars in the garage, and getting really rowdy. We finally found a parking spot on the 5th floor and had to take the elevator with 5 drunk men and women cursing and openly drinking. . . . while my son was with me!I know that this is not a reflection of the hotel, however, if you have children, are staying over the weekend, and will be driving, having to park in this garage might be an issue for you. The location of this property was decent. I've stayed all over waikiki in the past, but this location was not my favorite due to its proximity to the bars and nightclubs. On the plus side, it is close to starbucks, International market, and lots of restaurants. Another plus is that you can check out beach towels.
Excellent place to stay. On top of value for the price, the staff is very friendly! This was our second time staying here and we are pleased once again.

My wife and I spent 10 days here and found our room to be adequate and clean. Prior to the trip, we asked for and got a King size bed instead of 2 Double beds,which was nice. There is a fridge, microwave,coffee maker ( with daily free coffee and tea) and a Safe for storing your valuables while you are out. It can get noisy occasionally at night because of a Sports Bar next door although we find that it's not bad enough to prevent us from getting a good night sleep. There is free Wifi in the room for your laptops ( not wireless,cable ) and free Wifi in the lobby for Iphones. Service staff members like Dexter,Alex,all of them are super friendly and will go out of their way to help. Beach towels are free to use daily and Waikiki beach is only 5 minutes away. Starbuck is just around the corner and cheap breakfast places like Seaside Grill and Eggs'n Things are just a few blocks away. Check out Cheesecake Factory and California Pizza Kitchen a few blocks away for excellent dining experience.Overall this Hotel is Excellent value for those who are on a Budget and my wife and I will definitely stay here again

Lovely hotel at the best location I can imagine. Spent a whole week at the hotel, and was greeted by the hospitable staff every single day! Special thanks to Gabriel who helped to sort out the room downgrade issue, and Dexter for being extra friendly! Will recommend to friends.

If you are looking for a clean and convenient hotel in Honolulu, you should seriously consider the Pearl. It is in the heard of Waikiki, less than 5 min from the beach. The hotel was recently renovated and it looks great. The staff is friendly and very helpful. There is a great bar in the lobby.

When I thought of the savings I made, I thought I was going to get the same type of service. Boy was I wrong. Upon walking into the hotel, my family was greeted with such warm 'Aloha Spirit', clean and comfortable rooms. Housekeeping was on spot. Gabriel and Dexter were so helpful. They answered every question we had and even pointed us to some very exciting spots to tour and even gave us some 'local' advise. I would highly recommend this hotel for its great customer service, excellent housekeeping, great location and accommodating prices.

We spent 10 days at the hotel from January 19 through the 29st. This was our first experience at the Aqua and not the last one. We have lost one day because our departure fly been cancelled, but the hotel upgraded our room at same price.Special thanks to Sara-Beth, Dexter and the other staffJean Kupina

Don't expect anything fancy or super exotic, cause you aint gonna get it. We made a mistake with our booking so when we arrived we had no room booked. They were almost full, but still were able to accommodate us in a first floor room with a view to a beautiful brick wall. The room was pretty bad, with stains on the carpet, etc. But we couldn't argue much as we didn't even have a reservation and it seemed to us they gave us that room, cause there were no other rooms available. On our second night we were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to their biggest suite, their best room! there were 3 bedrooms, living room, kitchen and a massive balcony with chairs and a table! Not too sure how much it would have been, but I guess this room is more like an apartment and 6 friends could easily share it! Everyone at the hotel was nice and friendly. There was a computer with free internet downstairs and free wireless at the lobby. It was certainly good value, however you can probably still find cheaper options in the area!

We spent five days at the hotel from January 26 through the 31st. This was our third experience at the Aqua. The staff are both friendly and helpfull. The room was clean and quiet.The location is close to all activities. It does not provide a view but for the price provides all your needs. Margo C.
Great Location and value for money and we get a free room upgrade. :)

Ive stayed in a couple of Aqua properties and I still think they are the best value in Waikiki. We stayed in the one bedroom deluxe suite which frankly was stretching it in the deluxe stakes. Its a very tired old hotel which friends told me used to be the cheapest nasiest one in Waikiki but as with all Aquas it has had a tart up and overall furniture/fittings are to a pretty good standard but the aspect from the balconies is really ugly and being a low rise hotel the street noise and bin collection are the ususal pain as with any low rise hotel. We had problems with the bath not holding water and reported it to the front desk who promised to sort it out but when we returned late that night after a very long day nothing had been done. The next morning a manager happened to be present so we spoke to him and fair play he apologised and rang up back quickly to say it couldnt be fixed and we could move to same room type which was ok but a bit annoying given four women shopping in Hawaii we had to spend quite a bit of time and hassle packing bags and also packing a fridge full of food, would have been nice if they offered some help with the move. The next bath did hold water but like the previous room seemed to run out of hot water after one shower so I gave up on the bath all together (quite annoying as it was a big part of my booking that room and I did impress that before making the booking so to have a bath but not be able to have hot water in it was pretty useless. As with all of themthe water pressure and capacity was rubbish. be careful about booking here on a holiday weekend as we had several people partying in the rooms around us who were coming into Waikiki for the thanksgiving long weekend and also the Sat night was a nightmare with myself and one daughter on the sofa bed the noise from the bar underneath the hotel kept us half the night with screaming and car noises. Staff were present and friendly enough but not as helpful with lots of shrugs of the shoulders when we aksed pretty standard tourist questions we gave up and took our advice from shopkeepers in the area. The wifi only worked on the outdoor hallways and in the foyer (dodgy even there). Those are my whinges and I would not stay here again however the location and value (especially for a larger group of people) was good being close to Starbucks, restaurants, the bus stop and supermarket, across the road is the international market and minutes to the beach strip. My advice would be to look at the Aqua Wave which is just across the road on Kuhio, its a high rise so much quieter in the higher floors and although the lift is always slow its great value and the views add to the feeling of being on holiday.

The Aqua Waikiki Pearl was a very pleasant place to stay. The staff was always cheerful and helpful, especially the Concierge and Clifton. We used a lot of towels which housekeeping brought us promptly whenever we asked for them. We had a small problem with the location of the bathroom. In the two bedroom suite, it was located such that you had to go thru one bedroom to get to it. This might be OK if a single family stayed there, but we were friends and not too comfortable with this arrangement. Otherwise the suite was very nice -- clean and well appointed with quiet air conditioning units in each room.

I picked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. I stayed 8 days, and came to love the location both for the adjacent businesses (International Market, Starbucks, variety of restaurants/bars, nail salon) as well as the short walk to the beach and a public golf course. The Sports Bar on the ground floor is a huge help if you need to catch your teams on East Coast time--and, if you can't stomach bar food at 8am, they'll hold your spot while you run down the street for a bagel.I had two different rooms during my stay--the standard, which was just fine, comes with a nice TV, microwave and fridge and has a decent size bathroom. Partway through my trip, I upgraded to a room with a lanai because I like to ease into the day with coffee and close it out with a glass of wine. So, the lanai with the breezes and a pretty city view was well worth the extra bucks.The staff--front desk, housekeeping, concierge and bellman were all friendly and helpful. The hotel itself does not have amenities like pool, hot tub, gym or spa, but they will help you find what you need.I was concerned about the low price but trusted the Trip Advisor reviews and was delighted with what I got for my money.

Know before you check in that this isn't a 5 star hotel on the beach. It is about 3 short blocks to the beach, past the Starbucks, through the International Market, cross the street and you are there. So, grab a cappichino, enjoy the shopping, then swim. The staff was friendly and very helpfull, more than willing to accomodate unusual travel issues like mine and very knowledgeable about local (not Waikiki) places to visit that are wonderful and not expensive. For example, Hanauma Bay!So, not bad for the price, I'll keep it on my list.

This was my first trip to Oahu and we chose this hotel because it had a good rate. I loved everything about this hotel for the most part! The only two things that could improve, are the parking (we only had a car for two days so it wasn't a huge problem), and I wish it had a pool. Other than that, the room was spacious and very clean. Everytime we needed extra towels, they brought them up within minutes. Our neighbor had dogs and they barked a few times but we just called the front desk and they took care of it right away. The hotel bar had cheap drinks. The laundry room was clean and the dryers worked well.  The hotel had a conciarge, Sarah Beth who was AMAZING and sooo helpful! The front staff was very friendly and helpful and accomadating! Anytime we had direction questions, they were there to help! The location was also perfect!  A big thank you to Gabe, clifton, Harry, and dexter! Highly reccomend this hotel! From ALASKA!

Hotel's in a pretty good location. Not too far from the famous Waikiki Beach. A lot of good places to eat at, and a lot of shops to check out. The room is clean and very roomy. the house keeping staff is doing a fantastic job. Also, I really enjoy walking into a hotel lobby, up to the front desk, and receiving one of the most awesome greetings from the staff. They make you feel like you're at home. The only way to find out, try them out, you won't regret it. I will surely be back.

This property is my FAVORITE home base when traveling to Oahu for business in Waikiki - the ROOMS are always CLEAN and COMFY, with strong A/C units, crisp linens, lotsa pillows and FREE INTERNET. The front desk staff, belldesk, housekeeping and security personnel are always HAPPY TO HELP and the LOCATION, although not beach-front, is nicely situated in central Waikiki so that you can walk to the beach, restaurants, shopping, nightlife, etc. Onsite parking is limited at $20/day, with overflow located about 1 - 2 blocks away, which can be inconvenient if you are traveling with kids, so I recommend thinking about this when making a decision. All rooms include a refrigerator and microwave oven, as well as a coffemaker, so this helps keep food costs down a bit. Street noise is one of the CONS about the property, especially if you are on a low floor and are a light sleeper - the Garbage Truck is SUPER NOISY and can't be avoided, and sometimes it gets rowdy outside during the early wee hours of morning as the late-night party crowd disburses. The STAFF are really THE BEST here - I cannot even compare the level of service that I receive at other hotels with them because the AQUA Pearl team is just on a TOTALLY different level - truly ALOHA at its BEST!

Wonderful hotel and an awesome staff. The hotel is in a great location and close to the beach. We stayed in a 3 bedroom suite that was very clean and lots of room. The kitchen was great and saved us money. The restaurants, International Market, Pantry, shopping, and the beach are all in walking distance. Parking can be an issue.We would stay here again!

We'd give it 7.5 out of 10. Nicely renovated building. Very friendly and helpful front desk/activities staff. liked the location for central walking to all our favourite places. we faced east, and had very little traffic noise, which we appreciated. I liked the little fridge/microwave/coffee maker area in our room. They had a hair dryer and internet in each room.close to Starbucks! missed having a deck, but that was our choice as per hotel room rate.There was no pool or common area outside.housekeeping could improve - and we were short of towels a couple of times. good enough value for your money.

The Aqua Waikiki Pearl Hotel in Honolulu was in a great location near the International Market, beach, restaurants, and upscale shopping. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly, and the rooms were spacious. If you are looking for a nice hotel and don't want to spend a fortune on a luxury one, this is the place to stay.PGA - Atlanta, GA

Great value for great central Waikiki location. Walk to beach, zoo, market, lots of places to eat. This is not a five star hotel, but if this is the worst place you have stayed in your world travels, you live in a pampered, jaded world.Rooms are average, but clean and comfortable. Internet is available via ethernet connection. Minimal parking on site, over flow parking near-by. Staff is friendly and helpful.

The aqua hotel was absolutely wonderful. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. It was just across from the international market place, a short walk to the Waikiki beaches and close to great restaurants. We also had a small kitchen, so saved a lot of money as we could make breakfast in the room. The hotel also had wonderful staff. They were very helpful and knowledgable of the surroundings. The hotel also provides beach towels so you don't have to bring your own.

This is one of the worst places I have ever stayed, and I have stayed in motels and hotels all over the world. They allow dogs at this place, which is a terrible decision on their part, and it was a terrible oversight on my part to not notice the dogs policy when I made the reservation. I could hear dogs barking at all hours of the day and night. If you like quiet, this is not the place for you. The room was not worth the $93 daily rental, which was a rate that my travel agent negotiated, and was actually less than the normal rate of more than $100. The in-room Internet service was either spotty or didn't work at all and the front desk staff seemed brain dead for the most part except for one wonderful young man named Clifton who printed out a map to the airport. Other than him, the entire stay was a disaster. The location is in the heart of Waikiki, which is fine unless you like quiet, and I like quiet.

I have stayed here twice, both times in October. Rooms are decent and clean. The location is great. You can walk pretty much anywhere you would want to go and the busses.and shuttles run along the hotels cross street. If you like to spend a lot of time relaxing in the room or hote this one isnt for you. But if you want a clean room to sleep and shower in this is the place. A word of advice-If your room doesn't have a view, then it means you have windows overlooking the walkway to the rooms.

I stayed here with my wife for 10 nights. The staff were always friendly, polite and helpful. We stopped in the standard room. Although this was the smallest room, we found it a good size for the two of us, and we didn't plan on being in the room much anyway when there's so much to do in and around Waikiki. The room was a good size (larger than I thought it would be), had 2 queen beds, large wardrobe, and was cleaned daily by the maid. The bathroom was also a good size and clean. The larger rooms overlooking the front have a balcony, the ones on the back don't. As there isn't much of a view on either side, I didn't feel we were missing out by not having a balcony. We were on the 7th floor. We couldn't hear any noise from the front, but there was some noise from the car-park at the back, moving bins etc, but I wouldn't say it was a problem. For value for money, I'd stay here again, but I would ask for a room away from the lifts. We were close to the lift and therefore people walked past our room a lot or stood outside waiting for the lift, and at times, this was noisy as we found people didn't speak quietly. We never mentioned this to the hotel, I'm sure if we did we could have moved room. The beach is a few blocks away and the hotel is in a great location. A lot of evenings we spent at the Kani Ka Pila Grille bar at Outrigger reef on the beach which I highly recommend, live music every night. Thanks for a great stay!
If you need a layover to go to an outer island it is okay, close to shopping and restuarants, but on a noisy street.

We loved the Aqua Waikiki Pearl! The staff were so friendly and helpful. The room we had was huge and was very clean with a nice bathroom and microwave, fridge and coffee maker. The location was great, close the restaurants and easy walking distance to the main Waikiki strip. Would recommend to all.

we stayed there for 8 nights. the room and bathroom was big. the staff was very friendly. and it was in a good location. the room was very dusty, the rug was terriable i had to where my shoes the whole time. the bathroom had hair all through it. they came and cleaned the room one day, when we got back we had no towels. had to call the frount desk and ask for some we were told they wereout of towels we had to wait till they got more in. our tolite plugged up i called the desk and they sent up a plungger and said here you go. if that wasn' bad enough it set there in the bathroomfor the next 5 days. would not stay there again.

The Aqua Pearl was a wonderful chance taken! The price was so low that we were not sure that we wanted to chance the stay, but the hotel was wonderful. The staff was quite friendly, helpful, and efficient! The rooms were clean and well cared for. The microwave and frig were great for the traveler. And we met the nicest people from all over the world staying there. The close walk to the beach was through a marvelous "old world" marketplace and delicious food court. A perfect, inexpensive Hawaiian vacation!

I attended a conference at the Sheraton Waikiki and had the opportunity to stay over a couple of nights after the conference on my own nickel. I could have exentended my stay at the Sheraton (which was pretty nice), but I found the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for about 1/3 of the price so I was willing to give it a try. We arrived fairly late at night and the lady at the registration desk advised us on our parking options because the hotel's parking was full. She suggested I drive around and find a metered space on a nearby street and my parking would be free. Luckily, I did find a space one street over. I was a bit nervous about leaving the car, but it ended up being fine. I faced a similar issue the 2nd night and opted to park in a nearby "lift" where your car rides up an elevator and gets stored in a warehouse-like parking lot for the night at a charge of $14.When we stepped off the elevator on the way to our room, I was wondering about my decision because the carpets in the open-air hallways were fairly dirty and worn. My concern was put to rest when we arrived in our room to find a recently rennovated and very large room and bathroom. This is an older property to be sure, but it had been nicely redone. All-in-all, I was very happy with my decision. The $ saved by moving here from the Sheraton Waikiki paid for my car rental expense for the entire week. For people watching their expenses, I would whole heartedly recommend this hotel for consideration.

We stayed here for 2 nights. We transferred to the Pearl and was disappointed with the room. We had booked through Expedia, but the room was dated, with tired carpets. It had twin queen beds, microwave, fridge and hot plate. The location was very good and we didnt really spend much time in the room as we were out exploring. We were up on the 7th floor overlooking either another hotel or residential block.If we were to return we would not stay at the Pearl as I am sure there are better hotels around.

Hotel is well situated near to plenty of ammenties, there are several restaurants, cafes etc nearby, and it is only a short walk from the beach, staff were well organized,we arrived on an early morning flight at 9.30 am and were able to check in immediately, friendly and polite, rooms well appointed and clean. Freee internet access in the foyer was an added bonus.

My daughter and I stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for two weeks. We were there for a family vacation. We met up with my son and his fiancee there (they stayed at the Castle Grand and were very disappointed). We arrived at around 12:30pm and were able to check in right away .Harry, Cliff and most of the staff were very welcoming and helpful. Our room was very spacious and very clean. It looked exactly like the pictures on the site (we had the renovated junior suite with a balcony). Our room was on the 9th floor and we still heard street noise, but this is not the fault of the hotel. The beds were very comfy. Housekeeping came everyday(however, a couple of days we just asked for coffee and had the trash emptied).  The hotel is in a great location. It was very easy to get around and there were so many shops and restaurants nearby. We vacationed on a budget so we shopped for food for some of our meals rather than eating at restaurants for every meal (warning: the Food Pantry is very expensive. You will do much better shopping at Walmart if you are on a budget).  Overall, I was very pleased with my stay at the Aqua Pearl and will stay there again.

We stayed for six nights. This was one of the few hotels that offered a room for six people. It fix into our budget and was in a good location by the International Market, although it was still a bit of a walk to the beach.The room was surprisingly spacious. The kitchen had basic supplies, and we cooked most suppers there (2 elements, full fridge, garburator, plates, pots, cutlery, etc.).The room was clean, free of any smell, and had a balcony. The linens were fine.The in-room table was small (and a bit rickety) so we moved the balcony table inside so six people could be seated. There were a few problems with the rooms plumbing, but the staff were quick to resolve.Parking is a challenge in Waikiki, the staff bent over backwards to find us a free spot on the road on Saturday night (free roadside parking on Sundays in Waikiki). The staff were great--friendly and helpful.We would definitely stay here again.

This trip was to get together with my sister who was staying at the Big Island for 2 weeks. So, we just booked the cheapest room available.When I arrived, it was almost 9pm but Waikiki was still young at night. However, since it was only myself, and my room was on 2nd floor at almost the end of the corridor, I felt uncomfortable. The corridor was a little dark (it is open to the outside) and the room window was on the corridor side, so its there, but not for opening, especially if you are a woman and staying by yourself. The room was clean, simple and moderately large. Did not feel like a new hotel, but decent.The location is great. Close to everything in Waikiki. The only downside for the location was parking spot. The parking at the hotel costs $20 and very limited space, so we had to look for a parking spot outside. The public parking spot around the hotel is also limited and packed always. You have to be lucky to park there. There is a PC at the lobby area, but there was always someone using it. Now that I have iPod touch that I could use at the room for free, but back then, I did not so it was kind of frustrating. I hoped if our room was on higher floor for the safety reason.

All the staff there from the front desk (Winnie) to maintenance (Bryson) were very friendly and helpful. The junior room was not great but the upgraded rooms were much nicer. Good price and excellent location from International Marketplace to Waikiki Beach. We walked from the hotel to Diamond head a couple of times (takes about alittle over an hour walk) along the Ali Wai Canal. They only have wifi in the lobby(need to get a code from the front desk) and have ethernet in the rooms.

We stayed here for three nights, having booked via Travelocity. We got a good price (just one $100 per night I think) for a double double en suite on the 9th floor. The room was a fair size and everything was very clean. Reception was courteous but not over-friendly (fine by us). But the best thing was the location - just off the main drag, so a bit quieter, but easy walking distance to the beach, the bus from/to the airport, and lots of shops. You do have to pay for parking and reserve it in advance, but this was clear to us when we booked, and when they couldn't fit us in one night, there was room at there sister hotel on the next street. All in all, a bit of a find in the middle of the maelstrom that is Waikiki!

Recently stayed (4 nights) at the Aqua Pearl in Waikiki (end of September 2011). Requested a connecting room in reservation (2 rooms reserved) when called to confirm closer to arrival date learned that none of the rooms connected (door) - not a big deal. Building is old 60's style cinderblock construction with exterior walkways and room entrances. Had double/double rooms that face the exterior corridor and over the parking lot - rooms window is tinted and have heavy drapes, but still felt uncomfortable having them open. Public spaces were clean and "up-to-date". Check in was fine, could have been a little faster, but after 6 hours in the air it felt like anything longer than 5 minutes was too long. Room was very comfortable (both rooms were double/double). Looks of lamps but the bulbs seemed dim (especially with drape drawn). Good size desk with chair and desk lamp and flat panel tv (a little on the small side - I think about 20" screen). Off in the corner there was a floor lamp which was all by itself - could have used a nice easy chair in the corner for extra seating (only "seating" was beds and desk chair). Two beds with nightstand, clock, and lamp between them. Bathroom was nothing special - clean and had good lighting (I guess - not sure about anyone putting on makeup - probably could have been a little brighter). Towels were on the thin side, again - not a big deal. Body soap, hand soap, shampoo and condition were provided which is nice since it is a pain to pack it. A couple of things I like about Aqua hotels is the fact some properties provide free internet in the rooms which is great (this property did have free internet in rooms - wired and wi-fi in the lobby), also the mini kitchenette (microwave, coffee maker, and mini fridge) and safe in the room. The locale of the hotel is excellent - right across the street from the International Market (runs between Kalakaua Avenue and Kuhio Avenue), literally a 10 minute walk from the beaches of Waikiki. The hotel does not provide a continental breakfast, but there is a Starbucks on the corner next to the hotel, an IHOP and Denny's with in a block or so, a full service grocery store a couple of blocks away and all the ABC Stores you could hope for, and plenty of restaurants. The property was fairly quiet (except for doors) - could hear people outside, but not too annoying. The area around the hotel (Kuhio Ave) is busy during the day and evening (and as our rooms faced the interior of the hotel/parking lot) we did not hear much street noise (except for the garbage truck on the other street). The hotel has a laundry room (did not use) and no pool (not sure about towels for the beach).The price we paid was good - would probably stay again, but most likely would choose another property with a few more amenities.

this was our first family vacation to hawaii. the waikiki pearl was a nice hotel for the price, we didnt want to spend that much of our vacation money on our hotel or spend that much time in the room. the rooms were very clean and super big. the staff loaned us 3 boogie boards for our entire 11 days stays. no deposit just loaned them to us. the parking was great for us as we expected the worst. we did get a parking space right out the back of the hotel. please be aware that there is a daily rate for this. it is not included in the room charge. the hotel is located by several bars (bars are everywhere in waikiki) and the bar patrons often park in the hotel guest parking spaces. this happened to us once and there was no place to park. the front desk told us to park in a non-parking space by the door leave the keys with them and they would take care of moving the car when a space opened up. they took care of the car while we slept. we picked the keys up the next morning :) the hotel has a very convient location. close to shopping, beach etc......i WILL stay at the aqua waikili pearl when i return to Hawaii.

Booked suite, 3 BDR for conference. Limited parking, central location, renovated but forgot the little things, curtains in bathroom so tower residents next door see in, huge living room but no coffee table, new sofa that wanted to slide you off to the floor(had to put pillow under cushion to feel comfortable. Last day of 5, maids showed up at 5PM told them to forget, needed thorough cleaning of table edge, made me wonder about cleaning overall. so so performance.

I had read reviews on trip advisor about the Aqua Pearl that is why I decided to book the five rooms at their hotel for our group. Mistake. When we went to check in, they had given our junior suites away to someone else and tried to give us a standard room AT THE SAME RATE as a junior suite. The difference was almost $150. I said something, and it seemed like a big deal to get the room at the rate for a standard room. After telling us there was no parking left, they magically came up with a parking space for one of our three vehicles...hmmmmmm. We were told to park the other two vehicles around the corner at a sister hotel for parking. We did that and paid them each time as we left. The Pearl then tried to charge us for parking when we left. My room had little bugs all over the bathroom. Room service didn't put towels in our room, and when called to request some, they said they would deliver them. After waiting for 30 minutes, I had to go get some from the front desk. The location was good and we didn't spend too much time in our room. That is why we chose a lower end hotel. I do expect better service especially some honesty, and I expect to get what I reserved months before. We will be taking other trips to Waikiki, but we will not be staying there, and I would not advise others to. I believe their service is hit and miss.

to start is off I live in Seattle Washington and its a 6 hour almost 7 hour flight to Hawaii, after sitting on an airplane for this long we finally arrive to our hotel (after we had to drive around and find an ATM since the taxi's dont take credit/debit cards), to 4 different sets of people sitting in the reception area, walking to the front desk we were greeted and asked if we were checking in. once my name was given we were told okay well your room isnt ready, it is a single room, etc. clearly stated that i needed a double, this was corrected, Great! but then as we get told, "hey it will be about an hour for your room to be ready, you can have a seat, (there wasnt anywhere to sit the lobby was already full), then we were told, we can check you in, your balance will be 328...? on the phone we were told it would be a total of 228 left since there was a one night reservation charge and we did the promotion of aqua is 10, which makes the first night free. (heads up it went as a credit when they tell you on the phone that the money would be returned to you when you check out), we disagreed with this price and was told it would be fixed by the time we got back and they would check us in but not charge my card. so we left and walked around for two and a half hours. We came back and the same people were int he lobby and we were told your room still isnt ready. we asked whats the problem, they say our theres no towels in your room. We asked about the prices change and there we were told a whooping 3 different prices in the matter of about 20 mins. total came to 458 dollars for a room we were told would only be 328 in total. no one was able to explain this to us and as far as the phone rep i spoke to, they knew nothing of her at all. it was horrible! There was only one gentleman there that was actually nice and customer service friendly. other then that they could all use some training in that department. they arent abel to give you directions nor are they able to recommend things to you. For God sake there is a food pantry store on the corner, and when we were checking out they couldnt tell a visitor where to find milk for her infant child? ive only been to this island once and i even knew this as a visitor. I wouldnt stay at this hotel ever again, and i had a few sets of friends that were coming to visit and had planned to stay there i informed them of this and they got a better rate and service elsewhere. Im glad i know now not to stay in this no name hotels and stay with a chain, there your service is valued and what they said from the beginning is what they will charge you.

I stayed at the Pearl for several nights, and for the money it's a perfectly good hotel. The rooms were clean, everyone was friendly, and you can't really beat the location (right across the street from a huge outdoor shopping area, near to food, and to the beach). The rooms are set up with outdoor hallways, which I didn't expect. So, depending on which room you've got, your window might be looking into a walkway (curtains closed, please!). I booked a room which had a tiny balcony, except when I got to the room, said balcony looked right into another building across the street (not worth the extra money). Having said all that, the rooms were spacious enough, clean, and I did enjoy my stay there. For the proximity to shopping and the beach, to me the hotel's a pretty good bargain.
user_name:
nyc2117
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed this hotel because there is parking. However, I didn't know that I had to make a reservation for the parking spot. When I arrived the hotel, it was too late to get a waiting list. That would be my mistake, so I was not angry, but honestly I wanted to get detailed information when I made a reservation of the stay. To park at other places were not convenient for me. Besides, when I checked-in, my room was not ready and I had to wait for 30 min. Check-in begins at 3 pm and I arrived at 3pm though. Again, I was not angry for such a thing, but I guess I wouldn't stay that hotel again.

This hotel has a subtle entrance, not too flashy from the outside, but the rooms are better than what's required, the only thing that could be improved is the very noisy air conditioner should be replaced.It's got spacious rooms, with friendly and helpful staff, plus it's not right on the super touristy part of Waikiki, instead it's a few blocks back where it is a little more humble still there is all the amenities you could possibly need nearby, awesome

We brought our daughter to HNL for school and needed a very affordable but clean and friendly place to stay. We found this hotel and were very pleased. The room is not fancy but has all the ammentities you need for a GREAT price. It was centrally located and the staff was so so friendly. When we walked through the lobby we got a warm good morning and the same at night. I work in the travel business and stay all over the US and It means alot to me when the staff is happy to have you there and makes you feel so welcome and its genuine. Its the ALOHA spirit through and through!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Thank you to Harry, Daisey, Vince. Les and Dexter. You all are great with the public and really made out stay special.

This hotel has been recently remodeled. It is not fancy but it is clean.The housekeeping staff are very pleasant and accommodating. The property is only two blocks from the beach and well-located. The neighborhood has local residents and feels "real"; all for around $100 a night.What could be bad, right? Nothing, if you are a smart young thing and/or have a laptop and printer. If, like me, you are old enough to be the staff's mom/grandma and are not technologically savy, good luck. The business center is across from the front desk. The computer is high enough that most folks would need a bar stool to sit at it, but no chair is provided. If the purpose is to keep folks from using the computer more than three minutes, the hotel has met its goal admirably. After pulling up my boarding pass, I requested a printed copy. Staff looked at "Luddite Granny" with evident impatience and a young woman silently handed me a drive mechanism for the computer.Then she turned away to resume socializing with other front desk staff. It was only after I jammed the drive into the wrong port (unintentionally) that she turned around expressing concern for the computer. The next morning I asked the front desk to get me a cab. It arrived on time but it was a stretch limousine. When I said I wanted a cab, I was hustled toward the "limo." Because I had to catch a flight, I ran out of time to order a cab. The limo cost at least $10.00 more than the regular cabs I have recently taken to and from the airport. So, be sure to insist on a taxi, unless you want a stretch limousine.

Great location -- right in the heart of Waikiki, behind the International Marketplace, on Kuhio Ave. Staff is super friendly and helpful, never had to wait for anything. Rooms are HUGE, clean, and nice! We could have had a party in there! Went with a group of 6 girls, and if I ever do return to Hawaii, will definitely stay again. The bar downstairs has $3 drinks (ANYTHING) all day!!! OH--also, after I booked, it gave me the final price, but when I checked my bank statement, they actually charged me $200 cheaper than what I had thought I paid for! Not bad... The only CON... Parking lot accommodates about 10 cars, so obviously was full when we got there, so expect to park 2 blocks down...

Lucena from housekeeping was very helpful and accommodated our needs. She did a very good job cleaning our room and we wanted to recognize her for her hard work and service. She is a great asset to the Aqua organization. We hope to stay here again during our next visit to Hawaii.

AQUA WAIKIKI PEARL is a great hotel to stay in Waikiki. The whole STAFF is so friendly, helpful and accomodating; Always ready to make your stay the BEST in Waikiki. With special emphasis to the room cleaning lady (named: LUCENA) who is always smiling, helpful and always keeps our room very clean and neat anytime/everytime. The hotel entrance is approximately 15-yards to KUHIO/International Market. Lots of Good Eats within the area (25-yards radius of the hotel entrance), as in accross the block on Kuhio.

We enjoyed our stay at the Pearl. The staff was very helpful with our concerns and worked to address any problems. We had an issue with trying to get wifi in our room. They attempted to fix it and had an outside technicial finally solve the problem. Otherwise the room was clean and the hotel was accessible to everything. It didn't have a view and the provision were basic but that is all we wanted for an overnight stay in Honolulu. It is worth the price compared to other hotels in the area.

I picked this hotel because they stated it was newly renovated and the pictures looked nice online.While the room was spacious and clean which I guess is all that really matters, there were things that took away from it.The two elevators are extremely slow and one was out of service for awhile.The bathtub faucet handle fell off in my hand when I turned it on.The towels are paper thin and scratchy.I had to call housekeeping one day because they forgot to clean my room and they actually put my used wet and dirtied bath mat over the tub to dry and be used again.The coffee maker sputtered all over the counter and they forgot to leave a new package of coffee for the next day but gave me clean mugs.There is no swimming pool.This hotel is located of Kuhio Ave which is a very noisy area.I also stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Wave about ten years ago and remember a similar experience, so for the future I will stay far away from Aqua chain.

This hotel had exactly what we where looking for: Nice comfy beds, It was clean, had a good location and an attractive price.OK, it was not luxury but thats not what we paid for either. The location gives you good access to all parts of Waikiki, also close to bus stop to take you around the Island.

This by far was the best hotel we stayed in yet We r a family of 7 and stayed in the three bedroom suite. It was so nice very clean good view friendly staff only thing I would change is the kitchen didn't have a stove and parking is tight but the staff helped us out but other than that it was great not to far from the beach we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this to others.

We stayed in Wailkiki Pearl last year about the same time and we were in a standard room two double beds and we were pretty much satisfied.This year we decided to upgrade to a Junior suite that has one queen bed and one double bed.The room itself is very spacious,more than enough for two adults and one child.They provide a microwave and fridge.Bathroom is quite spacious too.IT's not a luxurious hotel but it's nice.The pics are exactly what it is.The staff are friendly,quite accomodating and curtious.Harry is great!!! The hotel provides you with floats,beach chairs,boogie boards,and beach towels.They have wireless internet in the lobby and free internet in room too which is great. They rooms are clean and are kept up by housekeeping so tips are much appreciated.Beds are comfortable,maybe too soft for me cuz I have back problems.Never had a problem with noise as I am a heavy sleeper . If your balcony door is closed,you won't have a problem. They provide a safe for valuables which is free too. What else can I say.. this hotel is great!!

The staff here, care and work hard to give you all they can and do this with a friendly smile. The accommodations we had reserved were not available, but they did their best to make sure we were given equal. Parking is limited at the hotel, but they make sure that loading and unloading luggage is not a problem. Spaces are provided (with extra charge) about a block away. The hotel is about 3 blocks from the beach but is very easy to get to. There is a small food market across the street and a Food Pantry about a block away. Check out is at noon, but they will store your luggage if need be. Our room was adequate - but that is all we asked for. It can be very noisy with the balcony door open - but, again, this is Waikiki. Actually, it was pretty quiet when the doors and windows were shut. Occasionally you might hear pitter-patter of feet above and the door next to you shutting - but not bad. Occasionally, we would have to wait on dish towels, wash clothes, beach and regular towels, but when we asked, they would usually appear within a reasonable time frame. This hotel is not luxurious, but adequate for what it offers.We could see glimpses of the ocean from the balcony - we were on the 9th floor.
