We enjoyed having just stepping out the door to be close to groceries, coffee shop and other amenities. We would come back.

We were in the process of moving to the mainland from Hawaii and needed a pet-friendly place to stay for four nights while our condo was being cleaned and painted. Even though the hotel was accommodating a number of military who were in transition, they made room for our family. And we could not be more grateful. We want to commend Karishma, the manager, and her staff, Harry, Robin, and Kahula, who bent over backwards to help us with accommodations and parking. Mahalo nui loa!
user_name:
pharmer98
New York City, New York

review_body: Love love love'd the Aqua Pearl. Booked a junior suite - room was huge and very spacious. The room had everything that you could ask for, even had microwave. Awesome location in Waikiki and the staff are really nice too. Will definitely be recommending to my friends and family to come stay here.

Overall the hotel was nice. The staff was helpful and accomodating. The rooms were clean and updated. Within walking distance of beach, restaurants and bars. Grocery store and pharmacy within walking distance. Only rented a car for one day to go up to the North Shore. We were to have a 2 bedroom suite for two adult couples. The first room they put us in had one bedroom and one bed in the living area with a curtain to pull in front of the bed! I went back to the front desk and told them we were supposed to have a two bedroom suite. They gave me a new room that did have two rooms, however, only one bathroom with the only access was through the master bedroom. This meant that if you had to get up in the middle of the night to go to the restroom you had to go throught the master bedroom, or go down stairs to the main lobby....yuck!!! Would have been ok if they had given access to the restroom through BOTH bedrooms. Would stay again, but it would be in single rooms!

Full disclosure- I am not a big fan of Waikiki. If you can - find a way to stay at the Marriot Ko Olina timeshares... I'm a big tripadvisor fan- I spend hours obsessing over the perfect trip, even reading reviews after I booked just to validate my choices until the trip date. The Pearl is not bad, but certainly not great. Very average motel type room. A bit dirty, very dated, with a clean lobby and an OK location, it gets the job done but you won't feel like you've splurged. Staff was friendly, no real complaints, just a tired older property surrounded by other older properties. Would only stay again if I was on a tight budget.

Front desk personal was very polite and made me feel like I was a VIP. The attention that she gave when answering my questions was awesome. she stopped what she was doing, looked at me and answered.just as i was checking out, your manager came up to the counter and show much "Aloha Spirit", very friendly.the room was excellant, very spacious. the only problem is the parking, very limited and stalls are slightly smaller.I'm already book for the middle of August.

I have frequently traveled to Oahu for business and never need to think about where I am going to stay. The Aqua Waikiki Pearl never stops short of trying to make you feel right at home with the feeling of "NO WORRIES". This location is smack dab in the middle of Waikiki and always has a friendly smile to welcome you in. You are paying reasonable prices and hassle free check in service. For a smaller hotel you get "BIG TIME" hotel service and friendliness. "YOU'VE TRIED THE REST NOT STAY AT THE BEST!!!!"FWWLSNPACIFIC

I stayed here over the 4th of July weekend with my family. We had booked a one bedroom unit and absolutely loved it. The desk staff were wonderful and we were able to check into our room as soon as we arrived. The lobby looks new and our room was very spacious...we even had a huge balcony which was great to sit out and wind down from our activity filled day. The room had a full kitchen (pots, pans, dishes included) - loved it!. The lady who cleaned our room was very friendly and our room was spotless everyday after we returned from our daily activities.Yes, parking is limited at the property and the staff at the check in desk were very helpful in providing other parking options available within walking distance - this is Waikiki and most hotels do have challenges with parking. We also loved the location - close to the International Marketplace and tons of great restaurants that were walking distance from the hotel. Excellent value and we'll definitely be back!

Stayed here over 4th of July. We picked the pearl mainly because of the location and price. Right across from the International Marketplace and within walking distance of pretty much everything in Waikiki, also very close to the bus stop. Hotel staff could be a little more attentive but no one was rude or unkind. If you just need a place to keep your stuff and a bed at night then the Waikiki Pearl is a great choice.

Let's see. Clean, comfortable, excellent service. Very nice to have a microwave and refrigerator in the room. Great location. Good bargain as we got 2 rooms for 5 people. Front desk was very hepful in printing boarding passes and beach towels are available.The downside - the trash trucks do start early but I think the trash trucks are everywhere in Waikiki. Very limited parking for additional $20. a day but there are in and out priveleges. Not a luxury hotel but thats not what we paid for.

I stayed mid June 2011 for several nights and was greeted warmly upon arrival, my room was immaculate and the staff were very friendly. Without a car I relied on the front desk to figure out some logistics (i.e., taxi's, timing, restaraunts, etc.)... their recommendations were spot-on!It's not a place to sit in your room, but in Waikiki, why would you. Proximity to beach was great for the price and overall would return again.... Strong recommendation for business travelers... the money you save on hotels can go for anything else!4 stars from me !!!

Like alot of mid-range accomodations in Waikiki, this place does the job if you can get it at a decent rate.We were two couples and paid 99$ a night for a one bedroom appartment that had two queen sized beds and a full kitchen. At that price, who can complain.It's basic, clean, and has a decent sized and functional bathroom, but no pool. The kitchen worked well, but we twice had to go to the reception for missing items (i.e.: salad bowl, bottle opener). As most places in Waikiki the location is decent, 3 blocks (7 minutes) from the beach.The staff was polite, but we had a few issues with billing at check-out...it was resolved after 10 minutes, but the staff seemed a little lost and confused during that time.This place can work well for groups of friends or families, but would not recommend it for honeymooners.

We got a decent rate, and it was for one night, so thought it would be fine. It WAS 'fine', but that's all it was. I have relatively high standards for hotels, and this did not meet it. I think for a family who doesn't expect too much, it would be a decent place. It was clean, if nothing else. It was very loud all night long, no fault of the hotel, but from the streets. I felt like I was in a shady area, but really close to a good one. Starbucks very close by which was nice in the morning. The elevators were small, the room was large. I think the cement walls and walking along the outside to our room made me feel like I was in a cheap motel. You won't be disgusted by this place, but nor do I see how someone could be impressed.

We have stayed at two other Aqua hotels and were satisfied. We live in Honolulu and had to stay at a hotel for one night because our house was having plumbing problems. It was only one night but several things happened that made our experience unimpressive. First, when I called to make reservations, the woman at the front desk asked if I wanted one or two beds. I said one. She quoted me $85 for a king size bed. I said the price online was less and she said it was actually more. I then realized she didn't offer me the queen size bed which was $74. She was trying to get me to pay more for something I didn't need. How rude of her, especially since I was a local resident and explained to her my dilemma with our plumbing. Second, the room was not the cleanest. The shower had many hairs on the floor and someone's shampoo left from a previous guest. Third, it was 11:30 at night so we wanted to get settled in and sleep. The woman at the front desk was kind of hyper, not warm. We had to call the front desk from the room because there was no remote for the AC. The woman at the front desk kept saying where it should be as if we were not looking hard enough in the small room. She finally sent a security guy up who verified there was no remote. He got us a remote to turn on the AC.Fourth, I went to take a shower and the water pressure was very low and didn't have hot water. I called the front desk and the security guy confirmed the shower wasn't working. We were moved to another room. Oh and we had to take the AC remote with us. Fifth, in the morning, I asked another front desk woman the price of parking and without looking up at me, she gave me a one word answer. I felt like I was bothering her yet no one else was around in the lobby. Needless to say, a motel experience in what could have been a pleasant hotel.

I stayed in Aqua Waikiki Pearl in May 2011. I thought the place was "just a hotel." Nothing special. It wasn't the worst place I had ever been but it certainly was not the best.I pre-paid through Priceline. The rate was very reasonable for my budget.The lobby leads you to believe that the hotel is posh and upgraded. There is a MAC computer available for guests' use. Don't be fooled by the nice hardwood flooring and cush lounge chairs. The rest of the hotel is 1987. When I arrived at 230PM, the room was ready. Check-in was very quick. I had a package delivered to me prior to my arrival and it was ready and waiting for me when I checked in. My room was on the 4th floor overlooking the street. If you are looking for a view, go elsewhere. The rooms facing the street look down on dirty Nahua Street. The rooms facing the courtyard get a great view of the hotel's parking lot. My room was decorated poorly but I never care about that. I will admit that the room size was HUGE. I was very surprised by this. I am quite sure that hotel room is larger than the master bedroom in my "luxury" apartment back home in DC. I think the room is called a junior suite, or something to that effect. The room has coffee maker, microwave and refrigerator. There is wired internet in the room, free for guests. Overall the room is clean and adequate. I can make no complaints about that. The lighting in the bathroom was a little dim but I realise that the lights had to warm up before they went to their full luminescence. The water pressure was decent; the temperature satisfactory.For some people, the one negative thing will be the noise. I always say that if you are in an urban area, you should get over it. If you want peace and quiet, get a hotel in the woods. There was plenty of street noise at the 4th floor. This hotel goes to the 10th floor. Last year, I stayed on the 17th floor of a property a block away and I could still hear street noise. I live in DC so noise does not bother me. But if you're sensitive, get a room overlooking the "courtyard." Less noise, but not entirely quiet because now you have people traipsing back and forth in front of your door. There is a bar adjacent to the building and this has quite a bit of noise until about 4AM. This hotel allows pets and this worried me because I thought there would be dogs barking all night. I didn't see one animal. There is laundry available on the 3rd floor. Bring your own quarters. There is no change machine. Go across the street to the video game place on Kuhio. That's the only place I could find with quarters.The staff was very polite. Every time I saw someone in the hallway they said hello. The front desk people were friendly. You can get beach towels, but bring them back because they charge supposedly charge $35 if you don't. One time I got a towel but they didn't even write my name down, so who knows if they enforce this policy. There was an issue with the phones but I don't use hotel phones. I think they allow free local calls but I can't verify this.Even though this area can be dingy at night, I did feel secure. I came back to the room while it was being serviced and maid did not simply just allow me to walk into the room. She checked my key and my identity before she let me stay. I appreciate this because any lunatic can just walk up into a room where the door is open while it's being cleaned. If you are looking for someplace clean and budget friendly, this is your place. If you are sensitive to noise then look someplace else. If you want cheap and close to everything stay here. If you want posh luxury, keep going.I would stay here again.
user_name:
WorfsBabyMama
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We were looking for a reasonably priced place to stay in Waikiki. We researched hotels and read reviews by other travelers before booking. This hotel stood out for cleanliness and location in its price range.I found the room spacious--it was really a one bedroom apartment with full kitchen and living room dining room area plus a spacious balcony. The room had high speed internet service (wired) and we found it fairly quiet from our perch on the 9th floor. The desk staff was very helpful and there was a parking lot that we didn't need or use. There was a sports bar attached to the hotel as well as an ATM and laundry facilities.In terms of location, we were 1/4 block from the Kuhio Avenue strip, 3 - 4 blocks from the beach, 2 blocks from the Food Pantry (supermarket/deli), across the street from the International Market including a Food Court and next door to a Starbucks! There was also a drug/sundry store (ABC), a bakery (St Germaine), a health food eatery, a liquor store and a very popular sushi restaurant within a block of the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. This will be my "go to" hotel on future trips to Honolulu and I will be looking at other hotels in the Aqua chain when I visit other Hawaii cities.

...i usually stay at the aqua palms but they were sold out so I has to find somewhere else to stay. I wanted to stay within the aqua hotels and the aqua pearl looked nice. The lobby was nice...it's a small hotel right in the center of Waikiki. Nothing fancy... But what surprised me was the people that worked there. From the front desk to my housekeeper. The front desk was great. Harry, Robin, and Precilla really made my stay great. They were always ready to answer any question I had. The room was nicely decorated. had some plumbing problems but the maintenance guy cane and fixed it right away. The hotel is okay. I didn't really spend a lot of time in it. I would come back because of the service I received. I would really recommend this hotel to others.

This hotel would be good for a family. It is clean, comfortable, spacious, well priced and well located 15 mins leisurely walk to beach. As a couple, we found it a bit noisy - the garbage trucks started at 6am every day plus we had some inconsdierate neighbours at 4am talking, laughing and slamming doors next to us. The hotel staff were ok but we didn't get a smile and greeting everytime we walked past reception. Free wi fi was good. One bedroom apartment had huge lounge area and was sparsely furnished - it was a bit crazy really. Next time I would just stay in a hotel room there. There were glass louvre windows in the bedroom which allowed noise in. It really is too warm to sit on the balcony - you wil prefer to sit in the cool of the AC. If I go back to Hawaii I will spend my cash and stay right on the beach.

Just return home from Waikiki. The hotel, Aqua Waikiki Pearl was just OK but please never expect more.I chose this hotel from priceline which was part of the package. Actually I had 2 options, one is mali sky court and this. After checking the review here and noticing the star rate, I decided to put my money on this one.We arrived at this hotel in the afternoon. The location was very good. A Japanese-style staff took us. I requested to had a room on higher floor. After talking with the housekeeper by radio, he refused to make it since the higher floor room was not ready. However, what I heard was that there was a room, 603 or 607 which was finishing cleaning. Also, in his refusal, he also mentioned that we were booked in a cheap fare and gave us an upgrade for extra fee or give a room in lower one. We declined his offer and had a room in a lower one. The room was good but no view and equipped with mircowave.There is one queen and one double in the room. Howevr the internet required a cable insert which was impossible if you had an ipod or ipad. The wall outlet was designed weird which is not inconvinient for recharging.Parking, the parking was 20 usd/day but the space was rather limited. For most of you who would come on hot (not peak) season. Please prepare some time to find a proper parking place with an affordable price.

been misled by some good reviews, but this is really a terrible experence. I stayed at outrriger reef for the 1st 4 nights and the stay was quite pleasant, then went to big island and spent the last 2 nights back to Ohau here. well, the only good thing is location, very close to all bus stops in Waikiki, but all other things were so bad... i booked a USD 120 standard room and been upgradted to a suite, the room is large but not clean, it was so noisy in the night, nosie from the street and from the sport bar downstairs kept me awake all night. the hotel door was supposed to close at 10:00 pm, but there were some strange local people in and out the hotel freely and chat with the front desk staff. also, the front desk was not helpful at all.

This was our 3rd visit to Oahu, and we knew we'd spend little time in the hotel. We picked this hotel due to great reviews, and in particular the price! We were SO impressed by the location- it was perfect! The staff was sparse, but helpful. Lobby was clean. Rooms were bare-bones, but acceptable. Parking was a joke- we got the last "spot" which we were happy about, but it was #7- TINY- we were up on a curb, next to the dumpster, and had to wash our car twice because we couldn't see through the bird poop on the windows. $20/day for that? Sad. Otherwise? GREAT deal for Waikiki. Don't have high expectations, and you'll be satisfied!!
user_name:
Amanda P
New York City, New York

review_body: We booked a 2 bedroom suite with a full kitchen online. When we walked into our room we expected 2 bedrooms and a nice kitchen since we did pay extra for their "Suite" We were wrong! There was only one bedroom. The second bedroom was a bed in the middle of the living room separated only by a long curtain! The beds were hard and the pillows were dirty. The only outlets in our room that worked was the ones in the bathrooms. We went out for the night, when we came back, I turned on the lights and roaches scampered everywhere in the kitchen! It was disgusting! There were roaches in the bathrooms crawling on our bedrooms walls. We will never stay there again... Even if we were offered a great discount! One thing that I can say was good about this hotel was the location. It was in the center of it all and within walking distance of everything even the beach. So if you don't mind roaches and uncomfortable beds and dirty rooms I would reccommend staying at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl.

We took a chance on an inexpensive hotel for the three nights we were going to stay in Waikiki. I trusted the other reviews I had read here on Trip Advisor and some other sites and decided to trust them, it paid off this time. The Hotel was everything the reviews said it would be. It’s not fancy but it has been newly remodeled on the inside, our room was very clean and a nice size a little larger than some others we have stayed in. We had not planned on being in the room much more than just to sleep and we were able to do this in complete comfort two of the three nights. This is a family priced hotel and it is used by families with kids and kids can be a little loud when they are excited. It is close to one of the main marked exits to the International Market Place and it is a short walk to the Waikiki Beach through the market place and the high rent hotels, a major City bus stop is within a block of the door and makes the whole island available to you for just $2.50 with one transfer.

Stayed at the pearl twice.. Just love the location.. It's opposite the international market and there's abc store just across the street.. Very near the food pantry for anyone who needs some stuff. The room is big and clean compared to the last time I stayed. Free WiFi only at the lobby!The service sucks!! Had to call twice for the housekeeping to send in a rollaway bed!! There's free high speed Internet service HOWEVER I couldn't get any connection plus I called the hotel to help me and had to call twice for them to come and assist BUT this guy came in and also couldn't help me get a connection and the best part he said he's gonna get help and that was the last time I saw him!! So had to go to the lobby whenever I wanna use the Internet!!!!!!So if you're looking for an affordable place to stay with awesome location.. This hotel is a good choice other than that dream on!! Hope this review helps!!!Above all I luv Hawaii!!! <3

I will be honest it is not a bad hotel but as a family it was a disappointment. Don't expect surprise from this hotel; it is only a good location in Waikiki with the minimum service.In the morning, you will hear the refuse lorry for 15 minutes at 6:30am or 7am.The hotel parking is small and could not accept all guests cars. It is 20$ a day and I dont remember it was mentioned at booking or on the website.The room is spacious and bedding of good quality (except the sofa). It was pretty clean but towels were missing. Same for dishes, cookware and chairs. The table was so small that we moved the outdoor table in. It was a nightmare having meals in this room. Did not have much choice because one of my kids is gluten free.The aircon from the room next door was doing plenty of noise. Watch out: the elevator is dangerous for kids. Free cable Internet is available in the room and wifi in the lobby only. Forget your fancy internet pad or smartphone except you want to share your secrets in the lobby.Otherwise some may say that it is a good deal for Waikiki and they are likely right ... if you are not a family. Anyway Waikiki is boring for family. Prefer Maui or Big Island or somewhere else in Oahu.
Clean rooms and excellent location. Close to bus stop, beach, restaurants, shops etc

We booked a so called 2 bedroom unit. The 2nd bedroom was a curtain that pulled across a double bed. The living area was large but sparsely equipped (one 3 seater lounge and a small round table. The access to the room was via a very dated external walkway and an elevator. The traffic and noise from below (on level 6) was loud as was the air conditioner. We checked out after one night of a 4 night stay and paid more for better accommodation nearby. Overall, it was expensive for what it was. Digital photography is great for making hotels look nice online, but it is creating an army of disappointed customers when reality does not match the pictures. The guy on the desk was ok but didn't even bother to ask why we were leaving early so I didn't bother telling him.
I stayed at this hotel for 10 nights, and it was awesome. Our room attendant, Daisy, had a lovely smile all the time and it felt very comfortable like being at home.

My wife and I recently stayed at the Aqua Pearl in Waikiki for 12 nights, this hotel has excellent value and service. The room was clean, the staff helpful, close to all amenities and walking distance to the beach (2 blocks) and many excellent resturants close by or a 10 minute bus ride to Honolulu. We highly recommend this hotel for those on a budget and want to experience paradise without the ballooned inflated prices that the higher end hotels charge. We also recommend a trip to Pearl Harbour (free entry) and city bus takes about 45 minutes from the hotel also Germaines Luau for about 50-75 dollars excellent event. The Waikiki trolley was an experience as well, you can take it to diamond head volcano, city attractions or shopping at various locations.

We were very happy with the service we received at the Pearl. The staff was great, especially Robyn who made our stay extra special! She was helpful and always willing to answer our questions. Our room was what we expected. It was cleaned regularly and comfortable. The location was convenient, just a few blocks from the beach! We will be sure to stay at the Pearl if we were to come back to Honolulu!

A few years ago I previously had stayed at the Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa (AWESOME Hotel, BTW) but they were sold out for this trip so I stayed instead here at the Aqua Aloha Pearl. Although this hotel did not have all of the extra free goodies as the Surf and Spa, it was still pretty much a nice hotel and stay. Here are the positives:Location: EXCELLENT location for just about everything in Waikiki. The bus stops right on the corner. You won't even need a car if you are just staying in Waikiki beach. You can walk to everything Waikiki has to offer! Dennys is right across the street. Hotel is right next door to a Starbucks. Hotel is about a block or so from a bit expensive (sans the Pineapples) grocery store. International Marketplace is a few blocks down with every kind of food imaginable, plenty of shopping, free stage entertainment, and great koi ponds. There is an ABC store right across the street. There are also several ABC stores within a minute or so of the hotel. (ABCs are like a dressed up 7-11, but much cleaner. They are great for souvenirs or a last minute snack or a morning muffin.) Up the street is the main drag for Waikiki where there is a mile or so of stores, restaurants, malls, etc...Very fun for window shopping and people watching. At night there is always some sort of entertainment going on along this walk. I would be out until 1 am or so and always felt safe walking from the main drag back to the hotel. The police are VERY good at patrolling Waikiki and keeping everything under control. There are NO alcoholic beverages allowed in your hands while walking around Waikiki. Also, do NOT jaywalk or ride a bike and cross the street anywhere where you are not suppose too. USE the crosswalks. The police WILL give out tickets if they catch you violating these rules..Hotel is a very easy 7-10 minute walk to the beach. Or a 15-20 minute walk to awesome FREE snorkeling just past Waikiki beach close by the aquarium. (Hotel gives you huge fluffy beach towels to use. Just remember to return them or you will get charged $35.) Employees: Harry is hilarious!! My housekeeper and her husband were VERY sweet and very attentive to our needs. I made sure and tipped them extra. Rest of the staff were very kind and attentive to us except for one girl working the night shift; she was upset with me because I turned in a towel at 1 am. (They check their towel list at midnight.) So if you plan to do some night swimming, just let them know ahead of time. I can't blame them for wanting their nice fluffy towels back. ☺Internet: Free and fast! It is wired, yes, but to even be able to FIND free internet at any hotels in Waikiki is amazing. I did not mind having to hook into the wired router. Aqua Aloha Surf and Spa is also free wired internet.Room: Very clean and enough room to store luggage in a long sliding closet. There is a safe in the closet. Clean fresh linens. NO Bedbugs!! Comes with a mini fridge, microwave, and small coffee pot with coffee packs. Fridge is great for getting stuff to make sandwiches with and storing drinks to save some $$. Bathroom has tons of storage underneath the sink. Showerhead is great; water pressure is excellent. Tub and sink drained great. Never lost hot water while taking those long showers after night swimming. Windows are tinted and room curtains are very good at keeping the room dark until you want to let the light in. Here are a few things that sorta just bugged me but did really bother others. Price: I paid a little over a $1000 for 7 days through the web site. My original price was $896 but the website decided to act up so I called their direct line and the gal that helped me told me that even though I had my reservation #, the price was no longer available on the web, and for what I wanted I'd have to pay an extra $100+ total. Ok fine...it happens. So I asked for a high up room and King bed wound up with a second floor room with a queen and double bed, facing the parking lot. I figured this is all they had left and I should be grateful. Well, here is where the noise factor comes in. At night, there will be a lot of sirens, etc... zooming by on the main drag. When the bar next door lets out, you'll hear a few drunk folks hooting and hollering. In the wee hours there is a lot of noise going on due to the trash truck picking up trash, delivery trucks, housekeeping getting ready for their day, etc... Being on the second floor, all of this sound is multiplied. Fortunately I had earplugs, but my colleague did not and was woken up several times during the night and morning. During the day, it is also very noisy. You are in downtown Waikiki so there will be noise, but since you are so close to a main street, it is extra loud. I was not in my room too much during the day, but during the times I was, I could definitely hear it. It didn't bother me but I did hear others that were also on the same floor as us complaining. My advice: Go exploring! But, if you have to be in the room, turn on the A/C. It has a dull white noise that cancels out most of the other noises going on. And if you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs. Dogs: This hotel is one of the hotels the military uses when it needs to house military personnel traveling or moving with dogs. Big dogs, little dogs, it doesn't matter. The dogs that were close to us barked every time someone opened or closed a door. At 12 midnight, it was not pleasant for other hotel guests. Many of times the dogs were left abandoned in the room and we could hear them whining and barking. I kinda felt sorry for them. Again, I used my earplugs at night but others without earplugs were none to thrilled at the yappers. Some applauded when the guests with the dogs checked out! Ants: My room had a slight ant problem. The windows at the top of the wall in the room have these little spaces in the glass slats and the ants somehow found their way through these slats and made a beeline for the bathroom and the top of the area where the microwave is and where I had food. I swear they were acrobatic ants. I could see their trail at the top of the ceiling. Fortunately they were harmless tiny black ants. I sprayed them with Lysol, but they kept returning. I let the front desk know and within 30 minutes they took care of the ants. After that, the ants never returned during my stay, thank goodness! Parking: We decided to rent a car and it was very hard to get parking. Parking is a precious commodity anywhere in Waikiki beach so if you do decide to use a car, be prepared to pay. The hotel charged $20.00 a night, which is VERY reasonable for the area.TIP: If you want to park 6 blocks away, the Banyan Hotel straight down heading south on Kuhio & Ohua street has a huge multi level parking garage with security that charges only $10.00 per 24 hours. You enter the garage from the west side of Kuhio. It's about a 10 minute walk from the parking garage to the Pearl, and a rather nice walk day or night thanks to Hawaiis marvelous weather temperatures. The night time walk gave me a good reason to stop in at the ABC market and get my next mornings yogurt and muffin. Prostitutes: Even in beautiful Waikiki, they are there. They come out at about 11PM and you definitely can tell who they are by how they dress. They seem to like to hang out across the street by Dennys and another hotel within eye distance of the Pearl. The cops do their best to shoo them away but they really are unstoppable because the "streetwalkers" know what their rules and rights are. They aren't mean; they won't stalk you or beg from you or hurt you, but if you are out late at night and are male or with a male, they may ask you if you want a "friend". Just keep walking along and ignore them and you'll be fine. ☺I would stay here again because of the location, free internet, and great customer service, but I would first check to see if their sister hotel over on the next block, The Aqua Surf and Spa, has rooms. They are both the same price but the Aqua Surf and Spa has a small pool, most rooms have a lanai, there is a cute tropical waterplant in room, and a free small breakfast. Just remember, you're in Hawaii, om Waikiki beach!! You shouldn't be in the room TOO much!! Besides, who needs one of those expensive fancy rooms??? Get out there and have fun and relax!! Jump in that beautiful warm water and see the gorgeous fish! Watch the planes fly by above you as you soak up the sun. Swim at night just so you can say you did. Eat fresh pineapple while watching the hula dancers! Get a Dole Whip! Enjoy the beautiful blue sky, warm weather, and friendly people. It's what it's all about when going to the Islands. ☺

We traveled to Honolulu in March to board a cruise ship on Saturday and stayed at the Waikiki Pearl Hotelon Friday before the cruise and on Staturday after the cruise . I made reservations for a room for our son and his wife and their 10- year-old grandaughter and one for my husband and myself through the internet and got a verification immediately. I always have apprehensions before I arrive at a hotel when I make the reservations via the internet. I called the hotel to see if they had transportation from the airport and they said that they didn't but gave me information regarding transportation and I felt very comfortable when we arrived at the airport . As I was talking to the man on the phone , I mentioned that our great-granddaughter was coming with us anrd that I would like for her to get a lei when we got there and asked him if he could arrange it for me. He said that he would and when we got to the hotel, he had an orchid lei for each of us and wouldn't take any pay for them. I so appreciated this gesture especially because it made it so special for our great-granddaughter. The accodomations were very nice and we had adjoining rooms. When we returned we planned to rent a car and they reserved a parking space for us. The fee was $20. but it was convenient and less than some of what the other hotels charged. The hotel is located across the street from the International Market and we enjoyed shopping there after we came in from sightseeing. We didnt walk to the beach but the hotel was about three or four blocks from the beach.It isn't a new, fancy hotel but it was a very good experience and I would stay there again. Harriett Tate

A boutique hotel near Waikiki Beach, great central location. My room was spacious and immaculate. Simple, nothing fancy, just what I wanted, including a good price. All the amenities were there -- the small fridge, coffee-maker and microwave were very useful, because Waikiki is expensive. There was a small balcony, where I enjoyed breakfast coffee. The welcome was pleasant. With beautiful beaches and so much to do, it was just right!

We have been going to Hawaii for 32 years and stayed at quite a few different hotels. 2 were in the "Never again" category, most were adequate and a couple were great for us. The fact that we have stayed at the Pearl for our last four trips (through all the renovations and 2 name changes) speaks for itself. We are budget travellers who prefer 2 weeks at a modest place to 4 days at a luxury resort. You don't sleep in the fancy foyer, my husband can't swim, so a pool or being on the beach aren't on our list of priorities but spacious rooms, comfy beds and a clean bathroom and a large balcony are. There is a fridge, microwave and coffee maker in each room, with a supermarket down the block so we especially enjoyed sitting on the lanai in our pyjamas eating breakfast at our leisure, reading the free newspaper and watching the world go by, as opposed to having to get up and dressed and down to the restaurant by a certain time for a ho hum buffett in a crowd.There are numerous eating places within a block or two. The bus stop is 2 minute walk away and the beach about 7. You ask at the front desk for a beach towel and just drop it in the laundry basket next to the lift on your return (no charge).There is a computer in the foyer and wi-fi in all the rooms for laptops (also free).With a laundry on site (not free) we found the Pearl ideal for our 4 week stay. The staff were excellent and friendly without exception, and the deal we got as return guests was the icing on the cake. Will we be back again? Too right!

We stayed at the aqua Waikiki Pearl hotel in Hawaii....the employee Harry at the front desk was so helpfull in so many ways and his kindness made our stay more enjoyable. Also the maid, Rowena on the 10th floor was very honest and kind a pleasure to see 5 days a week. her work was good and appreciated.

With a kamaaina rate, the Waikiki Wave and Pearl are great deals. The rooms are very large, clean with all you will need. Harry at the front the desk is charming and quick. Location was helpful, a few steps from bus stop, and a couple blocks from great shopping and dining.

We chose to stay at the Aqua Pearl as had a good experience with another of the Aqua hotel chain the last time we were in Waikiki - the Aqua Continental which is currently closed for renovations. This is a very good value hotel. Walking distance to Waikiki. Very helpful staff, we arrived on a flight early in the morning and were able to check in early. Clean and tidy room, mirrored windows for privacy, good amenities - safe, bathroom products, air conditioning. Will definitely stay again.

the hotel reception was nice and clean, the first room we went in smelt musty, so we paid to be upgraded, just so we could be moved,we were moved to the front of the hotel, lovely room no smell this time! probably because it had a balcony. if you want a nice quiet holiday do not pick this hotel? it lets anyone in for 1 night stays and they are not quiet. would not visit waikiki again its a young persons place.

Room was clean, had a microwave, refer, and coffee pot. Beds were comfortable.A bit away from the beach, but real close to shops and places to eat. We were on 10th floor and it was quiet. We enjoyed our stay.Downside, no gym, no swimming pool, and ice was on 7th floor.

Centrally located in Waikiki. Close to everything; bus stops, restaurants, International Market Place, beach, trolleys, etc.Hotel was clean and comfortable with all the basic necessities covered. No breakfast or restaurant, although all were close to the hotel. In room internet access is wired and for some reason, when I connected it gave me a virus. Wireless internet access is available in the lobby. That worked well. Room came with a digital safe, microwave, and small fridge. They all came in handy. Room was clean and the beds were confortable. Bathrooms were clean and looked modernized. The sink was set a bit high. All in all a nice place to stay and of particular good value.

As a local I've pretty much stayed at all the hotels Oahu has to offer, yet I always return to Waikiki Pearl. I ♥ their staff, Mike, Harry, Priscilla and their friendly, outgoing manager Kalei Lyman. Each time I stay there whether its been a month or a year ago they always remember me. This time they prepared for my arrival and had a parking stall already reserved for me! This is special being that they have a limited amount of stalls available. My room was perfect and they even remembered that I like extra pillows, so my room had an extra 3 pillows. A hui hou to the gracious staff and I will see you all again!

We had to come to Honolulu for three weeks on business. We received very short notice. We were unable to find a hotel that had three straight weeks availbable, until we called the Aqua Pearl. So we took four rooms. We rented a car at the airport and drove to the hotel.There were only 20 parking spots in the back of the hotel. The hotel has probably 200 - 300 rooms. We felt lucky there was one available when we got there and we parked our car. We parked there the first two nights we were there. But when we woke up at 5 am on our third day there, we saw that our rental car had been booted. I called the front desk and they said that we had to pay to park there and that I could get the boot off for $50. They also asked "didn't you SEE all the reserved signs in the parking lot????". I replied "well yes I did, I thought they meant reserved for hotel guests". But their tone with me was far from customer-service oriented. They acted like I was crazy for being upset that they booted my car for being parked in their lot.We were never asked at check-in if we had a car. If we had been asked, they could have informed us about the parking situation at the hotel, instead of BOOTING one of their guest's car. We live in the U.S. mainland, so we're not used to hotels charging us to park at their hotel.I just think it's very sorry customer service to just boot one of your guest's car without any warning, then tell them they have to pay $50 to have it taken off. It makes me feel like this is used as another avenue for profit. Besides that, the hotel isn't that nice. I was disappointed already when I saw what it looked like. Then to have the hotel boot my rental car without warning and tell me I have to give them $50 to get it taken off.!! I heard it was just renovated, so I really wonder what it must have looked like before. It's in a seedy-looking area.The walls are not very soundproof at all. If anyone within five doors of you shuts the door to their room, it's loud enough to make you jump. So you better be a heavy sleeper.I'll post pics later of the 20-car parking lot and the front & back of the hotel so you can see for yourself.

We stayed at is hotel for five nights and were very happy with the location, amenities and service. It is an older re furnished hotel and I think subsequently the rooms are better built than newer hotels in terms of being sound proof and dark. We had a three bedroom unit on the top floor and it was extremely spacious and comfortable for what we wanted. The old air conditioning is noisy and can't be turned off, however we did get used to it, and it was not in sleeping areas.We would definitely return to this hotel and will tel others about it, they seem to be constantly trying to improve the hotel too!!!

Having stayed 4 weeks, we benefitted from an entire exceptional front desk staff.Priscilla,Robin,Harry,Mike and others were responsive.efficient stores of info-willing to phone, google or print..Simply .The Best. ,Extras provided-dishes,cutlery, breach chairs,mats at no cost. Excellent location at Int.Market Place.Stores and excellent eats Food Court. Fatties Chinese Kitchen,Denny's ,Food Pantry, bus Stops,,Sports bar, Canal walk..All amenities worked great.Highly recommend spacious jr.suite great beds,large balony.......

This is not a luxury hotel. This is not a budget hotel or hostel. As soon as you calibrate your expectations to within these limits, you won't be disappointed. It's not on the beach but you could easily walk there. In fact, anything you'd want to do in Waikiki is within walking distance of this hotel. Rooms are large and clean. No views. It is noisy, but no more so than other big cities. I think people get in their mind surf and beach and soothing waves when they think of Waikiki. This is understandable, but one must remember a landmass and city are involved too, and that is where this hotel is located. There is FREE in room (wired) internet, which gives it an advantage over many of the more expensive hotels in the area.

My friend and I stayed at the Pearl 4 nights, it was a return visit. January 27th-31st. The rooms are large, clean and have internet access.The location is excellent walking distance to the beach,restaurants and shopping and the best part is the price very resonable.

After spending two nights in a noisy treehouse in Sunset Beach, we decided to move to a hotel in Waikiki. The Aqua Pearl was quite affordale at last minute rates and was in a good location. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a larger room with a balcony. The room itself was huge and had two Queen beds, so my partner and I slept in separate beds! They have free wifi in the lobby with confortable couches to sit on. The staff at the desk were very friendly and very helpful.All around great value and good location.

As a "local" who lives on Maui, I travel to Oahu frequently and ALWAYS stay at the Aqua Pearl. Why? I believe it is one of the very best values in Waikiki. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. The staff is friendly and responsive. The hotel is convenient to all of Waikiki. I have recommended this hotel to all my friends and family and those who have stayed there agree with me wholeheartedly. I look forward to my next stay which looks like will be in mid-February!

Hotel website photos are accurate and rooms are large, attractive and very clean. Great location close to corner of Kuhio and very convenient to everything. Just 2 blocks to beach, a Starbucks on corner, Food Pantry supermarket 1 block, International Marketplace steps away and a few feet to buses to Diamond Head and Pearl Harbor for only $2.50. Rented the 2 bedroom, 1 bath suite on 6th floor (approximately 985 square feet), but was dissapointed that the second bedroom has a curtained partition rather than a door. A full kitchen with large fridge, stovetop and microwave, coffee-maker, toaster, pots, pans, dishware and utentils for 4. Living room has a sofabed and a table with seating for 4. Only 1 television in living room and no TV's in either bedroom. TV had cable but no DVD player and we were unable to watch DVD's during late everning or downtime. Hotel had no adapter cables to borrow for DVD player hook-up to TV set. Unusually large large balcony (lanai) with seating for 2 and table. Laundry room with 3 washers & 3 dryers on 3rd floor for $2 each and ice dispenser and soda machines on 7th floor. No pool, but that's okay because Wakiki's gorgeous beach is short walk away. Consistent and plentiful hot water and a well-functioning air-conditioning system. Helpful and pleasant service at front desk.
user_name:
Globalmania
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Perfect setup if:-you are traveling with 2/3 friends and splitting the room price (standard room sleeps 3- one double, one queen)-you want to stay somewhere central (room is very close to the beach and across from the International Marketplace).-you wont be spending a lot of time in your room but want something decent sizedRooms are the biggest and most modern Ive seen for the price.Shower & bath, hair dryer included.Small LCD TV, fridge to store food.I thought this hotel was a great deal for the price and perfect for a trip to Hawaii with friends.-

I have been visiting Hawaii for over 10 years now and have stayed at this hotel for more than 20 times during this time. I have seen it grow and expand .It has now become a very professionally managed Hotel with all modern amenities and comforts.The Hotel staff is very cooperative and extend all possible assistance to their customers.The Rooms and Toilets are kept clean and functional at all times apart from other facilities.There are a few minor drawbacks like non-availability of guest parking, late check-ins, No kitchen or Room service etc.The best part of the hotel are its large room size and location.Highly recommended.

If you are not deciding to stay in your room all day, this is perfect for sleep. Also can walk out to the beach and go shopping. There are maps available to help you. My internet was not great, and the lamp by the bed was broken. Otherwise, not a bad place for the price you pay around the Waikiki area.

if your not looking for a fancy ocean view and want a clean budget hotel in Waikiki try the Pearl! free wi fi in lobby, convienent location to walk everywhere! Rooms remodeled with a more modern look.
located at the corner of Kuhio Street - just a walking distance to the shopping centers and the Waikiki beach... affordable rate, friendly staff and clean facilities. . truly worth a stay.

Before my trip to Honolulu for Christmas I read many mixed reviews on the Pearl and was a bit leary. I have stayed at several of the Aqua resorts during business trips in the past. By far I put the Aqua Waikiki Pearl at the top of my list. Not only is it affordable for a family or business the service was exceptional. Chris the security guy was the coolest! The staff from front desk to maid service were always with the Aloha spirit.There are many complaints about the noise levels in the surrounding areas. If you have never been to the honolulu area it is literally the concrete jungle as the locals call it. Expect street noise, expect the "ladies of the night" to be roaming the streets, yes all the streets not just Kuhio street. Unless you are staying at a hotel facing the beach and are on the 20th plus floor, ANY hotel you stay at will have some noise. My family and I stayed in the 2 bedroom suite, room 502, when my wife and I were in the master bedroom at night we could hear nothing with the door closed to the living area. My 13 yr old daughter slept on the pull out couch and said she only heard the trash truck at 8am... time to get your butt up lazy teenager( lol). Dont expect a view at all and again for those hotels that have a view/partial view/city view, you will pay for it.The location is great. took my family 6 mins to walk to the beach with all the boogie boards and mats (PROVIDED BY THE FRONT DESK). The international marketplace is less than 100 yds from the hotel entrance. Because parking in Honolulu is hard to come by I called ahed to the hotel (about a month early) and reserved my parking for my arrival which they had waiting when we rolled in at 1am.Good job Pearl team! You were all awesome

My family and I have been visiting Waikiki since '97, often 3-4 times per year. This trip included my husband, 70, our son, 17, and me -- I'm nearly 50 and a flight attendant who stays in hotels good and bad all over the world. We have stayed at this hotel under at least three different owners since '97. The Aqua chain has made it into a place we think of as our vacation home. My husband, who adores Waikiki, won't go if there isn't room at the Pearl. We have, at times, stayed at other properties, all more expensive. None compares.Prescilla at the front desk welcomed us warmly and checked us in QUICKLY (important after a long flight), but we saw several familiar faces at the desk during our week-long stay and I like to think that the management is creating an environment where employees want to stay. There were new vending areas and ice machines and the renovation (we stayed in the first fully renovated room two years ago) has made this place into a real gem. The lobby (where the Wifi is free) is VERY comfy with plush sofas and open air, and no one seemed to notice my teen-ager camping out there to play a video game. He plugged in his laptop and put on his headphones and no one minded and I didn't worry at all, it seemed very safe. There is a very nice computer set up in the lobby for checking in for your flights and perusing your email, if I'd known it would be there I wouldn't have dragged my laptop to Hawaii. The management has wisely NOT set it up with a chair, and have put it near the front desk, so that folks (especially kids) aren't tempted to abuse it as I have seen happen at hotels all over the world. There is a Starbucks so close you will begin to think it's part of the property. (Tip: Bring a Starbucks card with you for every member of your family, it makes checking out SO much quicker.)We've never rented a car in Waikiki so I can't talk about parking except to say that it appears there is a small lot off the lobby.We use Reliable Shuttle to and from the Pearl, it is not only reliable but very reasonably priced and they know the address well (415 Nahua is at the corner of Nahua and Kuhio.) The front desk will call them for you when you depart and provide their number so you can arrange transportation for your arrival; just call and ask.We had a small problem with our lanai door when we arrived and Pam, who is in charge of maintenance, came within minutes to get it fixed. She lives on the property and I like knowing that there is always someone there to come and see competently to things, which she definitely did.There is a frig/mike/coffeemaker/icebucket in the room, we used them all and they were all perfectly clean (practically new) and in working order. The frig means we can bring back restaurant leftovers (a lot of places serve positively huge portions, particularly Cheesecake Factory and Duke's Canoe Club); we chill and reheat for a quick lunch the next day, saving us time and trouble (and having to listen to a teen-age boy say, "I'm hungry.") Buy some Kona at the 24-Hour Food Pantry (one block away) and have coffee in your room every morning if you wish with a sliced papaya (packaged in halves at the supermarket and with a fork). Stick a bottle or two of wine or some vodka and juice in your frig.The lanai is nicely sheltered and we were able to sit out and read when it rained once. The A/C is fabulous (operated with a remote) and we had internet in the room (hooked up behind the new TV). One thing we like about the Pearl is the bathroom; it is large, new and there is a full tub with the usual toiletries and a full size hairdryer. We also like the long hall from the door into the room; it's a great place to shake off your sand and stow your beach stuff. The drawer handles in the room and bath are like towel bars, and they're handy!A stack of complementary newspapers is put out every morning on the front desk. We asked for extra towels every day and there were always plenty.Many of the folks I ran into in the lobby seemed to be either repeat guests (like us) or folks from other Hawaiian islands. We saw lots of families with kids younger than our son.This is no lavish spot or honeymoon resort; frankly, I wouldn't go to Waikiki for a honeymoon or some completely blissful getaway. It's not that kind of place, and anyone who's been there knows that. But for what we have come to call a "familymoon" -- a comfy, cheap getaway with all that we need and nothing we don't, plenty of sushine and good food and Aloha -- NOWHERE beats this property. Last but NOT least is its LOCATION. As I've already written, Starbucks and a supermarket with fabulous produce and to-go counters of sushi, pastry, bento boxes, etc., are VERY close. The International Marketplace (with food court) is across the street. A liquor/convenience store is directly across from the front door and a dive shop is next to that. Denny's is catercorner. A pharmacy/photo shop/Chili's/bus stop is around the corner from Starbucks and there's a fancy pastry shop on the other side of the Intl. Marketplace entrance. In other words, everything you need for a low-cost, low-stress family getaway is AT HAND. The folks at the desk will tell you which bus to take to get to the movie theater, mall, etc., and how to arrange tours of Pearl Harbor and other sites.I'm reading over the survey questions and frankly, I don't care that there's no pool, restaurant, room service, business or fitness center. Heck, maybe there IS a business and fitness center. What matters to me?In a five minute walk, you are ON THE SAND and staying at a place you will want to return to again and again.

The room was one of the largest I hve stayed in that was not a suite. Beds were comfortable, furnishings were tastful. Free internet. All the ladies at the front desk were helpful, knowledgable and friendly. Great value too.

My husband and I are in agreement that our visit to waikiki was made pleasurable by the staff at the aqua waikiki pearl. I loved the room it was very modern, roomy, and my husband was very pleased with the flat screen tv. My eldest son enjoyed the free internet on his laptop. It was a luxury to have the ice machine on the same floor as our room. Michael who worked at the front desk was very cool...he help me with all my bags and with gathering my little ones while i checked in and was kind enough to bring extra towels to our room for the kids. We really appreciated that. Another man at the front desk who was very helpful was a man named Harry. I would like to thank Michael for all his assistance in making our stay at the aqua waikiki pearl a great one! My husband and I plan on coming back to this hotel for our next family get away.

My children and I stayed at the Aqua due to our home being fumigated and economically it was the best hotel in our price range having to pay for the fumigation. Upon arriving my 16 year old daughter went straight to the public Apple computer in the lobby and she was quite pleased with that while we waited for our room to be ready. When we entered the room I thought it was very spacious. The 2 bedroom suite was extremely for what we paid. The AC was cold and the room was cozy and comfortable. The manager on duty that we dealt with over the weekend was Michael Singh. He was very accomodating to my 2 young boys who took a huge liking to him. He was GREAT! Another worker at the front desk who was really sweet was Marlena she was great with my daughter and suggesting to her places she would like in Waikiki bc we almost never visit Waikiki. I have recommened the Aqua Waikiki Pearl to many of my close friends who would have never thought this hotel was quite beautiful on the inside with modern decor and an awesome staff!!! Thank you Michael & Marlena.

I definitely would recommend this hotel to my family, friends, and colleagues. location wise it was ideal as it was close to everything. The rates were very reasonable, I was immediately impressed by the hotel staff always so friendly and helpful. the manager on duty during my stay was Mike Singh answered all my questions and was very courteous and welcoming. Overall I had a great stay and I plan on staying there again on my next trip to Oahu. :-)

As the title said, this place is a great value. Staff is great. Close to the beach and anything else you may need. People whine about noise, but that's Waikiki. You want quiet, find a retirement villa in Mexico.Also, we found a pretty great shuttle service. Pay round trip and John at Paradise won't let you down.

went to hawaii for work and brought my wife and daughter.room was extremely clean and beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows.hotel staff was great,everyone at the front desk was on top of any thing we asked about and were very friendly.made our stay very enjoyable.located right across from international marketplace it is right in the middle of everything

We stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for three nights and found it to be excellent. We were lucky enough to be given a newly refurbished three bedroom suite which was massive! Three decent sized bedrooms with two bathrooms, large living area, huge kitchen with up to date appliances and a patio with a good view. The cleanliness and service at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl was of high quality and as far as price is concerned, it was definitely excellent value for money. We look forward to staying there again!!

Location is the reason I chose this hotel. It is not a luxury hotel and so don't expect the interior design too much. Both of my parents are around 70 and they have no problem walking to Waikiki beach and shopping around locally since the distance to every place is not long. We went shopping in the international market near by at night and didn't worry it was so late to go back to the hotel. The room is very clean and spacious. The balcony is big as well. The only thing we dislike is the noise. Since our room is a city review one, we heard bike engine at midnight. However, I think this is part of the city life in Honolulu and nothing the hotel can do to get it away. Since I knew it when I booked the hotel, I would not too disappointed when I was there. If you care about your sleep quality very much, you might consider to stay in a hotel out of the Waikiki area.Anothing thing you might concern is parking. There is no enough space for parking in this hotel. If you check in late, you might need to park your car in the next street where allows Aqua Hotel's visitor to park with a daily rate $18 (Their normal rate is $30). There is no free parking in Waikiki unless you are very patient to find a street parking lot. Since we always go back to the hotel late and all street parking lots are full. We rather to pay to park. No headache.

The hotel were efficient with my online booking. I had a city view room which was huge with one king size bed. Unfortunately the room had a very large window which overlooked the room access walkway, so I had to have the curtain closed the whole time. I could have been is a dark windowless room !The hotel had a free high speed ethernet connection in each room and had a free Apple laptop on a stand in the reception area for those without a laptop.Very good location in the very middle of Kuhio - the main bus route. It is surrounded by shops and restaurants and only a short walk to waikiki beach.The rooms are huge but completely characterless - The rates fluctuated drastically by the day. On a few days, the room rate hit luxury hotel levels and this is definitely only a budget hotel.

stayed in this very affordable hotel and staff are incredibly friendly. the moment i arrived at the hotel i was greeted with a smile and staff are very eager to help with my questions. would totally go back in the same hotel in the future.
I was a guest at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl in December 2009, & had such a pleasant stay I made a return visit exactky one year later. I would stay here again & in fact may do so in 2011.

I am a frequent Traveler to Oahu for business. While in Oahu I only stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for my stay. Here are the reasons for staying there, the price of the rooms are very reasonable, very clean, very comfortable and the location in central in Waikiki with shops and a grocery store around the corner and even a pharmacy as well. Restaurants are at your picking from simple to specialty foods. With all this around you no worries of driving off to other locations for shopping or eating and the beach isn't too far from the hotel as well. You park your car yourself and it is not far to get to the lobby so getting to your room after a long day to relax is easy. For Business there is no other place for me to stay except @ the AQUA WAIKIKI PEARL...Great Job you guys!!!
Staff was great. But street noise intruded all night (5th Flr).Rooms are large. But 2BR unit is only 1BR + an alcove

We stayed in Aqua Waikiki Pearl twice. The first 5 nights we had a room at the 9th floor and the second 4 nights our room was at the sixth floor.Because we were on vacation with our parents, we booked a 2-bedroom suite, both new renovated.The suite on the 9th floor was very spacious with a big bathroom with a tub. The only thing is, that you have to go through an other bedroom to get there, but for us it was no issue.The suite on the 6th floor was smaller and 1 bedroom was separated by a curtain instead of a door, but this was also no issue for us. The bathroom was from 2 sites accessible (bedroom and livingroom).The suites were very clean and everyone behind the reception was very friendly. The service is great! We were very glad that we could use the computer in the lobby and that de receptionist was willing to print our boarding passes.We would certainly recommend this hotel to a friend.

the hotel is situated in the strict city center near the clubs, restaurants and shops and also close to the beach (just a few blocks away). The room is large but a the furniture is quite old. Cable internet is fast and free of charge. Additional 1 PC in the lobby. No breakfest or hotel restaurant. Mircrovave and the fridge is in the room

Usually when visiting Honolulu with my spouse, we book airfare and then use a "last-minute" travel site to snag a sweet deal on a Hilton, Hyatt or Sheraton hotel. This time around, we were travelling with other family members and due to a very convenient direct flight from our local airport, we booked an "air + hotel" package. I was a little concerned about other reviews of the Aqua Waikiki Pearl, but showed up with an open mind. On first inspection, we were quite appalled by our small, dark and dingy third floor room, with a view that resembled a soviet-era tenement block. Undeterred, we spoke with the very polite and helpful lady at the front desk, and for the price of $10 per day, we upgraded to a larger, brighter room on a higher floor, facing the city. The rest of our party did the same thing. IMHO, the negatives at the Waikiki Pearl still outweigh the positives. On the positive side, the hotel is clean, the beds comfortable, in-room internet is free, the carpets and furnishings new. There's a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The bathrooms and amenities are fine. Our air conditioner was very good.On the negative side the hotel is located just off Kuhio, which is Waikiki's "low rent" strip. The traffic noise (complemented by garbage trucks, loud motorbikes and obnoxious drunks hanging out in front of the sports bar downstairs) can be pretty obnoxious. The patio door in our suite didn't close all the way, which didn't help with the noise issue. The rooms are very sparsely furnished. Oh, and there's no pool. The safe in our room was missing it's locking mechanism. Although our 8th floor room was serviced very nicely every day, our family members on the 6th floor received barely any daily room maintenance at all, including unmade beds and no fresh towels four out of seven days. Overall, the Pearl falls short in several areas. Customer service is uneven at best. Amenities and facilities are barely adequate. But as long as you are prepared to overlook these shortfalls, comfort and security are fine, the beach is no more than a brisk five minute walk away, and hopefully the Aqua people are working to improve the areas that are under their control. I can't say that I would stay here again, but it's probably on par with other 2-star establishments along this section of Kuhio St.

We recently arrived back from our trip to Waikiki and I wanted to write a review on here just to say how much we enjoyed our stay at the Pearl. We were travelling with 4 adults (2 parents, and 2 grandparents) and a 20 month old. We booked a 2 bedroom suite, and apparently when the grandparents check in first the room was one of the ones were the second room was separated by a curtain instead of it being 2 actual rooms - and when they mentioned that the staff changed our room for us. We really appreciated the accomodation - the only thing is that there's only 1 washoom and which is located in one of the bedrooms - but if you are an understanding person and flexible it's no problem to allow the people you are staying with to enter in and out of your room at their leisure! (the grandparents stayed in that room and put up with pregnant me going in and out and it was fine).The rooms: nice and spacious! The bathroom is also very very large, and we brought our own sleeping play pen for our little guy and had large pieces of luggage all over our room and it was still great. The living area is also very very spacious which was PERFECT for our little guy - since the grandparents had spoiled him with tons of toys so he had a lot of space to play with them. The kitchen was also very nice and we used it fairly often as we didn't always eat out. The only thing I can suggest to management is to supply cutting boards. Service: like I said before, they accommodated our needs when we requested it. Also, we actually got sick in Hawaii (stupid Luau....) and our little guy was vomitting. We had used a lot of towels, and housekeeping was very understanding and sent up extra towels for us, and changed our sheets and everything by request. Location: this is a pretty subjective thing... but for our needs it was central. right across the international marketplace, 1 block away from all the hustle and bustle, and maybe 4 blocks away from the good part of the beach (where it's barricaded). maybe 3-4 blocks away in the other direction to the higher end of town, where there are a lot of good restaurants. It just depends on what your needs are, but I am 7 months pregnant, and walking is not my cup of tea, so it was great to have the pharmacy and food pantry right at the doorsteps. I've read some of the other reviews, and my impression is that some people just have a higher expectation than what they're looking for. We're from Vancouver and live a comfortable life, and were very happy with our experience at the Pearl. We feel like we got great value (about $1000 for 4 adults for 6 nights). We were not looking for a high end hotel with an awesome view (views are only useful if you plan to stay inside a hotel... but why stay inside if you're in Hawaii??) and amenities. I wanted something reliable, comfortable for family life, and spacious, and if I could find that for good value I was very happy - and we got that at the Pearl! After a couple of nights we really started to feel like it was 'home', and even with 4 of the 5 of us getting a stomach flu we STILL enjoyed our time there, and were very glad that we had a place to call 'home' and rest up in. Will most definitely tell our friends and will stay there again!

I recently stayed in this hotel for five nights. We were not happy. We had been booked into a 'savy saver' room which was a small square box that overlooked a square parking lot. This hotel is quite high and it faced one hotel directly in front of it and two on each side and one square parking lot in the middle. There are no balconies on this side of the hotel. For only $10 more, we were able to 'upgrade' into a nicer, larger room with a balcony, only to find that this side of the street was almost worse. In had garbage trucks in front of it every morning at 7am sharp that were there for at least an hour every day and were very loud. It sat directly outside our hotel EVERY day and emptied all the neighboring garbage bins for all the other hotels and apartments. When that wasn't there, there was usually a delivery truck stocking up the beer/wine/convenience store across the street. It had MANY trucks every day as they all brought different items to the store! I would never stay in this hotel again or recommend it to anyone else. The inside of the hotel was very clean though. There was also a pile of garbage (old computers, shelves, appliances) on the sidewalk that sat outside across the street for us to look at every day. They had a sports pub at the bottom of the hotel that was busy. Twice between 3 - 4am, there were people outside yelling and screaming and the cops were called to clear them up (not by us) on two different nights. The traveller in our room before us also left the hotel and switched to the Aqua Wave which looked so much nicer. I can't belive Westjet would use this hotel for one of their packages. There was also no fitness centre, room service, or pool. The lobby is teeny tiny and is super deceiving in the pictures. Signed, very disapointed!

This is our first time stay at this hotel and for the location and the price, it was perfect! With our 2 teenagers who found very short walks to the beach, restaurants and shops was very convenient. The staff was awesome and very friendly, especially the front desk folks, Prescilla and Harry, who were very accommodating and helpful. Their Housekeeping and security folks were all very friendly and courteous as well. Parking is limited if you're on the waiting list but front desk referred us to their sister hotel a block away for temporary parking for 24 hours. Laundry room was available and very convenient too.I will consider coming back to stay at this hotel for it's perfect central location and awesome friendly staff! Aloha and Mahalo to you all at the Waikiki Pearl!

This is my review of Aqua waikiki pearl. I booked because the price, location, revews are good. I'll have to say though, the pictures online are decieving. We though we were getting a nicely renovated place but it felt like a cheap motel to us. we rented a 2 br suite-- The 2nd br is not enclosed-it's open to the living room. You have to pull a screen to give you some privacy. There's only one bathroom also. So ok, it's my fault for not looking closely before I book.We checked in at night and were givin a room on the 3rd floor. Ok. The first things we do when we check in a hotel is to check for possible signs of bed bugs. The 2 beds were ok but when we pull out the sofa bed, we saw blood stains on the sheets and found 2 LIVE bugs! So that's grossing us out already... walked to the kitchen area and right away saw a small cockroach crawled across the countertop. This all happned 15 min within walking in. So I called front desk and told them about it. She says she'll talk to the manager and call us back. Waited about 30 min and the front desk (not manager) said they can offer us a 1 br?! For 6 people? Needless to say we checked out after that and srambled to find another hotel-with a sleeping baby and luggage!I thought the manager at least should have called us directly and apologize. Even if he's not on duty someone should call and resolve this. I'm not saying NOT to stay at this hotel. I think it's in a good location, across from International marketplace and close to beach. You shouldn't expect much when you are staying there though... and oh, check the beds and couch before you sleep!

I stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl twice in October 2010, both before and after a cruise with extended family on the Pride of America. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki, about halfway between Kuhio Avenue and Ala Wai Blvd. Like most Waikiki hotels that are not directly on the beach, it doesn't have much of a view of anything except surrounding buildings, but if you go out on the balcony and crank your neck you can see the ocean in one direction and the canal and mountains in the other direction. The hotel itself (again, like most Waikiki hotels), is older, but it has been recently renovated. The lobby is quite pleasant, with big couches on which to sit while waiting for a taxi etc., free wi-fi and a computer for internet access. The elevators are newer but very small (ie it was a challenge to fit the 5 of us and our luggage in one elevator). The hallways are outdoors, which can seem strange if you're not used to that. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite since we were 5 adults travelling together. We had asked to be upgraded to a higher floor for $9 per night to avoid some of the Waikiki noise, and we were glad for the upgrade since the streets are indeed quite noisy in the evening, especially on weekends. (We were on the 9th floor for both stays). Our suites (902 before the cruise and 914 after) were both very clean and quite large. Both were very clean and had comfortable beds. 902 had one closed bedroom with a queen bed, plus another bedroom with a queen bed that was separated from the main living area by a thick curtain. The living area had a double sofa bed plus a table and 4 chairs, and a television. There was also a fully equipped kitchenette with a fridge, a microwave and a stovetop as well as dishes, pots and pans, etc. The bathroom was large but had only a shower (no tub). Also it had no fan, which we found a little strange. There was a big balcony with chairs that provided a convenient spot to dry wet swimsuits, towels etc. 914, the suite we had after the cruise, was even larger than 902. It had 2 closed bedrooms with queen beds plus the same type of living area with a double sofa bed, a table and 4 chairs, a fully equipped kitchenette and a large balcony. The bathroom was huge and had both a tub and a shower. The one downside we found to 914 is that the bathroom is located off the master bedroom, so if anyone needs to use the bathroom during the night they need to walk through the master bedroom to do so. (We were only in that suite for 1 night, so we didn't really mind).The Aqua Waikiki Pearl doesn't have a pool or a fitness centre, but with Waikiki beach a short walk away that wasn't a problem for us. There is a sports bar in the hotel but not really a restaurant (and hence no room service), however there is a little Italian place called Mangiamo across the street that serves a good and inexpensive breakfast, plus a Starbucks right on the corner and a Subway less than 5 minutes away on foot. The hotel offers parking for $20 a night on a first come, first served basis, but we didn't use it since it was full when we arrived. They suggest parking at one of their sister hotels (there are a few in the area, at a municipal lot or on the street which is free on Saturday nights and Sundays).On a final note, I have to say that the staff at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl is friendly and amazing (especially Prescilla at the front desk). All questions were answered promptly, with a smile. All requests were taken care of on the spot. The Aqua Waikiki Pearl may not be luxurious, but it's a great value for money in Waikiki and it offers island hospitality at it's best.

Should have stayed at the Aqua Wave Waikiki!!! So many other options. Business center is one desktop in the middle of the lobby in front of the desk with a computer screen that faces everyone. Internet is only in the lobby. Two options for views - overlooking a couple rundown apartment buildings or view of the parking lot and other rooms. One chincy sheet for a "blanket," and the bathroom had all different kinds of hair in the corners of the shower. Prepare yourself to reuse towels. Just keep yourself in the middle of the floor. Dishonest manager...parking was $20 and was told it was free because he gave me the edge spot. It was no joke!! First you drive into the most narrow alleyway ever (push side mirrors in). The spot he gave me was underneath a large tree with dumpsters on one side and a home gas heater in front of me. I had to put the convertible top down and jump out of the car...and I wasn't driving some jelly bean. I can't believe they could charge for this toothpick of a spot. I was given a spot one day of the 3 that I was there. At check out I called downstairs and she said that it cost to park!! I walked downstairs to find that same female employee complaining to the manager about me (my room number). Park at the Island Colony on the corner of seaside for $18!! 2 blocks away! A real parking spot! This area is on the strip of all the clubs and all the promoters so its ridiculously loud and you get heckled or papers are thrown in your face. I woke up to a gun shot one night and the other time drunks were fighting. I had to wear ear plugs just to sleep. Not a good experience!

We stayed in the two bed-room suite in this hotel based on some of the good review online. Reviews mention the hotel room is big, which may be the case for regular room.
