For two bedroom, it is kind misleading because it is actually one tiny bedroom with a queen, and one big room serves both the second bed room(with a queen bed and curtain for privacy) and living area, where the kitchen is. The location is good, although you still need walk a few block to the beach and shopping center. It is pretty noisy in the night - as expected - so we are find with that. Walk to the bus stations, which can take you anywhere in waikiki or honolulu. Overall, this hotel is not a bad deal considering the price you pay and the relative good location. But if you have some extra bucks, stay elsewhere.

The hotel staff were very friendly and were more than willing to accommodate your needs. Parking is very limited and so you ... have to put your name on a list to get a spot. I had to park two streets down, which wasn't a big deal. The location of the hotel is great. It is a 5-10 minute walk to the beach. There are a lot of restaurants around the hotel, offering different types on cuisines. There are also a lot of small convenient stores so you can buy smaller things. There is a mall a few streets down with all your popular name brand stores. THe price was worth the location of the hotel and I would definitely stay here again

The one thing that I like most about staying in Aqua Pearl is that the location! It is so near to the Waikiki Beach, International Marketplace and also the Royal Hawaiian shopping center. The rooms are in good condition, considering the cost. I paid $70 per night for 2 queen size beds. A really good deal since it is located in Waikiki beachside area. Cleanliness is above average. Room comes with flat screen TV, microwave, refrigerator. If you are a budget traveler, staying here is definitely a good choice! You pay to stay in a hotel for a budget hostel price! Book 2 months in advance and get the advance booking option, I think it is about $10 cheaper per night. I stayed 10 nights and it was definitely a very comfortable stay!

I read all of the reviews and looked forward to a budget hotel with 5 star quality service. Unfortunately that is not what I got. Upon my arrival, the ladies at front desk were busy looking at something and too busy to even greet me even though I was literally standing ten inches away from them. Two minutes is a long time to just stand there without anyone acknowledging your presence. After a brief & speedy check in, I was given my keys & up to the room I went. The room is small, it is about what I expected. The room was very warm and realized later that the AC didn't work very well even though I cranked it up & waited an hour. Upon closer inspection I realized that there was so much dust gunked up in the vents that the cold air probably wasn't getting through. Gross. The microwave is a nice touch, but it was covered with crumbs. The maid obviously wiped the outside down, but didn't bother looking inside. I don't know how often they clean the carpets, but my feet were literally black after walking around the room for one hour barefoot. I bought slippers right away.The bathroom seemed clean, but they only give you 2 towels which had seen better days. One of my friends wanted to make some drinks in the room and we called the front desk to see if they had a can opener ( we had to open coconut milk), the lady told us that they didn't have any. We didn't think it was such a weird request, but she seemed to think so. The windows that are suppose to be one way feel creepy and they do not work if your lights are on in the room, so everyone who walks by and all the people in the hotel across from you can see you. We did not experience any of the warm greeting and aloha spirit other reviewers mentioned. Maybe we went when all of the "bad" employees were on duty.I expected it to be clean, not luxurious and people to say hi to you at least, but this was as if I was staying at a motel 6, but Motel 6 has better cable. The area is very good, it is close to a lot of the eateries and shopping, but I think for what I paid I shouldn't have to feel disgusted in the room. Even after the maids supposedly cleaned the rooms, the crumbs in the microwave never left.We were only there for 4 days so we didn't want to repack and move hotels, we weren't in the rooms too much. I have traveled extensively and always on a budget and I expected more based on the reviews.
user_name:
Wandering_Lust00
New York City, New York

review_body: Me and my family had the best time in Hawaii the Aqua waikki pearl work for my family .My wife and i have 4 kids the room we had work becouse it had alot of room and a kitchen. We will be staying there next time we go to Hawaii. The manager Mike and Marlene, Robin and your staff at Aqua Waikiki Pearl made it the best family vacation. Thank you from Kyle Given

This was my first time staying here. A very inexpensive hotel for Waikiki. The room and bed was very clean and tidy. Best of all the manager and staff definately demonstrated the aloha spirit which all of us should have.

A great, conveniently located hotel in Waikiki! Everything is within walking distance and the hotel staff are super friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable. Next time we go to Waikiki, we will definitely stay here again!!

Very good staff to deal with. Clean and good price. Parking IS limited, but assisted us with other places to park when needed. Laundry room available. No pool, but the ocean is within walking distance! No ice machine. Free wi-fi to stay connected. Could use more free movie channels, and a DVD player would be nice. Housekeeping personnel was awesome! Close to all which was nice. Many family restaurants nearby. Tiny Sports Bar downstairs. We have stayed here before, and we definitely will be staying here again.

i live in hawaii and i have stayed at a lot of the hotels in waikiki. From the Halekulani to the ohana west. But my stay at the aqua waikiki pearl hotel has been the best yet. The front desk staff, mike, robin, precilla and harry are the best front desk staff i have encountered. even the staff at the hilton hawaiian village cannot compare to the front desk staff at the pearl. From the day we checked in to the day we checked out they made us feel so welcome and at home. It really was a home away from home. The day we checked out precilla even gave us a good bye gift! Who does that? The staff at the pearl does. The rooms are very comfortable and roomy and althought the hotel has been recently renovated it does have it problems. But then again we paid less that $100 so we didnt expect the hotel to be the sheraton the royal hawaiin hotel. i will surely return to this hotel.
Spent a week at the "Pearl", Rowena and of course " Harry" were special. We tried every day for a week to "Stump" Harry with our questions. Never did.Facility was top notch, service too.

Location - within easy walking to anywhere in Waikiki. Great Kiwi - Aussie freindly bar, located beside entrance. (Thanks for showing Rugby) . For three adults, Aqua has friendly helpful staff. Our night was very comfortable. Would visit again. Bernie & Lyn Auckland. NZ.

This hotel stay is the best stay for me at a boutique hotel yet. The room &bath room is very spacious. Eveything has been up dated and the beddingvery comfortable.My Teenage Grandsons enjoyed sleeping in late because they were comfortable. The Location for almost everything was across the street, around the corner or a block away! Even the bus stopfor many major lines of choice was around the corner. Customer servicewas good and expidicious. What ever we asked for..such as extra pillowsit was delivered in a very short time. The amenities were basic . My grandsons enjoyed the room so much they called it home away from home and did not want to leave no sooner than the hour that is near check out time! For the room size..., it would be nicer if the flat screen TV's were larger.We would like to stay here again if other lodging arangements are not a priority (I would like to say a special thank you to serveral desk clerks,Harry and Percilla ,also our assigned room maid)and the rest of the friendly staff!
We were very impressed with the friendliness of the staff and the clean, spacious room. We'd go there again if the occasion came along.

The Waikiki Pearl is a moderately priced hotel just a short walk from Waikiki Beach. it is close to several eating establishments- from Denny's to a local sandwich shop to a wonderful restaurant right on the beach, Duke's. The Pearl is close to bus routes that take you to Diamond Head or Downtown Honolulu,across from a fun international market, and near many other stores and shops. The accomodations are clean and up to date. There is no pool but who needs one when you are just a couple minutes from a beautiful beach.The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. They helped us with figuring out bus routes to Iolani Palace, Diamond Head, the mall,;guided us to some great eating places, loaned us beach toys for our granddaughter. Our stay here was most enjoyable.

I got a largequiet bedroom for a very good price right in the heart of Waikiki. The hotel room appeared to have fairly new fixtures and fittings due to a recent renovation. The reception staff were exceptionally friendly and the night staff always greeted me by my first name(which is quite hard and difficult to pronounce). When the hotel manager K Lyman heard that my brother had passed away, he allowed me to make phone calls from the hotel at no charge back home - this is exceptional service. Overall, the room service was timely and the reception staff were helpful ( eg hints on sightseeing etc). I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to fellow travellers. Beach towels available for free at reception !!!!

I booked 7 days in a 3 bedroom suite at the Pearl because it had a full kitchen and could accommodate my family (all 7 of us) without having to get 2 separate rooms.Thats what I booked online and paid for, but that is not what I got when I checked into the hotel. The girl at the front desk was on the phone with about 5 people, including me, waiting to check in. When I finally got to the front, she gave me keys to 2 rooms. I told her I only booked 1 room. She said that they did not have the 3 bedroom available so they were giving me 2 rooms instead. I ended up having 2 rooms anyway! I have 4 children, what am I suppose to do? Leave them by themselves in a separate room? Needless to say I was very upset when the front desk girl handed me keys for 2 rooms. I booked this room back in April and called to confirm my reservations TWICE before checking in. Both times I called nothing was said to me about having to split into 2 rooms. Being that they gave me keys to 2 rooms I just assumed that these rooms would be right next to each other. I was wrong...I went back to the front desk and was told that the closest they could get us was on the same floor! Not even adjoining rooms! To top it off neither of the 2 rooms that they gave me had a kitchen! Both rooms had a small refridgerator and a microwave. I understand things happen and I dont usually complain but when I went back down to the front desk the person that was checking in also had their room split! I asked the clerk how many 3 bedrooms they had and she said they had only 1! I asked if it was a regular thing that they split peoples rooms up. "sometimes" was the answer I got. Maybe its just me but I dont think that this is good business. I booked this room specifically because it had kitchen and could accommodate me and my family. I didnt appreciate being notified on the day that I check in, that I wasnt getting the room I paid for. I know it wasnt the clerks fault so I wanted to speak to management, who was not there, so I had to wait until the next day. They gave me 2 free nights but still, it was A VERY DISAPPOINTING stay and in fact we checked out early and just went home. You know, its not everyday I'm able to take my family on little getaways...so when I do, its very important to me. Never again will I stay at an Aqua hotel, They really ruined it for my family and I. I will be writing to Aqua's corporate offices (maybe even the better business) about this and hope it never happens to anyone else and their family.

We chose this hotel because of the great online special they were running, and the impressive pictures on their website. When we arrived, we were disappointed that the hotel seemed old and a little run down, and it was surrounded by other buildings rather than any kind of pretty island view. But the lobby and our rooms did look exactly like the pictures on the website - lovely remodel with comfy beds, nice linens, beautiful bathrooms, in-room fridge & coffee-maker.We had chosen rooms with a lanai, thinking it would be relaxing to sit outside. Unfortunately, there are bars just across the street, and the noise kept us awake all night. The next morning we requested quieter rooms, and the front desk staff was happy to move us. The new rooms (without lanai) were quieter, smaller, and cheaper.All during our stay, we dealt with the frustration of door keys that didn't work properly, really slow elevators, noisy air conditioners (although it WAS cool!), and having to park far away from the hotel. But the staff was ALWAYS super friendly, happy to accomodate every request, and kept us on the reserved parking waiting list until we finally landed a parking spot in their tiny lot behind the hotel. Still have to pay for the parking, but much more convenient than parking a few blocks away!Location is close to several places to eat, shop, etc. and not too far from the beach. Starbucks just a few doors down.Although the staff did their best to make our stay pleasant, we probably won't stay there again because of the noise, parking, and lack of view.

After a long flight we were greeted by Harry at the front desk and he was very welcoming and helpful. Whatever you needed he was the man. We had upgraded to a room with a balcony and found it very roomy and comfortable. Our room #805 was equipped with a microwave, fridge, coffee maker and in room safe. Good coffee was provided also. The bathroom had a shower and tub and was very roomy too. Waikiki is alive at night and so noise from the street can be heard but running the air or tv drowns the noise level. Our housekeeper, Lewelyn was fabulous, especially loved the personal hand written note that she left on our last day. Priscilla at the front desk was very helpful as well. One morning I needed directions to a place and was on google maps writing the directions down, she asked where I was going and printed out the map for me. Additional items that the hotel provided were boogie boards, beach mats and towels. This hotel is centrally located to everything. Getting groceries at the Food Pantry helped out a lot we did not have to eat out every night. Starbucks and Chillis is right next door. Highly recommend paying $20/night for parking at the hotel as parking is painful. Although meter parking after 6 pm and on weekends is free those are hard to come by. If you aren't renting a car you can easily catch the bus as the stop is just around the corner. The beach is only two blocks away, very convenient. The icing on the cake for this hotel would be a pool as there currently is not one. There is no restaurant at this hotel but there is Legends bar. I would definately stay here at this hotel again and have already recommended it to others.

Thank you to Daisy, Priscilla and the nice security guards at night. We enjoyed our room and how clean it was. It was very roomy. Need to ask if you want sheets changed, but Daisy always did what we asked. Right across from Puka dog! Yumm! VERY pet friendly! We had a 2nd floor room so we could hear everything from the street though. Had a personal parking space, but our specific stall was always taken up so we just parked in someone's spot. Didn't know what else to do.

If I would write a review for a hotel, this is my first time providing feedback online. By evaluating the hotel itself, it is not too attractive from outside. It looks good in the picture but once you get in there and see it in person, it does not look the same. However, I would say... yes it not attractive from outside, but the hotel rooms (especially the one we stayed in was NICE). I think every room comes with balcony. I was a bit upset the second day we were there. The cleaning lady did not clean our coffee pot and plus they did not give us a new coffee to make the following day. I left it on the floor due to the lack of wall power plug suckets. When we get back from the hotel, it was still on the floor. I dont have any major concerns other than that.We will definitely go back to this hotel in the future. Puka Dog is right across the street, Int'l Marketplace is 1 block away, you named it.., Very close to everything. :)Mike Singh valued our business as their new clients in their hotel. He was very helpful when I was booking our hotel stay online and followed up with him on the phone. Aloha! Aqua Waikiki Pearl. We hope to see you all again in the near future. P.S...Oh yes! Free Wireless connection guys...that is a PLUSSS A+ :)

I stayed in Aqua waikiki pearl hotel half month in room number 809 . I feel very comfortable and clean. The only thing that didn't work was the refrigerator freezer - wasn't cleaned, too much ice. The front desk workers, Prescilla , Dawn and Robin are very nice and friendly. Also the housekeeper, Lewelyn, always made my room very clean and she did a good job. I feel so happy, I will come back again. Thank you very much everybody !!!!!!!!Sincerely,R. F. L .
user_name:
Miss_Leung
New York City, New York

review_body: My 18 year old sister and I spent 10 days at this hotel. It took a day for a car space to come through at $20 per day but it was worth the convenience as parking in Waikiki is painful. The hotel is very centrally located, if not at the glamour end of town. Our room was on the 5th floor facing Nahua st and it was very spacious. Waikiki never stops so you can always hear a bit of noise but it never kept us up. Although there was no view of the ocean, the natural light in the room was excellent and we spent every evening on the balcony soaking in the balmy evenings and Waikiki buzz. The safe in the room gave peace of mind. Everything was clean and worked well. The staff on the front desk were always friendly and helpful. I would easily stay here again.

The staff was very welcoming, friendly, and helpful. I felt very much at home. The room was clean, neat, and well-equipped (appreciated the hair dryer as I did not check baggage). The free morning newspaper was a nice touch to go along with the in room coffee service.

In this world of impersonal uncaring business dealings, this hotel is a refreshing experience. All the staff are friendly and helpful. We were there for a funeral. We were to meet a friend from another location. The hotel made the effort to give us adjoining rooms. They go out of their way to try and help the guests. One time when I was in the lobby, I saw an Australian couple having trouble with some kind of phone system for international calls and Kalei (manager) gave them a $50 calling card to help them out. The rooms are kept nice and clean and we had a note from one of the housekeepers thanking us for stayng at the hotel. We had a late flight and we were allowed to leave our bags there while we were out and to freshen up before we went to the airport well past our checkout time. This place has the Aloha spirit!

The front desk personnel are very cheerful and helpful. The room is very roomy with 2 queen-size beds, a desk and chair. We moved the round table and one of the chairs from the lanai so we could each have a work surface. Good lighting and comfortable beds. Nice storage area in the bathroom. Nice having a microwave, coffee pot, and frig. When you put out the 'Do Not Disturb' sign, housekeeping does NOT bother you. Very convenient to bus stops and restaurants. Only complaint - the carpet needs to be cleaned. The white soles of my bedroom slippers turned black in three days.

The Pros – We had a two bedroom suite. Both rooms were totally separated from the living room so privacy was nice. The living area and kitchenette was very large. The property is a very nice place for a family on a budget. The bathroom was very large. There were several towel racks so we could hang our towels to dry and reuse them to conserve energy. There was a small window in the bathroom to let fresh air in. There was an in-room safe which came in handy. The room rate included Internet and there were enough outlets to recharge all our electronics, camera, DVD player, cell phone, laptop, kindle, etc. The Cons – You have to go through the master bedroom to get to the only bathroom. The toiletries were very limited. There was only one bar of soap between the sink and tub and a tiny bottle of shampoo but no hairdryer. The hotel is a few blocks from the beach. The parking is very limited. If you’re lucky, you can find parking along the Ala Wai Canal but it’s really by chance as it is very crowded. The front desk staff isn't very friendly. This is surprising as I thought Hawaii was known for hospitality.

Our stay at the "Aqua Waikiki Pearl" was just awesome!!! The front desk staff goes the extra mile to meet your every need and request, to make your stay as heavenly as possible!! I would definitely recommend staying here to anyone. Our entire family would especially like to thank Robin, Precilla and Mike for the WONDERFUL SERVICE!!!! Can't wait to return!!!

will never go stay at this property again!location was a disaster..there was no warning fr the agents...front desk people..not friendly and helpful at all esp. Robin!dirty hotel and poor location...also parking was a problem...so dont ever consider staying at this hotel...it was a mistake and a waste of ur money!!!!!sooo regret booking at this hotel!!!

reasonable price. if it weren't renovated reasonably recently, and therefore is relatively clean, it would be very ordinary. however, the old windows need to be attended to. in our first stay, the window wouldn't close -- had a three-inch gap -- in the second stay, the window had about six cracks across it. they may have done some improvements to the rooms interiors, but they shouldn't stop there. it's a safety issue (not to mention one of noise).

My stay at the Aqua Waikiki was GREAT. When I receive excellent customer service somewhere I am overwhelmed and I'm inclined to share my experience so that others may have the pleasure to experience it one day as well. The Manager, Mike Singh was very kind and attentive to my colleagues needs as well as my own and I had the opportunity to witness him as well in action with other hotel guests whom were very pleased with Mr. Singh as well and that I was taken back by. His staff, Priscilla and Marlena of whom I had the pleasure of interacting with were very helpful and pleasant. They are made up of a great team with a great leader and if for no reason at all this email would be to just praise them in their efforts for making anyone's stay as pleasurable as it was for my colleagues and myself. This email with words of praise could not suffice how commendable the service was at this hotel. Thank you again sincerely to Mike Singh and his staff of the Aqua Waikiki Pearl.

the hotel and staff are excellent, we received a wonderful reception, our room was always made up and the staff always friendly and helpful. the room was a 2 bedroom and it had plenty of room for 2 adults and 4 kids, the room was clean to start and it remained clean the whole time. we always felt safe and welcome.there was only one downside to this hotel, the parking, very limited onsite parking, and you could easily lose your money if you have to park somewhere else, it's a first come first serve basis. so i would recommend don't bring a car, or be prepared to park a fair distance from the hotel. we were there at a busy period so that didn't help us.i will stay there again it was excellent value for money, close to beach and markets, it was a pleasure.

We stayed here from June 25-29. My mom and I stayed in the standard renovated room, while my sister and her family stayed in a huge room with a balcony. The staff was great, and our rooms were always clean. Our housekeeper was Daisy and she made it a point to clean our room and bathroom everyday during our stay. Overall, this hotel is a great find with it's budget friendly price and prime location. Will recommend to others!
overall, we like staying there. because we are returnees, they gave us a reasonable price but wish it was lower or a better kamaaina rate.

Stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for the first week of June and what a fantastic experience. All the staff, Harry, Dawn and a young gorgeous Hawaiian girl were absolutely fantastic, very friendly, down to earth, helpful and genuine.Hotel was fantastic, inside the lobby was spotless, and great with the free internet and free pool tools for lend. The room was well sized for the two of us and spotlessly cleaned everyday. Absolutely amazing hotel would reccommend it to anyone. The whole experience great and the icing on a cake to a great trip. Thank you everyone at Aqua Waikiki Pearl!!Well Done!

We had a speedy and very efficient check in and were allowed into our room at 1000. The room (most basic) was of an average size with everything we needed. It was spotlessly clean and well appointed. The room overlooked the back car park which only became a little noisy in the morning because of all the surrounding buildings - like most places in high rise Waikiki.

the hotel was really great. it was about 3 blocks from the beach and just across the international market place. the staff at front desk was the best. i want to thank harry, dawn, caesar, cilla/ robin for their friendliness and making us feel welcome. we had a kitchen suite and it helped us as we had a big family. we saved a lot of money staying at this location. we plan to stay here again next year....

My wife and I were looking for an inexpensive hotel located close to the shopping, dining, and beach areas. We found it at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. We don't spend alot of time in our hotel room since we like to go 'exploring'. The Pearl is located close to the shopping and tourist area of Waikiki. There were many things to see including the Int'l Market, general shopping, and too many restaurants to list. We did enjoy the Puka Dogs which is right around the corner! The Yard House is great for their happy hour martinis and appetizers.If you are looking for a hotel that is clean, convenient, and at the lower end of the price list, you've found it!

First, I'd like to say I didn't get bed bugs, my room coming and going (went on a cruise in between) was clean and fairly decent.My family and I prepaid at a lower rate for an early booking. Upon arrival we were able to upgrade our rooms, made a big difference I think. The hotel is old, been revamped, and I could tell they are trying to keep it up with the times as best they can.The room was good, better than many I've stayed in from many years of traveling. The front desk staff were good, very friendly and accommodating. The hotel had spa specials with the spa two doors down or another Aqua hotel nearby. My sis and mom had a massage, and my other sisters did a facial. I actually tried to get in for a bikini waxing last minute, didn't work out, but the hotel desk called around and got me a last minute appt at the marriott. Can't ask for more when in need of services, can you?For what I paid, it was worth it. There was a place to eat breakfast across the street each morning, and a Starbucks on the corner. I also stopped at the St. Germain bakery at the end of my run and bought bread and pastries for the family.The two block walk to the beach was convenient to shopping, eating, lounging on the beach. I was also close enough by car to the Hale Koa for my subsidized PX shopping for gifts.The ABC stores are also a godsend, you can throw a rock in any direction to one.and for those of you worried about such things, the front desk had a hand scale to weigh your bags prior to departure for the airport.The street is not quiet at night, we were there during the world cup and there is an Irish pub right outside the lobby door and a CW bar that is always busy and full of people in the hotel around the corner. My last night there I did hear a terrible fight that went on forever, somebody got their butt wihipped for a good while until the police showed up, then it was quiet again until morning.I felt relatively safe, I went out and walked or ran by the canal each day.I miss Hawaii already
user_name:
materielgrrl
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl and was there to take my National Physical Therapist Assistant examination. I did get out to the local eateries, but mainly studied...The staff was great & everytime I needed anything they were always willing to assist, espeically Mr. Harry. He was always there from the moment I checked in, to the moment I checked out. Always laid back & easy going & truly knows the ins/outs of his job.The onlything that I'd have to disagree with is the price you pay for parking, $20 a day. I had a rental car (only used it for 4 days). The parking lot is behind the hotel, not covered with the exception of a HUGE tree & not to forget about the birds. The next morning, I went to my rental car only to find it covered in bird poo & various debrie from the tree that was near by.All in all, I did have a positive experience at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl, just didn't really agree with the parking issue.

Stayed here for 6 nights. Rooms were sparse, clean and spacious. We found it noisy in the evening (bar next door) and garbage pick up trucks in the morning. The elevators were temperamental (sometimes they work, but most times did not). Staff were friendly and helpful. I would not recommend this hotel for couples with young children. To walk back to the hotel at night is very questionable. You had to walk past ladies of the night, as well as bar patrons who were very boisterous. If you are on a budget, then it's ok and if you are not, then I would recommend somewhere else.

This hotel was nice for the money. Good location about an easy 10 minute walk to beach but within all the Waikiki action. The room was one of the more spacious I've stayed in, and I've stayed in over 200 different rooms in the last 5 years. Very clean and comfortable. Nice staff.Only downside was the noise from the street. Even though we were on the 7th floor the outside noise, especially at bar time, was a little excessive. Entertaining though and we even learned a few new words. Parking was $20 per day at Pearl or hotel next door which was just as convient as Pearl.Overall very good value for the money.

My boyfriend and I were on a strict budget when we visited Oahu and the Waikiki Pearl allowed us to keep our budget and have a wonderful stay. We were given a large room, more like a small one bedroom condo. It had a kitchen, full sized fridge and a nice living room. The balcony was nice in the evening, the view is of an interior street and the hotels sits about 4 blocks off the beach. I cannot complain for the price we paid, the hotel was spectacular compared to places I have stayed on the mainland at the same price point. There is a fun little bar right beside the hotel that has a great happy hour special all day and lots of TV's to cater to any sports fan. Everything you need is within walking distance. The only con to the hotel is that the parking area is small so if you do not get there when a space is available you have to search for parking somewhere else. Parking would be a hassle if you have a large vehicle or one that you are worried about being protected. The hotel lobby was sparse but nicely decorated and the bedrooms are quiet. Overall it is a great value.

Stayed there 7 days for vacation. Great location, just 2 blocks from beach, easy to get to, Snooze and cruise package made it easy. Very large room, the lanai was a great place to spend the morning with the complimentary paper and coffee. Maid service was always top notch. The attached bar "Legends" was a nice quiet sports bar that was a homey comfortable atmosphere.

Our stay was wondeful,Harry and Marlena were at the front desk ready to take care of us and answer any local questions we had.  People paying big bucks to stay on the beach stay away. This place was great for someone on a budget. Walking to and from the hotel was a great way to learn the area of Waikiki.  The international market is out the front door and leads straight to thebeach 5 min walk. Convenice store and liquor straight across the street. Next to mangianos Italian restaurant. Cool spot. Mini fridge and micro were great for night caps and leftovers.

This hotel exceeded my expectations for the low price. It was newly refurbished, very clean, large rooms, comfy king size bed and friendly staff. If you don't need a pool or a balcony (not all rooms come with balcony) then I highly recommend in this price range.

We spent one night. We flew from Vegas and were very tired, just wanted a bed in a quite and clean room to have a rest before our trip around hawaii, but we didn't sleep at all the night. Other guest were talking in front of our door until 5 am, traffic noise was coming from the window and we also had to turn off air conditioned as it was terribly noisy as well. The morning after lift didn't work...our room was at the uppest floor.....We had to take down our heavy luggage by ourselves as nobody from the hotel helped us.

We stayed at the Pearl and found it be be a great experience. First the bad news: it is a bit noisy because the activity on the street. We are all sound sleepers, so that didn't matter to us. The location is close to the beach, but not right on the beach. But, we were wiling to walk 5 minutes to get to the beach.Now, the good news: the price is excellent. It's the best value hotel. The rooms were large and clean. The fridge and the coffee pot saved us lots of money. But the very best thing about this place is the staff. I would wager that they are the best staff from any hotel in all of Honolulu, and that's saying a lot. Thank you to Harry, Mike, Prescilla, and especially Robin. You guys are the best!

I wrote a review a few weeks ago and mentioned the name of the person that had ignored my phone calls and faxed letter about the bugs in our room at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. I didn't realize that the review would go directly online. Although the staff was great, the one manager that I dealt with was not. He acted like we were lying and made us feel badly about complaining about bugs in the room. I had even taken pictures of our bug bites. Although at the end, that particular manager didn't charge us for the upgrade to another room (which he shouldn't have anyway), there was no apology, no credit offered, no nothing! In fact, when I stated to him that he should make sure the room was disinfected because a child or baby could stay there and get bites like we did, he ignored me and never even answered me. I'll never stay there again.

Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Aqua Pearl. We got a great rate of 64.00 a night so it was well worth it. I have stayed at the Aqua Beachside before and would choose the pearl since it was 3 blocks away from the beach. You can move around a little more, a lot more shops and places to walk around over there. The room was decent and clean, with a microwave and mini fridge. King bed in the unit we chose, it was comfortable as well. There is a bar right downstairs with cheap drinks compared to the other places in the area, a mini mart right across the street as well. All in all, I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone who goes on a budget.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from 11 March leaving on 15 March. We were in Waikiki for a friend's wedding. The hotel staff were very helpful in recommending for me a hairdresser to make an appointment with prior to arriving in Waikiki which saved me time once I got there. There was a great little photo processing shop around the corner which was great for developing photos from the wedding and giving them to the newlywed couple before they left for their honeymoon (as if a wedding in Hawaii wasn't great enough!) as well as a number of food outlets and souveneir stores. The tour pickups were easy to find at the larger hotels close by and we were able to walk everywhere to the other wedding guests hotels. We did not once need to pay for a taxi anywhere. The rooms were spacious, had a fridge and microwave so we were able to save on buying breakfast we just bought milk, cereal, fruit, tea and soft drinks from the Food Pantry which was so convenient when we had our early morning tour starts. There isn't a swimming pool but when your in Hawaii you would want to swim at the beach anyway. The only downside is the noise outside when your trying to sleep but honestly I was so exhausted from sightseeing every day I was out like a light within 10 minutes of laying down. The staff were also fantastic especially the housekeeping they were so friendly and kept the room clean, neat and tidy for us. This hotel was fantastic value we would recommend it to anyone. It was everything we needed for a whirlwind 4 day trip to Hawaii.
This Hotel is older but clean staff is great not the best location but not the worst had a great time would go back again

Stayed here for 3 days, was able to get into my room a little early which was really helpfull, not sure if that is the norm , but was appreciated. Room was clean, and surprisingly large, really comfortable bed. Balcony was large too.Easy access to Waikiki, one block away, grocery store one block away too. Free Internet use in the lobby was a bonus. Kalei Lyman, the manager was so helpfull, directed me to great restaraunts within walking distance and had some maps for me as well to get around with. For being in the heart of Waikiki I was surprised how quiet the room was with the balcony door closed. I called front desk once for an extra towel and they brought it up almost before I had hung up. Cash machine in the lobby was great too. Added security after 10pm with electronic key swipe I liked. I would recomend this resort to friends as well as family. Price point for what you get (clean large secure rooms, great friendly staff, location) can't beat it. Plus the staff were so welcoming, made me feel so comfortable and relaxed.

We stayed at the pearl for 2 nights and were mis led to thinking it was a solid 3 star venue. Granted it was clean but if you have any standards avoid this place. We came from the Marriott Courtyard and should have stayed there. The location is poor even though its a short walk to the beach I thinks its the worst street in town. There is no service so I hope you dont have to many bags because its not easy lugging your stuff around. In fairness I got what I paid for but the on line deal was promoting DOWN from $229 per night to $86. If you are a backpacker you wont care bu if you have some style go anywhere else. By the way its noisy and dont worry about an alarm because the garbage trucks start at 4 am. Humpa from Sydney Australia

The rooms are old but remodeled to a reasonably new standard. The hotel is located close to the beach. It is on a very busy one way street that is the main traveling street for fire trucks, ambulance, beer trucks and a whole host of others.IE. it is very noisy. Having said that, I grew up in a city where traffic never stops and is always noisy so it was just a matter of getting used to it. It took a couple of days. It is a half block away from a main bus route which I might add, is probably the best bus service on the entire planet. It is $2.25 each way but they give you a very long transfer time which allows to tour the island for the original fare. We were there for the tsunami emergency and I might say that the staff at the hotel were very nice, helpful and organized when it came to getting us out of what could of been an incredible disaster. We were all instructed to travel to the eighth floor, to the hospitality room, where we met and talked to a wonderful group of people from different parts of the world. The cleaning staff were great and accommodating, making our bed with military precision that you could bounce a quarter off of keeping the beach sand that we brought home to a minimum and all around friendly. Overall, I rated the hotel a three. Inexpensive, tidy, close to all amenities, helpful staff, noisy, close to Starbucks, the international market place etc. with the best, friendliest staffed, bus system on the planet. I would and have recommended this hotel to others.(It is not Trump Plaza so some of you should lower your expectations)

This was a very nice hotel at a great value. It is a newly renevated hotel in 2009. The rooms were clean and neat. We traveled with a group so we had reserved several rooms. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It is in a great location within a short walking distance from the beach, the International Market Place is right across the street, and several place to eat are also within a short walking distance. We would definitely stay here again.

We stayed in Pearl for just 2 nights in 1 brm suite with kitchen, lanai on 8 floor.Everything was very good, except for air conditioner in the bedroom - it was old and so loud that we actually had to turn it off in order to get some sleep. The air conditioner in the living room was much better.Other than that - the location is great, close to everything.

I have the privilege of staying at this hotel to during my first stay in hawaii. I have to admit that the parking, would need to be worked on. The staff made me feel as though I was right at home. Out of all the staff that was there, there was one that stood out the most.Marlena helped me out by point out points of interest as to where to have a good time. She along with the rest of the staff made me feel very welcomed. I want to thank Marlena and the rest of the staff at the Aqua Wikiki Pearl and made me feel special from beginning to end.Mahalo and I will be returning.Anthony

We've been to and thru Honolulu many times and stayed at many hotels, but this was our best experience yet. We checked in early as we were just on layover .  I actually called the front desk and asked if they had made a mistake with our room as it seemed too good for the price.Mike and the staff were very accommodating without being suffocating.Large room, free internet. We will return.

Exceptional Hospitality and ProfessionalismFour of my good friends and I occupied their spacious 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom Suite, which included a kitchenette, livingroom, small dining area and a nice balcony.We were very impressed with the entire staff. Harry and Mike were very accommodating. Three of our friends had return flights early in the day. My other friend and myself had a later afternoon flight.Mike and Harry were kind enough to allow us to have an extended late check-out at 3.We were so thankful that they were able to do this for us.My friend's and I are planning our next annual Hawaiian vacation for this fall again and will surely make the Aqua Pearl our Honolulu accommodations.Jeff C., Redondo Beach , CA
I had the worst room I ever had in waikiki.A tiny, very basic room without even a table or chair.A tiny little window and that's it.I could hear every noise next door.In a word Yuk

My parents come to Hawaii to visit me while I go to college. They have stayed in this hotel every time, since our first time to Hawaii. Mike, Harry, and Prescilla are very accomidating to any request that we have. It's not on the beach but it's very close to it and because it's a block away you eliminate the hustle and bustle of downtown Waikiki. There is also many places to eat and shop within close walking distance. If you need to catch a bus, the bus stop is across the street and the buses take you virtually anywhere you want to go. The rooms are perfect for a stay in Honolulu at very reasonable places. If your looking for good service, clean nice rooms, all at a good price stay here and you won't be disappointed.

I found this hotel to be very comfortable for the money. Overall the rooms were in very good shape and the hotel its self was in very good shape. Being located in the centre of Waikiki you could walk to just about everything; restaurants,the beach, transportation. The only thing that maybe a problem is the construction at the Hotel to its northeast and the noise associated with it.

Front desk staff most congenial. Make sure you upgrade to a "city view" room. It's large and has a lanai. The standard room is taken up by the beds. Not much additional space. No lanai. Don't do it. No pool is a major drawback and parking is sparse and too expensive. Anyway..if you are on a tight budget this is the place.

I hadn't read that parking was an extra 20 dollars a night, so that disappointment was my own fault. They told us to park next door in another hotel's underground parking, so naturally i assumed i was paying something extra, and eagerly checked in on parking in their lot, which was in the back of the hotel in a dodgey lot, and assumedly free. They had us on a wait list, and we didn't hear from them concerning it for three days. Then when i asked they checked again on a clip board and said they did have parking, and they had tried to call us (nope) but didn't have our name written down correctly, quickly referenced an empty slot on a paper, then wrote our last name. Our car was then in the parking lot, in a dark spot under a tree, where it could be spotted with bird poo. Whatever. But the desk attendant was rude after i called him on over charging me a night.The room was fine, there was no coffee or coffee maker, and it was so noisy in the early morning that we just dealt with getting up at 6am. It must take the city 3 hours to pick up all the hotel's garbage each day, which is surprising because there isn't any way to seperate your recycleables, so you'd think it'd be one big pile. The amount of paper and plastic we had no choice but to throw out was disgusting.The elevators are remarkably slow and the buttons rarely light up. The staff were just sort of there...sometimes. Cleaning people were friendly, though we kept the 'do not disturb' sign on our door for our whole stay, so i can't speak to their cleaning talents. The location was great(ish). The view from our 7th floor balcony was kind of depressing. Into other hotels and into what appeared to be half empty slums, and the repulsive canal down the street. But quick walk to the beach, and the starbucks on the corner and the veggie star restaurant next door were wonderful. That's about it. Everything else was sort of a disappointment.

My son and daughter-in-law gave my husband and me a six-night and seven-day all-expense-paid vacation to Hawaii for our 24th wedding anniversary (October 26th). The room we originally had was too small for us and it had no view. We wanted a room with the city view since we were going to be there for a week and we were willing to sacrifice spending money to be totally comfortable. I called the hotel about two weeks before our departure date and spoke with the manager, Kalei Lyman and asked if we could upgrade our room. He checked the computer for availability and said yes. However, because it was our 24th wedding anniversary, he waived the upgrade fee. We were so touched by Mr. Lyman generosity because even though all we had to have for our vacation was spending money, we struggled with even that because we are putting a daughter through college. Mr. Lyman didn't know that. Not having to pay the additional fee made - what we consider - a signicant difference in the amount of spending money we had. Mr. Lyman was a true blessing to us and we want to pause today to say, "Thank you" for having him as a manager. He represented the company well. We would definitely stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl again when we visit Hawaii; even if we have to pay full price.There's no way we could repay him for his generosity at a time when it counted most. Therefore, we've asked God to.If you need to contact us, here is our contact information:Hezekiah and Tammy Deligar[--][--]

We stayed for a total of four nights on our way to and from the Sheraton Maui. The property is very old with a dated layout / design, but has recently been renovated. The rooms were very clean and modern with a new bathroom, fridge, microwave and small flat screen TV with cable channels. Due to the old design / layout there is quite a lot of noise when the people from the adjoining 2 rooms enter / exit their doors. I was scared several times at night because it sounds as if someone is trying to enter your room, but it is just the noise from your neighbours door.The location is excellent for the price. There is NO swimming pool, but it is only about a ten minutes walk to the beach. There are many dining choices in the immediate vicinity.The night markets and shops are only a short walk away. We received a compilmentary Honolulu paper at the door each morning.To reach our room we had to walk from the lift along an exterior corridor with a sheer drop on the side facing the courtyard which I did not like doing with our young son. It would be difficult to relax here with children due to the corridor balconys.If all you need is a clean, modern room to sleep in, I would not hesitate to book if you can get a good price.

I booked for 3 nights for our family of 2A/4C and could luckily cancel last night & move on for our last 4! We had a 3 Bdrm suite... It was really spacious & yes it had obviously been done up a little but I wouldnt say it was spotless & it still had an old unclean feel about it - i.e old furniture..... The windows were filthy and our bedroom had what looked like a bullet hole through it!! Window of Ensuite off one of other bedrooms was broken and all taped up with 'Caution Tape' across it! This kind of thing should be repaired before allowing guests to stay!! Ranchslider in Lounge had obviously had children recently stayi who had obviously had fun sticking Christmas Stickers all over window....these should have been removed!We moved to the Outrigger Reef on the Beach which was Gorgeous, had partial ocean views and cost not too much more.Staff at reception were pleasant and helpful.

We stayed at this hotel for 1 night and we were surprised how nice the room was for that price! It was nicely decorated and had everything we've needed. There is no view (you cannot leave the shades open as anybody who walks the floor will see you) but it doesn't really matter as you are only in the room at night. The location of the hotel is really good. It's located in waikiki and it only takes minutes to get to all the shops, restaurants and so on. 1minute away there is also a starbucks.

I would highly recommend the Aqua Waikiki Pearl as a place to stay for a traveller on a mid-level budget. The place is clean, the rooms are cozy, the location is more than adequate and the service is exceptional. I stayed in a standard room with lanai on the 9th floor facing towards Nahua Street. My room, the elevators and the hotel common areas were always clean throughout the duration of my 11 night stay. From the lanai was a great view of the city to the west, a peak at the ocean to the south and a nice view of a waterway & golf course to the north. The extra charge for an upper floor lanai is worth it! The beach is only a few blocks walk to the south and there are numerous nice local and/or chain restaurants, and a convenience store, just outside.The only drawback of the hotel is the sound of garbage trucks each morning between 6 - 6am. My room was more than peaceful and quiet for 23 hours out of each day, but for some reason the sound of the big trucks in the morning seemed unavoidable...even on the 9th floor. I didn't have too much problem with that because I wanted to be awake early anyway. However, I would probably try to obtain a fan to drown out the noise the next time.Overall, the charm of the hotel was the friendliness, courteousness and respectful of the staff. Everyone I came in contact with, from the front-desk staff to the cleaning/maintenance staff, were professional and accomodating. The consistent, friendly and timely service helped to make my stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl carefree. Mahalo to the staff!

We had a group of six adults. I had made the reservations and of course was nervous about the hotel. I definately have to say that it was what I expected. The reviews were pretty truthful. We had a 2 bedroom suite and another single room. The 2 bedroom suite wasn't really 2 bedrooms. The 2nd bedroom was an extension of the living room with a curtain you could pull across, which worked for us. The hotel was located just a short walk to the beach. Close to reataurants and shopping. We were only staying for 2 days before getting on a 7 day cruise and for 2 days on our return before flying back home. If the vacaation had been on the island we would have not chosen this hotel. We would have liked a pool also. The hotel was definately clean and would reccommend it for anyone that is traveling through like we were. The staff were wonderful especially a customer service rep named Harry. He was very friendly and helpful. Certainly went out of his way to treat everyone great.

We stayed in 3 different hotels in honolulu on our trip but this was the best. Cute breezy lobby with super comfortable couches. Pretty nice staff (besides one creepy guy). The rooms included nice artwork, extra pillows, spacious bathroom, flat screen tv, etc. It was very relaxing. Good location near lots of shops & restaurants. About a 4 block walk to the beach. It was very quiet besides some rude boys next door to us who kept slamming the door. Overall I would highly recommend it!

Walking distance to the main strip, International Market place, Waikiki Beach. Our room was spacious and clean with a lovely big verandah. The rest of our group were not so lucky as they found their rooms a bit dirty and smelly. The hotel looks as though it has been recently refurbed and will be even better than when I stayed. Don't expect anything too flash but this was a great budget place in a bustling location.

My travelling companion and I stayed here for 4 nights and there is nothing to complain about. We got an ultra chap rate and were very happy at the end of our stay. The hotel has been recently renovated, the rooms are quite large (we had two doubles), air-conditioned and clean. There is free wi-fi in the lobby and the hotel staff were unbelievably helpful. We were on the 7th floor I think and didn't have any problems with noise as mentioned in other posts.Only downside is that it is a few blocks off the main waikiki strip, but you should know this already if you do any research before you book.

This is an older hotel with updated amentities. Very friendly staff and the rooms are clean. The best of all is that it is centrally located and only steps from the beach, shops & where the actions are. This is an excellent choice if you are looking for good hotel with all the necessities and without all the luxuries that you don't need or use.

I chose this hotel because it seemed to be one of the few that offered space for our family of 4. The last vacation we took we were crammed into a 10x12 foot room and we were miserable, so this hotel offered a 2 bedroom with full kitchen and almost 1000 square feet. So, space we did get, but not much else. We really only had 1 bedroom and the other bedroom was a bed behind a curtain. We had 1 T.V. The full kitchen was a joke. We had a mini coffee maker, 2 burners, a small fridge and a microwave. Dishes-only a few-flatware-only a few. Pans-just the bare minimum of everything. Good thing we did not really cook. It would have been grossly inadequate for that. Oh-it did come with roaches-babies-lots of them. When we checked in we had a a full garbage can in the kitchen of someone elses garbage and 1 bath towel for 4 people. We had to ask for everything. Nothing was provided without effort on our part. We were told we had complimentary coffee provided every day and as much as we wanted. Well, it depends on who you ask. The maid does not provide it so we would have to ask down at the desk and by day 3 we were told that we get 1 packet for free and that is it. Now, we were 4 people with a mini coffee maker, so we needed 2 packets of coffee to give each person in our party a cup of coffee in the morning. We all had to share one bathroom, but we managed with that. Upon our arrival, we could not get into the buiding because they lock the entry door at 10pm. We read about that ahead of time online and called them to inquire about this and they assured us that the door will be open for us even at the late hour of our arrival. Well, it wasn't, so we had to follow someone in who had a key. We asked for a room on a high floor since we had read online that the garbage trucks wake people up because thay are so noisy. The check in went smoothly. As for the maid service-well sometimes we had it and sometimes we didn't. They work on "island time." In other words, whenever they get there and when they get there they only make the beds. We asked at the desk and left a note and a tip for the maid to clean our floors and vacuum as they were not clean upon our arrival. Well, the tip was gone but the same trash, leftovers, dirt and toe nail clippings were still on the floor. We were instructed to place our used towels on the floor so the maid would know which ones were used, but when we left to go out for the day and we returned, the maid had not come yet and now all our towels were on the dirty floor and not able to be used, so again we would go down to the desk to get new ones. They are definitely used to this because they seem to keep extra of everything at the desk and will accommodate you for any request. But to have to ask for everything is a lot of expended effort while on vacation. Oh-as for the garbage trucks, oh yes, they woke us up every morning except Christmas and Sunday between 6am and 7am, even though we on the 9th floor, we could hear them perfectly. We eventually began sleeping with ear plugs!! The building is old and according to my inspector husband-displays a lot of construction errors! So, what good can I say-Well, the room had about 1000 square feet give or take and the hotel was near a lot of things. The beach was a 2 block walk, but we knew that before we came. No one knew the hotel by name because it has changed name so many times-including our cab driver from the airport-so I gave him the address. They were nice enough to print our boarding passes for us at the desk although not without sarcasm and negative inferences regarding mine and my daughters intelligence. The hotel had a bar but nothing else. We had no car so we did not have the parking issue. We managed well with "the bus," as it was cheap and easy to use. I bought a package hotel and airfare combo but I would not do that again as I shudder to think of how much I really paid for this hotel. I would definitely stay at a well known hotel next time and have more ammenities available like pool, restaurants, hot tub, service, etc. This was definitely a "no frills" hotel, but not at a "no frills" price!

We booked this hotel last minute because our trip to Madrid was very disappointingly canceled. My fiance used to live in Honolulu, and we love the islands, so travel here often.The Aqua Waikiki Pearl has been renovated, but they really need to work on the outside as well. It can use some plants and/or flowers outside (maybe benches). We had the standard room with 2 beds. It was ok, however, because it did not face the street, we never had our curtains open. Although the room has a one way window, it felt really uncomfortable having people constantly walking by.One of the big negatives with the hotel is the noise!! The cleaning staff talk very loudly and doors are constantly slamming from the employee rooms and guest rooms. Sounds are magnified because of the echoes that carry throughout the hotel.In terms of location, yes, it is right by Waikiki, but this is NOT the safest location. Prostitutes walk right outside (on Kuhio Ave.) and Legends is a "burly" bar right downstairs (not the coolest place to hang out).We are not big fans of Waikiki and usually stay in Kailua in a rental or in the North Shore, but because this was last minute we decided to book it.Would we stay here again? No.Overall, this is just a place to sleep.

OUr stay was made very comfortable by the staff. Mike and Harry went out off their way to make our vacation a great one Ederlina kept our room very clean. The location is good. for the price we paid we felt we got a good deal
Hotel staff very very good. Excellent always helpful morning or late at night.Harry, Dawn and Cesare (security) all very friendly. Most impressed.Standard of hotel excellent with a brillant location.

I was a guest at the Aqua Pearl from November 24 to December 8. I had an inside standard room, which was 100% satisfactory. There was no balcony, but I spent the day at the beach, & the benefit of an inside room is that there is no street noise. The location was excellent, the room was clean & newly refurbished. I would stay there again.

Upgrade to a bigger room if you can, it's worth having the extra space. Hotel is in a good location within walking distance to all the beaches and shops from Ala Moana to Honolulu Zoo. It is across the road from International Markets; Starbucks, Food Pantry and 2 ABC stores are in the immediate vicinity. The room has basic amenities but the ones that count: microwave, decent sized bar fridge, wide kitchen bench and space for all your food/drinks, LCD TV, free high speed internet, desk to sit at and air conditioning. It's clean and house keeping are prompt if they notice you haven't put the "Do not disturb" card in the card slot. Reception staff are friendly and helpful. Only cons are it gets noisy at night especially on the weekend because it is close to a couple of clubs and you might see some ladies walking the streets which didn't help the night before the marathon.

As a college student living in Hawaii I choose to stay here because my brother & his fiance were going to be visiting me,plus I had received a really great offer for the aqua hotels. I'm 21 & I have to say I really liked this place. The house keeping ladies were so extremely nice & always gave 100% when cleaning my room.I had a room with a balcony/2 beds. I would recommend paying the extra $$ for the balcony/city view because it's so worth it,I loved having the sliding door open while I was in the room because theres always a nice breeze. Nightlife is great in Waikiki especially if you're young. It did get a little noisy at night & early morning but it's not as bad as other people said. I didn't have any pest/bug problems either. Mike that worked the front desk was super nice as well as the other guy that worked there & one of the girls(the one with the colored eyes) she was so sweet. I liked the location because the International market place was like a 5 min walk( local food in the food court there,I recommend eating local food while visiting because you'll save money & get the try new things!) Also here was food pantry to pick up groceries & other things like 5 mins away. Big Kahuna's is within walking distance & is nice to eat & grab drinks. The beach is like 10 mins walking & super easy to get to. Waikiki is pretty nice but expensive to non-locals so I recommend getting out of Waikiki during the day & exploring what the rest of the island of Oahu has to offer(beaches,hanauma bay,Kualoa Ranch,pearl harbor to name a few things) The hotel has brochure's in the lobby so check them all out, trust me as a local it was worth getting to play tourist for a week with my brother! If you can avoid going to the bar that's next to the hotel do it! it isn't worth it & doesn't show any Hawaii hospitality whatsoever. It's more for annoying drunk old people who don't know how to really enjoy their time in Hawaii not to mention the male bar tender was an (--). Other than that the Aqua Pearl was pretty nice,try booking through expedia though. You'll save money trust me! A few more things I forgot to mention... parking is $20 a day with the hotel or you can park at the Waikiki trade center which is less than a 10 min walk. $7 for a whole day starting at 5am till I believe 11 pm.

Thanks for a great stay. We loved the size of the room and the deck, and it had everything we asked for: fridge, micro, tub, air conditioning. The front counter staff was especially friendly, especially Harry who had such a cheery, helpful manner! We look forward to coming back!

I checked into this hotel on the 9th of December and plan to be here until my departure day on the 23rd. So far, it is everything I had expected based on their website. It is a little noisy at night but if you use ear plugs, you don't hear a thing. The room is large and in an excellent location. Only 1.5 blocks to the beach. At this point, I have no other issues with this hotel and I would recommend it to friends, which I have already done since they stayed here before I got here. Aloha!

I stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl on Nahua in Waikiki Beach 12/1 - 12/9 2009. The room was absolutely comfortable and everything was in good working order. There are others closer to the beach, but at 3 times the cost. The staff was superb and very polite. My room (2-bedroom) was nicely air conditioned with lots of space. Might be a little noisy at night due to the night life in Waikiki. The refuse collection occurs between 5 am and 6 am on the street and the dumpsters make some noise, but at no control or fault of the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. Stay here and enjoy everything that the local area has to offer.

Ended up at the Auqa Pearl due to a mix up with other accomodations. Staff was very helpful (Priscilla and Harry are terrific) and the rooms clean and modern. Bed was firm and comfy, kitchen and bath clean and well stocked. Only minor issue was the on-site parking which was very limited, cost $20 per night, and the spot are very narrow. Other than that, had a great experience, all the staff were helpful and smiling which made the stay even nicer.

My family, wife and two kids 10 & 6, stayed at the Aqua Pearl for two nights on the tail end of a week in Oahu. We were looking for a hotel that was a decent value. We were not looking for 5 star quality or service, just a clean room that we could use. If you are expecting anything other than a 2 star, you need to pay more and look elsewhere. If you are looking for a clean hotel at one of the cheapest prices in Honolulu, you might want to consider it. The good: The hotel is exactly what I expected and actually a little more. The room was a double queen on the 6th floor. The bedding was pretty comfortable, carpet new, bathrooms "remodeled." Once again, nothing fancy, but clean and adequate. The pleasant surprise was the size of the rooms. They had plenty of room for the family. A coffee pot (no coffee provided) and a mini fridge might come in handy for drinks or snacks. The hotel is located on the north entrance of the International market. A quick walk through the market (about 1 block) puts you in the heart of one of the upper ends of Honolulu and another 2 blocks over on the primary point of Wikiki Beach (near "Duke's" statue and surf board rentals). This location was prime for this area during the day.The bad. What a difference a few blocks make. The first night we were woken up about 5:00am by a drunk man banging on a down spout, yelling and singing. The second night we were woken up at 3:30am by the yelling of a crowd and someone saying "drop your weapon." Don't worry, sirens soon followed and by 3:45 I'm guessing things were better. My wife and I listened to a rain forest app to drown out the noise and luckily the kids slept through it all. Also, while we were out on the balcony trying to see what was going on we saw what appeared to be a drug exchange in front of the hotel. In all fairness, these negatives had little to do with the hotel itself (with the exception of the sliding door blocking out very little noise, including the 5:30 garbage truck that others mentioned). There are a couple of much pricier hotels that would have had to put up with the same distractions. Next time we will either stay at one of the hotels on the beach (just a couple blocks away) or a little further away all together. In summary, a economical, clean, remodeled, bare bones hotel. It is a good value, but have realistic expectations going in.

I booked the hotel because of the great reviews... it had been newly renovated and it shows. For a budget hotel... Aqua Pearl had it all! I booked thru orbitz with a package including the hotel. It is across the street from the international market, steps from starbucks, 2 blocks from the beach and really nicely located. I upgraded a room on orbitz, one queen and one full sized bed. Nice bathroom and balcony facing the street. Not much to look at but other hotels... however at night, the building lights gave a nice glow. The balcony didn't face a huge hotel right in front so that's also a pro. 300-350 sq ft. Had a mini frig, microwave, free safe and FREE in room internet (ethernet)! Other hotels would charge like 10 bucks a day! Downside... I booked the hotel for 5 nights and left after the 1st night. As the title says.. there were cockroaches. The first night... I noticed lil ants on the desk as I was researching Waikiki for tours. I killed at least 5. The next morning everything was fine up until 11am I found a cockroach about 1 1/2 inch long in the bathroom. As I went to phone front desk about the encounter, I noticed a cockroach on my laptop (which was placed on the desk where I had killed 5 ants the night before). As I investigated... I noticed 1 more ant on the desk... however this time it had a clear white bottom half. Baby cockroaches! Front desk sent maintenance, he was there promptly. He checked it out, left and came back with a spray can and thoroughly sprayed the infected areas. I was given the opp. to take a room on the 2nd floor (the only other room opened), however because of the size and 8th floor location I decided that if the spray didn't work I would move. Based on other reviews... Im a heavy sleeper but the noise at night and the dump truck in the morning were a bit much. So, I remained in the room to make sure the lil bugs didn't come back and I waited for the housekeeping to stop by and vacuum the room. 2 hours later as I was working on my laptop on the bed... something caught my attention out of the corner of my eye.... ANOTHER 1 1/2 inch cockroach on the headboard of the bed! I really liked the location and the hotel but that was it! I have never felt more disgusted in my life! The maintenance guy said it could be that cockroaches laid eggs in the new furniture before they received it, so I thought it was only the desk. Boy was I wrong!I threw everything (literally) into my luggage and bolted out of there. I called the lobby as I was packing and front desk said they were booked out. I waited in the lobby 30 min before the said they could move me to the 2nd floor. Forget it. I was over Aqua Pearl! I rather stay in a older hotel without pest problems than stay there and chance it. I was in the lobby of Aqua Pearl around 1:30. The hotel had me call my agent and go thru the whole loop of refunds and this and that. In the end the hotel wanted to charge me for 2 nights cuz chk out was at 12. I had to demand that they refund me that night as well before I got results. Would I stay a the Aqua Pearl again? Probably not. There are many other great hotels. BTW I booked a room at the Royal Garden. away from the noise but still walking distance of all things. The room is on the 12th floor with balcony.. great view of the canal and mountains! I have a frig 2x the mini frig at Aqua Pearl, microwave, stove with oven, conditioner, great view and NO roaches! Stayed here before and no complaints... I'm sure I wont this time either!

We loved this place so much that we stayed 1 week, hopped over to the Big Island and then booked another 4 days here on the return. The price is unbeatable for Waikiki. We paid £38 per night for a family room through Expedia.The staff were excellent. Especially Mike on the front desk who allowed us to check in 5 hrs early after a long flight with young children. The room service was spot on, the location is perfect and everything you need is around you. The on site laundry room is a bargain and the free beach towel loan is fab. The rooms were clean and well stocked daily.We can't really fault the place and will definitely use it again if we are lucky enough to return to Waikiki. It definitely surpassed our expectations for the price.

Thank you to the wonderful staff for our excellent stay the first week of November 2009! I agree with the many wonderful comments other reviewers have already posted about the fine folks that work here and can only say "Bravo!"The location is *very* convenient as it's a half block to Kuhio and the International Market Place. Only a few minutes from the main beach at Waikiki and very close to many, many food options (grocery stores and restaurants are numerous here in the heart of Waikiki).I do, however, recommend a room with a patio/lanai as the wonderful trade winds are great to have in the room. I live in a downtown neighbourhood, so I actually liked the street sounds outside.All in all, I would definitely stay here again... Mahalo to the wonderful folks that work here!

The room was large as was the lanai, with a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The only thing they could have done that would have been nice was to have coffee filters esp. for the first morning, but there is a grocery store one block up. The International Marketplace is across the street. We were on the 9th floor. The staff was friendly. When we did not have a safe in the room we were given another room right away. They allowed us a late check-out. We stayed for 5 nights, and made Royal Hawaiian beach "our" beach every morning. Certainly would recommend this hotel. All the busses you need ahve stops less then a block away.

My husband and I and our friends stayed at Aqua Waikiki Pearl for a week at the end of October 2009. It is a great affordable hotel, five-minute walk from the beach. It has been recently remodeled and everything is very very clean. The stuff is super nice. Our flight back to the mainland was delayed and they let us keep the room till 6 pm at no additional charge.

I found the hotel an ideal location, handy to the beach and International market and on the bus route. The staff were very helpful. You need to take your own tea or coffee as they do not have it in the room but Starbucks was very close - 30 seconds away. It is also reasonably priced so if you are just going to use it to sleep in it is great.

Special thanks to Marlena, Cesar, Chauncey, Mike, Harry and Bruce for making my stay at the Waikiki Pearl enjoyable. This hotel is one of the better priced hotels in Waikiki and is perfectly located. My room was always cleaned early and if I had any problems they were taken care of promptly. Hope to stay here next year if I come to Waikiki.

After moving from a horrible stay at the Aqua Wave I moved across the road and 50m down a side street to the Aqua Pearl. The Aqua Group have brought a lot of the older Hotels in Waikiki and renovated them, this is one of their better efforts. Formally the Honolulu Prince Hotel the newly renovated Pearl has been renovated correctly. Please note, this hotel does NOT have a Pool. The renovations are simple and it has a very modern, clean feel which extends into each of the rooms. I opted for the end room (higher numbers, I think my room was 917, 9th floor at the quiet end of the building) and it was quiet. I really liked the matting style carpet and unlike many renovations, the Pearl had new bathrooms. My room was spacious and clean, there was a big closest, the safe didn't work but there was enough hanging and storage space for two people. The bed was big and comfortable, there is a flat screen TV with cable and free wifi.I got what I thought was a good deal from a Trip Advisor partner, $65 a night plus tax (17%). This is a very good deal for this Hotel. I don't think it is worth more than $85 a night even in the high season (November 2009). The location is great, while being near the noisy clubs, it is far enough away so you don't get bothered by it. The staff were way better at this Aqua Hotel, especially Harry. Harry worked the front desk and would always go out of his way to make sure he could accommodate my requests, airport transfers, quarters for the laundry, directions to places etc. There are plenty of good value restaurants nearby and there is a 24 hour store minutes away.This is a budget Hotel but it is very well setup and managed, and if you can get it for a good price i.e. under $80 a night then you'll get really good value.

I recently spent several nights at this hotel in a standard king room. Here's the low-down on the room: it was spacious but very bare bones. There was very little furniture (literally, a bed, a desk, and a lamp) and they didn't fill all the empty space. The bathroom was also very spacious and the shower had good water pressure. The hotel provides shampoo but no conditioner. The hotel did have free high-speed Internet (a huge plus for Oahu!). The small hotel parking lot was full so I parked with Ohana next door ($20/day, cash only). The location of the hotel is fantastic if you like the hustle and bustle of a city - it's in downtown, close to the International market, shopping, and the beach. However, it is definitely noisy at night. If you are a light sleeper, consider bringing ear plugs. Overall - if you are looking for a budget hotel and you want to stay in downtown Oahu, this is a good bet. If you are looking for luxury/romantic vacation, this might not be the best choice.

We accidently discovered this little gem when looking to move hotels as we weren't happy with where we were staying. The price was nice, and the photos looked good on the internet so we went to the Pearl to inspect a couple of rooms before committing to the move.We couldn't get back to the hotel where we were staying to pack our gear and checkout to get into the Pearl asap. The renovated rooms are very comfortable and clean.We upgraded to a slightly bigger room with a lanai that faces onto the street. We were on the 2nd floor, so had a little street noise but nothing too significant as the hotel is on a side street - just a couple of garbage trucks was the worst of it. This room had a new split system airconditioner that was completely silent - some rooms still have old ones that can be a little noisy.Free internet was a big plus. Only two blocks to the beach via the International Marketplace.They have a microwave in the room which is a huge bonus when trying to save some extra cash on dinner.

We booked this hotel for 8 nights in a deluxe King room. The hotel upgraded us to a 1 bedroom with full kitchen. The living area was very large and the kitchen had all the basics for cooking meals.
