The rooms have wired high speed internet - no fee.The hotel is located off Kuhio road, very close to all the action of Wakiki. No ocean view, but the lanai was very nice. The room was fairly quiet considering the amount of traffic nearby. The front office staff are very helpful and friendly. They were good about giving directions and finding the right bus to take. Bus stop is about a block away, grocery store is 2 blocks away.Parking is expensive and limited. We had a rental car for the week-end. We were a able to find on street parking to avoid paying the fee, but it would not be possible to do on-street parking during the week (limited 2 hour parking).We felt the hotel was a very good value and enjoyed our visit.

I am a "bang for your buck" traveler. The Pearl is a good value for what you pay. The staff is courteous, the rooms are clean and nice, and it is walking distance to everything. I would definitely stay there again.They have very little parking though ($20 a night) so that can be a challenge.

Aqua Pearl is located in a central location in Waikiki. Around the hotel, there are several restaurants, bars, and shops. 2 minutes from the hotel is the International Market. Waikiki Beach is about 10 - 15 minute walk. The designer shops on Kalakaua Ave are 5 minutes away, as well as the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. Ala Moana Shopping Center is a 5 - 10 minute car ride away.We had a larger room with 1 queen bed and 1 double bed. The room was large and spacious. There was a decent sized bar fridge, coffee machine, and microwave. The bathroom was a good size as well.The hotel provide very few amenities. House keeping was hit and miss - although the room was relatively clean, house keeping routinely forgot to provide shampoo and did not even leave us hand cream.There is WiFi Internet Access in the Lobby and Free in room internet. Rooms had basic cable - with about 20 channels.I noticed others mention a lack of parking - that is true - sort of. The hotel itself only has ~20 spots, but Ohana East/West next door have plenty of parking spots. I was able to find parking every night with not much of an issue.Noise is my biggest complaint! The first night we were put on the second floor - the street noise was unbearable!!! Around 5:00AM, Garbage trucks would drive around the area emptying out the dumpsters. Our room had a large patio door which was single paned glass that did not keep out the noise. We felt as if the garbage truck was right besides us.The next night, we were moved to the 9th floor, it was much better but still noisy.The hotel also needs new mattresses ... Every morning I woke up with a sore back, probably due to the lumpy mattress.Hotel staff was friendly butit was a challenge getting a bottle of hand cream from them. We paid an extremely cheap rate for the hotel, but if only the hotel staff were more forthcoming about providing items like hand cream, shampoo, it would have made our stay more enjoyable.Bottom line, this is a bare bones, cheap hotel. If that is waht you're looking for, I will recommend the Aqua Pearl. Just be aware of noise - perhaps bring a pair of ear plugs.

I stayed at the Pearl while my friend and I were looking for a place to live in Honolulu. They were so welcoming and helped us out with everything and anything. We spent a week here, went to another hotel after and had to come back because we had it so good at the Pearl. It is CLOSE to the main scene of Waikiki, Bus lines are right at the door, and the beach is no further. Mike, the manager, even upgraded us during our stay! It was awesome! You get the paper every morning, the staff are all friendly and accomodating. Robin at reception was helpful with many of our questions! I recommend this hotel if you want a great experience in Waikiki!

I stayed here for four nights. The outside of the hotel isn't much to write home about. The room we stayed in (2 double beds) was very clean and nice. We were on the street side. If I stayed here again I would request a room on the back side because there was a lot of street noise a couple of mornings. The hotel is very close to everything...beach, shopping, Starbucks, etc. We rented a car and had to park in the lot next door. I loved that the room had a refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot, and a free internet connection but bring your own coffee and filters. :)

needed a place to stay close to Univ of Hawaii and the beaches.The Aqua Pearl is two easy blocks to the beach, 1/2 block to the bus lines. The staff was so helpful. Free online available in rooms and in the lobby. The rooms were very clean and quiet. Will stay there whenever in Honolulu.

Excellent location 2 blocks from the beach. The front desk was very helpful in dining suggestions and faxing papers. Internet in the room was functional, but no wifi. If you need quiet to sleep, ask for a room far away from the corner bar. We could hear the partygoers deep into the night. Other than that, this was a great deal.

This hotel is one that I would recommend to others without any hesitation. We stayed in Waikiki for 4 nights before leaving for The Big Island. We were in a room on the fourth floor with a balcony. The room was spacious, simple, clean and the two beds (in one room) were very comfortable! We received the newspaper everyday and were very happy with the location. The hotel is situated right near the International Market Place and is an easy walk to Kuhio Avenue or the main strip of Kalakaua Ave. We arrived quite early at the hotel and as expected, our room was not available. We were able to leave our luggage at reception and use the restroom in the foyer to freshen up from our 10 hr flight. We greatly appreciated this. We were initially concerned, however, with the front of house service when we had arrived. We did not receive a warm welcome. Within 5 minutes of being there, the staff member had not only forgotten that we had spoken to her about leaving our luggage behind, but she also gave no indication of when our room might be ready or when to return. I could understand if this was the case because she was busy, but no-one else was there at the time. Luckily, when we did check-in later in the day (and throughout the entire time of our stay), the service from other staff members was exceptional and worthy of being mentioned. A very big thank-you is extended to Dawn and Cesare for providing suggestions on what to do and see. They were so easy to talk to and made us smile every time! We would also like to thank Marlene for organising our shuttle to the airport and for happily answering the queries we had. Aqua Waikiki Pearl is great 'value for money' - we would stay there again when we return!

After reading the reviews of seemingly every Waikiki budget hotel online, I decided to go with the Pearl for the four days I spent in Waikiki. I must say that the reviews were right on and I really felt like I got the best deal in Waikiki. The renovations were very well done, the maids did a great job of keeping my room clean every day and the front desk team (especially Harry and Mike) were some of the nicest people I ever met. As long as you understand what you are getting at the Pearl (new room, clean room, huge room, great location, great service), then look no further!
This was a great find it was so clean our room was huuuge and we could not believe the location. Thank you do much to Mike and Marlena for make it great for us!! We will be back for sure!

We got one of the less expensive rooms and it was clean but about on par with a motel 6. Perhaps if we'd splurged a little we could have had a better experience. The room was noisy and we were woken up very early every day from noises out of the parking lot which was right below our window. We never felt that we could open the curtains because there was a walkway right next to our room, motel style. Again, had we gotten a more expensive room I'm sure these things wouldn't have been a problem. The room was clean, the staff was friendly. It wasn't a bad place to sleep.

A big thank you to all the staff at Aqua Waikiki Pearl who made our seven day stay the best. Our flight from Australia arrived in early in the morning we were so thankful for the early check in. Our newly renovated two bedroom suite #714 was so spacious and suited the needs of my husband and I and our two adult children, a friend and our 20 month old grandson. The suite exceeded our expectations as did the helpfulness of the staff. The central location makes it so convenient to Waikiki Beach, International Market Place, buses, restaurants and shopping. The Pearl for us was a quiet oasis in the heart of Waikiki.

From the moment we arrived,the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly.The rooms were comfortable and clean,but the only failure was the lack of a hairdryer. Please one fixed in each room couldn't cost all that much.If you want a clean, friendly inexpensive hotel in the heart of Waikiki this is the place. We shall be returning here sometime soon and recommending it to friends.

Aloha! I recently stayed at the Waikiki Pearl with my family and had a very pleasant experience. ALL the front office staff - Mike, Marlena, Harry and Robin - are very nice and professional and were always willing to cater to my needs. We were lucky enough to stay in both the standard room and the two bedroom suite - both are excellent value, clean and newly renovated. And have comfortable beds!!! I got the best night's sleep here, I did not notice the noise at all like other reviews. (We were on the fifth floor though).The hotel is in a good location and if you do want to reach the main part of Waikiki to Dukes, Macy's etc all you need to do is walk through the International Market Place. I found the facilities it offered - free wireless, laundry etc catered to my needs - I didn't notice not having a pool with the beach so close. However, I would have liked to have a hairdryer in the room - I had to keep asking for one as they remove them each time the room was made up. Overall, this place is great value, convenient location, with friendly, helpful staff. I will be back.

I recently stayed at the Waikiki Pearl and had a very pleasant experience. The front office staff was very nice and professional and always willing to cater to my needs. The hotel is a little off the beaten path but, if you walk through the International Market Place you are right on Kalakaua and right at the beach. The hotel was recently renovated and the rooms were spacious and very nice and clean. Special thanks to Kalei, Robin and Marlena. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

First impression, clean and friendly reception. Only 2 lifts, of which 1 was out of service for 1 of the 2 weeks we stayed here. Room was absolutly huge with balcony and airconditioned. Only got shampoo, no conditioner or lotion (which is shown on their website pictures). No hair dryer - you have to ask at the Reception desk, and then they took it out my room after 2 days. Room was cleaned every day. Bedding and towels clean. We could not connect to the internet, friendly staff quickly came and sorted it out for us. Have to pay extra for use of safe. Fridge, microwave, filter coffee pot and two mugs provided, but no teaspoons, sugar or coffee (would have at least expected teaspoons so you could buy the rest from the shop. Not quite what I expected from a hotel). No plants / flowers in the room as shown on their website BTW. Location good - just two blocks away from Waikiki beach. We were on the 4th floor and was woken up at 6am every day by the noise of dirt trucks picking up rubbish and the dive shop loading skuba bottles.* Since we pre paid the whole holiday via Expedia we felt like we were stuck with what we had and just had to put up with it. We decided that we were going to be out all day so it was just a place to catch sleep* All in all, the Aqua website made the hotel appear a bit more luxurious than it actually was, but it was at least clean and people were friendly.

I was blown away with what they did to this hotel. I was here a couple of years ago and was sad to see how depressing it had gotten but Aqua did a great renovation and it made me really love this place. My room was huge and the lanai was even bigger. Bathrooms are spacious. The most important things was for the price I could not imagine having better value. The location was perfect for me to get to the convention center yet still be close to tons of restaurants, bars and the beach. My favorite staff member was Pam who came up to fix my free internet in the room. She was really funny and let me know about all the great things in the area. Pretty good for a maintenance person.I will definitely be back!!

Stayed there for 2 nights after we checked out of out time share. Had never stayed there before and was concerned when our room was on the back side facing the Ohana West,which can get loud. But it was perfect, no noise, the renovated rooms were well done and everything was fresh and clean. Loved the mini fridge and microwave. The staff were all very nice and we got late check out at no extra charge. would not hesitate to stay there again. Great Place and great location!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I had the pleasure of staying at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for a total of 10 days and truly had a great stay there. For the first week, I was there with two friends in their double queen room, and was in a one bedroom suite for Labor Day Weekend. The first room was a very generous size, almost 500 sq ft, had a mini-fridge and decent size bathroom. The suite was bigger, not sure exactly how big, but was basically a one bedroom condo with a kitchen! As their website will tell you, they just recenlty completed renovating their rooms from top to bottom and it shows. I was a little worried at first, because of the older reviews of The Pearl from before their renovation weren't as glowing, but I have a strong feeling that will change now for sure. The best part of my stay there easily would be the Aqua Pearl's staff and the wonderful customer service they provide. Despite the modest size of the Pearl, there was ALWAYS somebody at the lobby desk, no matter the time of night, and they were always friendly and welcoming. After 10 days there, I knew most of them by name, Mike, Kalei, Harry, Wayne, Robin, and the really cool two lobby folks who seemed to man the desk into the wee hours of the morning when I came in from a long night out. They were always so helpful, that Robin even gave me her own bottle of conditioner she had on her when I needed some. That's customer service, something you're definitley hard-pressed to find these days anywhere, let alone a very nice, yet modest place like the Aqua Waikiki Pearl. I would definitley recommend it to anybody looking for a no frills, yet still hidden gem of a place smack dab in the middle of everywhere at a VERY reasonable price. Just to be fair, I should mention that if quiet is a high priority for your stay, you might take issue because of the median age of the other hotel guests being younger, and if you face the street, you will get some traffic noise, but nothing my hearos didn't take care of easily. I hope to visit again next summer!

My wife and family really enjoyed our stay and were excited about the size of our room @ #204. The room was clean and bathroom as well. I can't say enough about ' Mike Singh '. He went out of his way to see that I knew where to go as far as directions and was more than helpful. Mike is the example of great customer service. Thank you for him.With much gratitude,Mr. F. Lavatai II

The Aqua Waikiki Pearl is conveniently located in the heart of Waikiki. We didn't spend a lot of time in our room but the staff was very friendly, especially Cesare & Mike. The rates are good for an average Waikiki hotel. House keeping could have come more frequently but I would definitely stay there again.

The Aqua Waikiki Pearl has an excellent staff and comfortable rooms that make you feel right at home. The amenities provided (television, microwave, & internet service in the lobby) were very useful & appreciated. Upon arrival, our pomeranian Snowy was welcomed by manager Kalei with treats, a toy, blanket, food & water bowls, & some much needed doggie pads. The best thing our family liked about the Aqua Waikiki Pearl is that it's a "pet-friendly" hotel & the staff made us all feel welcome!

Our suite had 2 bedrooms and a HUGE bathroom. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. We enjoyed being so close to the beach, just a couple blocks away. Diamond Head and Kapiolani Park were also close by. With 3 teenagers, we appreciated the grocery store just around the corner and made good use of our kitchen. The staff were friendly and helpful. The internet access in the reception area was appreciated, and a special thanks to the desk clerk who so kindly printed up our boarding passes the evening before our early morning flight. I highly recommend this place. Great value!

My friend and I stayed here over memorial day weekend. The rooms were recently updated, very clean. Staff was very helpful and friendly and the location was great - just a few blocks from the beach. Definitely an excellent value for what you get. The only thing that I didn't like was that the hotel didn't seem to have Wi-fi throughout the hotel.

I would recommend this hotel to others. Before I got to Hawaii I read the reviews and was scared because everyone complained about noise. However, in my opinion its no worse than city noise. Other than that we have one of the larger rooms which was great size for 3 people but they didnt have a pool (WHO NEEDS ONE WHEN YOU HAVE THE BEACH 2 BLOCKS AWAY!!). The location and price where great we stayed there for 2 nights.

I would absolutely return there! Although the hotel was overbooked we were given a 3 bedroom suite which was just beautiful. The carpet was brand new, the amenities were clean and the whole suite was "SWEET"! There was one problem though, the parking. There was at least 10 stalls, which was all taken. Then the parking we had paid for in the hotel next door was taken. $20.00 a day. So since those were taken on our second day there we had to park 3 blocks away for $18.00.That's the city for you! Other than that everything was great! The rooms are beautiful, lets just leave it at that!

A hotel room must meet my three criteria: 1) The room has to be clean, 2) it has to have a spacious bathroom, and 3) it has to have a comfortable bed. This hotel definitely met my standards especially for the price. I also thought the staff were nice espeically the security guard, Ceasar. He was friendly and so helpful in looking for a parking space for my husband. I will definitely be back and I will recommend this hotel to my friends and family. If you're on a budget, this is the hotel for you.

I had read the past reviews about the noise level and was glad to find out that we were on the 8th floor. Once I got there I understood why people complain about noise ... Waikiki is "UP" until about 4am. If you're concerned about noise and bars ... don't stay in Waikiki. Even though we were on the 8th floor, we could hear the street noise below but it wasn't that bad. Our city view was awesome. I could see a little piece of ocean between the bigger hotels. Housekeeping was top-notch. I requested a hair-dryer from the front desk and I got it right away (and was allowed to keep it the entire week). The renovations to the hotel were wonderful and we were delighted to find out that we would be there for the "blessing" of the hotel. The hotel is not located right on the beach but the walking did us good because there is great food everywhere and we ate ... a lot. Also, the hotel left us a coupon for a free Mai-Tai at the hotel bar ... small and kind of dive-y (which we love) with lots of regulars (very interesting crowd). The Mai Tais were awesome (and cheap) and happy hour lasted until 8pm. I only have one negative comment and that was that we only got one coffee pouch on the first day ... there was a Starbucks almost right next door ... but sometimes you need a cup before you can even face the baritsa. In the end, everyone at the hotel was very helpful and we were sad to go. Definitely will be staying at the Pearl again. Mahalo!

Me and my teenage daughter stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl from Aug 12-18, 2009. We stayed in a simple standard room, that had 1 queen bed and 1 standard bed, Plasma television, air conditioned, microwave, safe, refrigerator, closet space. I can't complain the room was clean. The Honolulu newspaper was delivered to our door daily, we received good customer service and housekeeping service. Our towels were changed daily and rooms cleaned daily. The hotel in in the center/heart of Waikiki across the street from the International Market place and within walking distance to the beach 1 block, close to many restaurants and bus lines. Overall the hotel was very good, I can say the negative comments made about the cleanliness did not happen to us. I do recall walking by the housekeeping cart and saw the trash bag and gross towels that were collected from the room next door (bigger suite). Of course a bunch of college kids were staying in the room and just did not care. It is what you make of it. I had a great time and I would recommend the hotel to friends or family on a budget.

First of all let me say I am not a complainer...nor have I ever written a review before. We read the reviews prior to our stay and thought because the hotel was recently renovated that it could not be that bad for a 4 night stay. How wrong we were with our assumption. We could put up with the street noise (bars are open to 4:00 am), $20 per day to park our car, and the suppose to be 2 bedroom that was acually a 1 bedroom and the other so called bedroom was separated from the livingroom by a curtain. What pushed us over the edge was the cockroaches in the kitchen and in the beds!...please DO NOT STAY HERE, save you and your family the aggravation.

By no means is this place a 4 star hotel, but we wanted a clean, affordable place to stay during our stay on Oahu and the Waikiki Pearl/Tides was exactly that! The 'City view' was a joke, but it was nice that the hotel is located walking distance to shops and places to eat (Puka Dog & Keoni's!) The staff was really helpful and very nice.Only gripe was that even though we were on the 5th floor the music (and the drunks) from the pub - Legends- could be heard until well past 2 am! Get a room on a higher floor or further away from the pub side.We had such a good experience that we plan on staying here when we return for another visit to Oahu.

First of all we were in Hawaii for my buddies wedding, and we had booked a huge sweet with a couple extra rooms to accomodate all of us. When we showed up, we were politely asked to downgrade due to construction, which wasn't the end of the world but was annoying just the same. The rooms were nice, newly renovated and not bad at all. The service very quickly showed its colors. We were missing a luggage rack and called down to the front desk to ask for one. I didnt care much but my buddy insisted in one. After about an hour, we called back and the lady YELLED "it coming!!!!!!! as if we had called 17 times in 5 minutes. We called the first time at around 3 pm it didnt show till we were leaving to go out at nine. Our room was not cleaned in 4 whole days and getting clean towels was impossible unless you caught the cart in the hallway and took them. The staff was rude and hard to find. Sometimes there would be no one at the front desk for 30 min at a time. On one of our last nights a big guy at the front desk responded to us being a little upset that our group rate would go up if we wanted to stay 1 more night with "Just get the !@&? outta here and dont @!#?ing come back......I really could write 2 pages on more but i think i have made my point

We stayed in the one bedroom suite. We had a queen and double bed in the bedroom. The beds were new and quite good. It had it's own TV (an older remote model which was quite adequate to put us to sleep). The room had it's own air conditioner which could be operated by remote control (we turned it off at night). The living room area was quite spacious and had an LCD tv, which, although not large, met out tv watching needs quite well. There was a hide-a-bed/couch, a small table and four chairs and a desk in the large living room area. There was a nice balcony that looked out on other hotels in the distance. The kitchen had a two burner stove top, was fully equipped with dishes, pots and pans, utensils, and a full refrigerator. There were granite counter tops throughout. My husband felt the bathroom could use some hooks for hanging clothes. Everything is new and fresh with their recent renovation.The best part, however, is the friendliness of the staff. Everyone greets you and strives to meet your needs in these hard economic times. Kalei, the manager, has done a wonderful job instilling a real sense of Aloha in his staff.The parking is limited, but parking can be obtained in sister hotels. The bus service is great and it is possible to get around with a combination of walking and riding the bus. The stops are nearby.We were on the top floor, so noise was not a problem.BTW, it is a non-smoking hotel and that is strictly monitored. Great for all of us non-smokers.We'll stay there again.

We had a wonderful time! Although the hotel was going through some renovating, the service was exceptional! Michael and Pricilla went out of their way to make my family comfortable! We came in a group of 10 with 2 young children and they went out of their way to accommodate such a large group!! I have absolutely no complaints!!!Next time I come to Hawaii, I'm definitely staying here!!Jasmine, Indianapolis, IN

The hotel is newly renuvated, neat, clean and idealy located across from the International Market, but the staff is what made the visit special. Everyone was kind, very polite and took intrest in my daily activies to ensure that I got the most out of my visit. I have traveled a lot, some fancey some not so fancey but this topped the list for genuine customer courtesy. If I am ever in the area again I will be sure to stay at the Waikiki Pearl again.
